The book is of course ruled by the shadow of Adrianople, and Hughes spends an appropriate amount of time setting up the battle. While I wouldn't say he adds much apart from some excellent campaign maps, his account goes beyond being merely satisfactory and serves as quite a good introduction to the battle.I think that this is my least favorite of all Hughes' books. The focus on two separate emperors and his annalistic chapters are both questionable decisions, but they prove disastrous when combined. Although still readable, it makes the task of sorting out events needlessly difficult. Unlike his previous books he never offers much insight into the personalities of his protagonists, who remain distant figures throughout. It is in fact slightly inaccurate to call this a military biography of their campaigns since it is more of a history of military activity during their reigns. The material in here is good enough to be worth reading, but it needs some serious reorganizing before I can come to like it.Incidentally, for another take on the battle of Adrianople I'd recommend The Day of the Barbarians. It's a bit sensationalistic but it covers the events well. It's also a lot shorter.

This game is a bit of a step down from the previous two. The basic plot of the game is the same as the first one: the Raimon Junior High soccer team competes in a series of matches to defeat all their competitors in the Football Frontier, only this time it's the Football Frontier International and their competitors come from all over the world. This is a bit of a step back from Inazuma Eleven 2, where the team took on aliens who were trying to conquer Japan through soccer. Going back to just a soccer tournament is kinda a letdown, and there's no way to avoid that. That doesn't mean it can't still be good.This title continues the same gameplay of the previous entries. You face random soccer battles where you have to score a goal with four players. You also face full matches where you fight with your entire team, using special moves and special tactics to defeat them. This is mixed in with RPG elements of walking around town and recruiting players. Put that way it sounds kinda dull, but it really isn't. The character fluff is great and the soccer battles suitably challenging. There is only one major change to gameplay here:  you now get exhausted quite rapidly and are constantly switching players out. I suspect that this is because most of the soccer battles are rather easy and they wanted to make the game as a whole more challenging. Whatever the reason, once you level up your stamina the problem goes away and the game returns to normal.This game is the Japanese version, so while it will play on a US DS the menu and dialogue will be in Japanese. Which is a bit of a problem obviously, unless you speak Japanese. I know that there are sites online that translate these, so anyone interested enough in playing this can find a way to do so. This game is the same as Inazuma Eleven 3: Bomber and Inazuma Eleven 3: Spark, the only difference being that this game focuses on a new team from the movie (Ogre) while the others focus on Rococo and Fideo respectively. For anyone with a European 3DS these games are also available as Lightning Bolt] and [[ASIN:B00BG4R0KM Bomb Blast, which are in English but are also replete with horrible cockney accents and names.The game's problems come with the advent of the story. And there really isn't anything special here that we haven't seen before. The FFI advances just like the regular FF, even to basic structural elements. I can't say any more without spoilers. The matches have just a few too many plot-railroading moments where you can't control the game. This is combined with occasionally sloppy plot devices, like how Fubuki suddenly develops a broken leg and has to stay behind with no setup or warning. Also, there are four hospitalizations, and of those four characters three hid their illness from their friends and three needed operations to cure terminal plotitis. It feels just a little bit overdone and stale.Another problem this time round (and one they didn't suffer from before) is the characters. Endou, Goenji, and the rest are as cool as ever. Fideo's great, and so are some of the new guys. But then you get the two most annoying characters in the series: the coach (who I shall always think of as Snake) and Fukou. As you might remember from the last game, Fukou's kinda a dick. He doesn't get any better here, although his story is partially saved by a late piece of character development where you realize just how much Kageyama screwed over him and Kidou. Snake has no such redemption because the game seems to think he's utterly brilliant. And there's nothing quite so annoying as seeing everyone fawn over a character you can't stand. Coach's problem is that he is the worst coach in the entire world. Rather than tell his players what they should do, he gives them a series of arbitrary tasks that then lets them learn the skills they'll need. Like locking them in their rooms for no reason. Or making them practice in the mud. Or banning Endou from playing. He has super secret reasons for all of these, but he maintains the idiotic attitude that if they don't work out why he's doing what he's doing for themselves then they deserve to lose. What a pro.Honestly, the plot may be repetitive, and several new characters a nuisance, but the core of the game is the same old Inazuma we already love. It ties up a number of the loose ends and resolves the series on a decent note. I might wish that it didn't feel quite so tired, but at the same time I was glad to be returning to a world I enjoy. I can't exactly say I never got frustrated playing it, but the good definitely outweighs the bad. I'm not so sure that will still be true if they ever adapt Inazuma Eleven Go and Inazuma Eleven Go 2: Chrono Stone, but that's a different story.

This product is very thick/dry so care must be taken with application to use just the least amount that will cover and to feather/blend the edges.  It covers quite well.  As the box says, it is intended for very high coverage.  To get that kind of coverage requires a layer that sits on top of the skin and will probably be noticeable at close range. The color that I received, Sand, is a better match for tieback of my hand (which have gotten somewhat tanned and where it covers freckles very well) and a little dark for my under eye area (which is much lighter since I am careful to use sun screen).  The color Sand is on the yellow-golden  side, not cream or pink tinged at all.  Your skin has to be absolutely smooth to use this.  If there is any dryness or flakiness the product will accentuate that.  So for these areas you have to blend with moisturizer, which helps application but of course also reduces the opacity of the coverage.  This product is "okay."  It does seem expensive for what it is.  There are alternatives that are as good at a lower price.

This is a very convenient way to get turmeric into your daily routine.  I have been using turmeric for quite a while.  I have been buying turmeric pieces at the supermarket and pulverizing it/blending it with fresh ginger, lemon juice and water.  I drink some of this almost every day.  It takes some time to do the preparation, so having these turmeric capsules is a welcome supplement to my supplements.I am absolutely convinced that the natural inflammatories such as bromeliad (which you get from fresh pineapple, also available in capsules) and turmeric are potent and effective.  I have had problems with my knees -- meniscus tears -- for years.  Every so often I will move the wrong way and my knee will lock and instantly become extremely painful.  I have found that if I really load up on turmeric and bromelain (ideally in natural form but I always keep capsules in the house in case I cannot use fresh and it is an emergency) I can reduce the time it takes for the knee to "unlock" by 24 to 48 hours.  I have had these episodes three or four times and am just amazed at how effective the pineapple/bromelain and turmeric have been.Ubervita is a well-respected company.  While these capsules seem expensive they are powerful and safe.  Which is more than you can say about many pharmaceuticals.  I do like using the fresh Turmeric roots but they are not always available so these capsules are a great back-up and a whole lot more convenient.

It's just water but it feels amazing.  The secret to this product is the sprayer.  The water is dispensed in such a fine spray that it just feels amazing on your skin.  Very refreshing and hydrating.  Not a must have but a lovely luxury.

If this is the first book about miniature poodles that you read, you will probably think it's great.  Between the time I ordered it and the time it arrived, I did a lot of reading online, and by the time this book showed up I had already read most of what it contains.  If you come to it after reading around on The Poodle Forum and watching You Tubes about how to groom and trim nails, you will be less impressed than if you pick this up first.  There is a great deal of useful information about how to find the right dog.  But a lot of the information is generic, and applicable to any breed.  Also as in joys books of this kind,  some of the information is presented as gospel.  For example, the author talks about the benefits of early spay neither.  He has a great deal of company here, but it is worth noting that early spay neuter may well not be in the best interest of the dog's long term health.  I guess relying on any one source is inadvisable.  One needs to read around.  The inclusion of the DVD was a plus.  Without it I might have given two stars.

In addition to being absolutely mind blowing with respect to the insights and information it provides, this book is entertaining, poignant, a delight to read.  We have already been through the life cycle with two dogs and are getting mentally prepared to get a new puppy.  I had thought we had done a fair job training our dogs (and had read several books before getting them) but I am just aghast at what I didn't know.  There are lots of books out there about the mechanics of training.  This book is unique because it helps you understand how your dog is reading you, and therefore, why your training  might not be working.Or worse, why your behavior may be having exactly the opposite effect from what you intend: Just the other day I greeted my neighbor's sweet Golden on the sidewalk by coming up to her and patting her head, only to find out from this book that this was a total affront and the very worst way to approach any dog.  And that's just for starters.  I am totally chagrined.  I have been reading section after section of this book out loud to my husband -- we both have a lot to learn.  Of all the many many books I have read this is the one that will almost certainly have the biggest impact on my overall relationship with my dog.  Absolute must read.

I have a small facial epilator that I love so was happy to have an opportunity to have this Panasonic combined epilator and shaver.  The Panasonic unit comes with two heads, one for epilation and the other for shaving.  It also comes with a charger, a little brush for cleaning (you might miss this as it is the same color as the packaging and very small), and a pouch that is large enough to store all the components.The Panasonic is recommended for use as an epilator only on the legs below the knee and on the top sides of the forearms.  Not the face, and not the bikini area.  As a shaver it can be used in all the usual places.Because I have been using a facial epilator, I was prepared for the sensation of having the hairs pulled out.  Not pleasant but really no big deal, quite endurable on the legs. (no interest in using on arms).  It leaves the skin much cleaner/softer than shaving.  I am really pleased!  I would probably never have purchased this but now that I have it I can say that it is really worth having.  It has made a very noticeable difference with respect to the smoothness of my legs.It is a very competent shaver; easy to use and did a fine job on areas where you cannot use the epilator.The two heads are very easy to pop out and re-install.I am really surprised at how much I like this, despite the fact that I have already been using a facial epilator for a long time.

Wow I am editing my review and increasing to 5 stars.  After using for a week I can see a definite difference in the area under my eyes.  I almost cannot believe what I am seeing.  There is significantly less puffiness and the area looks lighter.  I am quite skeptical about the power of over-the-counter preparations, but this really has made a difference.  Thinking of purchasing a back-up jar of this even though I have barely made a dent in the first jar.This eye cream is fairly thick/dense.  It does not have a lot of slip -- you need to pat it on.  It doesn't feel very emollient, but it stays in place without migrating.  It is entirely fragrance free.  If you put it on before bed, you can still feel that it is on your skin in the morning.  It is paraben-free and non-irritating.  I do believe that it may have slightly reduced under-eye puffiness, but that could be wishful thinking.  I prefer this to the Kiehl's Avocado Eye Cream, which I had been using before getting this.  The Kiehl's has a lot more slip to it but does not feel like it is staying put nearly as well as this eb5 eye cream.  The other product that I have used on my eyes is Sukin Moisturizing cream.  This is not an eye cream specifically but it is also paraben free, non-irritating, and works very well as an eye cream -- does not migrate and moisturizes well.  By contrast the eb5 is thicker/tackier and feels more present on the surface of the skin.  The Sukin is more moisturizing but does not stay on the skin as long.  I think I prefer a slightly lighter weight product such as the Sukin for day; the eb5 is better for night as it seems to stay on longer.

This ticks all the boxes for me.  I rarely wear make-up but when I do, it is because I want something that will cover the darkness and veins below my eyes.  But I also want something that is moisturizing, not tacky.  Something that glides on easily, and does not settle in pores.  Something that feels good on, which means basically feeling like nothing is on.  As we all know the best makeup is the one that improves the appearance of your skin but doesn't look like you're wearing make-up.  This product really does strike that balance quite well.  The tube says "avoid eye area".  I found it to be fine in the area below my eyes, but did not put it close to my eyes.  It is absolutely non-irritating on me, has no fragrance and is oil free, non-comedogenic and paraben free.  It feels moist on but does not have any shine to it.  Since I never wear makeup during the day it is not a problem for me that this does not contain sunscreen, but worth noting.  I really like this and will repurchase, if I ever use it up.

Design books are my crack, and this delivers quite a high.  It is a gorgeous book, large (10 by 12) with full excellent quality large, full color photos on nearly every one of its 250 pages.  The book features fourteen projects designed by the team of three architects.  They are all "shingle" style, but they vary widely from contemporary to traditional.  Many of the houses are brand new but several are renovations and expansions of existing residences.  My personal favorite is the second one -- a Craftsman style house that was renovated and added on to.  The shingle style is so interesting architecturally because it provides a great deal of freedom.  There is no one dictated set of principles or geometries, as there would be, for example in a classical Georgian.  The Shingle style house can be symmetrical or not, it can be any size, with any kind of trim and fenestration.  There is enormous range among the fourteen houses featured here.  There is a short essay be one of the three architects for each of the fourteen projects, describing the siting, the challenges and the design philosophy and principles.  Each house is photographed lavishly, inside and out.  I will never design or have an opportunity to live in a house as glorious as any of these but for a short while at least I can take pleasure in seeing what some of the best designed houses look like.  This would be a great reference for an architect, designer or student.  But for me it is simply for pleasure, and a great pleasure it is.

I was pleased to discover that this has no scent at all (expected a mushroomy smell).  The taste is innocuously sweet, not delicious but potable.  I think I can manage to get down a half size serving of this once a day, probably not a full serving (i.e.4 ounces instead of 8).  The sweetness is provided by stevia, so a full serving has only 20 calories.  The plastic bottle is only half full but it does contain the 8.47 ounces which is the advertised 30 scoops.  (The scoop is in the bottle.)  The bottle comes with a full plastic sheath sealing it but there is no internal seal between the cap and the bottle.  The price seems rather high but mushrooms are very expensive and this is certainly a very convenient way to attain the benefits of six different kinds of mushrooms (cordyceps, reishi, Agaricus blazei, shiitake, maitake, turkey tails.)  This can be taken every day or reserved for "situational use".  My bottle, received in September 2015 is labeled fresh until April 2017 so I may reserve using this for stressful times or days when I feel under the weather.

This combined cable modem and wi fi router is very fast and so far seems very reliable.  This unit was installed when my son moved into his new house by the Comcast rep so cannot comment on ease of install.  It seems flawless in operation so far.  The only potential downside is that if and when the unit fails you have to buy another unit that combines both the cable modem and wi fi functions.  But this seems the  best way to go in any case.

This unit is replacing a garage door opener that is over 38 years old (it was the existing unit when I purchased the house in 1977 and was still operational in 2015).  The new Chamberlain unit is belt driven rather than chain driven (like the old unit) and is impressively quiet.  I had not even realized how loud the old one was.  The old unit had a more solid robust feeling but the new unit is certainly up to doing the job.  The installation was not easy -- doable but a challenge.  The directions contain many warnings about following specific guidelines to avoid "death or injury".  We are very pleased with the operation of this unit and amazed at how quiet it is.  But be forewarned:  the installation is not a slam dunk.

This moisture cream contains the usual suspects: water (though it is "mineral spring" water), glycereth-26, cyclomethicone, glycerin, aloe barbadensis -- you get the picture -- mostly the same stuff you find in most moisturizing potions, from the least to most expensive. It is paraben free, which is good.  But I really did not care for this for two reasons: (1) it leaves a sticky feeling on your skin and (2) it has a  chemical scent that I really do not like.  Reaction to fragrance is a very personal thing.  Others may like it but I for one really do not.  I will say that if you are alright with the scent and the sticky feeling, this does seem to be a quite lasting and moisturizing product.

This is a great price  for a good 20% C serum that contains Ferulic Acid.  I have used the Paula Dorf and the Timeless Brands and this is just as good, if not better,  as far as I can tell, and a much better price.  I have been using it very morning (I use prescription Retin A every night) and I am convinced that it does make a difference.  I am convinced that tretinoin, Vitamin C serum and consistent use of sunscreen are the three (and virtually the only three) topicals that make a difference and none of them has to cost a fortune.  This C Serum is a good value and I will repurchase.

I have no trouble falling asleep initially, but like many my age I wake during the night.  As you age your own production of melatonin wanes so that you "break through" to wakefulness during the stages of  the sleep  cycle that bring you up out of dreaming.  I had been waking several times every night and had difficulty getting back to sleep.  This product does work quite well.  But, the instructions say you should hold it under your tongue for about 40 seconds.  You should not just put it in your mouth and swallow right away.  So, to hold it in your mouth under your tongue you have to kind of sit up in bed, which in itself brings you more into wakefulness.  Taking the pill (1/2 of a 3 mg pill) was easier.  I think this does work a bit faster than the pill  so it is worth it.

This is so easy and fast to apply that I almost always grab this instead of one of my powder shadows.  The Amethyst  color is very subtle and the sheen is visible but not sparkly.  It is medium dark, just about perfect.  It does wear off more quickly than my Urban Decay powder shadows.  Expensive but will repurchase.  Have just about stopped using all my other shadows as this is great for day and evening.  I am tempted to try some additional colors but am totally satisfied with the Amethyst (light medium beige skin and green-blue eyes).

Received this through the Amazon Vine program.  This replaced a Lynksys E8350 which is several years old.  Worked great but has been dropping the network a lot lately.  (Isolated to the WiFi as my Macbook stayed connected fine at the Apple Store).  The new OnHub router comes in an elegant package with cords -- including a long and short so you can get the OnHub to a place where it is more or less out in the open, which the directions strongly suggest.  It was supposed to also come with a quick set up guide and did not, but the guide is available online.  Once I connected to power the OnHub downloaded a new update (you find out what's happening on your IOS device, where you have downloaded the OnHub App).  This took a few minutes, during which you are placated with folksy messages such as "You have time to make a cup of tea."  Once the updates are downloaded and installed, the OnHub finds all your devices and you just connect to them in settings.  I had to re-enter the password into the Brother printer but once I did it was up and running.The OnHub provides good signal strength throughout our old house (lathe and plaster walls).  It is located on the main floor and wifi is fine on the third (attic) floor.  Pages are loading much faster than previously.One of the nice features of the OnHub is that you can go into the App and tell it to prioritize one of your devices for a designated period of time so that, for example, if you want to use the iPad to watch Downton Abbey you can funnel all the wi fi bandwidth to the iPad for a couple of hours or however long you wish.  In our house it is currently supporting one printer, one MacBook Pro, two iPhones and an iPad with no problems.I am thrilled to have this.  It really is extremely user friendly and a very welcome replacement for our sick and dying Linksys router.

I received this watch through the Amazon Vine program.  This is a man's watch and I am a woman.  I wanted this watch for a specific purpose and this watch and this watch is a great match for my needs.  This is a large and very heavy watch.  The large white numbers on the black dial are very easily read even from a distance.  The watch is moisture proof and both feels and appears very heavy duty and durable.I go to heated power vinyasa classes nearly every day.  The clock in the room is not visible from where I like to be.  I really need to see how much more of the class remains in order to pace myself.  Had been taking my dress watch into the room but felt uneasy about putting it down on the front edge of my mat in this very hot and humid room.  And could not see the face well from a standing position.This Invicta Men's watch is perfect for my needs.  I can see the numbers clearly even when it is on the floor and I am standing.  I have no worries about the heat and humidity harming it.  So I am more than pleased as it is a great match with the requirements of my specific application. There is no date or other features but that is fine with me.  But I would caution that it is a heavy and bulky watch which I cannot imagine being worn on an all-day every-day purpose except by a quite large person.  It arrived in a gorgeous bright yellow elaborate case with generous yellow suede padding so would make for a great gift presentation.

I love short stories and have read through this collection every year.  It is actually a little melancholy to receive this now and to know there will not (or ever again) be a story by Jphn Updike or Philip Roth (who stopped publishing a couple of years ago) or Rayond Carver or Andre Dubos or James Salter. . . the list goes on.  But this was the first time I received a collection  in whichI didn't recognize a single name.  No Alice Munro, no Ann Beattie . . . .I am giving my age away and so may as well confess while I am at it that my tastes in short fiction run toward the traditional (have you already guess that?)  I appreciate but do not really enjoy the black humor, the magical realism that so many contemporary authors are drawn to.  I was happy to find that many of the stories in this collection were very much to my taste.  Several, I loved.  One in particular, "Lady Lazarus" gripped me and held me from beginning to end.  This story alone was worth having the collection for.If it were not for this annual collection I would likely lose touch with contemporary fiction.  I will continue to read it to stay in touch, and sometimes be very amazed, moved and delighted, as I was here.

Just had to add my vote to all the other reviews.  This really works.  And I too have found that it nearly completely "healed" a vertical split in one of my finger nails.  For years I had been polishing my nails and then had the bad habit of pulling the polish off the nail when it would start to chip.  Then I used nail products like Nail Tek that only seemed to make it worse.  Finally after forswearing all nail products for a while, I came to understand that even in their natural state the main problem was lack of moisture, not lack of hardness.  The first product I tried is Trind Nail Balsam, and that made a huge difference, used twice a day.  Then I came across this and have to say I think it is even more effective.  The Trind does moisturize the nails but the CND leaves a very light protective coating.  I continue to use both products as often during the day as I can.  My nails finally look healthy, better than I can every remember them looking.  I will never use polish on them again.

I usually use Melissa's brand turmeric root -- I purchase it at Wegmans.  By comparison with Melissa's, the pieces in this bag were smaller and also quite dirty.  They're fine and I am glad to have them as a back up because Wegman's is frequently stocked out but I prefer the Melissa's even though it costs a little more.  I use the turmeric to make a tonic, with fresh ginger and lemon juice.  I go through a great deal of turmeric and I am glad to know there is an online source for the fresh root.

I had been buying the crystallized ginger cubes at Wegmans.  I like these slices much better.  They seem fresher, softer, with better flavor.  I use them in hot tea and also to flavor kombucha tea.  They are so good that I eat them plain.  The only thing that bothers me is that there is just so much sugar in the bag.  But I guess it is required to have  plenty to completely coat the ginger and some just dusts off.  I will repurchase these and keep my fingers crossed that the next batch is as good as this one.

My experience with Ballet  Slippers is that it dries to a soft nearly white (just a tinge of color).  I use it for pedicures when I am doing it myself.  Have found it to be extremely durable -- it lasts without chipping until my nails grow out, about three weeks.  Never have to do the next pedicure because of chipping.  It goes on very sheer and somewhat streaky.  I actually use three coats (over a base and with a top coat/dryer).  With three coats it is opaque.  I am not especially skilled at doing my nails but with Ballet Slippers I can usually achieve acceptable and consistent results.

This is so expensive (which is why I gave it four stores rather than five).  But it is truly better than any other sunscreen I have tried, and I have tried many.  This is a "physical" sunscreen rather than a chemical sunscreen.  After reading about the two types I decided that I wanted to use only a physical sunscreen even though they tend to be thicker and less lovely from a cosmetic point of view.  They protect just as well and they are felt to be safer, as some of the chemicals used in chemical sunscreens are questionable.The Clarins sunscreen has a wonderful texture -- amazing slip and goes on so smoothly, but with no feeling of oiliness at all.  It is slightly white on your face for a moment, but quickly becomes completely sheer.  Once you try this, you're hooked as all the other sunscreens feel so much heavier and greasy by comparison.I continue to use a really heavy duty screen on my face when I swim laps -- my face is white when I head out to the pool.  But for every day the Clarins is what I love the best.  Hate paying the price for this, but will have to just scrimp somewhere else.

When I acquired a pre-owned LV Cabas Mezzo I did a lot of research on products to protect the vachetta leather.  This bag has vachetta straps and a vachetta bottom.  It had already developed an even patina.  The bag was made in 2003, and kept in a dust bag for nearly the entire past 12 years.  So everything I report about my experience applies only to vachetta that already has some patina.There are many people reporting their experiences on The Purse Forum.  Among the many products, two brands seem to have the greatest following for treating and protecting vachetta.  There is that very expensive vachetta kit which has its loyal followers.  A tiny 50ml bottle of conditioner will set you back over $20 and even this brand has some users who are not happy about what happened when they used the product on new vachetta.  And then there is Apple.I have used Apple Garde and Apple Conditioner on other bags and after doing all the research I decided to try it on my new-to-me Cabas Mezzo.  I used the Garde first and then the conditioner.  The Garde did not change the color or texture of the leather at all.  The conditioner darkened the leather very slightly, and left the leather feeling smooth, and the straps were even more supple than before.  I am greatly relieved and completely satisfied at least for now.There are all kinds of warnings that you should not use anything at all on LV vachetta, and that LV warns against using anything.  And yet the vachetta is very vulnerable to water spotting and soiling.  After doing all the research it seems that the best approach is to use nothing on new vachetta.  Wait until the bag develops a light to medium patina, and then condition and protect.  The problem is -- what do you do while you're waiting?  Some people actually sun tan their bags for a few weeks.  My bag was stored away like a fine wine.  There really seems to be something of an advantage in acquiring a pre-owned bag if you can find one in great condition.It is curious that there is no manufacturer's site that you can find online, nor are there clear directions provided.  Which should be applied first -- the Garde or the conditioner?

I have used this with great success on several bags.  Recently acquired a  2003 Vuitton Cabas Mezzo.  This bag has vachetta straps and a vachetta bottom.  It already had an even patina when I received the bag.  Sprayed it immediately with Apple Garde.  The leather did not change color or texture.  I think I would have been more afraid to use this on a brand new bag with nearly white vachetta, especially as LV warns against using anything.  But I can report that on a bag with a light patina, the Apple Garde works completely satisfactorily.

I have been using this for years!  It just keeps on going.  As others have said, it hurts when you do the most sensitive spots like at the base of the nose.  But over time you just get used to it.  I only need to use it about once every two weeks.  I am really impressed by how well it works and how durable it has been, especially for the price of this little unit.

I do a hot yoga class most days of the week.  This towel really does help keep you from slipping.  But I found that it moved around somewhat.  I discovered that if, before class starts, I wet two patches on the towel (where hands and feet are in downward dog) it adheres to the mat.  It still moves around a little bit but having it is way better than not having it.  Like others have said I think it has a funky smell.  I washed it several times before using it and wash it after almost every class.  But I do like that I can wash it and have a fresh surface.  It is not perfect but I would buy again.  Would not want to be without it.

There is nothing especially revolutionary about this product -- it uses a HEPA filter, a carbon filter and a fan.The good:  it works very well even on low speed.  And it is quiet on low speed.  (rather loud on high speed).  We have an aged dog who is no longer trained (she is pretty out of it).  She spends a lot of the time in the basement laundry room, which we have lined with towels that are washed daily.  Still, the room smelled awful.  This unit made a very big difference after only a couple of hours.  We were very impressed.The bad:  You have to replace both the HEPA and carbon filters every few months (interval dependent on usage).  I went to the Fellowes web site to check prices.  This is a new model of air purifier and the parts for it (9406402 carbon filter and HEPA filter 9406502) are not up on the site yet.  But the price of HEPA filters for the other models range from about $40 to $60.  The carbon filters are less -- $!0-$20.So we have a little bit of the Gillette razor blade model going on here.  Not surprising I guess but caveat emptor.

The suit I received when I ordered this had a tag that said it was nylon/spandex.  Not lycra.  So I sent it back for a refund. It wasn't a bad price even for regular old nylon spandex, but it wasn't what I ordered.  It was quite thin but the styling was fine.I will go back to Speedo and Tyr.

These have a wonderful feel.  The tone is gorgeous, rich and mellow, which I much prefer to the more metallic sounds you get out of steel strings.  The combination of the feel and the tone make playing so much more pleasurable.  These would be worth if for these qualities alone and if it turns out that they do last longer, that would just be an added bonus.

My husband and I both really like this.  It cleans thoroughly but does not leave your skin feeling tight or stripped.  I don't really know why this is targeted explicitly to men as there is nothing obviously "masculine" about the product, the packaging or the scent.  Many "for men"  toiletries and soaps have a characteristic kind of scent that is vaguely like popular men's cologne but the fragrance in this face wash is pretty benign.  My skin is a bit sensitive as I use tretinoin, and my husband's skin is just quite delicate and fair.  We both have been using this and will repurchase.

What I like about this:  The colors are excellent because there is a good range from very light vanilla to very dark charcoal, and there are some very useful medium- dark taupes that are great for every day.  The box containing the palette is a nice quality solid plastic that will keep the shadows safe, and it is quite small -- about the size of an iPhone 6. The rose colors are pretty and fairly subtle.What I wish were different-- only two of the twelve are truly matte. Six  are slightly to moderately shimmery.  Four are very sparkly and probably will not be very useful, at least for me.  I would have preferred more matte colors.  The shadows are a little crumbly-powdery.  They're OK but if you compare to Urban Decay, the difference is pretty apparent.  These are fine especially at this price point.  It's fun to have a palette and much more affordable here than some of the other brands.

These are just the best!  For a long time they were unavailable -- was so glad to find them here that I ordered six of them.  They fit well, grip well, easy to get off and on in a  hurry, and really protect your hands and wrists.  Silly to get rhapsodic about a potholder,  but these are just seriously better than any other mitts or potholders I have found.  I am so glad to see that they are in stock now and hope they always will be.

Have been using these for decades!  I had really bad frown lines.  For years these really helped.  But the frown lines were so persistent that I decided to start getting Botox -- and have been doing so for several years.  But I continue to use the Frownies every night!  I think it helps the Botox to last longer -- just my opinion, but everything you can do to make those muscles quit working and just atrophy from lack of use has got to be helpful.  I am so used to putting on the Frownie at night that it has become part of my lights out routine and I just feel something is amiss if I don't have one on.  They really do work and I will continue to use them, along with the Botox.

These tools are really substantial and solid, not thin and bendy like other silicone tools I have seen.  They have a good feel in the hand and are a pleasure to use.  They are heat proof to 480 degrees so no worries using them on things straight out of the oven or in boiling water.  I was surprised at the size -- they are on the small side.  Not a real problem as I have larger spoons and spatulas.  But if this is going to be your only set you may feel the need to augment with some larger tools.  The bright red color is not my personal favorite but it serves a function as these are easy to spot in my crowded kitchen tool drawer.  I think these would make a great gift for someone starting out, especially someone with limited kitchen storage space.  I received these from Amazon Vine and  and really happy to have them.

I purchased this based on the reviews.  Was really anxious about having to do the installation but am happy to report that it went very easily.  I have Time Warner cable internet, and no phone or TV at all.  I  disconnected the old TW Ubee modem and connected this to the power and then directly to the computer.  The install page with the MAC number came up immediately.  My page instructed me to call Time Warner.  I got a helpful person after just a few screens.  It took a few minutes to get the modem activated, and then the TW person made sure that it worked when I switched from direct connect  to my WiFi router.  I am on the TW standard tier and routinely do the test to make sure I am getting the speed that I am supposed to be getting .  So I didn't expect to see an improvement when I swapped modems but in fact pages are loading a lot faster now.  I wish I had not waited so long to get my own cable modem!!!!The primary reason that I had delayed was the fear that if I ran into problems that TW would back away and blame the problems on my modem.  But so many people have their own modems now and are reading about how to deal with the cable providers that it seems that there is a lot less risk in going with your own modem.

I had the Aqua Sphere Kaiman EXO goggles and liked them but found them to be too wide so I ordered these.  The Kaiman Lady Swim goggles are only a tiny bit less wide than the regular  Kaiman EXO but it is enough to make a difference -- these fit on my face with no overlap on to the swim cap.  Have worn them for half a dozen long lap swims now and they have not leaked, or fogged.  I would not mind if they were even a bit more narrow.  The primary size reduction seems to have been on the vertical axis -- they are not as deep as the regular size.  They suck in fairly tight around the eye (though I do not have any problem with them hitting my lashes), and they leave rings on my face.  But they do work.  The material that provides the seal is not as soft as the EXO and I kind of regret that I did not order the Lady EXO.  But these do work well enough.

This is a very attractive hard cover book filled with recipes for juices, smoothies, soups and salads.  There is a brief introductory chapter narrating the author's experience recovering from breast cancer and regaining health, which she largely attributes to her green juice regimen.  But this is essentially a recipe book.  I got a lot of new ideas and found the recipes very useful, if a bit repetitive.  I am really glad to have this book as a reference.  However, I do think you can find many recipes for green and other juices, smoothes, soups etc online so it is a luxury to have a book dedicated to this.A couple of other observations:  the author says she has tried many juicers and prefers the Breville Juice Fountain.  I have this product.  This is not a review for the Breville Juice Fountain, but I will just comment that, while I agree with the author that the Breville is a great solid machine that makes juicing easy, even fun, it is also a big heavy unit --- it is either going to take up a lot of space on your counter or be a very heavy item to store away and take out every time you use it.  Also, it does come apart easily for cleaning, but the mesh strainer requires several minutes of careful scrubbing every time you use it.  It is not a trivial clean up job.Also, the focus of the book is on green -- kale, spinach, celery, cucumbers -- which I accept, but I do think that a more balanced approach would be welcome.  There are four recipes that use carrots but the author states that carrots contain a lot of sugar and so she doesn't use them that much.  No mention of beets at all.  So, "Daily Greens" is great as far as it goes, but it does not really offer complete coverage of the array of nutritious produce that you can use for juices and smoothies.All in all, a very pleasing and useful compendium of recipes, but with a few caveats.

I have repurchased this many times.  I use it when baking almond biscotti.  It is totally satisfactory.  The Simply Organic is better but also more expensive and I don't think the difference in price is worth it for something like this.

I'm not the craftiest person but the potential for creativity of this devise appealed so I ordered it. I've had it for a few weeks and waited to post a review because it took me a while to figure out how to use it (hence the four stars).  This machine provides so many cool features and many more that I am still trying to figure out.  I think that you have to be an experienced craft person to use this machine to its fullest potential but for the everyday crafter, it still provides fun and creative ways to make homemade cards that look professional and provide a personal touch, scrap booking (this is the primary function for me), frames, etc.  I'm having some issues transferring digital images to the machine but I'll keep working on it and report back.

2.5 StarsLIKES:+ flavors of the coffees+ espresso / cappaccino capability+ removal of used pods (to be taken out later in bulk)DISLIKES:- can overheat and stops working (this is annoying)- can ONLY use Nespresso pods- availability of Nespresso pods issue (not widely available like Keirug)- having to wait for cleaning cycle to finishI love the function of this coffee / espresso / cappaccino machine.....when it works properly.  I returned the machine because within a two week span of daily use, it stopped working due to overheat issue a handful of times.  I'll wait for the next generation of this line and hopefully the pods will be more widely available by then.

I've been using this software for over a month now and still impressed on all it provides for an everyday user.  It easy to understand how the features work and plenty are offered - many filters to provide flattering or artistic results, corrections for bad photos (red eye, etc.), and online posting options, collage or film choices, and many others that give an uncrafty person (me) options that make me look like I take much better photos that I do.  I love how it allows me to save a key photos that need some work and provides a finished photo that looks 10 times better than what I started with and it this with a few clicks of my mouse.

I have great memories of playing darts when I was younger and wanted to add it to our family room.  This is the third board I've tried and I like it the best so far.  Cheaper boards mark up from the darts and bounce out much more than this one.  I did have some trouble with getting the darts to stay in the board but not sure if that's user error since everyone raves about this board.  I wanted a dart board with a cabinet but those sets didn't work as well as this board. Now all I have to do is practice.

Playmobil has been a long time favorite in our house and this knights and castle set is as good as it gets.  It includes a few knights and the castle was easy to set up.  The exploding wall, dungeon and cannon that really shoots figurative fireballs were a huge hit.  There's nothing worse than spending a lot for a toy that sits on the shelf after a week and thankfully, this knight playset is not one of them.  It's worth every cent with the hours of creative play it provides.

I really loved this machine until this week when it randomly pours out just water.  Usually shutting it off and on fixes this issue but not sure I'm okay with this being a long term solution.  It takes up more space on my counter but getting what you want at the press of one button instead of scrolling through the digital window of most other pod coffee makers is nice.  I also like being able to see the water level.  I really loved the convenience, features provided (you can remove bottom to install carafe), easy to clean and more importantly, taste of the cup of coffee brewed but the misfires concern me as it is only a couple of months old.

Let me start by admitting that I am not using these speakers as intended, I am using them for an outdoor area.  I use wireless speakers (UE Boom do a great job) as a rule for outdoors but thought these would be a great option.  My husband was able to wire these up and once installed, I had fun testing it out.  The speakers are water resistant not waterproof so placement was key.  This sound system incorporates bluetooth and it works more than 20' but less than 50. A clear packet to place your iPhone when using it for these speakers helps when on the water (or in my case, near the pool).  The included remote provides basic functions (play, pause and skip) which is really all you need.  I love the convenience this system provides for my pool area.

I have a car charger for my iPhone but it needs the cable which isn't always kept in the car.  50% success rate is not good and ordering this all-in-one charger gives me 100%.  I'm loving the convenience factor and the low price makes it that much sweeter.

There's nothing to complain about, this is a sturdy case that fits snug around the Ipad Air 2 and allows for multiple viewing stand positions.  The price is a bargain for the function provided.  I prefer a softer case but this is for my son who needs the extra protection.  It claims to prevent damage even if dropped onto cement and I hope its accurate.  Several weeks later and more importantly, several drops later, all is good.

(3.5 STARS) I got this software for basic book keeping and it does that and a whole lot more.  This version includes the most options and allows for three users which was a primary concern for me.  Let me start by admitting that I do not have a background in accounting so the software was not as intuitive as I would have liked and I'm not using it for a small company but for a 40+ committee.  The options were amazing and it offered professional grade invoices and financial statements.  It can be set up to manage direct deposits, print checks and a whole host of small business needs (payroll, inventory, audits, etc.) that I do not require at this point.  This software is overkill for my purposes but would work well for a small to mid sized businesses.  I subtracted a star for the difficulty in installing the software and that some features require subscriptions (read payment) to provide complete function.

I love the colors, the customization, the wear and the look of these powders!  What I don't love is the color flying everywhere when used with a brush.  The four shades to one compact make customizing to your specific skin tone possible.  My favorite is a toss up between the translucent and bronzer as both do a good job. Most bronzers can look too fake but this one allows a hint of color (using the left side, something more by swirling and using all four and darker using just the right).  I still use Benefit (TM) but this is a great back up and at a much lower cost may be my next purchase.

We have a tricky spot in our front yard that was an issue before this grass seed.  I've tried sod, shade mix and regular grass seed with very little luck.  It's this weird mixture of sun and shade that defies growing grass from the start or maintaining sod.  I ordered this grass seed and so far so good.  I need to do another spread to get the grass more dense but it works even with missing a day or two watering.

This is a good gift for the tween set or younger with adult supervision.  I have a child who is interested in law enforcement and this was a fun way to introduce him to it.  Lifting fingerprints was the favorite,  The supplies included only lasted for a couple weeks but fun was had while they lasted.

2.5 STARS: I'm at a loss at how to rate this...  I like the cup of coffee it brews, being able to see the water level and adjust coffee grounds, and the thermal carafe is a thing of beauty but the plastic filter is a major disappointment (especially considering the amount spent). The plastic looks good (albeit cheap and it soooo wasn't) for the first month or so and then the wear shows. Also, it can get clogged and overflow on occasion.  Thankfully, I've earned from previous attempts at replacing my aging Krups coffee machine and keep it as back up because this one lasted five months before being shelved. The cost prevents me from throwing it out but it doesn't work nicely enough for me to give away, or at least to anyone I consider a friend.

I have a wireless UE Boom speaker so I grabbed the opportunity for a wireless UE Boom 2 speaker.  I've posted a photo to show the differences.  The UE Boom 2 is the one on the right.  While the speakers are the same size, the cases are different.  The amazing 360 sound quality is the same but the wireless range is DOUBLE from the original.  I didn't break out a measuring tape but the claims of 100 ft is about right.  They kept the large + and - volume buttons (just tap to use) which is super convenient and they added the function of tapping the top of the speaker (use two fingers or it won't work) once to pause/play and twice to skip a song.  This feature is very cool but did not work consistently.  They also changed up the recharging and jack features.  They are on the bottom of the Boom speaker and on top under rubber flaps on Boom 2.  I prefer the open ports (more convenient) over the covered but I'm assuming it keeps it cleaner and helps prevent loss of function.  They have also improved the playing time.  I get around 9-12 hours on the original and 10-13 on the Boom 2; granted, a slight improvement but I'll take it.  I cannot find a way to double up a Boom and Boom 2 speaker but I have a call into Logitech to see if this can be configured.  Overall, I LOVE the sound quality, convenience, and mobility these speakers provide and at the same cost as the Boom, I would recommend these for double the wireless range.  I might even spring for the Mega Boom speaker.

You gotta have the right crowd to appreciate this game.  The name might imply cute or quirky but it clearly states recommended age is18+ and they should add, "not suitable for those easily offended."  Having read reviews prior to opening and playing, I made sure it was an irreverent crowd.  It's not one of those competitive games as the point is to make people laugh when matching up statements with accents.  The statements range from bland to amusing to a few that are extremely rude.  It's combining the accent that takes it up a notch and having friends attempt these accents that make this a brilliant but not politically correct game.  This is the perfect game after dinner (read a glass or two of wine) and good friends that can appreciate Utter Nonsense with an adult twist.

3.5 STARS: I like the sound it provides.  This must be the cheaper line from Bose but at over $125+, not so cheap.  It can only be used alone, you cannot connect another speaker with it like other wireless speakers.  This is a huge negative for me.  The sound quality is good, not great, but it plays anything we throw at it (classical, metal, bass).  I also liked how it was easy to connect thru wifi with a free app.  The range was pretty good too.  Not all wireless speakers provide the same sound quality and this one performs adequately but there are better speakers out there in the same price range (UE Boom is a personal favorite).

Amazing and worth every cent!! You will need to read the instruction booklet to get full use of this product.  The multiple functionality of this bundle is amazing!  It has a hard case that can be used alone or attaches magnetically to the cover case.  I wasn't too sure about how secure this connection would be but after shaking (over a bed), it remained secure.  The cover case has several positions available for your iPad and the built in keyboard is a thing of beauty as connecting is easy and it's one of the better ones available (comfortable spaced keys for a smaller keyboard, smooth and quick with little to no lag time between key strokes).  A charging/connecting usb cable is provided for convenience. The magnetic holder has tape strips to attach (we use it in the kitchen for tv use) or holes to be screwed in place (no screws are provided).  Once again, the connection is very secure.  The cover case is wider than average due to the built in keyboard but nothing too bulky.  The cover closes with a magnetic flap.  I cannot say enough good things about the style and functionality of this bundle.

I love the crisp clean look of white towels and lay these out for guests.  I've tried them and they are plush and more importantly, absorbent.  My only minor complaint is that the body towel could be larger for the price listed but it's average sized.  They've been washed several times and still look and feel good.

We ripped some questionable plantings the previous owner had on our front lawn and planted grass with less than desirable results.  We do not have inground sprinklers and when we went away on weekends during the summer, the new grass suffered.  I ordered this bag hoping it delivers as promised, great looking grass that doesn't need a lot of water. It's just starting to fill in and I've missed a few days but it still looks good.  I will report back later with long term results.

It does the job of providing good sound with comfort.  The headband is comfortable and adjustable, fitting kids to adults.  We use this for movies in the car and there's been no complaints.  For the price listed, it's a bargain!  I took a star off because the blue metallic ear piece looks cheap.

I have only used this cream for 1 week but so far, happy with the results.  I get pedicures every other week and use the oils, scrubs....you name it to battle cracked heels.  My feel look amazing the first couple of days but then, I need foot moisturizer every day, twice a day.  So far this cream has allowed me to cut back to once a day and even skip a day.  I'll report back after continued use.  It has a scent but I cannot identify it, it's perfume-y but not overly so and it states it's good for sensitive skin.

This cleaning pad does provide an excellent shine to stainless steel but you need to put a lot of elbow grease to get the desired effect.  I debated between 3 and 4 stars due to amount of effort needed but it does provide an extremely shiny finish so 4 stars.  I thought my stainless steel sink was shiny and decided to test this pad.  Swiping it back and forth didn't do much but pressing down and scrubbing did the trick.  I really am amazed at the difference but to be honest, not sure how often I would use it because my arm was getting tired after cleaning just the sink.

My favorite mascaras are Benefit (Are They Real) and Smashbox.  I ordered this based on the details and figured it was worth a try as it's much cheaper than my favs.  Overall, it provides good coverage and the price is a deal.  I'm not a fan of the funky container as I keep trying the open the wrong end - the  slimmer end is the base (not sure who thought this was a brilliant idea).  The wand is slim and has a lot of short bristles and does not apply as smoothly as I'd like but that may be due to me being used to the long and fuller wands of Benefit and Smashbox, which makes coating every lash easier.  It took me 4-5 swipes of the wand to get my lashes fully coated.  The mascara does flake off slightly through the day if you put a lot of coats on but nothing too bad.

I have no idea if it provides what it claims but it does a very good job of freshening my breath and the minty taste lasts.  I got this mouth wash over others hoping its claims of helping my teeth's enamel is true.

We tried the regular Nutro and loved it so we figured we would try this one for our over weight spaniel.  He's a picky eater to begin with and he's refused every "diet" dog food we've tried.  We end up putting so much people food mixed to to get him to eat it that its counter productive if not worse.  We were surprised that he ate this dog food (we mixed a little egg in but he always gets that).  It's only been a week in so I'm not sure how weight beneficial this dog food is but will report back later.  I do love that it does not have a lot of filler and is not outsourced (as in from China).

I expected more for the price paid.  The stone looks good from afar but once closer, it looks obviously fake.  The mailbox included is a garish orange gold and you'll need to replace it as well as your address number so you're looking at an additional $50-80 bucks.  On the plus side, it was easy to assemble.  I ended up giving this to a family member because I did not like the look.

I was thrilled by the performance and multi functional cleaning uses of this Bissell steamer at first but after a month of constant use, the detachable function no longer works.  I was looking forward to receiving this steam mop/cleaner and opened it as soon as it arrived.  I may have even grabbed it out of the mailman's hands I was so excited to try it. I have 2 dogs, 2 cats and 2 boys that all seem intent on making the house as messy as possible.  It's a never ending battle.  It was easy to assemble, fill with water and use (I added a few drops of fresh lemon juice to the water, I have no idea if this is a good idea on certain flooring).  It left my floors clean and with a fresher scent.  The water container lasts for a more than a medium sized room.  I really needed this for the attachment steamer that easily disconnects from the mop to steam clean certain chairs and sofas that I see pets slinking off of in the morning.  I currently use Febreeze(TM) but figured this was a better way to actually remove pet smells instead of masking it.  There isn't an attachment made for upholstery cleaning  but we used one of the small ones and it worked like a charm on the sofa and chairs for the first month.  I also used it to clean around my kitchen and it did an amazing job at getting rid of the gunk between my counter and undermount sink but I doubt I'd use it every time I clean.  Unfortunately, the handheld steamer would no longer operate once detached from the mop (stuck on ready button) and as strictly a mop, it works but the draw was the multiple uses of one device.UPDATE:  After hearing from Bissell, I contacted customer support (1-800-237-7691) and did not have the best results.  Bottom line, I probably caused the issue by adding fresh lemon juice and even though it's not a chemical and I've used it with other steam mops and cleaners, it was the likely culprit.  I am still disappointed by customer service whose english was limited and did not provide help.

Okay, these labels are waaaay smaller than I expected but the correct measurements were provided so its on me (although the photo provided DID help me with this misconception).  They provide ideas and forms to make personalized labels but I would go at least a size up because I can still hear Nana complaining about how she can't read it, why'd I make the print so small?  If used for one or two words, this is a fancy way to gift without much effort.

These labels do what they are suppose to and the format number is provided for Word to make it easy.  The added bonus is that additional formats are provided by Avery to add some zing to your label.  I like. A lot.

I have gone through close to a printer a year and figured at $100-150 a pop, it was smarter to move up to a higher end model.  I ordered this model and I could hit myself for not doing this sooner.  I'm not sure if it's the brand as my previous printers were HP, Lexmark or Canon or going up to a higher end model but it's a winner!  The only downside is the real estate it takes up but it more than makes up for it in performance.  Heck I'll build it it's own cabinet if it keeps performing so well.  Our printer gets used daily.  It needs to handle two school kids (have you seen the homework they have?), business reports and newsletters for school.  I really hate reading instruction manuals and this printer was very user friendly and intuitive to set up.  A cd was enclosed for convenience but drivers can easily be downloaded.  I called customer support when I had a problem printing from my iPad but it was user error, not the machine, and they were nice about it.Printer Overall:+ Ink cartridges last up to 2 years and are cheap to replace - NOT SURE, have to get back to you on this.+ Can easily set up wi-fi printing - CHECK!+ Can print easily from your iPhone, iPad and other devices - CHECK!+ Can handle volume printing without issue - OH YEA!  A 72 page monthly report was printed and it never stumbled.+ Up to 30 pages can be used on Auto Feeder - CHECK!  This was tested and worked but fanning papers first helps- Loading the ink cartridges can be tricky, a steady handy is required.

Mix two very active boys, two dogs and a backyard and you get filthy clothes by the end of the day.  True story, I once had a pair of shorts that could stand up by itself because it was so caked with dried mud.  I sat folding their clothes thinking they looked really dirty and knew I had to try a new washing detergent because I can't spray their whole shirt with Shout.  As an added bonus, one of my kids has very sensitive skin so I cant use harsh detergents.  I ordered this detergent with oxi and claims of being "tough on stains but not on skin" with no dyes or perfums and figured I'd give it a shot.  Twenty loads later and I'm still in love!  Their shirts aren't as dingy from mud stains and grass stains have disappeared (I do still use Shout on heavy grass stained knees to be fair).  It comes in pre-packaged liquid packets which makes it ideal for full loads only.
I like the length and performance of this cable.  I took one star away for the slight stick on the micro cable when plugging or unplugging.  It works but I'm worried about the pressure needed.

We have a very picky german shepard who we've been trying to reach that delicate balance between providing a healthy dog food that she keeps down or eats, period.  Our dog is very active and my husband is diligent about finding a healthy dog food not made in China.  We are not always successful and Purina One is our current dog food but we want better.  We think we've found it in Nutro!  After two weeks of use, our dog eats it without issue following the guideline of mixing it slowly into her diet, although we still mix some egg into it.  Nutro promises four things: healthier skin and shiny coat, healthy digestion for a firm stool, natural ingredients and never outsourcing food source from bone to bowl.  They offer a 100% satisfaction guarantee.  What's not to love?  I just hope our dog continues to eat it without issue.

I am NOT a fan of this coffee maker.  I love coffee.  I depend on it to get me through the day so having a tasty and reliable source of it is almost a "need" and not a "want."  I have a trusty Krupps coffee maker but it's getting really old and I was looking to upgrade.  I ran across raves about Breville being the king of coffee makers and decided on this model, despite the high price tag. I should have checked the reviews here first.....Breville is suppose to be the top of the line coffee maker but my Krupps brews just as tasty a cuppa and costs a heck of lot less.  I was forced to read the manual to be able to use all the features but didn't end up using many as they performed inconsistently.  I cannot detect much of a difference between the mild to bold taste feature when brewing coffee although the boldest setting does have more depth, sometimes.  It doesn't seem to work all the time but I'm not sure if that is dependent on the type of coffee grounds used.  I did like the ability to brew for a cup, a travel mug or a pot of coffee.  This was the only feature that I really liked but it isn't worth the almost $400 price tag!

This is a bargain for the price listed!  A cup of coffee at the push of a button is one of my favorite conveniences.  The vast amount of coffee pods available are delicious but can be a little pricey.  I really like that Keurig has a re-useable pod available (not part of this package) that allows you to use your own coffee and not the pre-packaged ones.  I had one of these machines years ago (I'm talking around 10) and I ended up giving it away because I didn't like the pods available.  I'm very picky about my coffee.  The machines today offer much better hot beverage options!  I still have my Krups beast for when I have a lot of company but for everyday use and small gatherings, this one is a winner.  It allows me to offer all different types of drinks to my guests.

I got this wireless speaker based on the reviews here and they did not steer me wrong.  I had a great portable wireless speaker (UE Boom) but it is inconsistent when used in high humidity areas.  They do have a waterproof version at $270 but figured I would give this one a try as I'm a huge fan of Denon.  I like to blast my music (from booming classical to rock) and this speaker handles it all without the distortion of lower end speakers.  I don't mind spending a little more for speakers that perform but hate spending money for brands that don not deliver.  I'm happy to report that this speaker lives up to my high expectations.  I need to save up and get more!

Easy to install, I got tired of waiting for my husband and did it myself.  My old toilet seat was made of plastic so cheap (not that it was inexpensive mind you) that It would bend if you sat on the closed lid.  This seat is reasonably priced and much sturdier.  I love the soft closing lid but will report back after a few months of use to see it still performs the same.

I really like this speaker when traveling outside.  It's great for the beach, camping, hiking, etc. You don't have to worry about it getting damaged easily as I have boys and this has been tested.  It's been knocked around, water poured on it and "accidentally" dropped into the water and it still works.  The sound quality is good given the price point and the size makes it very easy to carry around.  My only issue is the sound level.  I'm not looking to blast my music but a higher volume would be nice.

This sugar cube might sound and look sweet but it kicks butt! What's not to love about this small speaker that packs a punch at $20 elsewhere?  Not much.  When a friend took this out to play music, I laughed but stopped once she turned it on and asked where I could get me one.  I'm not an audiophile but I am picky about how my music sounds and this inexpensive little speaker is as good as the more expensive ones at $99 or less.  It doesn't begin to compare to high end models like UE Boom ($200) but the convenience factor and low cost makes it ideal for the beach, etc.  It has a carrying bag to protect it and holds the charging plug.  You're going to need the charging cord because the battery life is only 3-5 hours. The short battery life is the only downside.  It comes in several colors and it is easy to set up on your phone thru bluetooth.  I've wasted money on several wireless speakers for travel and outside use that delivered the same quality of sound but at higher price and bigger dimensions.

Not sure how I ran across this book but I liked it enough to look for and read others by this author.  The back story of three men who formed a brotherhood while in Serbian refugee camps was interesting and one of them, Niko, is a background character in the Dance Series (Tap Dance).  I hope his story is next but didn't mind meeting Brand in this intro to the series.  Love that it's a complete story and didn't end on a cliffhanger but leaves you wanting to know more about other characters for future books.  The heroine, Reese, was a good match for Brand and the author knows how to write interesting characters.There are plenty of sex scenes without going overboard.  I liked the suspense element to this story but found it to be more fun fiction then realistic (MC resolution and family issues).  There were minor editing issues.  I'm feeling a definite Kristen Ashley influence but in a complimentary way and not a ripping off another author way so if you like KA's books and are looking for something to read, I highly recommend this author.

I cannot recommend this backup battery as it does not do a good job of powering up our digital devices ( iPhone 5, iPad and Kindle).  I was thrilled when I first got it.  Charge it up, throw it in my bag and use it when needed - that was the plan.  It did hold a charge for a good length of time but it only added up to 20% more power to my apple devices and it took a long time.  I find myself using it at the start to maintain the power level of my device and that seems to work better but kinda not the point.  I don't want to have this backup battery always attached to my device when mobile, just when needed.It does not provide enough power to recharge your device for an extended length of time but it works as an emergency backup battery as long as you don't let the device lose complete power.

Overall, this is a solid choice for internet security. Here's my thoughts after using it:GOOD* lots of optional features make this a good choice - banner free ads, questionable website warnings, etc.* scans have caught low level security issues and removed them* support offered online and by telephone* works on up to three pcsBAD* despite claims to the contrary, it does slow down the speed of your pc although most security software does* it works for one year and then updates expire which make it less useful.If you are not using Mozilla or something like it that provide a lot of the options for free, this is a good choice.

This is a very basic wireless router for a simple set up.  I would recommend this for those with few wireless gadgets and simply need a wireless connection without much fuss and the parental controls feature.  It was easy to figure out, connect and get it up and running.  This was ordered to provide a simple wireless connection for a parent with no tech savy and this model appears to provide exactly that with solid performance.  I also like the parental controls feature that allows you to block access and really like the low price (~$30).I will report back on the parental controls feature (great idea for grandparents) and if there are any problems but so far, it works smoothly with no issues.

My boys were excited to get this set up but the results were mixed.  My oldest did not like the way cars flew off the track too easily but my youngest seems to like that feature.  Setting up the track is a chore as some pieces do not fit together easily but once constructed, it holds together.  Time will tell if this toy is worth the money.  If my boys keep playing with it I'll rate it higher.

Sometimes modern versions of classic games are not a good choice but this one is a winner.  I have a favorite childhood games that needed to be replaced (monopoly, Life, etc.) and the new versions were expensive yet cheaply made.  This game is a close copy of the classic and worth the money spent.  They even kept the classic packaging which brings back warm memories of time spent playing this game that works for all ages.

This was chosen for an older relative who had a 30+ year old thermostat and wanted to able to read the numbers and a better way to adjust the settings.  This model was a very good choice.  The temperature is digital with easy to read numbers.  The adjustment buttons of "up" and "down" are easy to press and see.It provides an updated thermostat for older models for those who want an easier way to set their heat but do not want a programming option.  It was easy to install and directions are provided.

I got this one for two reasons: (1) needed to save space on my kitchen counter and (2) looking for a cheap but functional microwave.  Five months later, I'm still happy with this purchase.  I paid around $140 for a high end name brand microwave that took up a lot of space and wasn't very user friendly (needed to read the manual to use functions) and this one I got on sale ($60) and find it performs the same, maybe even better.This microwave does not have a push button to open the door like most; instead; it has a handle that takes some getting use to - my kids constantly move the microwave when pulling on the handle to open the door.  Not the best design but I still like it over my old one.  It has plenty of useful buttons: beverage, pizza, dinner plate (love this one!), frozen veggies, fresh veggies, popcorn and soup.  This microwave defrosts without cooking and doesn't seem to overcook food as easily as others I've used.If you are looking for a space efficient microwave that provides a lot of function at a bargain price, I recommend this one.

It was a sweet enough story but it was too inconsistent to recommend.  It has the tough alpha male with a gentle side and  affable heroine but their story didn't gel.  Maybe it was the overtly sexual daydreams the characters have about each other but [SPOILER] when they become a couple, decide to live together without sex......for a REALLY long time.  Seriously!?!  This didn't make much  sense.  Whole sections didn't ring true and ruined the flow of the story for this reader.It was like this story was written by two different people or that the author couldn't decide between two versions, one G rated and one R rated.  After finishing this book, my thought was "done."

How does Jessica Clare (Jill Myles) do this?  Make me read a book series about fictional reality tv series?  I stumbled across the first book in this Games Series ("Wicked Games") and now eagerly look for each new one as it's released.  This fourth book is based on a Big Brother type format and although it contains familiar characters (from the 2nd book, "Playing Games"), it's not necessary to have read previous books.  The author took a character I disliked and turned him into swoonworthy within a couple of chapters.  That takes talent.If you are a fan of those reality tv game shows, this book will really appeal to you and if you're not, it will still appeal.  There is something about this author that sucks me into her stories.  Maybe its her well defined characters, witty dialogue, sexual situations without being too vulgar (think R rated), plot lines that keep your interest or maybe, she just knows how to write a great story.The beauty of this series is that you don't have to have read the previous books to get it.  If you are not familiar with this series, you'll want to be by the time you finish this book.

I liked the first book in this trilogy (White Trash beautiful) so I got this book as soon as it was available.  I was happy to revisit the lives of Cass and Tucker.  Although Cass was a little whiny in the first installment, she had plenty of reasons to be that way so I cut her slack.I liked how the author highlighted the rock star/regular person relationship rather than ignore the inherent issues like  most books in this genre.  Cass deals with serious issues and certain passages were gut wrenching.  Jealousy and alpha male hotness abounds but too much whining from Cass prevented me from rating this book higher.  At certain sections I wanted to yell at Cass to get a backbone.  She was unhappy being labeled fragile by Tucker but acted that way and sniveled far too many times.I will not be in a hurry to get the final book in this trilogy but I will read it, probably from my local library.

This is a great idea but it needs some work before meeting its potential.  My thoughts after several weeks of usage:1) It's expensive and yet cheaply made.2) Doesn't really work as a protective case as careful handling has already resulted in a slight crack - not sure how long this case will last.3)  It DOES provide extra power when desperately needed.4) Gets kinda hot when being used as a power source.5) Hate the gap!  Hate. It.Bottom line: as much as I might complain, I use it as a power back-up source.

I have two kids in elementary school and they go through boxes of pencils with teacher requests for even more.  I have used several different types of pencil sharpeners - battery and electric with lousy results.  I ordered this one keeping my fingers crossed that it would work better.It has several different sized openings on a rotating wheel which clicks easily into place to provide custom sharpening.  The pencil shavings are neatly stored in a see thru container that easily slides out and locks back into place after emptying.  The pencil sharpener gets heavily used in our household and no complaints from either myself or my kids.After several weeks of use, I highly recommend this sharpener over others!

The characters are familiar - sassy heroine and bad boy Hero but the story and dialogue make it stand out in this packed crowd of YA novels.  I liked the blend of young love, private school drama and espionage.  The spark between Taylor and Colt is full of heat and teen angst.  There's a lot to like in this story.This is the first in a two part series with the next one (Tempted) due out shortly so although this book does leave you hanging, you won't have to wait long for the conclusion.  I appreciated knowing upfront that it was a two-part series.
