I was in the market for a portable power solution with quick charge technology. There are not many out there. So I applaud Aukey for stepping up to the challenge.  They are currently leading this sector of the market right now. I'm sure other providers will get this implemented in due time.When I saw this massive beast on sale, I immediately clicked on buy now so I could have it in two days!!The battery pack had a nice matte black finish. All of the letters on it have gloss black finish. It's very solid feeling and for being a bit bigger in size than a Galaxy Note 4, it has some serious weight to it. This isn't a battery that you can have in your pants pocket at the same time your charging your device.  Its not really designed for that.  I use the battery to replenish my removable battery pack from my Samsung Note 4 device.  It works well for that.The battery works great. After 45 minutes it charged my Note 4 from 35% to 100%  Excellent performance charging devices quickly.  I have recharged my Note 4 four complete times, and it's still showing a white battery status light.  This is some serious heavy lifting that this battery is doing.Now here's the bad news on this battery.After your device is charged, and the voltage draw drops below a certain level, the battery pack turns off.  So at night when charging my phone, it fully charges it very rapidly, and then it turns off, so in the morning, my phone is at 85% since it has been running background applications to download my pod-casts all night long. This is a problem with phones.  I know the auto off function is nice so you don't accidentally leave it on when you don't intend to, but it needs to stay on all night to keep my device topped off or have some auto sensing technology to kick on and keep your devices full when you are not paying attention.****RevisionAfter being contacted by Aukey that my battery might be defective they sent me a new unit to try out. In the process I upgraded from the Note 4 to the Note 5 phone. After using this battery with the Note 5. I'm not seeing the auto sensing tech kicking in as quickly. When using the phone it stays on powering the device consistently. When the phone goes idle it still kicks off.The next generation of this device needs to drop the current draw sensitively down a notch so it doesn't turn the battery off as soon. This isn't a deal breaker but just something you need to be aware of before making a purchase.

Works great as an easy mount to use on your mirrors. Put this in and securely mounts my gps in the right orientation.  I got two, I've for each side of the bike. One for a drink holder and the second. Fits great just buy this and you'll have solid mounting points for your gear.

Ok, I scooped this up to redo my kamado joe cooker. The surround was leaking air and smoke making temp control difficult after 18 months of use.After gathering the appropriate tools, spraper, sandpaper, butane torch, ect. It took me about 30 minutes to remove the old surround and install this one.Although it has an adhesive backing already on it. I still recommend using some spray adhesive to help with the bond of the gasket on your grill.Let it setup for 24 hours before firing off the cooker at 170 degrees to smoke some Salmon. It worked great. No leaks anywhere.The only gripe in have is that this stuff is gray and not black but it works great so its a good buy.

If you like to do low and slow cooking this is the tool for you!  I used to have to very closely monitor my grill to insure that I never exceeded my target temp of 260 for my pork shoulders.  Not anymore! This thing keeps the grill LOCKED IN at your temp for DAYS!  Full load of charcoal, handful of wood chunks  Loaded up the grill at 10PM with a 10 pound pork shoulder.  14 hours later.  Perfect pork.  Falling off the bone!Hooked up my remote iGrill tracking system alongside this to track the temps overnight.  It never moved more than -5 or +2 over my setpoint.Awesome tool for your BBQ.  Spend the money.  You will not be disappointed.Just a note. You can't use this for temps over 400 degrees.  You will burn out your probes doing that.

I love this little speaker. It has outstanding sound quality over some of the other units I have tested. It's also weatherproof as long as you have the rubber covers installed.It has two drivers in the housing.  A eight inch bass driver and a three inch driver with a peizo dome tweeter on top of it.The lights are a very nice touch. They are bright enough to light the surrounding area around the speaker at night.Improvements:Every once and a while I get a bad Bluetooth connection. Resetting the speaker usually resolves it.This doesn't do USB audio from your iPhone. That would have been a great feature to provide a better quality audio connection.Equalization would have been nice to tweak your sound.Take out some of the battery and give us a subwoofer in the bottom of this thing. There's a lot of space in this thing thats underutilized.Finally 1/4" input would have been nice so you could use a microphone with it.The slot at the top of the device could be a little further back to allow you device it tilt back a bit more so you can see it better when this thing is on the ground.Overall this is one of the best sounding portable speakers you can get. A few more features at this price point would make it an excellent choice.I waited until it went on sale and got one for $120 so I had to get it.

Very nice case. It's the perfect size to carry my Phantom 3.  I saw it on YouTube as another user had purchased it and he was spot on. Perfect weatherproof case for this tool.I spent a little more time with my pulling of the foam so I could get a very tight fit with room to spare for other accessories.Got space for 4 extra batteries, an a iPad mini when I get them. You have room under the foam for the manuals so you don't misplace them.Excellent case for the money. I went with the orange case as it's very visible but not as bright as the yellow.Just a note if you need to put some foam back in after you pull it. It can be done with just a touch of 3M light spray adhesive. It's permanently attached after that.

Hooked this cable straight up to my camera, fired off lightroom CC 2014, and my camera was instantly recognized with this cable.  The cable is quite thin and very flexible.  Going to try and use an extension on this cable to see if I can get some more length out of it for my photo shoots.

Excellent cover. Works great to cover my Kamado Joe cooker in both the stand and a custom table setting.  Good value at a fraction of the cost of the Kamado Joe branded cover. Only had it a few weeks but it's holding up well thus far in these spring thunderstorms.
They ultimate in stage microphones.  Works great on guitar cabs, or with vocals.  Used on a snare drum in a pinch.  Sounds great, works consistently every single time.

I was totally blown away with these speedlights.At first I was skeptical about this system.  How could these lights be so cheap and provide stable, consistent lighting.  Well, I was sold after doing three photo shoots with these lights.  They work just as good as my Nikon lights on Manual Mode.  The triggers fire every single time although they do not transfer TTL information, so keep that in mind when purchasing this kit.  Learn how to use your lights in manual for the best creative control!

Perfect for mounting this on your 1/4-20 screw holes.  Mounted this to a video tripod so that I could use a RAM mount to hold up my video monitor rig.  Works great.  After putting a little locktite blue on it, it never backs out.

This is a fairly good backdrop but there is one big issue.  There are no loops on the long side to hang this backdrop from a muslim stand!  The last one I purchased had the loops on the long edge.  Why not this one?  Will be returning it as I can't hang this on my system.  Highly dissapointed with this purchase.
These little puppies work great starting my Kamado joe grill. Just two of these in the coals have it roaring hot in fifteen minutes. Much easier than other types of fire starters.

These do exactly as advertised. Stops the shafts from coming apart on your darts. Just pop one of these puppies on and you are golden. Threw twenty in my case to give away at the next dart meetup at the bar.

Well there are only two options on Amazon for this type of device. I went with this one because I didn't trust a $10 device in my $2,000 laptop. Glad I chose OWC.I was totally surprised to find all of the tools, screws, and a full color step by step guide for every make and model of MBP. That was really nice. After reading the instructions, I dove into the install. Appears on the last generation 15" MBP (Mid 2011 non retina) they switched to Torx screws from phillips on the optical drive parts. No matter, OWC included the tool to get then removed and nice new phillips head screws to go back in.I'm pleased with the construction of this carrier. Solid aluminum should be great for helping to dissipate heat. Everything lined up perfectly and after restarting my machine all the drives were working flawlessly.This is a good piece of kit to help expand your MBP storage. It's more expensive than alternatives, but you get what you pay for in most cases. This is one that's worth the extra coin.

This is the ultimate charger for the Samsung Note 4. It immediately recognizes it is a fast charger and give me a full charge from 15% in just under 60 minutes on my commute home. you cannot beat that!! make sure you use the right cables for you get the full current from this device into your phone I am currently using an Amazon basics Micro USB cable and it works great my only caveat with this device is that it is very long I cannot close my arm rest in my truck with this plug into the cigarette lighter adapter. I had to plug it into the back seat cigarette adapter so that the armrest could close. not a big deal is my USB cable is 6 feet long and my kids need a plug for their devices in the back as well. Do not hesitate to get this charger if you have a device that supports fast charger. Excellent purchase!
Awesome. Looked for this stuff everywhere. No one carries it. Installed in seconds. Alcohol pad was a nice touch with the kit.

Works great. Lined it up snapped on the case and popped it on the charging pad and it took off instantly. Charges very quickly using a 2A charger. It does generate quite a bit of heat. Dropped it down to a 1A charger and it generates much less heat. Good for overnight charges at the slower rate not so much for quick refills on the go.

Got two of theses to put an Ethernet network across my basement. My transfer speeds have now tripled. No lag on my PlayStation or NETFLIX anymore.Good product, now I have to figure out how to get an Ethernet line upstairs to speed up things up there.

You have to get one of these if you like fried Turkey. Its super easy and indoors. Never again will I be outside frying Turkey. Get one you ain't be disappointed.Just a note. The condensation chambers near the lid get full of water after frying for over 90 minutes at a time (2 Turkeys) Make sure you dry those out between drops otherwise you will have water on your countertop our a random flare up when the water hits the hot oil.
Cool lights. Love how you can adjust where the light shines. Disappointed that only three of the four lights worked out of the package.Not worth returning for one light

This is a nice case.  It protects the phone great.  The phone just holds too much heat.  When quick charging the phone the case gets way too hot to hold.  Have to take the case off in order for it to cool off.Something to watch out for is that even though the S5 is waterproof, if you get water on the front of the screen you will have to take the case off in order for the phone to work properly.  Water gets trapped under the front screen and doesn't allow the screen to register touches.Additionally there needs to be a cut out at the bottom so that you can use the fingerprint sensor.  You can make it work if you use your thumb sideways but its not easy.

Nice this is perfect for me.  Its slim and fits the phone perfectly.  Doesn't interfere with any of the functions of the phone EXCEPT the heart rate sensor.  In an attempt to be the most form fitting case on the market, they didn't make the space large enough for the heart rate sensor.  In the next batch of cases they need to open up that space a bit so you can actually reach the sensor to be able to use it.  Since I have a Smart Watch that measures my heartrate automatically I don't really need the one on the phone.

these headphones are an excellent option for replacing your standard Bose ear tips.I replaced these ear tips on my Bose MIE2i 326223-0080 Mobile Headset for Select Apple Products (Black) and WOW what a difference in sound quality!!!!!!I don't know why but it doesn't include these ear tips with all of their in ear options! Though mine do not have active noise cancellation these ear tips provide better clarity and detail and a tremendous amount more bass.Do not hesitate, these are a excellent option for replacing ear tips to get better sound quality. Are they perfect? No, but why pay twice the price for the name brand when you can get these!!Pick them up while they are so cheap!!!!
My old 2010 set of Bose headphones are brand new again!Popped these babies in and was ready to listen to my music again with these great headphones.Perfect fit. Awesome buy!!

Simply awesome.Got this little clip to go on my case and now it stays closed 100% of the time.Dint know why Samsung didn't think of this our at least or a magnetic bezel on the device so the case stays closed.Good thinking Spigen.

Finished the install in 40 minutes start to finish.Works great!Instructions are quite vague, and have the wrong wires identified as the ones needed for installation.There are plenty on clear instructions online at. http://www.gm-trucks.com/forums/index.php?/topic/156468-2014+-Power-Tailgate-Lock-installedShould be standard equipment on these trucks nowadays. Great accessory nevertheless.
Solid Parachute cord. Used to hang hammocks on a camping trip, and after the trip made bracelets out of the cord afterwards.

It's a solid piece of plastic that adds another row of storage top your armrest in the silverado. It's a pricy piece of plastic and should be standard equipment.Works well. I sure one side for change and the other holds my camera, Leatherman knife, and tire pressure gauge. Leaves plenty of space for my rechargeable flashlight and concealed carry underneath.It's a good option to organize this space a whole lot better.

Absolutely holds my Samsung galaxy S5 in its otterbox case perfectly. Positioned it with a suction cup and a couple of extension arms right where I wanted it.Now the phone is up and out of the way giving me more space to work with in the console.

Nice option versus chopping up one of your standard cords.  Works great,  Just note that the wire with the stripe on it is the positive wire.  There are no instructions, so this will make your install go much faster!

Charges everything at one time!  Love it.  Have it on my nightstand with all of my gear.  Don't like that it automatically turns off if the power goes off.  You have to manually turn it back on.  Doesn't really need a power switch.
Solid performing replacement filter.  Don't delay grab one of these if you don't go with a full cold air replacement kit.
Just like old times.  A little heavier than I remember the original version being, but its great fun throwing long bombs that you can hear coming towards you.
Totally awesome light.  Installed this in my truck using the direct wire kit, and now I have a fully charged flashlight in the truck at all times.  Nice beam pattern for everyday use!
Good quality stickers. They will look nice on my black truck. Fast shipping

Good mats. Like the contour fit. It's an exact print of my floor. They could have s bit more grip on them but that's ok. Also had to use a heat gun to reshape mat to get it to fit perfectly. 10 minute job and it was done.What I didn't like was that to install the passenger side mat you have to use a carpet drill and put a huge hole in your floor to install the mat anchor. Didn't like that at all so I skipped that. The mat does slide around a little bit. Will use some Velcro to solve that issue later.Rear floor mat is perfect. One continuous piece across perfect fit.Wish I would have knew about that carpet dill. Would have probably went with the husky liner Or the weather tech model, one step down. Like the mats overall though.

This frame is way better than the orignial one.  Doesn't feel like its going to break as you put the device in the holder.  The lens cover is an excellent touch.  We needed that.  This is just way overpriced.

Solid construction. This device works well with my Sony RX100mII. The clip is ultra strong. Requires you to open it up very wide in order to hook it to anything. This gives me an extra sense of security when carrying it around.I connected this to a generic Tamarac strap I had at the house. It works very well to have my camera at the ready all the time while out on adventurers.No instructions were included but it's pretty simple to figure out.

This press works great.  Perfect bun sized burgers.  I had 8 pounds of meat and used this press to quickly knock out 24 burgers.The trick is to place piece of clear plastic wrap on the top of your meat before you use the press, and put your wax paper cut out on the bottom.Perfect burgers, no mess at all, and I was able to reuse the plastic wrap about 20 times before it wore out and used a second piece.Great Product.

I got this drive thinking it was going to be my main drive for recording and mixing on the go, both video and audio productions.  The drive seem to work great on my Mac using Fire-wire 800. Things changed when I brought the drive back to the studio and hooked up to my PC.I'm constantly getting connection issues, extremely slow transfer rates on USB 3.0 and Fire-wire 400. The ESATA would not even connect to try that.  It completely locked up my computer. I did grab a 5V DC adapter  and hooked it up to the drive to see if that would help.  It stabilized the data connection on USB 3.0, but the transfer speeds are still super slow compared to my Seagate USB 3.0 drive.Seems to not have any problems on a Mac.  If I still had the box I would return it.
Absolutely love this thing. You can't go wrong with a Glo Frisbee.  Made the same for the last 10 years.  Flies perfect and excellent fun at dusk.

Just like the oringinal Jawbone Up, this one is plauged with issues.  1st one locked up and wouldn't charge after 30 days.  Second one, wouldn't turn on at all. and the third, lets just say its working FOR NOW.Skip this one.  Go for the new version.  My wife has that one, and it has had zero issues since Christmas 2013.
Perfect spheres of ice every-time!  Just follow the directions and you are golden!  Can't beat these at all, and the price is perfect as well.

I have always had a cheapo meat thermometer in my grilling kit.  Buddy came over and told me I needed to step up my game and he was right.  This maverick is about 5 degrees difference from the 10 dollar one I have been using, and the reading is fast!  My mom wanted a steak medium rare so I seared it both sides 3 minutes took the reading, and bam right one the money at 130 degrees while my old one was reading 120.  Steak was perfect for her liking, if I had used my old one, i would have had an overdone steak.  Not good!Unit turns on fast, and is easy to read with the big backlight numbers.  You can't go wrong with this unit. Buy one today!

Nice and thick grill gloves.  I love them. Use them to pick up pizza stones, remove racks and just keep my hands cleaner when grilling outside.  They are good to about 500 degrees no problem.  You go hotter and you have to move fast cause the heat starts to transfer through quick.

I guess the saying you get what you pay for is exactly right on this one.After looking at some reviews on amazon and YouTube. I decided to give this one a try.I'll start with the good points on this tool.Good stabilization once it was balanced.As a stabilizer I was able to get it balanced in a few minutes with a Nikon D7100 and a 55mm 1.8 lens. I was able to shoot some nice and smooth footage walking thru the house and then outside with the kids.  Didn't attempt to run since I wasn't quite ready for that on the first outing but it did a nice job taking out all of the shake of walking around.  I practiced for about thirty minutes before shooting and using techniques I have seen used by pro steadicam operators I learned how to pan and swivel my body to keep the footage smooth pretty quickly.Now that's about it for upsides here's the catchBuild QualityThe unit seems to be made out of light gauge steel. The paint was chipped the welds were not cleaned up making some of the transitions a little rough.The most concerning part was one of the SHC screws was broken and would not tighten up. It wouldn't back itself out either so I'm guessing that it broke at the end of the threads and since it had a shoulder on it, that it was just stuck.The gimbal ball is a steel ball in a brass bushing. This probably would work but the unit I got had a burr or something inside the ball that was causing the unit to stick every once and a while when moving side to side.  I was able to overcome it with two hand operation but this should not be needed. I lubricated the ball according to the instructions but it continued to stick and it would not level side to side on a constant basis without assistance.Lower Arc StabilityThe mechanism for the lower arch doesn't allow the position of the arch to be "locked in."  If you accidentally tap the lower section on an object it instantly becomes unbalanced and the camera points up to the sky or to the grown depending on how you tapped the arch.  Tightening the adjustment is difficult and you can never get it tight enough to not move at all.Lower Arch AttachmentAttaching the lower arch to the upper section requires you to slide in a section that has no locating pins into the handle section . If you don't get this section perfectly perpendicular to the camera mount plate the unit will be unbalanced to the right or left. The Nikon camera body is naturally heavier or the right side versus the left so on the first attempt to balance this camera I ran out of side to side adjustment to get it level so, you have to disassemble it, reposition the lower section arch and try again. Luckily I nailed it on the second try but others might not be so lucky.WeightsYou only get one half unit weight and six full sized ones. I could have used two of those units to be able to open up the bottom section a bit more to give my hand a bit more room between the handle and the bottom weights. The photo on the website was not the spacing that I had when I balanced my camera. I was able to get more space by bringing the camera back on on the stage and adding a spider quick release plate to add more weight, but it wasn't enough space for me to be able to move around a lot without tapping the bottom weights.ConclusionI got a unit that needed some better quality control. I honestly would have kept it if that screw wasn't broken. That was a deal breaker for me. The sticky ball probably would have worked it way put over time.  Finally there wasn't a carrying case with my model. Older models had a bag to hold it while traveling. Nothing was provided with this model so I'm moving on to a steadicam Merlin.

You really need to have multiple z-wave devices networked to get this to work well all the time.After adding some switches and another lamp module to my network things now have worked 100% of the time. Going to grab two more of these modules over time to control lights in the basement and living areas.
It's a wall plate. Not much more to say on that. Didn't come with screws so I took away a star. I already had screws so it wasn't a big deal.

Solid Flashlight. Very confusing product numbers on Amazon. None of them match the stream light website. I got a Stinger DS Led HL one with a piggyback charer and a AC quick charger.Charges fast light is bright.Will get another for my truck that I will mount inside the vehicle. No more batteries to replace for a few years.Only time will tell if it was worth the price I paid.

I have had a Heat and Glow fireplace for 4 years now, and we use it every evening to warm the den and not the rest of the house in the winter, because that's where we spend most of out time together as a family. No way I was paying $300 bucks for the company I purchased the blower from to come out and install a blower on a $900 dollar fireplace so we didn't get that option when it was originally installed. Didn't think it would make that much of a difference, boy I was wrong.My dad came over and said that he had installed one himself and that it was super easy,  so I went online and scooped this up.This thing comes fully assembled, wired and ready to go,  it was a tight squeeze to get the device in the housing, but if you take the rubber isolators off the bottom it gives you  a little bit more space to get it in there. Slapped on the temp sensor, plugged it into the AUX power connection and fired it up.After a 20 minute warm up the fan kicked on and heated up the room QUICK.Now I need to get a tempature control for the fireplace to turn it in and off automatically as it warms the room much quicker than I expected.The fan is louder than I expected, but it's a good trade off for the amount of heat this thing pumps out now.

Couldn't ask for more!!! Charges 2 iPads, an iPhone, and a kindle ALL AT THE SAME TIME!  No more extra chargers chained together on a power strip. The unit isn't as small as I had hoped, but what is good is that the power supply is built in, there is no wall wart to plug in, just a two prong cord that is detachable for easier travel.Only thing they missed on with this unit is that the front panel has a blue led letting you know that it's working. That led is BRIGHT! So much so that I added a price of black tape over it and problem solved. Just turn the intensity down on the light and it would be perfect.Going to get a second one for the kitchen area to charge the kids and the wife's devices.

Amazon, your work is perfect. Ordered one of these used it for a week and then got a second one. It charges and syncs my iPhone and iPad. It's thicker than the apple version and less flexible but that's ok. Adds more durability. Works great!!

This works great in my shower for my kids.I stuck it up and it doesn't loose suction. It's been up for weeks and it hasn't fallen yet.I did wet the cup with a little saliva before sticking it on the wall.I'm happy with it and will probably get a second one for my other shower.

These cuff links are totally awesome. They are big and bold and solid silver. I get asked all the time about where I got other from. I won't tell anyone our little secret!!These are a perfect gift for any Transformers lover!!!

As soon as the package arrived I had the parts out of the box and ready to install on my Civic Si. Everything was the right size and all items when on without any trouble. They even included the stainless steel pad guides as well.Dropped the vehicle down and took her for a spin with the new brakes and I was amazed at the stopping performance. The ABS was kicking on way sooner than before and the wheels were not as hot as they had been in the past with the stock rotors on it after heavy braking coming down this large hill near my house.I'm happy with this set of rotors and brakes. Will be getting the rear set next spring.

This is an expensive version of cucumber slices on your eyes. I may not be the market for this sort of thing, but for someone who's into organic, spendy, gimmicky skin products, this product comes in a nice box with silver-bullet vials and a tray for each pair of eye masks. According to the three steps on each foil mask label, you soak both masks with the contents of a vial and place on your eyes for 10 minutes (or 15-20 according to their website description). I left them on for 20 minutes, and although they felt good and mosturized the skin under my eyes, there was no difference between the before and after snapshots I took, except extra-shiny skin. Like others said, the soggy masks are delicate and curl up easily; basically you need 10-20 minutes to just recline with your eyes shut, so block off time and put music on or something. I'd stick with good old cucumbers, or I'm sure there are just as effective eye treatments for less.

This is great: no more chubby charge plugs cluttering up outlets or power strips. I plugged this into the wall and set it on an end table, where it's heavy and unobtrusive, and when guests come over they can charge their phones without poking around for an outlet. It works best on ipods and iphones (and we have no trouble using an ipod while it's plugged in and charging) but also charges my Kindle, tablet and Android phone. It doesn't get hot, has a nice long solid cord - good product.

This is similar to iDVD, which I've used on an older Mac, but easier and faster to use. I wanted to burn some videos I had downloaded from Youtube onto a DVD, and it was simple to drag and drop the clips, select a style of menu and burn. However, twice the program crashed as I was selecting features for the DVD, and I had to start the process again. The program is loaded with features, too many for me to explore at first, but I wish they had debugged it better.

As long as your roads aren't too bumpy and your device isn't too large, this should work. The holder is easy to assemble and the clamp adjusts to hold a variety of phones, although it was a tad too small for my Htc One with an Otterbox case. It fit my ipod touch just fine, though, and frankly I would be leery of putting a heavy phone or GPS on this. The velcro strap easily mounts or dismounts the holder from your handlebars so you can just take the whole thing with you while the bike is parked. On smooth roads, the holder didn't come loose or spin around, but that probably wouldn't be the case on rougher roads or trails - and I would be afraid of the skinny plastic stem breaking if there was a rough spill. But for just around town or on a stroller or shopping cart, this works.

A mat, a spinner and a couple bodies (plus ideally a third to act as spinner) are all you need for this classic game. It's pretty much the way I remember it from 40 years ago. The mat is nice and heavy, the spinner is on large thick cardboard and spins easily, and the box is very sturdy and with a retro design. The game itself definitely gives you a workout! I'd recommend this edition for schools, community centers or anywhere that it will get a lot of use.

I don't usually care much for protein powder but this actually tastes good! I could smell the aroma of chocolate as soon as I opened the jar, and a shake made with 1 frozen banana, 1 scoop of powder and 6 oz water was yummy and only around 210 calories (many protein shakes are 300 or more). I also like the compact jar and sensible pricing.

I mainly got this for my ipod touch so I could listen to music while working out (hate being tangled in earbuds during a workout) and it works great, right out of the box. I paired it up in about a minute - it uses both a light and sound to signal pairing - and the sound is way better than the ipod's speaker. It also works with my HTC One phone, although I probably won't be using it as much with that since the phone has excellent speakers. The carrying bag is a nice bonus.

With protein powder, good taste is relative, and this powder is okay in taste. I tried it with frozen banana, frozen berries and pineapple (three separate smoothies, not all together) each with 6 oz of water and 1 scoop of Vega. The banana was the best tasting, the pineapple was okay and the berry smoothie didn't do much to mask the gamey flavor of the Vega. If you don't require vegan or dairy-free, I'd stick to one of the whey powders for taste. But this one does have fewer calories per scoop than many powders, so you can add milk or nuts and still not go overboard.

We needed a foundation that was more suitable for our memory-foam mattress than our old box spring foundation, and this seems to be ideal. It has stiff wires rather than springs, a wire grid on the top, wooden slats on the bottom, and thick, attractive gray quilting around the sides. I noticed there aren't plastic reinforcements on the bottom corners like our old boxspring, so I just hope the corners don't get frayed.Delivery and setup were as easy as can be for getting a queen sized box to the second floor. Ceva, the delivery company, called to set up an appointment to deliver, and it came 6 days after it was ordered. I was relieved (after reading some older reviews) that it came in a cardboard box, and inside, the foundation itself was sealed in sturdy plastic. The delivery men put the box in our garage, and with the help of my 12-year-old, we unwrapped it and got it up to the bedroom. Note that the bed frame is not included, nor do the delivery people take away your old bed.Lying on the bed feels great, with no more squeaky springs or sagging feeling. The bed now feels really solid. If you prefer an extra firm bed, this plus a memory foam mattress would make a very good combo.

This is no dollhouse replacement, and price is rather high, but my daughter still likes this bag, with its brilliant colors depicting the ice cream castle in Barbie and the Secret Door. It comes with a cardboard printed frame of rooms that doesn't seem to be removable, a mini Barbie doll and two stands that snap onto the upper rooms. It could also be used as a storage bag for small dolls in general, like Polly Pockets or the ones that come in Happy Meals.

This mill is an attractive modern design (looks sort of 70's), sturdy, and even comes with pepper inside. It's easy to fill by unscrewing the metal ball on top, which is also used to adjust the grind. The metal grinder part works great and has a lifetime warranty; the rest of the mill has a 5-year warranty which is better than many appliances. Nice to see a company stand behind its product these days.The mill just comes in a plastic bag, and the wooden top has several nicks on it when I received it. It would be nice if it would come in a suitable-for-giving box.

If you really need a glass bottle instead of metal or plastic for some reason, I guess this will do. But after using this, I prefer metal or plastic.It's heavy and the shape makes it prone to falling over, making it impractical for running, hiking or the gym. It's definitely not "one-touch" and while the metal screw cap seems sturdy, it's not attached to the bottle so it's prone to get lost. The metal mesh strap is also sturdy but the clip is very hard to remove and not much easier to reattach. The neck is too narrow for ice cubes. You're not supposed to freeze it and I'm afraid a hot drink might crack it.I'm going to stick with plastic or metal bottles.

This is labeled HE but it works fine in my conventional top loader washer; the suds just aren't as billowy. Clothes get clean and colors look fine. I would suggest to Tide to make the cap out of lighter colored, or better yet, clear plastic. On the black cap, the measuring lines are very hard to see.

Three stars for practicality, five stars for sheer "cool!" factor. I wouldn't give this to a small child who would be rough on it (and keep it away from dogs or cats!) but tweens, teens and even adults are attracted to this soft, cuddly light-up cartoon icon.My 12-year-old takes it to bed and uses it as an ambient light for playing Nintendo DS or laptop games in the dark - it's nice for being able to see the keyboard. It does take awhile to charge, though, and it can be easily knocked off the charger stand, which takes up a lot of room on a bedside table.

My 10-year-old was very thrilled by this doll. Apparently she was familiar with the Ever AFter High website; this doll comes with a bookmark that has a short backstory attached to it as well. This doll is more for someone who doesn't "play rough" with their dolls. It has a very elaborate gown with small bracelets and earrings that detach, a small plastic purse, a mask with a handle that goes over the doll's hand, and a key-shaped hairbrush. There's also a doll stand which, instead of going around the doll's waist like most stands, snaps into the doll's crotch. It's priced more like the collector Barbies than the ordinary ones, and DD is already saving her dollars to buy Apple White's friends.

This is useful not just for lockers but fridges, file cabinets, the side of a microwave or anything else magnets stick to. It has a large square magnet on the back, not just several little ones, so it holds sturdy. The large right pocket holds even my big smartphone (HTC One), Paper Mate stick pens just fit in the bottom shelf, and the small left pocket can hold pens or a narrow pair of glasses.

It should be said up front that this needs to be set up using a compatible smartphone or tablet (Android 4.0 or above, or iOS 7.0 or up). You can monitor it through a PC browser, but you CANNOT set it up using a PC. So don't buy unless you have a compatible phone, tablet or ipod.When I saw this "pet monitor", I thought, why can't this be used as an indoor security camera in general? In particular, I wanted a camera to set up in the living room window facing our front door, so I could see if the person ringing our doorbell was a friend or just another window salesman. I've had a different camera for more than a year (Trendnet camera, provided by Vine for review) doing that job, but it was a real pain to set up and I can't figure out how to view it remotely or record video. Another camera I got through Vine took very grainy black and white pictures, was battery-operated and required a paid subscription for most features. This Motorola camera seems to have made both of those cameras obsolete.I set this up in under 15 minutes. I downloaded the accompanying Hubble for Motorola app on both my Android smartphone and my ipod touch, turned on the camera (it plugs into the wall), created an account/password and paired the camera with the app.The interface is very user-friendly. You can have up to 4 cameras on the account; each one can be given a different name and picture avatar on the app's main menu. Tap the avatar and you'll see a live stream at the top of the screen, and below it, a timeline of events. If a motion or sound is detected (by default, motion and sound detections are on; they can be easily shut off or put in "do not disturb" mode for up to 3 hours) then it will say when on the timeline, and if motion is detected, a 10-second video w/audio is recorded, hopefully long enough to catch a crook stealing packages from your porch. Motion and sound detection sensitivity can be adjusted; "medium" is enough to trigger someone moving right outside the door but not if a car goes down the street.Because these videos are cloud-based, I can view them from other locations, and get alerts on my phone when things happen. It was cool to get alerted from across town when my husband came home! Other remote features: touch the live stream, and you can take a snapshot, turn on the camera's speaker and say something (maybe freak out a burglar? LOL) or even play one of 5 lullaby tunes (just in case they market this as a baby monitor).The camera also has a temperature detector, which you can set to alert you if the ambient temperature goes above or below a certain number. I suppose that's useful if you have reptiles or other pets that need a certain temperature.I downloaded the app onto a 7" tablet running Android Kitkat, a smartphone also running Kitkat, and an ipod touch with iOS 7.0, and all work well. The tablet is nice to have set up on a counter as a full-screen monitor. Because videos are sent up to the cloud and back again, there is occasional buffering and lagging. The ipod app keeps wanting to update firmware on the camera, and it keeps failing to load - I'm going to ask their CS about that.In addition to the smartphone apps, the camera can be monitored by logging in to Hubble's website. But again, you need the smartphone app to set it up. (May as well reiterate that at the end of the review.)

I got this spray to help get rid of mustiness in the basement, and it works great for that. Then I tried it under the kitchen sink, which had some stink from a leaky garbage disposal, and after spraying the Febreze and closing the cabinet doors for a few hours, the odor is GONE! The spray's scent is sort of floral/chemical, but after a few minutes, it goes away and I can't smell anything in the air, bad or otherwise. I don't know about the allergen claims, but for getting rid of smells, this stuff works great.

This notebook seems as sturdy as when I used them in school. It has a kelly green plastic cover, four double-sided pocket dividers (not tabbed or gusseted, but at least they're reinforced) and perforated three-hole college ruled paper. It will fold back, or lay flat. Hopefully this will survive my daughter's school year.

My 10-year-old Barbie fanatic tore this out of its box and had it assembled almost before I had the packaging carted away. This is a rather pricy one-note toy, but she seems to like it. It comes with a lot of very small pieces, so beware if you have younger tots that like to swallow things. Many of the pieces pop into holes in the two-tiered stand or store inside the covered "bathtub", and DD likes how the three pet jackets hang on hooks on the stand. There's an unboxing video for this on YouTube - apparently toy unboxing is a very popular genre there - and after watching it, DD gave me a demonstration of all the little pieces and really got into pretending to wash the three pets.

A case like this is almost a must for the HTC One, because the slick metal body can make it slippery, and the Otterbox is known for top-notch protection. The case is easy (especially compared to their Kindle case) to install, but they need better instructions, because as others have noted, if you don't tug the headphone-jack flap all the way through the hole, it won't fit right on the bottom. Thanks Amazon reviewers for pointing that out!One thing that doesn't work when the Otterbox case is on the phone, is the volume-button pressing to turn on the camera when the phone is sleeping. But the other features work fine with the case, including the infrared sensor to use it as a TV remote.

This is my first real smartphone (I'm not counting the Palm Pixi Plus with the obsolete OS or Kyocera Milano which gets full after about 3 apps) and I love it. The slim metal case with gleaming gold (not gray like in the photo) speaker bars really makes it stand out and sets it apart from the ubiquitous iphones and Galaxys. People walking past my table in restaurants have stopped to ask about it. This phone looks like it belongs in an executive suite or Hermes bag instead of a teenager's locker.But beyond the looks, there are tons of impressive features; where to begin. The dual-lens camera, which turns on with a press of the volume button, has modes for a 360-degree panoramic photo or a selfie within a photo. There's also something called Zoe which I think makes short Vine-like videos (I had trouble figuring it out). You can edit photos with various backgrounds, filters or a 3D effect. The photo gallery app automatically makes slide shows of photos you took each day or for events, and you can add music and easily share them online.I also think the TV remote feature is really cool. Because it works with an infrared bar at the top of the phone like your regular remote, it doesn't require wifi or data unlike TV remote apps. It's easy to set up and it's great to just grab my phone to change the channel or volume instead of hunting down the remote.Oh yeah, the audio! Whether listening through the speakers or included premium earbuds, it sounds awesome. Both the included music app and the Amazon Music app work fine. I have Prime Music and have made a ton of playlists.The phone also works well as a phone. You can set it up to answer when you pick it up or by swiping, and the contacts list lets you add picture icons and all kinds of info. Everything's very customizable. The Blink Feed interface shown in the photo can be customized to add various news sources or social media. If you download the Fitbit app, the phone acts as a pedometer (no Fitbit necessary!) and displays your steps and other data on the Blink Feed screen. If you don't care for Blink Feed, it's easy to make a different screen your home screen and add widgets such as the clock and weather icons.This is a fantastic phone, even for a smartphone novice like me. HTC deserves to run with Apple, Samsung and all the other big dogs.

Tide has been a favorite detergent of mine for a long time, and this version has Downy fabric softener already added, to cut down on laundry room clutter or make it good for traveling. It's easy to measure and gets our clothing clean and fresh-smelling.

I have a Dell Venue 7 tablet (obtained through the Vine program) and since it's not as popular as the ipads, Kindles and Nexuses, I can't find a decent case for it in stores. This case fits, although it's a tad large (made to fit both 7" and 8") and feels very sturdy. The only problem with the corner holders is that they either cover up the power button or the charging socket, but I fault Dell for that design, not Belkin. I just remove one corner when the tablet is charging. The holders hold the tablet in very securely and the cover stays closed with a magnet in the lower lip. Outside is smooth, doesn't show fingerprints much and is a nice dark purple color.

If you want a Dustbuster for carpets and stairs and money is no object, this might be just the thing. On hard floors, though, a Swiffer vac does as well or better for a tenth of the price.I had never owned a Dyson, so I was eager to see why it's so pricey and popular. It's shiny and attractive, with large and small motorized brush heads, a crevice tool and a small dusting brush head, all of which easily snap on and off the purple tube or the wall mounting unit. Everything's matchy matchy, even the oval silver wall wart. The unit is very light and unlike other reviewers, I didn't mind holding down the trigger.After charging the battery for a few hours, I tried the vacuum on my hard kitchen floor. While it picked up crumbs, it had trouble with bits of paper or cereal. I did a side by side test with my cordless Swiffer vac (around $50) which sucked the cereal and paper right up. Hmmm.Next I tried my carpeted stairs, and that's where the Dyson redeemed itself. After pressing the Max button, I had time to clean 4 steps before the battery died, and they looked like they had been shampooed. After recharging, I used it minus the Max to clean the rest of the stairs, the landing and part of the living room before the battery died again.Bagless vacuums are never not messy to empty, but the Dyson is about as easy to empty as can be; I put the canister deep inside a grocery bag and pressed a button to make the bottom flip down. I also had to clean a lot of hair from the brush heads, which are easy to take apart with a coin.This would be best for small carpeted apartments, or if it's worth this much to make vacuuming stairs easier. For a big house, though, it's not going to replace the corded vacuum.

I had been looking forward to this book because I liked Nick's website and youtube videos, so I bought the kindle version before getting the hardcopy book on Vine. The book is big in format, with lots of photos and descriptions of exercises using all sorts of equipment from barbells and angled barbells ("landmines") to dumbbells, kettlebells, balls, suspension trainers and your own bodyweight. Throughout, Nick explains the purposes of each exercise and routine (broken down into circuits, combinations and complexes). At the end are a break-in muscle building program, six sample routines where you alternate two workouts each, a bodyweight routine and an optional strength-cardio circuit called Fat Loss Five.All throughout, you're encourages to plug in or substitute exercises based on your ability and available equipment. But unlike New Rules of Lifting for Life, which organizes exercises within type based on difficulty, this book organizes them more by equipment used, and since there are no page numbers on the workout charts, you have to go back and search if necessary. I agree that an index is badly needed as well as page numbers on the charts (I wrote them in myself, in the book).The workouts themselves are fun and have a lot of variety, but they are long. With a warmup, I can't get them under an hour, and it's more like 90 minutes in a crowded gym. But they do work me out! I especially like the farmer's walk routine, and I'm learning how to use the landmine at the gym. I feel like I've gained strength more than fat loss at this point, but that's still a good thing especially at my age.I feel they could have done a much better job with the Kindle edition. There are no hyperlinks and the photos are tiny, although they are in color while the book is in black and white. Still, I prefer the layout of the book.

Mr. Clean leaves Fantastic in the dust. Just a little blob of this cleaner plus a wet sponge will leave greasy stoves or sticky tables clean and smelling great. It's also wonderful in a bucket of water for mopping both tile and hard wood floors. I also like the compact bottle design with flip cap and easy squirter.

This really tastes like ranch dressing, a nice sweet-salty-spicy combo, and unlike the others, isn't a fine powdery cloud. Not only is it good on popcorn (if you air-pop, spray it with water or oil first so it will stick) it's also delicious on veggies, salad, eggs and potatoes.

The spicy Cheesy Jalapeno is my favorite of these three seasonings. I like it on eggs, potatoes, tacos, anything that cheese can be put on. The Bacon Cheddar is not bad, with a very overwhelming bacon flavor. The Buffalo Wing is okay; kind of salty-peppery and makes me sneeze.If you make air-popped corn, like we do, you'll have to spray it with oil or water to make the seasoning stick. The small hand-sized shakers with flip tops are convenient and let people choose their favorite flavor.

If you're going to put this in a bedroom, keep in mind that it has two narrow strips, one on either side, that glow green at night much like the lights underneath some hot rods. They are bright enough to maybe interfere with sleep for some, but might help as a night light for kids.There are 12 3-hole outlets with sliding covers, but only the four at the corners have enough clearance for wall warts, while the others are crammed together in 2 rows of 4. There are also in-out surge protectors for a phone line and ethernet line (no cables included), and 2 USB charging outlets. The low profile, shiny black plastic and glowing light strips make this a very attractive, high-tech-looking device.

This coconut (sort of) scented spray offers light-duty control for flyaway kids' hair.  I deducted a star because mine didn't like the smell very much, which disappointed them because they like the smell of Suave's coconut shampoo. To me it's more of a tropical-floral scent. But this spray works and is easy to use, and the smell dissipates after a few seconds.

This Duck-brand tape seems no different from Scotch Magic Tape, the matte tape that you can write on. It's best for paper and labeling. The dispensers are slightly smaller than the Scotch dispensers, if space is extremely short in the junk drawer.

This screen protector is very easy to install (made of stiffer, thicker material than other protectors) and has better "glide" and shows fingerprints less than others. The only thing hard about the installation is lining up the inside edges of the border with the viewable display. Otherwise, this is great and I would highly recommend it for the new-model (cameraless) Kindle HD 7".

I don't like this as much as the Moshi iVisor screen protector (which I also received from Vine) but if you can't or don't want to spend an extra $10, this works okay. It's more flexible than the Moshi and doesn't have a border, making it harder to position correctly and with minimal air bubbles. I ended up removing this (replacing it with the Moshi), and putting it on my Dell Venue tablet after trimming it to size.

These drops had a sharp menthol taste at first, but then the honey lemon flavor kicked in and was very soothing and effective. Cough drops are recommended over cough syrups for relief from coughs, so I've been using drops a lot this year, and these are very good ones.

My husband and I have been Dave Barry fans since way back when the Washington Post actually printed his column every week. Dave has also helped navigate us into middle age with his "Turns 40" and "Turns 50" books, which is why we were disappointed there was no "Turns 60" book.Dave helps make up for it here with a chapter on turning 65, appropriately titled "Death." In it, he tears up the usual topics of aging - Viagra commercials, junk mail for old folks, forgetting things - in his usual hilarious way, topping it off with a description of his funeral that I hope actually takes place and that William Shatner had better stick around for!Yes, after all these years, he does have familiar schtick like remembering some obscure thing from the 50s or 60s (here, a Beach Boys song) while forgetting something that society deems important (math).  Things like the grammar guide and writing guide have also been done before, but they're no less hysterical this time around.

This case isn't cheap, but what a difference from the discount-store cases. The different materials and textures (smooth rose-pink fabric, matching leather and plastic frame and soft interior cloth touching the Kindle screen) are stitched together very well and held with a matching elastic band. I've been carrying this around constantly and nothing is fraying or coming apart. The Kindle snaps in and out of the frame easily, although there's no real need to remove it unless you're changing cases. To read the Kindle in portrait position, I simply fold the cover back so that the leather part is making sort of a "lip" on the right side of the Kindle, making it easy to hold without getting my fingers all over the screen.

I was a little disappointed that Just Dance went back to their generic Kids series instead of a Disney Party 2. The songlist includes Disney Channel's heavily-played "Ready Or Not" by Brigit Mendler, plus DC stars Selena Gomez and Demi Lovato and Nick star Victoria Justice, yet it's Just Dance 2014 (the "grownup" game) that got Disney's Prince Ali, from Aladdin.Still, if you have young kids and are concerned about lyrics or twerking, this game might be preferable. Like JD Kids 2, it has videos of kids dancing on colorful backgrounds, plus the make-your-own Just Create feature.I'm meh about this game, because some of the dances make you wonder what they've been smoking. "Do You Love Me" has a weird skit about a dog and cat and mouse, instead of a 60s-style setting like one might expect. Some dances seem a little complicated for younger kids. But there are a few fun gems, like the very disco-styled "The Hustle."If your kids are over 8, go for the regular Just Dance 2014. Let's hope for another Disney Party next time.

I've been using kettlebells for several years and Steve Cotter is one of the biggest names in the field, so I was looking forward to this book, and it's worth it. Steve goes over pretty much everything you need to know about kettlebells - different types, how to choose a weight, clothing, trainers, shoes, safety, no stone unturned, followed by full-page photo illustrated descriptions of kettlebell exercises plus warm-ups and form correction drills. There's even general fitness info like goal-setting and energy systems. At the end are sample programs, including programs for specific sports like boxing, golf, hockey, etc. Of course there's no substitute for a live kettlebell trainer and I would've liked to see the Kindle edition with videos, but this is still a great kettlebell book for all levels.

I got a Kindle Fire HD a few weeks before I got this Dell Venue tablet, so I'm going to compare the two. They're both good, in different ways, and cost about the same.One thing I noticed right away about the Venue is it's more comfortable to hold. It's slimmer, slightly thinner and lighter than the Kindle. My female hands can comfortably wrap fingertips around the Venue but I can't quite get them around the Kindle, although a man might not have that problem. So I actually prefer reading Kindle books on the Venue, although the Kindle app for Venue isn't quite as "fancy" as the Kindle's (the Kindle lets you scroll a table of contents from the side, for instance) but it's more than adequate. (Also note that the Kindle lending library only works on the Kindle.)As others have noted, if you have a Prime membership, you can't watch those free movies on the Venue without some sort of hacking. If you like to watch Amazon streaming movies, the Kindle HD has a huge advantage there; very impressive stereo sound and slightly bigger picture. But the Venue has a micro SD card slot, which the Kindle doesn't, so you can use fingernail-sized cards to store movies, music and photos and access them without using wifi.The Kindle doesn't have a camera while the Venue has really lame ones, so I'd say that's a tossup, unless ability to Skype or other video communication is vital. The rear-facing one is grainy while the front-facing one is grainy and dark, and no flash.  The Venue also has a mike, which is fun to use with the Google Now widget that tells you what's on TV just by listening to it.The Venue lets you download apps from the Google app store and customize your screens more than the Kindle. Both tablets have good displays and touch screens (the Venue seems slightly more responsive). Battery life and wifi sensitivity seem alike. You can easily flip between open apps on both tablets; the Kindle's is a little more elegant with a scrolling side menu.Overall, this is a very nice little tablet if you're more interested in Google apps than Amazon movies, or have smaller hands.

I knew from the moment Dean and Lily met, this book was going to be amazing. Not only were they blatantly antagonistic towards one another from the get go, but it was actually really entertaining trying to see them one-up each other through out most of the book. It provided me with a lot of chuckles and full laughter too. You see, both Lily and Dean have very strong personalities and opinions. Dean is used to being in control at all times and he even micro manages, which means he's happy but Lily isn't. While Lily might be a decade younger than Dean, she's well educated and aware of how to make a restaurant successful and she's not afraid to tell Dean when he's making a mistake.To make things even more difficult, their personal lives are as intertwined as their professional ones. It doesn't help their respective best friends are romantically involved with each other, making it imperative they get along. With everything they've got going on, I loved seeing them transition from adversaries to lovers. I knew when they finally let go and gave in to the attraction between them, it would be wonderful, and it was. Even once they managed to get together, their personalities softened while still showed through their new dynamic. I really loved how they were unable to stay away from one another.I get abnormally excited when I find out R.S. Grey is releasing a new book. There's just something about her stories that I love. It's the humor, the blistering chemistry between her characters, and the yearning for more when I'm finished reading.  It's the fact they're impossible to put down, even if you decide to start reading at around 1 AM just because you're so excited it's finally available. It's not just all of the above. If you've read any of her books you'll agree with me; they remind me of the wonderful rom-coms film that used to be made and ones I loved watching. I miss those so much, but R.S. Grey's books mean I get those same wonderful stories in the best way possible; a book.

Life has a funny way of throwing a wrench into your plans. While that holds true for the characters in this book, it also holds true for me. You see, I've had this book in my possession for almost 7 months now but only recently had time to sit down and read it. I truly loved this book. It was so much better than I was hoping it'd be and I wish I'd read it sooner.All it took to capture my interest and attention was the prologue. It's just a handful of pages, but it shows the beginning and fall of an almost fairy tale like relationship. My heart broke for both Ruby and Aaron. Nothing was going to be the same for them after that. Redemption for Aaron wasn't going to be easy. He didn't come home from jail the same as when he went in. Plus being around familiar places wasn't as much a blessing as he'd have liked especially when the memories associated with those places didn't let him rest.Before I get into how much I loved Aaron and Ruby, I've got to tell you about the story as a whole. First of all it's amazing. There are so many turns and twists, each one larger than the one before it, changing the trajectory of the story. I was on the edge of my seat wondering what was going to happen next for a very large portion of this book because I didn't see the majority of those twists coming. There was one in particular were I was chanting in my head as I read, "Please don't let it be her. Please don't let it be her," over and over again. Besides being full of surprises, it was HOT! It's much hotter than any of the other books written by L.J. Wilson under her other pen name.Aaron completely stole my heart. I'll admit to being shocked when his crime was revealed, but getting to know him and who he was was allowed me to see the motive behind it. I loved how committed he was to his family and trying to do the right thing while staying on the right side of the law. I loved his determination to overcome all of the challenges he was facing after leaving jail and being thrust into unfamiliar environments. Most of all, I loved his unwavering love for Ruby.I loved Ruby too. She's down to earth and a natural beauty. She loves fiercely and loyally. She' was destroyed by Aaron's betrayal and her pain changed her. Ruby is considerate to a fault. She too had a resolve of steel. Aaron and Ruby together were incandescent. I could almost feel their attraction to each on a  cellular level. They were truly the keepers of the others soul. Of course their relationship wasn't smooth at all. There were moments when I wanted reach into my e-reader and get rid of all the obstacles hindering them from reuniting.L.J. Wilson has written this fantastic second chance romance that defies categorization. This book elements of so many different stories that are interwoven seamlessly and effortlessly. She manages to connect readers to a story told in the third person, something most writers struggle to do. You don't know what to expect but all you can do is devour each page frantically, at least that's how it was for me. When I finished this book I was left with an overwhelming sense of admiration for L.J. Wilson for this amazing story and wonderment as to how I was going to verbalize that coherently. I'm beyond eager to read the next book. While reading, I fell in love with not only Aaron and Ruby, but the entire Clairmont family. I have a feeling this entire series is going to be full of passion, drama, suspense, and discovery. I can't wait to find out for myself!

I'm not going to lie to you. This book was brutal. Karina Halle really out did her self. I don't know what it was but this book blew my mind in all sorts of ways both expected and unexpected.I think the reason this book hit me harder than I thought it would is because I was so emotionally invested in Javier Bernal. While Dirty Angels and Dirty Promises focuses on him, I first met him in Karina Halle's The Artists Trilogy. There was something special about him even then. Thankfully the Artist series doesn't have to read before this book, but Dirty Angels does. But I digress. I wanted Javier to find some semblance of happiness with Luisa, as much as someone like him could find.I've read all three books in this trilogy and I've got to say even having an idea about what might happen to Luisa and Javier still didn't prepare me for everything that went down. I was devouring this story at a furious pace when something happened that both horrified and sickened me. I had to put my kindle down. I stepped away from the book for about 20 minutes and then realized not knowing what was going to happen next hurt more, so I started reading again. There were a number of times when I felt like the story was going to overwhelm me. It wasn't just the violence and brutality that occurred in the pages, but also my feelings and those of the characters.Surprisingly enough, I never reached my breaking point; the point where things were so horrific or painful I couldn't take any more, and there were some truly horrifying moments. Weaker characters couldn't have survived, but Javier and Luisa are anything but weak. They're imperfect people who make costly mistakes and lose sight of each other amid grief and strife. How ever their inner cores of strength and resolve do not waiver or weaken a bit. Luisa truly surprised me in this book. I don't think I could come close to handling a tenth of what she endured in this book alone, but she somehow managed to remain strong and not lose her will to fight. I can't tell you how much I admired her for that.As Karina Halle says before the book even starts, this isn't really a love story, and she's right. It's what happens after the happy-ever-after when things don't go as planned. It's gritty, raw, and violent, but it's real. It's hard to look away from and impossible to forget. While this may not have been the semi sweet with a touch of violence story I was expecting, it was 100% true to Javier and Luisa, and a story befitting of them. It's the story I didn't know I wanted and I'm thankful to Karina for taking me out of my comfort zone. I don't know if I'm ready to say goodbye to Javier. He's managed to carve a special place in my heart for himself.

Toni Aleo has a distinct writing style. I've read and loved some of her Assassins books before, so I sort of knew what to expect. It turns out this story is a prelude of sorts to another. Now I have no problem with that, but I wasn't able to connect with the hero, well rather with his logic. I didn't like Jordie very much. Will I read the continuation of his story when it's released? Yes, because I'm expecting Toni to redeem in my eyes. I won't be easy, but I have feeling it'll be sweet.

4.5 stars!Sarina sure does know how to write some amazing romance! This book was hot and steamy yet all of that took a back seat to Dane and Willow's feelings for one another and the challenges they faced. I can't believe how quickly I devoured this book! I started reading it after midnight and finished it in a matter of hours.

This book was a total surprise. I love stories where unlikely people are fated to be together. Seeing them struggle to mesh their beliefs and lives is always satisfying. It shows how even though you're meant to be, the journey isn't as smooth as one would think.  I loved how this story caught my attention from the very first page. I really liked the way Jill Myles built and introduced this new world to us. I really felt like I was visiting another world with all of these fascinating new beings.I can't say I sympathized with the Athonites much. Especially not the way they were treating the people they conquered like the Vidaris. I was amazed at how my feelings towards both the Athonites and Vidaris changed as I read the story. It wasn't like my allegiances switched between one people or another, but my perception of them did change. I stopped caring about who was who and was totally invested in Prince Graeme and Seri.To say Graeme and Seri butted heads and were opposites in personalities goes without saying. Both of them had very strong personalities and ideas about what their future would be like. Having to all of a sudden deal with being bound to the other was tough for both. I liked seeing them figure out how to work around their differences and come together both for themselves and their peoples. I also loved the connection they had with each other. Even when they were at odds, they showed a care and concern for the other that was touching.There aren't many moments in this book that made me laugh, but there were moments that made me cry happy tears. There were some sad and angry tears as well. There's a lot of action and drama that comes with nobles being bored for hundreds of years. The book will certainly keep you on your toes and captivated as the story unfolds. I would love to read more books set in this world. I hope Jill Myles continues to write in the paranormal fantasy romance genre. I certainly would read it!

No one writes teenage angst the way Jessica Sorensen does. She has this way of reaching into my chest and bringing out all these emotions and feelings I had as teenager. I can't always relate personally to the experiences her characters have, but I can always empathize with them.I fell in love with Isabella from the first page. I hated how she felt in her own home. Her parents were no help or support and neither was her older sister Hannah. I wondered if it was any surprise Isabella didn't feel comfortable in her own skin. I liked how sweet Isabella was. Even with everything going on around her, I loved that she never gave up trying to reach her family. I loved how she was with Kai and Kyler even if they didn't give her the time of day before her metamorphosis.  I don't know if I'd be able to do the same if I was her. I would've given up on all of them a long time ago.When things happened at home that led to Isabella getting out of the toxic environment for three months, I was ecstatic for her. Granted she was leaving home with a broken heart of sorts, but she was out of the stifling company of her parents and sister. I loved seeing her blossom and bloom during her escapades with her cousin Indigo and grandmother. I also loved how she kept up with who she wanted to be when she came back and her new avatar threw lots of people into a spin. I hated how insecure she was even when she was getting lots of attention but it was easy to understand why when she'd been told she wasn't worthy all of her life. I was so glad to see Isabella coming out of her shell and making new friends as well as being friendly with old ones.I've got to say for  a seventeen year old, Isabella is remarkable. She handled numerous sticky situations with aplomb. I totally admired her for trying to find out who she was and where she'd come from. I also admired her for sticking to her guns to try and find out who she was and what she wanted. The way this first book ended, I know the second one is going to be difficult to wait for, but I have a feeling Jessica Sorensen will make my wait worthwhile.

4.5 stars!This book has been on my radar for a while. It had all the prerequisites necessary to catch my attention: a great blurb, two good looking people on the cover, and most important of all...athletes! Not just one, but two of them. That definitely wasn't usual and I had a feeling the book was going to special, but I knew the moment I read the prologue and was hooked and left with a lot of questions.I loved how the book took me back to the first time Jordan stepped off the plane, both anxious and excited. I could almost feel it coming off her. I really liked Jordan. She was down to earth, dedicated to her game, and determined to become successful at her sport. She wasn't going to let anyone or anything stand in her way, not after the sacrifices she'd made and those that had been made for her. I loved how she was with Brody. She really truly loved him. She was compassionate and caring.  He was important to her and she showed it. Jordan was so resilient, taking control of things as they happened and standing strong through everything that came her way.I adored Brody too. Brody might be the star of football team and have a bright future ahead of him, but he was as blindsided by his attraction to Jordan as she was to him. It didn't help that Jordan knew things about him he'd never let anyone know and that bothered him to the very core of his being. Brody wasn't used to being vulnerable. My heart went out to him when I realized how much pressure he was feeling and especially when he began to relieve that pressure in ways that were harmful to himself and those around him.At the heart of this amazing story is an internal conflict of self value and worth. It's about overcoming the challenges and hurdles life throws at you while everyone around you watches in glee as you falter. There were times when I felt both Jordan and Brody's pain as if it was my own. I can't say I agreed with all of their choices and actions, but I will say I understood them. Not everyone can be strong all the time. The people we surround ourselves with help shore us up and keep up strong. Brody didn't always have the right people around him and he wasn't always willing to reach a hand out to those who were.I've got to say I loved how the story captured my interest and kept it as it moved from the past to the present. Brody and Jordan underwent lots of upheavals and changes, but their commitment to each other never wavered. There were a few places where I felt emphasis wasn't given enough and others which I felt could've been handled differently. Overall though the book is fantastic and I devoured it in what seemed to be no time at all. I love how Kate McCarthy did her research and incorporated plenty of information about soccer and football. I loved how she made her characters feel real. In the end, my wait was worth it because I got an unforgettable story with depth and emotion.

This book has left me speechless in all the best ways. It took me a little over two hours to read it, but I enjoyed every word of it. As a connoisseur of organized crime romance novel I can't believe I've never read any of Bethany-Kris's books before. I'm so glad the brightly colored cover of this book caught my interest and then the blurb ensnared me.Lily DeLuca does not want to return home, but she heeds older brother Dino's summons and comes home, only to find out she's been promised in marriage to Damian Rossi, a man she doesn't know. Damian is willing to do what's needful, but isn't counting on his attraction to Lily and Lily is also taken by surprise at how much she finds herself liking Damian.As things tends to happen in a crime family, trust is tenuous and all it takes is for one attack from an unknown entity to start pulling loose the threads that ties these four crime families together. No one is safe as the bodies start piling. I've got to tell you for someone like me who loves to read books like this one, I had no idea what was going to happen next. I was just as stunned as the characters when the story took a turn. Lily was shaken by revelations and so was I.I think part of what made this book so great was how the story focused on Lily and Damian, yet also included what was happening in between the Chicago Outfit families as well. It was incorporated in way that never let you feel you were reading two stories in one. I loved getting to know Lily's friends and other members of the family. Another part of the book I really loved was how it tapped into a wide range of emotions. It wasn't all tears and fears. There were moments of lightness and happiness as well.I loved how Damian and Lily were together. Granted the way they were getting married wasn't ideal, but I think they really suited one another. I loved how Damian softened when he was with her. For a man who'd always been alone and a shadow, he really took his duty of keeping Lily safe and happy to heart. There were some moments when I really felt Lily's pain like it was my own. I understood her fear, anger, and confusion and also understood why things had been kept from her.Honestly, I can't wait to read more about the people I met in this book, whether it's Lily and Damian or others. I have a feeling this series is just getting started and this first book has really set the tone for the others. There's mayhem, romance, violence, and death in this book plus secrets and manipulation. It all comes together to tell a story that will leave your heart racing, you on the edge of your seat, and left wanting more.

The Dirty Secrets continues with the third installment in the series. Things between Sinthia (Sin) and Core are heating up and I mean literally. The tension that's been growing in between them is at boiling point and it's fantastic to watch! Sin is being her scrappy sarcastic self, giving lip like a pro. Core is still the master of his domain and all in it as he tries to avenge his mother's death.I felt like this part is the hottest yet. Not only do Sin and Core burn up the pages, but the mystery and suspense also ramp up. There were some interesting developments in the story. I liked how the flashbacks to the past were included. It really helped me grasp what motivated Core and Sin as I was privy to moments and thoughts other characters weren't. Thankfully it's a fast read which is a mixed blessing. Especially since I wanted to read more at the end of this part. I felt like while Sin and Core made great strides with their attraction to one another, I was a little confused at how quickly Sin capitulated to Core's desires and demands. Plus the mystery surrounding Sin's parents is making me curious and something I would've loved to know more about.I'm really looking forward to the next part because I'd love to know how the story progresses from here. I have a feeling things are about to get a little more interesting for both Sin and Core as the puzzle pieces of their lives fall in place.

Jay and Bridgett are coming face to face over a decade after they'd last seen each other. Back then they were in love and the future looked promising, now they have nothing but animosity towards each other. Of course nothing is as it seems as they slowly learn. The flame that burned brightly between them hasn't gone out making their interactions a bit more complicated than they'd like.I liked Jay and Bridgett. It's obvious there's history between them that's caused them to change. Jay notices Bridgett is no longer the lively girl her remembers. It's like the spark in her has gone out. Bridgett isn't the only one whose gotten cynical. Jay's attitude has changed completely too. The open man with lots of love to give is gone, leaving this current avatar in its place. I loved being in both Jay and Bridgette's heads. It really allowed me to grasp who they were and how they'd evolved. I was even excited when they allowed their instincts and bodies to override what their heads were telling them.
