Sound is clear but not much bass, and you can definitely make out stereo effects watching movies.The battery is only 5930 mAh which is pretty small for a 10" tablet.  This is really the biggest downside. Battery life is by no means awful and overall the tablet seems generally power-efficient, but with the brightness cranked way up you're definitely going to notice the battery draining faster than you like. If you want amazing battery life this is not the tablet for you but I think overall the pros outweigh the cons.

It's just body wash. Not much to say about it. You lather it up, it gets you clean. My gf loves the smell of it. One time after I took a shower she couldn't stop sniffing my arm. "YOU SMELL SO GOOD!" It keeps me clean and her happy so go ahead and get some for yourself.

Judged only on the merits of salad spinners, this is more like a 4-star product. There are other salad spinners that have larger capacity, and are easier to get cranked up and spinning. This is a bit small and basic.BUT...those salad spinners take up a lot of space. I have a small kitchen and not a ton of storage space. I also have all kinds of kitchen stuff taking up space. So the ability of this salad spinner to collapse down is really what gets it the 5-star rating. Collapsing it definitely helps with storage, and also makes it much easier to throw in the dishwasher.So if you don't want a huge salad spinner taking up a bunch of space, this is a great choice.

I have wide, flat feet and I pronate. I buy a lot of sneakers for how they look even though they don't come in widths and aren't necessarily the best for my feet. But for working out I like to have a pair that are actually good for my feet.For my workout shoes, I've been a Brooks Beast guy for many years. The most comfortable shoes I've ever had were the Brooks Beast 8 from several years ago. I've had a couple of the newer versions as well. When it came to buy another pair, I tried the current Beast 14 but they were far too stiff and lacked cushioning.  So I looked for other options.Compared to my old favorite Beast 8, the Stabil CS3 isn't quite as sublimely pillowy, but it is still quite cushioned, provides great support for my feet, has enough flexibility at least for a shoe in the motion control category, and is noticeably lighter than any of the Brooks Beast versions I've had in the past. When I first tried them on I was concerned they weren't going to have enough cushioning, but after a couple runs they softened up considerably while still maintaining their support.Depending on the shoe, I will buy an 11 2E or 4E.  The Stabil CS3 is only available in 2E but I tried them and they are wide enough for me. So for you extra-wide wearers, don't be too scared off by the lack of 4E, these are worth a shot.

I was all excited about the Tab 2 A10-70. Decent enough performance for the price, nice screen, mostly free of bloatware once you ditch the terrible stock launcher for something better like Nova.  But there's an annoying issue that I just can't live with: it maxes out at 720p video! I've tried Netflix, Amazon Instant, and YouTube and they all look like crap.  What's the point of a full-HD screen if the device can't actually play 1080p video?To give you an idea of how annoying this is, I pulled up the same movie in Netflix on both the Tab 2 A10-70 and on my PS3 hooked up to my 50" tv. The picture on the 50" tv, which is blowing the image up way larger than a 10" tablet, looked consistently sharper.  It's impossible for me to ignore this when most of the time I watch video on a tablet lying in bed with the thing close to my face. The pixelated video is quite literally staring me in the face.Supposedly this thing is going to be updated to Lollipop soon (Lenovo's original specs say "expected June 2015," so much for that since it's July 6 today) and maybe there's an off chance that it will start playing 1080p video with the update.  That's the only reason I haven't returned it yet.  If the Lollipop update doesn't fix the video quality, or it doesn't get updated by the time my return window closes, it's going back.

It was easy enough to tune, but unfortunately it had static in the background on every radio station I tuned it to. I returned it and got a GoGroove X2 Mini, which has worked much better. As others have mentioned, a lady with a Chinese accent says "the bluetooth is ready for pairing" when you turn on your car, and "the bluetooth has connected successfully" when it pairs to your phone. I guess they didn't want to have it just make a beep.

Fit my '05 Grand Cherokee perfectly and do a great job of catching all the crap that gets stuck to my shoes or boots in Wisconsin winter. The tire tread pattern on them is helpful for scraping snow off my boots when I get in the Jeep.  Only real downside is the little grommet for the hook on the floor of the Jeep to go through on the driver's floor liner is so tight on the hook (to prevent leaks) that in the winter, it's tough to get the liner off the hook when the plastic material of the liner is cold and thus less flexible. But overall very happy.

I tried a couple cheaper FM transmitters before settling on the GOgroove X2 Mini. Both of the others were unable to broadcast a static-free signal to the radio in my '05 Jeep Grand Cherokee, on ANY frequency. The audio signal they did send was a lot quieter than regular radio stations.  So I decided to try a GOgroove, and for the most part I'm happy.The good news is, the signal from the X2 Mini is nice and clear.  I live in Madison, WI and was able to very easily find a clear station. It took a little more work on a recent trip to Chicago, but eventually I was able to find one there too. If you live in Chicago and are having trouble finding a good station, try 98.3, it worked well for me.Cons (none of these are a big deal, but worth mentioning):The stalk that goes into the power outlet is too long.  I've attached a picture of how far it sticks out from my dash.  I'm not sure if it's this long for a reason, but it would make more sense to not be so big. I didn't want the goose-neck regular X2 since that'd stick out even more.  But the stalk should be an inch or two smaller.The auto-tune feature lands on even-numbered stations like 102.2 but US radios mostly can only tune to odd-numbered stations like 102.3.  But it's pretty easy to find a station manually. Using the knob to tune it is a lot nicer than others where you just have buttons.There's no power switch. I have 2 power outlets in my dash, one switched with the ignition and one that stays on all the time. It's in the switched outlet, so when I turn off the car, the GOgroove turns off but the radio stays on, and I get static. I'm training myself to turn the radio off when I turn off the car.Overall though, these cons are pretty minor, and given how poorly some of the other FM transmitters I tried performed, I'm just happy the GOgroove puts out a clean signal with relatively little fuss.

I haven't had the sealing issues that other reviewers have mentioned.  Not sure if the manufacturer has improved the seal over time since those reviews are from several years ago.  My one annoyance with this tire gauge is it has what looks like a power button, but that's just for the little flashlight on the end of the tip. To actually turn the gauge on, you hit the 'SET' button. I went to use the gauge after like 6+ months of not messing with it, forgot this quirk, and thought the battery was dead. I bought new batteries for it, pressed the not-power button, and when the gauge still didn't turn on I realized, oh yeah, what about the 'SET' button? So...the slightly counter-intuitive buttons led me to purchase new batteries probably sooner than I really needed to.

I have a big (relatively speaking) RCA amplified antenna that we had been using in our living room with a 39" tv.  We upgraded to a 50" tv and the RCA antenna was kinda crowding the space on the tv stand. We moved the RCA antenna upstairs to our guest room, and used this little guy in the living room, just kinda hiding behind the tv. It pulls in all the same channels as before. Granted we're within a few miles of the tv towers here in town but no issues whatsoever.

This pouch is a perfect fit for my Olympus E-PL5 with Panasonic 20mm f/1.7 lens attached. It's good quality and let's you dangle a wrist strap out the corner for easy carrying. There's a small inner pocket for items like a memory card, rear lens cap or filter.

I have a few fancy watches, but I recently left a desk job to cook in a restaurant and didn't want to mess them up in a kitchen. I wanted a cheap water resistant watch with a day & date display, and countdown timer. This one does the trick and looks pretty cool too. I really like how when you go to set it, it has a little icons that show you which button will adjust what setting. So you don't have to remember secondary functions for the buttons while setting a timer or alarm, because the watch tells you what the buttons do.The only thing I'd change is that in countdown timer mode I wish there was a way to quickly put the timer setting back to zero. You can reset the timer to the last setting you entered, but if you want to enter a new setting you have to adjust the timer setting using the +/- buttons. But this is pretty minor and I still really like the watch.

I bought this strap to use with my Olympus E-PL5. Unfortunately it's not quite doing the trick. The big leather thing you see in the picture is a sleeve that goes over some screws. You undo these screws to open up the strap and attach it to the camera, and the sleeve covers these screws. The problem is this sleeve then gets in the way of your hand when holding the camera. I've tried to hold the camera with this leather sleeve between the camera and my palm but it makes for an awkward grip on the camera.

I bought these for watching movies on my iPad on planes.  I didn't want big over-the-ear type headphones and figured these would do the trick.  The noise cancellation effect is somewhat subtle, but combined with the in-ear style buds the net result is pretty good.  I also use them when working in the library at school where people are obviously quiet but the HVAC vents are kinda loud.  Here they do a great job of making for actual quiet.  Sound quality is also pretty nice.

I upgraded to the Expert Mouse from a Kensington Orbit w/ Scroll Ring.  Hardware-wise, this thing is really nice.  It's kinda huge, especially with the included wrist rest attached.  Ball is nice & big with good inertia.  Right out of the box it was a little rough but after a couple hours of use is already starting to smooth out so I'm sure will be fine. The scroll ring isn't quite as good as the Orbit.  It's made out of a soft-touch rubber material, but is covered in a ton of tiny ridges so ends up feeling a bit rough to the touch.  The Orbit's scroll ring uses the same rubberized material but has much fewer raised ridges that are spaced farther apart--it actually feels soft unlike the Expert Mouse.  But other than that I really like the Expert Mouse hardware.The Kensington TrackballWorks software DID NOT WORK on my office PC, running Windows 7 Professional x64 SP1.  I installed "TrackballWorks 1.1 for Windows (32-bit,64-bit) (Windows 7)" from Kensington's site. I attempted to change button settings with it but the settings, while showing in the program, had no effect.  I uninstalled TrackballWorks and instead am using X-Mouse Button Control (just google it) that does work for setting button functions.  This combined with the built-in Windows mouse control panel for pointer & scrolling speed works well enough.If Kensington got their software working better then this would be a 5-star review. I wasted what would've been a productive hour of work, fussing around with TrackballWorks before getting settled with X-Mouse Button Control.

I've had this trackball for a couple years.  Overall it's pretty good.  I use it with the included wrist rest that clips on to the edge.  It's reasonably precise, but the ball also has enough weight where you can fling the cursor around the screen when needed.  I also like the scroll ring.  I can use it while still keeping 2-3 fingers on the ball, and I now am pretty good at using both the ball and scroll ring at the same time.  I strongly prefer this setup over a traditional scroll whell stuck on a trackball.I wish the ball were a little larger & heavier as this would aid both in precision and flinging the cursor.  I'd also like a third button or the ability to click the scroll ring.  With only two buttons, I have to Ctrl-click to open a link in a new browser tab and I'd prefer the ability to do this one-handed.  Cordless would be nice to help clean up desk clutter but a corded trackball is way less annoying than a corded mouse, because unlike a mouse the trackball stays in its place on the desk.I recently bought a Logitech Wireless Trackpad, but within a couple hours got sick of it and went back to my Orbit.  I'm returning the Trackpad.

I have an iPad 2. With how thin this thing is, it seemed silly to get a case for it that stays on all the time. I like holding my iPad without a case.  But I did want something to protect it when tossing got on my car's passenger seat to take somewhere, or slipping it in some other bag with other items.  I saw a previous review stating this case is too tight for the original iPad, so figured it'd fit my iPad 2 just right. It does. The neoprene provides tons of cushioning and I don't have to worry if my iPad gets knocked around a bit. Not that I try to knock it around of course. Only downside is the white material around the edges is hard to keep perfectly clean looking but that didn't seem worth deducting a star for.

I have a Dell Latitude E6510 with a DisplayPort. Apparently a lot of business projectors, depending on age, have DisplayPort but not HDMI. So the Latitude as a business laptop has a DisplayPort to be compatible with more projectors. I don't use it with a projector, but I do like to hook it up to my HDTV, so I need some way to convert the DisplayPort to HDMI. I had previously bought ar DisplayPort-to-HDMI cable. It worked for a while but eventually stopped providing an audio connection. Picture would show fine, but Windows 7 audio devices control panel showed Nvidia HDMI Audio as not connected. I have an HDMI cable hanging out connected to my tv for my other (HDMI-equipped) laptop, and camera, so I got this cheapie adapter rather than a whole new DisplayPort-to-HDMI cable.  So far it works fine including audio, and if it goes bad then I only need to replace the adapter and not a whole cable.

I picked these up as part of my laptop's "home base" on my relatively small desk in my relatively small bedroom.  Didn't need particularly huge bass and decided to give the T3100 a try because their satellites have both a midrange AND a tweeter.  Most computer speakers, even plenty of expensive ones, just have supposedly full-range drivers on their satellites which go neither low enough to blend with the sub nor high enough to give crisp cymbals etc.  I hooked up the speakers and was pleasantly surprised, they really do have a pretty decent range of sound.  It took a bit of moving the sub around underneath the desk to make the bass sound like it's part of the rest of the sound (tip: center it between the satellites) but am more than thrilled with the sound quality for the price.  Don't go expecting a home theater but for my purpose they're great.

Taste tested these on my dog this afternoon and surprise, surprise, she loved them (sarcasm, pups eats just about everything, these were no exception).The dog treats are about 1" long and 1/2 inch thick, so they are big. They smell sweet, like honey, they're crunchy & require a bit of chewing for the dog. Given the ingredients, I'm sure they taste sweet as well. The healthy ingredients is a plus, your petting is getting a treat and something healthy.Pups gives these five stars and wants more now.

Delicious!! No surprises Two types of snack mixes here - milk chocolate, pretzels (small, pea sized bites), milk chocolate with pretzels and almonds. The other type has mini peanut butter cups, pretzels, peanuts and Resees pieces.Snack mix, while tasty, not to be confused with healthy snack. Yes, peanuts & almonds are good for you (OK, chocolate is too) but these snacks are high in sugar, calories (280 each) and carbs. The chocolate in the bags comes out a bit salty after mixing with the pretzels, but in this case, that's ok.I can recommend this treat since I love Hershey's and their chocolate.

Overall, this is a good product - not without flaws. Set up is fairly intuitive and part of the app, although I am of an age I still prefer having an instruction booklet. The laser sometimes requires calibration, again in the app. The image  depends on Internet connection quality on both ends, your mobile device and the Petcube, and not just on speed but most importantly on signal quality. Bottom line - it's not going to be perfect all of the time, it will freeze up and cause frustration as with many tech devices.Note - this is not a night time camera - if you want to view your pets on at night, leave a light on. You can take images of your pet and post them on the petcube wall, allow selected friends to also view your pets (they down load the app after you've given them permission to view).The smaller your dwelling is, the more likely you'll see your pets. I set this up in the family room. Great until my dog decides to sleep in the kitchen, or go upstairs to sleep (on my bed, in my spot no less).
Healthy ingredients, dog loves these - what more can you ask for in a dog food? My yellow lab really gulped these down and was looking for more. Dogs love fish too and it's good for them.

AAA+++ for the taste - my 55 lb yellow lab loved these. They are hard, like biscuits. Great ingredients. Only thing I'd caution small dog owners about - these are hard to break into smaller pieces. Not impossible, but harder than say a milk bone treat.

My wife and I have been using this for our pup for three of the four years we've owned her. It's done a great job at keeping fleas off of her and no ticks have latched onto her. We buy this every three months - it's affordable and works for our 55lb yellow lab. Recommended for price and effectiveness. Easy to use.

4 of the discs I used were ok. The last disc and after 2 writes/re-writes, went bad. No longer readable/writable.Now I cannot return product because the time period has expired. Great, so now 20% of what I purchased no longer works at all. Buy a better CD-RW brand than Verbatim. Very displeased.

I couldn't even get this out of the shipping box before my pup was sniffing and wagging her tail. Gave her some kibbes, she loved them very much!These are small kibbles, perfect for small dogs. My lab is about 55 lbs but has no problem with them.Chicken is 1st ingredient, then rice, veggies and vitamins.Excellent choice for dogs who need a special diet. Made in USA per the label. Just gave her another handful to see if she still likes them - yupper, all gone and she wants more!

The overall system & idea are great - 5 stars. I gave 4 due to the technology skills required to set it all up. If you're familiar with Wifi, routers, ethernet, usb then this is no problem at all. I'm in my 50's so I get this (barely), but I those less exposed to technology are going to carefully follow the step by step instructions (which are very good, just a lot to absorb). It's not a plug this in and let it rip.Start off with a controller (AA Batteries not included). Connect to power source, then tv, then internet (Wifi or ethernet - I suggest ethernet, less likely to have problems). There is a camera that can be installed above TV or on a flat surface. Once this is done, the kids can play.This is similar to Wii - games that get you up & moving. It's educational for the kids. The games, puzzles, shapes adjust to the child's learning curve and help with cognitive skill building.Heads up - if you buy only the gaming system, there is one game pre loaded. If you want to maximize the gaming potential, you'll want to also get the Disney Froze:Arendelle Video game. This set up comes with one controller, if you want multiplayer, then you'll need an additional controller.Summary - good gift for grandma/grandpa to get the kids - the price is compatible with other games for older kids.

These are very good ear buds. They produce crisp, clear sound - even at max volume in my Ipod. Not a lot of bass sound, even when I tried adjusting the equalizer to bass boost.The ear buds have magnets on the back so they can stick together - not sure how needed that is. They are advertised as tangle resistant. I tested this out by mashing the cord together as if it were at bottom of back pack or tossed around. They were slightly easier to untangle than standard cords.These were in grey color, which does not make them look as sharp as others, but again, if you're buying just for the sound, these are excellent for treble and mid range, ok for bass which is why I gave 4 stars.

Very pleased with this storage bin. Everything is clearly marked where it should go and can only fit one way. The spatula and Cuisinart manual do fit as well, but there are no specific spots for them - this would be a good enhancement should they ever decide to do that. Nice to have a designated area for these very sharp blades. Lessens chances of spouse or kids cutting themselves. If they had made a spot for the manual and spatula, which makes sense, this would be a five star rating.Good product, recommended.

This was a a gift for one of my neighbor's kids - it went over very well. I've not kept up with all of the Marvel Superheros, but I know a kid who likes a gift when I see one. Recommended! Nice gift for a friend/neighbor/nephew/niece without breaking the bank. I'm amazed at the technology these days - it not only talks, but can learn to talk specific phrases to other figures.

Brings back great memories - helping my son build K'Nex, watching him play with them. This one is especially fun since it's also a toy nerf gun. Safe to use, operate, kids love these. Hint - adults too! This is a great gift for a nephew or child. Ages 8-11 appropriate.

This Cuisinart is very quiet - I could not hear my wife using it and I was only 10' away, like that a lot! Our old machine was very loud. This has 2 bowl sizes, which is nice if you only want to chop an onion or something small, and if you want to set aside the small ingredient while using the large bowl for the rest of the recipe. Shredding disk was quick and efficient.The instructions say you can put everything but the base in the dishwasher on the top shelf, but it was easy enough to wash by hand. With the sharp blades, I prefer doing it by hand.I wish it came with a safe and easy way to store the blades and disks. I will be looking online to find a storage case, but I could not find anything in the instruction booklet that suggested a way to store the accessories, other than the warning that you should not store them in the unit. cord storage is not great. it is under the heavy base, and you have to manually wind it around the bottom, so not convenient to use. would be better if the cord was retractable, as the base is heavy and holding it up to wind the cord is cumbersome.Bottom line  excellent & recommended.

I've had a wireless mouse before, so I knew how to install this. It's intuitive, but they should still have directions for old people like me who sometimes  struggle with new things. I'll share my experiences in case you need them.Insert the  'wireless receiver' (that's the small USB thingy that goes into your laptop). Turn on the mouse, button is on the underside on/off. You'll want to remember to turn it off when done, one downside to wireless mouse. You can link up to 3 devices with this. I only have one, so ok. The white light on the bottom of the mouse blinks for a few seconds and then the connection is made & you're ready to go.What I like - the battery is internal and rechargeable. A USB cord is attached to do this and that is a nice feature. The other wireless I had used a standard battery. This mouse is everything they said it is in terms of use. It's accurate, fast & versatile. If you press down on the scroll button, you can change the setting from click to no click. Being older, I like the traditional click feel of a scroll wheel. There is a small square button behind the scroll wheel that allows you to move mouse in any direction. In other mice (mouses?) you press on the scroll wheel for that option.Due to the very small initial frustration of setting this up, lack of documentation and no place to put the receiver (which is called a 'dongle'), I decided to rate this a 4 because it is far better than my old wireless, the battery is rechargeable but there should be a place on the mouse to store the dongle.

I saw Melissa M.E. Tour in Phila in Nov 2014. I thought she blew the roof off the theater and completely loved the performance she gave.This CD lacks the power & passion of the show I saw and does not have the song Monster, which was a 12 minute jam in November.The sound quality of this CD is good, but not as satisfying as the show I saw.

Having grown up with terrible allergies, I feel horrible when my son gets attacks. Medicine does not help him, but this Allergen remover has. Perfect size for his room (12x16 ft) this unit is quiet (unless run on highest setting) and effective. His sneezing has been reduced considerably. I like the white noise, so it does not bother me. It can be set up to run vertically or horizontally, depending on your requirements. Easy to set up & operate.In addition to the pet, dust, pollen removal from the air, it also helps when the neighbors are re-doing their house. Lot of construction going on and this unit has helped. Recommended!

There are several things I love about this tent - quality, lightness, ease of setting up. It's a snug fit for 2 adults, but not so bad for cub scouts, which is what I had in mind when getting this. You can't stand up in this tent, the measurement from bottom of tent to the top is 3' 6". Enough to sit up, but that's it. FYI, the bottom of the tent tapers down so it's not a perfect square. This saves weight, but something to consider/know when buying.I rated this 4 stars because of the side entrance/exit. If there are 2 people in this tent, someone has to crawl over the other one if they need to get out for any reason.

Standard, typical ww2 b&w footage of the invasion of Normandy inter spaced with color, modern footage of people in gift shops of museums, artifact shows, talking about various books that are for sale regarding Normandy. It seems very exploitative, commercial, shallow. The modern footage seems to be amateurish, almost as if they were making a satire.

The back pack I've been using was given to me over 20 years ago, so when I picked up this Kelly Capture bag, the first impression was how light it is. This is an excellent choice for day tripping, bike riding, camping if you're not carrying huge loads. Lots of thought went into the design to provide the user with many easily accessible exterior pockets and loops for snack bars, water, swiss army knife, etc.One of the main advertising features of this backpack is the front phone/camera holder to film your activities. Since this cannot hold the larger, current generation smart phones without adaptation, I knocked once star off. My wife's phone fit - barely - and with doubt as to how safe that would be. Personally, I'm not going to use this feature much, so what I have is a really great, lightweight, durable backpack. So the phone flap gets left aside...as does my 20 yr old heavier backpack.

Bought this to replace our old crock pot. This Hamilton Beach Wrap & Serve Slow Cooker is excellent for our needs and has many nice new features the old crock pot did not. There are three temperature settings - High, Low, Warm (not counting off) vs High and Low. The lid is glass, vs plastic and the oblong shape allows for more flexibility in cooking - a large roast will fit without having to cut it first. The cooking pot is dishwasher safe.The decorative wraps seem like a gimmick, but they are nice - we have the fourth of July theme going now. A very nice gift or upgrade to the old fashioned crock pot.

I've been a fan of Steven Zaloga since I first started collecting books back in 1983. I have come to respect his writing and opinion. Armored Champion may be his best yet. It is a superb book for beginners since it addresses so many of the considerations needed when discussing tank vs tank combat. Firepower, protection, mobility, reliability, cost. This is not new, but how this information is presented is top notch as are the printing, paper and illustrations.Zaloga breaks it down by nation and by time period. He further breaks down analysis by what a tank crew would choose (expensive tank, world beaters) vs what a battlefield commander might choose vs what a nation would choose. Sometimes, those decisions are different and Zaloga outlines why. He supports his decisions with excellent tables, charts, clear B&W photographs and narrative. His choices are sometimes controversial, something he welcomes to promote discussion and differing views. The bibliography and appendix are detailed, helpful and come from many sources, foreign and domestic.For the more experienced reader, there are still many insights, details and facts to be gathered, the summaries of each nations tank development alone make this a worthwhile purchase. This is not a color photo walk around, it is a highly informative treatise on tank developmentThe reader's digest view of this book  buy it, it's an excellent collection to the library.

My dog is a rescue, she's about 5 yrs or so - slowing down a bit - but when she saw this squeaker ball, she was after it like a young pup!. Eyes lit up, chasing it down and even retrieving it (Normally, I'm supposed to chase her down - yes, she's spoiled). These squeakers much be at just the right pitch to drive dogs nuts. Looking forward to tomorrow when I take dog to the dog park and she can wrestle, chase, taunt other dogs with this.Fits easily into your hand, great for smaller or medium size dogs. Large dog might swallow. Very rugged, I don't think this will be torn apart anytime soon.

Excellent, excellent, excellent! Dog loves this Natural Grain Baked Blends. Safe ingredients, no questions there. healthy choice for pups. The velcro resealing pack is very easy to use - much better than ziplocs. Wish all bags were this easy to open/close. One note - the kibbles are very small. I mention this because sometimes my pup wolfs down her food too quickly. May want to consider putting something in the bowl to slow her down a bit.

For the taste, 5 stars - my pup really wanted more. The ingredients look ok, but duck is the 8th on the list. Chicken broth, water, chicken, carrots, potato starch, chicken liver, eggs, duck, then vitamins and your usual fillers, My dog happens to like carrots, so while they may not eat those in the wild, they're not bad for a dog. The package is easy enough to open.Price of course is an issue, however - this product is made in Thailand - which makes me wonder if they have the same level of supervision, quality control to protect our pets, which is why I gave it 3 stars.

As with all products, the key decision for me is value for your dollar. If you demand better performance, these Pulstar Spark plugs will help improve your vehicles performance as advertised, will you notice a difference of 7%? The average person probably not, but those who are motorheads, those who love to race and need every added increment of improved performance, yes.New spark plugs will outperform older ones, regardless of cost, another factor to consider for the average driver is the cost per plug vs. the improvement in fuel economy. If you have to replace four, six or eight plugs, how long will it take to break even on fuel costs.I'd recommend these spark plugs to those who love racing, quick acceleration and are willing to pay that extra bit for them. For the average driver in average conditions who use their car for commuting, I'd look for good reliable plugs and keep the difference in cost.

Very easy to set up, good for its intended purpose - providing sound in a shower or camp ground. One downside, no volume control on the speaker, although you can change the song (skip forward or back). Sound quality is not bad for such a small speaker - it's not going to rattle your teeth, but it is certainly better than a phone speaker.  Given the USB cord, you can recharge this wherever you have a power source with USB port.Also rugged, would survive a drop or being in a back pack.

My dog loves fish, so this was a big treat for her. Good ingredients, Salmon, Chicken Meal, Brewers Rice, Whole Grain Barley, Whole Grain Rye, Peas, Chicken Fat, vitamins. Made in USA. Kibbles are about 1/2" long round shape and 1/4" wide. My dog is a mutt/rescue, has never had problems switching from brand to brand, but it's nice to be able to feed her one type in the morning and a different flavor in the evening.The bag can be resealed to keep food fresher - it's a bit confusing at first how this feature works, but take your time, you'll see how it works. Directions could be better for that - minor observation.Nice upgrade from usual dry dog food. Absolutely recommended for those who want dog food made in USA, healthy ingredients and great taste.

I gave this to my wife, who agrees with other reviewers in that this inStyler does not work with wet hair, but does do a good job with dry hair. Note she said good job - not spectacular. Does curl or straighten hair, but still quicker to blow dry and use curling iron. All in all, a pricey styler that does not work on wet hair

I got this for my wife. She likes that she does not have to change styling tools when she wants to add body after straightening her hair. This does not straighten hair alone, but worth trade off for 1 item to do 2 tasks. It straightens hair and can do large curl, but not good at making tight curls. Good at adding body with the large brush. 4 out of 5 stars.

I actually didnt expect to like this. Pretzels are about as tasty as sticks to me. But this was surprisingly yummy. The sweet chocolate drizzle is my favorite part. Despite the chocolate, its not too sweet. The popcorn balances it out.The brittle is made of popcorn, pretzels, toffee, and Hersheys Milk Chocolate. It comes in a cute brown tin that you can keep and reuse.4.5 - 5 STARS: I dont usually mention price because whats affordable to some might be expensive to others. However, at its current price, I think this brittle is too expensive. I could probably buy all the ingredients to this brittle (and add nuts), and still come out cheaper. But I cant deny its delicious. If I were given this as a gift, Id enjoy it.INGREDIENTS: popcorn brittle [sugar; dairy butter (milk); popcorn (popcorn, soybean oil); corn syrup; water; sodium bicarbonate; salt; natural vanilla flavor]; milk chocolate [sugar; milk; cocoa butter; chocolate; lactose; milk fat; soy lecithin; vanillin, artificial flavor; PGPR, emulsifier]; pretzels [enriched wheat flour (flour, niacin, reduced iron, thiamin mononitrate, riboflavin, and folic acid); water; salt; malt; dextrose; canola oil; yeast; sodium bicarbonate].

PROS: The design is attractive. I like that it has an off and on button. The temperature can be adjusted on the side. Its easy to hold. The heat seems sufficient. It ranges from 266 to 410. It has a toggle so that you can lock it closed. It closes nice and flat. (I had a previous flat iron that left a gap wide enough that you could see a beam of light through it. Of course, it was useless.)CONS: When are they going to stop using the hard plastic case with no opening to package products? I was seriously afraid of the plastic slashing my wrists as I fought my way into this thing.I wish the cord was a little longer.When I used it on my daughters very curly, very thick hair, it straightened enough to go from being at her shoulder blades to stopping at the base of her spine. Her hair was mostly straight with the occasional recalcitrant spiral curl. But, it was hard work. If I didnt go over each section of hair very slowly, there was little discernable effect at all. I admit that I didnt use the highest temperature setting because Ive never used any sort of heat on her hair and I was being cautious. I dont know. Maybe it would have worked better if Id washed, blow dried, and then flat ironed her hair. But just thinking all that makes me tired.3.5 - 4 STARS

PLOT: After an uncharacteristic one night stand, Laura finds herself pregnant with Daniels baby.PROS: I thought Laura and Daniel were likable characters. I like that he didnt turn out to be a player.CONS: The biggest issue with this story is that far too much of it is told as a summary. The majority of the final chapter summarizes about two years of their life. That would be fine it the final chapter was an epilogue. Its not. Because most of the story is told in a summary form with little action or conversation, it makes the reader feel removed from the action. I felt like I was reading a history book. And guess what? It was just as boring.I dont consider this much of a romance. Other than their initial meeting and when she tells him about the baby, theres not much interaction between the two of them. The rest of their interactions are summarized. We dont even get his point-of-view until the story is about 70 percent over.I detested the authors habit of calling Daniel the fireman or the captain. To a lesser extent, she called Laura the young woman. Each time she did it, it just took me out of the story and made her characters seem flat. No one thinks of themselves in those simple terms.OF NOTE: Daniel buys her a stuffed toy and Laura puts it in the crib with the baby. Its a small detail so I wont list it as a con. But I did want to mention that as a new mother, youre probably told a thousand times by your pediatrician and other literature to never put items in the crib with the baby (even at their feet) because of the risk of SIDS.2.5 - 3 STARS: I had to force myself to read each sentence and not skim the lengthy boring bits of summary. Im glad I borrowed this instead of purchasing it.

PLOT: Farah and Dougan meet in an orphanage and fall in love. Theyre children when they marry. Dougan kills a man trying to protect her and is sent to prison where he is killed. Seventeen years later, Dorian Blackwell, a former inmate with Dougan, finds Farah and proposes marriage in order to protect her.PROS: I really liked Dorian and Farah and found myself missing them when I was finished with the book. I had my reservations about reading this as I was worried it would be too dark and depressing for me. Thats not the case at all. Fortunately, the author chose not to detail grizzly prison assaults in either flashbacks or conversation. Parts of the story were even funny. The pace of the plot was fast. I cant recall a dull moment. It was a very enjoyable read.CONS: Though I understand why there werent more segments written from Dorians point-of-view, I still found myself wanting to know more about what he was feeling and thinking at certain times.5 STARS: When I really like a book, I generally cant think of much to say about it and I certainly dont want to ruin it for other readers. Its an excellent read.

PROS: You definitely feel like youre getting a gift. After opening the Amazon box, there was another box inside. Once I opened that, I was at the Cailler box. That was covered with a ribbon with a helpful description of the chocolates attached. Once I removed that and pulled out the box, it was wrapped in red paper. Beneath that was plastic wrap. Only then was I finally able to remove the paper on top of the tray and have access to chocolate.CONS: The chocolate was okay. I thought most of the flavors were sort of bland. It wasnt as sweet as Im used to. This may be a bonus to some, but I have a sugar addition. I did like the slight taste of salt in the caramel one. I disliked the dark coffee as it was bitter and just tasted like burnt coffee to me. I generally hate dark chocolate and I thought that that might be the cause, but the other dark chocolate candies werent so bitter.

PROS: It comes in an attractive palette with eight options ranging from nude to wine.CONS: This isnt what I think of when I think of lip gloss. The colors are more opaque than I was expecting. It also doesnt have the shine that I associate with gloss. Because of the opacity, the colors will not be flattering to all skin tones. Im just not bold enough to go out in a color that looks neon against my skin.Theres no listing of what these colors actually are. I know it starts with nude and ends with wine, but I have no idea what to call the colors in between. I suppose it doesnt matter so much since you can judge the color yourself once you apply it.The brush allows for accurate and less messy application, but it also takes more time to apply than simply using a tube. Plus you have to clean it after each use.When mine arrived, one of the little color trays had popped out and was sitting halfway on top of another shade.3 STARS: I wasnt crazy about the colors or the lack of shine. It might be great for some, but I dont see myself wearing this often.

It functions as a cleansing water, soothing toner, and eye make-up remover. It effectively removed my mascara with minimal irritation. It has a light fragrance when you sniff the bottle, but isnt really noticeable when applied. After use, my skin felt fine. Its not oily, but I felt a slight residue for a moment. It also didnt make my skin feel tight or dry.

PLOT: Millie and Sam are engaged, but while he wants a big wedding for his family, she wants it to be just the two of them. An old high school crush of Millies turns out to be a co-worker and seems to be pursuing Millie.PROS: In general, Im against sequels, but I liked this one. I felt like it was a worthy contribution to the story of Millie and Sams relationship. The two of them get to know each other better. I really enjoyed the story. It was funny and sweet. Despite their faults and their mistakes, theyre a loveable couple.5 STARS: I loved reading more about Millie and Sam. And I wouldnt mind another one in which they finally get pregnant.

PLOT: Lucilles father is unstable and her mother has left her home alone with her younger sister.PROS: The story is told in first person from the point-of-view of Lucille. The pace is fast.CONS: If Id noticed the word poetic in the Jennifer E. Smith quote when she was referring to this book, I would have avoided it like the plague. This maybe a con for just me, but I hated the authors writing style. There are lots of short, choppy sentences. Theyre often one or two words. Used judiciously, this would be great, but its overused here. Though it made the pages fly faster, it quickly becomes annoying.I wouldnt have wanted to read this as a teen. I was a moody, bored kid and I liked the darkest characters, but I would have only read this if I was forced to do so. Id have thought it was boring and depressing. I mean, I can basically sum up the entire plot in two minutes. I find it weird that authors write these books for teens, but the teens never talk like teens. They sit around reading poetry and they know who Betty Page is. I had to look her up.The conclusion feels unresolved for reasons I can't go into without serious spoilers. There's probably a sequel already in the works.OF NOTE: The recommended age for this book is 14 and up. I guess thats okay. Id probably say 16 and up. Theres one incidence of underage drinking, some underage smoking, and a few swear words.3 STARS: Overall, I didnt care for the story. It didnt feel like a love story to me. The romance is a small equation in the book. I never really felt connected with any of the characters. If there ever is a sequel, I don't care enough about them to read it. I gave it three stars because other readers might find it funny and romantic. I did not.

The box comes loaded with snack-sized Reeses Peanut Butter Cups, Hersheys Milk Chocolate, Kit Kat, and Almond Joy. Theyre perfect for handing out or using as a sweet addition to a lunchbox. The candy is delicious and irresistible. I confess that I never eat Almond Joy since I hate coconut. Fortunately, my daughter was trying them for the first time and liked them.5 STARS: This is a lot of temptation in one box.

Its very pretty. The strings at the neck and waist are of an adequate lengthnice and long. What looks like one large pocket across the front is actually two pockets. They are decent sized and large enough to hold my large cell phone.The material is somewhat stiff before you wash it. Id like it if it were a tad wider across the chest, but it serves its purpose.

Other than the color, I really couldnt tell any difference between these bags and the bargain brand were currently using. They did hug the trash can a little better.Theyre thinner than the regular Hefty bags that we also have on hand, but the difference is minor. They held the trash well and didnt teareven when I shoved a couple of flattened cardboard boxes inside.

PROS: It has so many uses. I was surprised to find that you could even use it to file down rough skin on your feet. (I mix lotion and Vaseline after a bath and put on socks. My feet are SMOOTH.) It can be used for wet or dry epilation. It can be used on legs, underarms, and in the bikini area. You can use shower gel as a shaving cream when using it for wet epilation.Its very attractive and comes with a pouch to store it in.CONS: To be honest, I didnt use this and I will explain why. This was not the product for me. I wanted it to remove facial hair. Im not going to hold that against this epilator. I knew that it was a possibility since it did not list the removal of facial hair as one of its uses. That is one of the few areas that this epilator is not intended for. I would have tested it on my legs. I had hair there as a teen, but due to genetics or whatever, I have so few hairs there now I can literally count them.OF NOTE: The manual cautions diabetics not to use this appliance. I am currently on the borderline.

The smell was okay. Its not too strong and I cant say as I notice it when the bag is in the trash can. The fit is good. Lately, wed been buying the store brand. Though the cheaper brand hasnt torn, it doesnt hug the trash can rim the way these bags do.So far, weve experienced no tears while removing the bag from the can or carrying out the trash.

The cardboard core has been removed from these tissues. To place it on the roll, you have to un-flatten it. I had a moments trouble finding the exact center. Because of the lack of cardboard, it unrolls in a wobbly manner. This isnt really an issue though since it still unrolls efficiently.The tissue is very soft and as ultra-plush as the name implies.5 STARS: I saw the commercial for these and thought it was a cool idea. The rolls take up less space in the pantry and theres no cardboard roll to fill up the tiny trashcan in our bathroom.

The core of these tissues have been flattened so that they take up less space. I compared the six pack to the pack of another brand that we had on hand. Flattening the core cuts the width of the pack down almost the width of an entire roll. Even when they are un-flattened, the core doesnt quite regain its round shape. It kind of looks like a rounded diamond. It still comes off the roll but with a bit more thumping around. But thats barely noticeable and not a deal breaker for me.As for the tissue, its very soft and plush. Thats because its three-ply. That can take some adjustment. I have to get my hands used to pulling off fewer squares.5 STARS: Loved it, but that was mostly due to the softness of the 3-ply.

The name gave me the impression that this was only supposed to be used once and only at night. I was surprised to see that the instructions said to use it once a day at first to make sure that you dont have an adverse reaction before moving up to using it up to three times a day.It has a light fragrance that fades quickly. Im ambivalent about the smell. It reminds me of a crisp green apple. Love apples. Not so sure about this smell. But like I said, it fades quickly.3 STARS: I have the occasional break out. When I used this, I didnt really notice any difference. I mostly wanted to try it for the skin toning, but I dont expect that to happen for months. Hasnt happened so far.

I have to say I dont honestly pay that much attention to my underwear. It was only after I got these that I realized that I dont actually own any of this brand. Theyre comfortable and dont ride up into uncomfortable places. Theyre taglesswhich is a must these days.Im not particularly crazy about the cut because its not what Im used to. And I wish the top band were a bit thicker, but overall the fit is good.

PLOT: Julias just broken up with her boyfriend after catching him cheating. Unfortunately, this means that she wont have a date for her sisters wedding.PROS: I thought Julias first reaction to seeing Derek was hilarious. I liked both of them. I liked the unique twist of her having a solid career and him being the one in position of just starting out. I liked the extended epilogue that really showed you their future together.CONS: The way Derek talked was occasionally too sappy. I thought the way he was talking about Julia at her sisters wedding would have been annoying to the bride since he was basically stealing the spotlight.4 STARS: Good story. I enjoyed the romance between Julia and Derek.

PROS: It cleans well without being terribly drying. (I did still feel the need to use lotion after.) My skin looked clean and had a matte finish after I used it. Its a fun way to pamper yourself.CONS: It took several minutes to wash away the mask. The second time I used it, I tried to use a lighter coating to see if it would wash off faster. No such luck. It still took three minutes.4 STARS: It doesnt really have a detectable fragrance. Two minutes twice a week makes it convenient to use.

This was perfect for my daughter. School was just beginning to encourage her to read chapter books. There are illustrations on each page. Many include word bubbles like a comic book. Theres just the right amount of text. My daughter read this in one sitting. Later we read it together over a course of days.5 STARS: It was a good book. Thats a direct quote from my daughter. It's funny and cute.

When I saw these, they had me at the word caramel. (My standard cheesecake at the Cheesecake Factory is the dulce de leche.) Ive tried some of the other Fiber One bars and liked some of them. This is a new favorite. I was surprised by how much these actually taste like real cheesecake. Theyre creamy and soft. They dont have the texture of something with five grams of fiber. Theyre sweeter than I was expecting.5 STARS: Delicious! I will be buying more of these.

The way they catch the light is quite attractive. Even the black stones sparkle. The first thing I noticed when I took them out of their box is that they feel quite substantial in the hand. Fortunately, they didnt feel overly weighty in my ears. I was conscious of them if I shook my head, but otherwise, they were fine.I had a bit of difficulty putting them in because of the curvature of the hoop. I had to use a mirror.5 STARS: Theyre very lovely. Love them.

PLOT: The bodies of preteen boys are found in the dump. The new police director comes to Father Gus Saenz to ask for help.PROS: I liked the chemistry between Father Gus and Father Jerome. Their friendship was funny and comforting.CONS: I consider myself a patient person, but this story moves rather slowly. Though interesting, I thought too much time was spent on infighting at the police department and within the Catholic Church. It takes over the book and takes away from the urgency of the mystery.Im not sure why the author bothered making Father Saenz a forensic anthropologist. I kept expecting him to use the computer he mentions to do a facial reconstruction to help identify the boys. Instead, the majority of what the two priest do seemed to be footwork that the police could have done. Its not until very late in the book that he uses any skill that would require either a forensic anthropologist or a dentist.OF NOTE: This story does contain some gruesome details. I guess I should have expected that given the plot. Still, I wasnt expecting mutilation. No matter what, its always difficult to stomach when children are the victims. There are even a couple of short sections told from the point of view of the victims.3 STARS: Overall, its not a bad book. Its not terribly exciting or action filled. The mystery is so-so. The moment the killer is introduced the majority of readers will identify him instantaneously.

PROS: It slicks on easily and quickly and leaves behind an attractive shine on the lips. My daughters lips are constantly badly chapped and natural products are always appreciated. It's wider around that the usual sticks and can be used all over the face and body.CONS: I didnt care for the smell. Just a matter of opinion. I tend not to like the smell of most natural products.

PROS: This soap is huge. Its sure to last for weeks. The lather is good and my skin felt soft after using it. I sort of like the smell. It doesnt linger too much. It comes nicely gift wrapped.CONS: While I found the smell to be fine, some might find it to be too similar to perfume. A bar this huge is just a bit awkward when you try to hold it in the shower.4 STARS: I liked it. I had a hard time deciding the rating for this because its soap. It does what its supposed to do. So I hate to knock it just because I didnt find it to be a life-altering experience.

The colors are bright and vibrant. All of the markers worked well. (I have bought markers in the past that were dry and barely worked straight out of the box.) I was surprised at the accuracy of the smell for each marker. And the smell lingers on the art work. Even a day later, my daughters art work smelled good. The blue is my favorite. Love the color and the smell.

PROS: Maybe its just my husband, but he hates using a paper filter so much that sometimes he will skip coffee and have a cola instead. This coffee maker has a permanent gold tone filter. That does mean having to wash it out after each use instead of just tossing the filter.The instructions are easy to understand. Not that using a coffee maker is rocket science. But it sure made setting the clock and selecting options easier. All the parts are well labeled so I had no trouble figuring out the various parts.The warming plate has three options: low, medium, and high. I chose medium and found it keeps my coffee quite hot. There are two options for strength: regular and strong.CONS: If you drink coffee every day, youll need to replace the water filter every two months. (Its a small packet that comes taped to the coffee scoop. It has to be soaked for about ten minutes before placing it into the coffee maker.) You can visit their website to reorder it. There is also a number in the manual to call and order replacement parts. There is no price mentioned at this time. Though I drink coffee every day, I doubt Ill remember to order these in a timely manner.4 STARS: It makes a tasty cup of coffee. Its sure to make an attractive addition to any countertop.

PROS: After use, my skin took on that look it gets when you put baby oil on wet skin. This is a lot less messy than oil. Applying the product is quickquicker than using an in-shower lotion that has to be washed off. I really appreciate the convenience. The scent is light and not unpleasant.CONS: Though less time consuming that the in-shower lotions or applying regular lotion, patting yourself dry still takes more time than a brisk drying off. This is more expensive than buying a bottle of baby oil.INGREDIENTS: water, glycerin, mineral oil, ethylhexyl isononanoate, ethylene/propylene/styrene copolymer, acrylates/C10-30 alkyl acrylate crosspolymer ceteareth-20, methylparaben, fragrance, butylene/ethylene/styrene copolymer, phenoxyethanol, magnesium aluminum silicate, ethylparaben, sodium hydroxide, helianthus annuus (sunflower) seed oil, camellia sinensis leaf extract, blue 1, yellow 10.4 STARS: I liked this. I liked the way my skin looked and felt after I used it. The glowing skin doesnt last long but the soft skin remains.

PROS: It has a strong plastic cover on the front and back. There are nifty tabs for each month so that you can find your page faster. Theres plenty of space for writing down important events, due dates, and taking brief notes. The decorative pages and cover are very attractive.CONS: The cover claims that the improved paper resists ink bleed. It does an okay job but I could still see a bit of bleed through from my gel pen. Id still recommend not using a gel pen with this.4.5 - 5 STARS: I would have loved to have one of these when I was in college. I still find it very useful in keeping track of my schedule and daughters school events. I had a smaller version of this notebook last year. It didnt have the same room or the time saving tabs.

Ingredients: water, sodium laureth sulfate, glycerin, acrylates copolymer, cocomidopropyl betaine, phenoxyethanol, caprylyl glycol, sodium hydroxide, fragrance, disodium EDTA, citric acid, camellia sinensis leaf extract, tocopheryl acetate, methylparaben, propylparaben, ethylparabenPROS: It foams well and smells nice.CONS: I in no way consider myself to be an expert on what ingredients were supposed to be avoiding now. I dont even look up that sort of information because when I do I get the urge to start making my own soap. But I think most of us have heard about parabens. Recently Ive heard more about sodium laureth sulfate and sodium lauryl sulfate and had to struggle to give up body wash because of them.2 STARS: The products claims may be true but I cant see myself using it on a regular basis.

Though my daughter has only occasionally watched Thomas the Train, she loves playing with trains. Each time weve taken her to a childrens museum, we always end up having to pull her away from the trains when were ready to leave. A couple of years ago I bought her an oval starter set and for her birthday this year, I bought her an expansion pack.PROS: Kids are sure to enjoy it. Its so simple yet my daughter is drawn to it again and again. The set is very durable and well made. Properly taken care of, you could probably pass it down for generations.CONS: All of these sets are a little pricey. I think I bought my original oval on sale for about thirty dollars. It was a simple set with fewer parts.

The Bang & Olufsen H8 Wireless noise cancellation headset is comfortable to wear for long periods of time.  I used it both wirelessly with my Galaxy Note 3 and wired with my computer.  Using Bluetooth, the H8 paired with my phone easily.  From the Note, I changed the Bluetooth settings so that it would not call out while I figured out how to adjust the volume and other settlings for music from my phone. (I accidently called a friend twice when I first started playing with the headphones.) In addition to an audio cable, there is a USB cable to charge the battery with.CONS: For high-end audio equipment like this, I would expect an outlet plug and possibly a case, but their absences are not a deal-breaker for this headset  although I did take a star away for it.

PROS: Its quiet. The suction is great and it pushes without too much effort. Our carpets looked fantastic.I love that the smaller attachments are housed inside the vacuum body. Even the cord is stored on the inside and retracts with the touch of a button.The cord is really long. We were able to do all the floors in the apartment with the vacuum plugged in at one central location.CONS: Vacuum bags. Theyre a pain. Having to find the right one for your model and the continual need to purchase them is no fun.Its a bit cumbersome. The special head is the heaviest Ive ever experienced and moving around the canister body is something Ill have to grow accustomed to doing.The assembly instructions were basically pictures. I put it together without even glancing them because Ive never found picture instructions to be particularly helpful.

PROS: My husband has sinus and allergy issues so he rarely wears scents. Fortunately, this didnt bother him. It had a light clean scent.CONS: Neither of us was blown away by this cologne. I didn't find it either offensive or attractive. It has a generic smell that didnt impress.3 - 3.5 STARS: It's simply okay. I don't think this is going to become my husband's signature fragrance.

The wipes are thin and soft. They come in a box that dispenses them like facial tissues.These are great for dry dusting. They pick up dust, crumbs, and even glitter well, leaving surfaces looking clean. I did the majority of my dusting with just one wipe. (That included a desk, a printer, a monitor, a television, two television consoles, and a dresser.) The only shine they leave behind is whatever is natural to the wood or item that youre dusting. Still, I was very happy with the results. With 54 wipes in the box, these will probably last me a very long time.5 STARS: Theyre very effective and especially useful for cleaning electronics. These are great for a quick and convenient cleaning.

PLOT: Krysteena kidnapped Rym from his planet as her chosen mate. Her planet is low on males and his is low on females. When he refuses to be Krysteena's mate, Krysteenas mother makes both of them spend a year on Earth as housecats.PROS: The idea is good and the world building is very well done. The story is incredibly creative. I loved all the little details that enhanced the tale. The connection between Rym and Krysteena was steamy. As always with this author, the hero sounded yummy.CONS: So much is packed into this in this short story, it feels like it should be longer. I wanted to see more interaction between Rym and Krysteena.Krysteena treats Rym rather poorly and doesnt take a second to consider how she would feel in his situation. Its not until the end that she seems to feel any remorse. It made her difficult to like at times.4 STARS: I enjoyed Sieged by Rym and would like to see more stories in this series.

I liked the smell very much. Its soft, sweet, and warm. I dont notice it for very long but then I dont tend to use very muchjust a spray behind the ears and on the wrists. By the end of the day, its subtle but still smells very good.5 STARS: My favorite fragrance at the moment is Jadore. I think this fragrance is similar in its sensuality. Its not a sharp or aggressive smell. I love it.

Ive always found the smoky eye look very attractive and wanted to try it. But Im no makeup artist and poorly applied eye shadow is a frightening thing. So Ive avoided it for years.PROS: I liked that this came with four different shades with directions for application.CONS: This is probably operator error, but I never could achieve a look that I liked. I couldnt get it to smear properly. In fact, I could only get it to smear when I was struggling to remove it.I didnt feel that the color had enough impact on my skin tone. My husband could barely tell I had it on. I guess that could also be considered a good thing since Id prefer that to looking like I had a black eye.3.5 STARS: I experimented with this several times and never liked the look.

PROS: I like the graphics and the look of the Sims. The scenery is beautiful. The homes are beautiful. I love the new roof styles.Customizing the Sims is fun. A great deal has already been said about creation so I wont add to that. There is a decent variety of clothing. Eventually you will find many of your Sims wearing similar clothes because you can pick out multiple outfits for them. As I like a certain look, it gets repeated often.Load times are quick. Im running it on a Windows 7 system and find the load times acceptable.CONS: It has been one glitch after another. I could care less about the loss of toddlers. They were the most difficult to care for anyway. Im happy they added pools. But what would make me really happy is not to have to go from one issue to the next. First it seemed that the game crashed constantly. Ive never had a Sims game crash this much. Move a Sim into a new home. Crash! Try to save a game. Crash! Try to exit to the neighborhood. Crash! Okay. Then that was fixed to a certain extent. Then I couldnt get it to shut down. That was fixed. Then Sims couldnt get food from the fridge without forgetting everything in their queue. Last week, I created a Sim using a Sim Id created previously in CAS. I changed his name, personality, eye color, hair color and hair style. Who knew that this would cause his alter ego (who was now an elder) to disappear altogether and be replaced by him? My new Sim was at once a new person and the old Sim. He was sort of in the old house with a grayed out picture and his wife was in love with him. And he was in the new home where he did not know anyone and was not married. And now I cant play at all. I click on a house and it acts like its going to load only to put me back at the neighborhood screen.There are minor details that are so annoying. When Sims marry their last name doesnt change. And the person they marry doesnt move into the house. You have to go to the neighborhood screen to move them. (And probably initiating a crash.) Throwing parties is a chore since you have a specific set of goals to achieve to make the party a success. There are a limited number of lots and Maxis filled many of them with expensive homes your Sims wont be able to afford right away. I could go on with the issues2 STARS: I skipped Sims 3 because I thought the Sims were ugly so Ive been looking forward to this game for a REALLY long time. As a fan that started playing with the original game, it pains me to say that this game sucks. I preordered Sims 4 a year in advance but if this latest glitch isnt addressed soon, Im going to uninstall and go back to Sims 2.

I figured these would be big for my daughter since she wears a size 8. A size 7 is snug on her. Growth spurts make having larger clothing a necessity. While they were a bit loose around the waist and too long, the fit was not as unsuitable as I feared. She can still wear them if I adjust the waist and roll up the bottoms or hem them.PROS: It has an adjustable waist. The material feels sturdy and I do believe the claim that they will resist wrinkles. I like the style.CONS: This material seems to be prone to picking up lint. It shows up especially well on the dark blue pants that I received. Its not as bad as some pants Ive seen, but it does mean I will be pulling out the lint roller whenever she plans to wear these.I dont know if its just this specific pair of pants, but the button is hard to fasten. My daughter is only six and still tries to put off going to the bathroom until the last second. (Because, of course, play is her primary concern.) These are an accident waiting to happen since I had difficulty buttoning and unbuttoning them with her in them and when she was out of them.

I could smell the chemicals in this without even opening the bottle. I used it outdoors (you cant get any better ventilated than that) and still felt slightly lightheaded when I was done. Before use, you have to wash your tires and wait for them to dry.I decided to do two coats since the first coat left my tires with a general clean look but not a great deal of shine. If you like a high gloss, I suspect that this is not the product for you.The main reason I wanted to try this was for the weather protection. Only time will tell how well it works. But only a couple of days after application, my tires were not as shiny though they still appeared clean. After a light rain, their appearance didnt change much. My tires still looked clean.

My daughter has missed four days of school this year due to colds. I asked her if they were forming a sneeze circle at school and if so, would she please decline to take her place next time. She eats very few vegetables so I was hoping that these would help boost her immune system.PROS: My daughter can be a picky eater, but she likes gummies. I was still worried that she wouldnt like these. Fortunately, she did like them and ate them with no problem.Id also considered the opposite problem, that my daughter would like them so much that she wanted to eat a handful. Thankfully, it has a child-proof cap. (I also placed them in a cabinet out of her reach.)Theres a clear section in the plastic on the side that allows you to see how many gummies remain in the bottle.CONS: Maybe its due to settling, but the side of the bottle indicated that it was half full after two uses. My daughter is six so that wed used a total of four gummies at that point.4 STARS: It comes in three flavors: mixed berry, raspberry, and pineapple. Its too early to tell if these will help with the colds. Hopefully, shes had her share this year. Ill update when Ive had more time to see the effects.04-14-15 When these ran out, I didn't immediately replace them. And my daughter almost immediately caught a cold. I'll say it was coincidence. We found out her earlier issues might have been an infection but her doctor did recommend a daily vitamin since she is a picky eater. Since I know she liked these, I bought another bottle along with a bottle of the heroes.

It smells great. I loved the citrusy scent. It foams well. Im not used to scrubs that foam.I only have occasional breakouts. This arrived just in time for me to test out during one of those infuriating times. It worked well without drying out my skin or causing additional breakouts.

I have a serious sweet tooth so I didnt find these to be overly sweet. (By serious, I mean that my usual morning coffee is chocolate flavored. I sweeten it with about 5 teaspoons of sugar and a vanilla caramel flavored coffee creamer.) They were chewier and less crunchy than I was expecting. The squares are very tiny, smaller than croutons. I thought that they were a nice nutty snack. I ignored the serving suggestion on the packaging and finished them off in two sittings. I ate them alone since there was no ice cream or lettuce in the house. Had I used them as a topper, I probably could have stretched them by one or two more servings. I can see these being used as a more carb friendly substitute for croutons.

When I first saw these, I thought, bleh! I like strawberry and I like spinach. But together? Yuck! But I decided to give them a try. My daughter, probably like many children, doesnt eat her vegetables. When I gave her one of the bars, she thought it was tasty and ate it without hesitancy. I tried one myself and thought it was pretty good also. I could only taste the strawberry. I didnt notice any spinach. Theyre soft and not overly sweet. The bars are slightly shorter and thinner than Kelloggs NutriGrain bars. (They are .67 ounces compared to the 1.37 Kelloggs bars.) But unlike the Kelloggs bars, these are organic.

Once you get the software installed, this is a fast scanner. It took my computer about 40 minutes to install. In my first test scan after setting it up, it scanned 39 sheets of paper  front and back for a total of 78 pages  in about ninety seconds. Much faster than my old flatbed scanner! It does a variety of paper sizes well. I did have a small issue with a set of business cards. The last card did not come all of the way out of the scanner automatically. The scanner opens so that I was able to remove it. Still it scanned each of the cards, including the last business card, completely. I like its compact size and that it can be cut off when not in use by holding the power button for two seconds. My husband is a college professor who plans on using it to scan copies of students twenty-page papers after he has marked them up, before he gives the papers back to the students, so that he has a copy of their first draft.

PLOT: Its been two years since the death of Ben. Grey was days away from marrying him when he died. Bens best friend, Jagger, has been the support she needed to finish college. Hes also been secretly in love with her for as long as shes been with Ben.PROS: I liked the way everything was nicely tied up at the end. I liked how supportive Jagger was. For the most part, he was really sweet. I liked the bit of mystery as to who was trying to break them up. I thought it added an additional spice to keep me reading. I thought it was obvious who the culprit was and I was glad the author wrapped that up before the book ended.CONS: The characters are a bit over the top with their emotions. After two years, it seemed unrealistic to me that Grey would have been grieving to that depth. Im sure its possible for someone to grieve that long, but at times she seemed like she might have needed to be sedated or hospitalized.I was curious as to why she and Jagger went to college, and more importantly, why she bothered to finish since she got a job that she could have easily had before or during college. Its never stated what types of degrees they earned.4 STARS: I really liked the warm ending. Overall, I enjoyed the story.

PROS: I nabbed this because of all the ingredients it doesnt have. Its hard to find soap or body wash without sulfates or parabens. Im very happy to wash my daughter in something pure and safe. And it came with cute little stickers.The lather was moderate but more than I was expecting.CONS: Its as thin as water. I didnt like the smell, but fortunately its light. After my daughters bath, the scent had faded and she smelled clean and fresh.

PLOT: Kamryn and Brody meet and it is love at first sight. Unfortunately, hes married and shes hiding her identity.PROS: I liked the way it started with this instant connection between Brody and Kamryn. Since the story is told in first person from both their sides, you get to know how strongly they each feel for one another. I thought Kamryns feelings of jealousy and insecurity were entirely believable.I applaud the author for trying something different. Trying to turn an affair into a romance a reader can root for is rather defiant to the one of the strongest tenants of romancefidelity. I think she does this well by giving Brody one of the most non-marriages Ive ever heard of. The only way he could have been less married (other than divorce) would have been for them to have been actually separated.CONS: At the end, the author says this was based on a true story. Many times true stories are startling or hard to believe. It had me wondering what parts were real and which were fabricated since much of the story doesnt come off as believable. That Kamryn came from a rich family, I can buy. That she made enough money from gambling on horses to eventually open a bakery across the country? Not so much. There are other details that I thought were farfetched as well, but I wont list them all.There were some bits that needed to be stretched out and others that could have been shortened. The emotional connection between Kamryn and Brody doesnt feel fully developed before they are embroiled in this affair. The author skipped over their getting to know you conversations so their relationship soon seems to be all about angst and sex. It devolves what began as a sweet connection into a stereotypical tawdry affair.3.5 STARS: I generally enjoy drama and angst in a read, but lack of development made this feel as though the characters were being overly dramatic as opposed to being embroiled in any actual drama.

You won't know how something holds up ... until it doesn't.Having said that, I like this little beast, even if it is a little noisier than WD.This is fast, seems rugged, and for those interested will plug-n-play directly with a S5 (etc.) - it is already formatted to suit, unlike WD, aND will rin strait from the OTG with no external power. Without rooting on board and SD files move back and forth, and for what it's worth to you, the ES3 encrypt/decrypt moves straight through, too (handy, if not bulletproof).I haven't bothered with the included (downloadable] software - I use WD Passports on laptop and desktop. I got this for the phone and as a large-ish transfer medium, and I like it so far.

Beautiful ... in its way, as are SO manY CRKT knives. Definitely one of the most fascinating-looking pocket knives I've seen (and have, now). This is a bit heavy for light EDC, and might "agitate" the uninitiated onlooker. But heck, it is nice!- Opens easily (for me)- It can be a bear to close ... a good thing, in its way- The blade spine is about 0.143" thick! Yikes!-  Great edge & serrations. Fabulous!- Almost like a pocket kitchen knife... and one of the most creative, interesting designs ... but heavy!One observation about the finish: the edges of the grip areas are very finely machined ... and sharp. I took a .125" ceramic rod in a pin vise and "melted" the edges, just breaking them. Some folks might not care to do this, and it is finicky work. I like doing that stuff, and the result retains the same grip, without the edges. (Only talking about "breaking" perhaps .001 or less!)Love it! Just looking at it is neat, using it is amazing.One last observation ... a one-hand opener is great when working, and a one-hand closer is useful, as well. This knife is very difficult to close with one hand, which may be a plus for some, and a minus for others. I bought it because it is a unique-looking and feeling design. It is not my favorite tool.
I have no idea if it was a qc issue, but my wife tried this and no one could hear her.This gave me an excuse to get my wife a Legend ... which, yes, is pricier ... but, you know ...
I'm using this on top of my cpu to exhaust warm air ejected from the rear of the case. I've git 2 of the smaller ones running inside the case cover. These things are effective, and quiet.

Yikes!Have a problem with stuff sliding off the fridge? Next step up from these is rivets.Just pulling these apart from the stack is an exercise. And I hope the mailman didn't get them close to his watch ... probably make it run backwards...

I'm never going to convince my wife to haul around a backup battery. But it was easy to sell the idea of a handwarmer. The idea of her carrying a lighter fluid warmer? Ha. Ha. Ha.She turned this on and wouldn't let go. Which is good, because it costs too much!Seriously ..  I think it us a little pricey ... and talking my wife into needing 2 cables ... well, never mind. So, there's the -1 star.This may not be expedition-worthy, but it works, doesn't stink, and most likely won't explode! ;-)

I finally brought my wife over to the "Dark Side," and have her using a Legend. Much better for both of us. BUT ... the constant complaints about chargers, and cables, and backup batteries! So, this was tiny enough to keep the complaint level about the oddball charger to a minimum.Of course, she'll never find it in her bag... ;-)

Neat gadget for determining which chargers Do ..  or Don't provide the rated voltage and current. Also handy for checking daisy - chained fan strings.-1 star for not having a tiny switch to lock the display to v/MA  But very useful!

These were a compact, quiet, effective solution for my Dell 7100's "fever" problem  Maxing the RAM and pushing the thing (BOINC) ran things too hot.
