You just need to make sure there is no gap between the can and your opener and it smoothly cuts cans that can then be safely handled. I'll be using this as my primary can opener from now on. I received a discounted can opener in exchange for my honest review.

I just love the way these feel after a long day at work. The lavender scent is also really relaxing. It smells so clean because its real unlike the scent in alot of the lotions with lavender you can buy, I really like it. I heat the 2 larger pieces up individually and throw the eye mask in with one of them to ensure they heat evenly and fast (directions are right on the products tab and its less than 2 minuets to relaxing soothing relief). I was a little surprised by the difference in color of the soft underside of these pads. The top is accurate to the photos but the softer inside part is more of a bright grass  green, but its really not a problem and the set is very well made. I found it kept warm for about 20 minuets. The set comes in a clear drawstring back that looks nice enough to give as a gift. I received a complimentary set in exchange for my honest review.

This set is just precious. I wanted it to give my sister for her newborn daughter. I've always loved those sweet little pictures of the sleeping babies in hand-crocheted little costumes and this one takes the cuteness cake. Its made of a soft yarn not the super fuzzy soft stuff but definitely soft enough for a little one. Its all adjustable to fit a newborn but I think it would fit up to 3 months if they are not on the big side. Over all the colors are vivid and the materials seem nice all the little detail on this photo prop is just too cute. I cant wait to gift this! I received a complimentary product in exchange for my honest review.

This lens kit is pretty cool. It allows you to take quality and unique photos with just your cell phone. I really like the included hard zip case that comes with it to store your lenses in. The lenses clip right over your existing camera on your phone and slides to adjust. I have a really thick case on my phone so it didn't work well but when I took the case off it fit just fine. Overall its a fun little gadget that allows you to experience different lenses on your phone and it came packaged really nice. I received a complimentary set in exchange for my honest review.

For this type of hand drying towels, they are both strong and quite soft.  The fact that they are softer than other types of hard roll towels is both refreshing and one of the main reasons why I give them five stars.  They are a good size for the professional containers.  And show that they are a step above just the ordinary hard and very difficult to manage brands one encounters elsewhere.

These towels are surprisingly light feeling, but very absorbent.  They are multi-purpose as they can be used for cleaning and even drying some.  And they are a nice size, too.  They aren't too big and not too small.

I was impressed by how big the speedway race rug was.  I knew it said 39 by 36 inches, but I hadn't imagined how big that would be.  It is nice because it is ample enough in size to allow to play comfortably with it.  I also like that the cars are wooden, as kids nowadays are exposed to plastic, plastic, electronics, plastic, and nothing real.  So it is nice for them to get to play with these wooden cars.  And I like how they include suggestions for storytelling with the cars around the rug.  Melissa and Doug are a name in wholesome games for children.  And I very much like this addition to the children's game repertoire.

This book has a cute premise.  A cat who has been abandoned is allowed to sleep on the balcony of Mr. Ellis' home.  However, the only view from the balcony is an ugly refinery-like looking type of building.  So, in order for him to have some shade to sleep under, Mr. Ellis gets some plants for the balcony and even a trellis for the plants to grow on.  As Louisa May Allcat sleeps, he dreams of the whole neighborhood doing the same thing and eventually the whole world.  Which is very nice, as the book teaches children about global warming and the importance of having plants to clean and purify the air.  The illustrations are a little blurry or something, but they do fill the pages.  And, all in all, I thought this was an alright book.

This is a lovely book that chronicles the journey from Massachusetts to Colorado that inspired Katherine Lee Bates to write her poem, that became the famous patriotic song "America The Beautiful."  It opens with her childhood and how she loved to write in her red leather diary.  Since money was tight she stayed home to help out, but she was older she was able to get a loan from her brother and go to Wellesley College.  She taught English literature and when she first reviewed her poems after her memorable trip out West, she thought they weren't good and tossed them aside.  Later on, however, she decided to submit her "America, The Beautiful" poem to "The Congregationalist."  The editor liked the poem and published it in their fourth of July issue.  As it turns out, the rest of the country agreed with the editor and it soon became a song.  A much loved one, at that. The book is very nicely written and has many illustrations that fill the pages, throughout.

"Long Ago In The Old South . . ." when a fairy tale opens with a line like that, you know it is worth the read.  And this story is very much worth the read.  It is a fascinating retelling of a traditional Old Southern folk tale that has elements of Cinderella and King Lear in it.  The illustrations and the whole setting just evoke the Old South and the Southern mysticism and gothic heritage.  As the story goes, we have a sweet Candace who loves her father dearly.  Unfortunately, she has two sisters who don't.  Nonetheless, they trick their father into thinking that Candace doesn't love him as much as they do, thereby banishing Candace from the beautiful eight columned home.  In the woods, she encounters a green-eyed witch woman who hands her a gown made of boss.  However, by the starlight it turns into a beautiful gossamer gown.  Mistaking her for a peasant girl, she is taken in as a cleaning girl in a fine home that she comes across.  They have a ball . . . and you can imagine the rest.  I found this book to be utterly fascinating and I recommend it highly.

This is an engrossing novel about Lydia, the purveyor of purple, who is one of Paul's first converts to Christianity in Europe.  The author has done a credible job of coming up with a believable plot about her life as a businesswoman during Roman times.  And she does a very nice job of exploring her conversion to Christianity.  She explains how Lydia and her friend, Fulvia, were tired of the orgies that some of the pagans passed off as a religion.  And how they learned for something true.  She makes Lydia a little bit more hesitant in her decision-making than I would have liked, but the story is a fascinating one, nonetheless.  This book is a very good read, that brings to life some of the lesser known New Testament characters, such as Timothy, Lydia, Syntyche, etc.  And it really brings to life some of the Roman era mindset.

Alas.  This didn't work too well for me.  I managed to break it while I was putting it together.  I really like the idea of it.  And all the neat hammocks and ladders, etc. that it has the for kitty kats to play with.  It is quite big, so make sure you ample space in your home for this.  And I like the feel of the carpet like covering that it has, it was nice and soft.  However, it didn't work too well for me.

This is a horrible movie.  Why in the world it has become a classic in the USA for Christmas time is beyond me.  They even made us watch it in school, which I still don't understand.  All I can figure is that it must appeal to the most "common" element of society.  The boy is antagonistic and unfriendly.  The family odd.  And spending Christmas eating at a Chinese restaurant is definitely unappetizing.  I"m sorry I can't rate it any higher, but to me, this movie is just disgusting.

This is a sweet story about an orphaned hippopotamus and his friendship with a 130 year-old turtle.  The hippo, named Owen, was rescued after the tsunami through the bravery and collaboration of a lot of volunteers.  Away from his Mother, he sought out the friendship of this turtle named Mzee (Old man in Swahili).  As the book relates, their friendship is a very sweet one.  And the book includes plenty of pictures on each page featuring the two animals and some of their caretakers.  I especially love the picture with the caption "Owen's future is bright."  There is so much love in that picture.

Alas!  It has been such a long time since I've had a book that was as good a read as this one.  This is the first installment in the Penny Parker Mystery series, a young girl's detective series written my Mildred Wirt Benson, under her own name.  She was the famous "Carolyn Keene" for the original Nancy Drew mystery stories that have appealed to generations of young readers.  According to Mildred, she thought Penny Parker was more Nancy Drew than Nancy Drew.  Being a huge fan of Nancy Drew, I don't quite think so.  But, I thoroughly enjoyed venturing into this new detective series.  It features an actress who comes into town who is traumatized by the recurring appearances of a Witch Doll that continually brings her bad luck.  There is also a scandal involving a fortune teller and a poor girl who is trying to run her doll shop.  Riverview is the Penny Parker equivalent of Nancy Drew's Riverheights and the the broken down blue "leaping lema" is the Penny Parker equivalent of Nancy Drew's blue roadster.  These are more classic elements of the Nancy Drew detective stories are present throughout this mystery series and in short plain language, this book is so much fun to read!  Penny has a fun repartee with her newspaper owner, Dad.  And I just found myself being so happy reading this book.  Now, I'm on to the next one in the series!

George Foreman grills are always exceptional.  And this is a very nice addition to the line of grills that have become synonymous with George Forman.  It is curved to let the extra fat naturally melt away and has a ceramic  surface to it, as well.  It is nice and large, so it allows for plenty of cooking.  And all in all, it is a very nice grill with which to make some delicious steaks.

I really enjoyed this collection of some of the early literary forays into what would become the Classic Mystery/Detective story.  There is a sample that Louisa May Alcott wrote under her pseudonym called "A Double Tragedy:  An Actor's Story" that I really enjoyed, since I'm such a fan of hers.  I also enjoyed the one by Anna Katherine Green, which was similar.  And I really enjoyed the fluid writing style of Edgar Allen Poe, although, I found his hard to follow at times.  It is really interesting to see how some of the masters of fiction tried their hand in this genre early on.  And it is fascinating to see how it all has developed.

This is a nice story about a lady having to make ends meet on her own, after an unfortunate experience with a "gentleman" of fraudulent intentions.  She turns to writing and becomes acquainted with the dashing young naval captain who is determined to make his way as a gentleman of means, in order to win the love of his life back.  Lest I give away too much of the plot, suffice it to say, we are treated to a charming look at life in England during the Regency era.  And we are filled with warmth over the redeeming outcome of the novel.  At times, I thought the novel was a bit depressing.  As I felt a little depressed while reading it, which is curious given the chapter featuring Jane Austen's quote of "Let other pens dwell on guilt and misery."  But, I also felt joy when the protagonist, Mariah Aubrey, is reunited with her horse and she realizes her affection for a certain dashing young naval captain.  All in all, it made for a very pleasant read, and I was glad I got to read the entire novel.

I'm quickly becoming a fan of the Ageless La Cure line of Beauty/Cleansing Products.  Their Phyto 5 formula seems to work really well on my ultra-sensitive skin.  The ingredients in their products are very gentle on the skin and from pure sources (not as synthetic as most commercial brands).  I've been using the Phyto Peel for a while now and I like it so much, I save it for special occasions that I need to look especially nice for.  With this serum and moisturizing cream set, my skin gets an especially noticeably elegant and refined beauty to it.  That is one thing that really impresses me about this cream and serum, the fact that they give me a refined look.  I love that!  The tubes are small looking, but since only the tiniest bit is needed for each application, they are lasting a long while.  The premise of htis company is that women shoudln't have to compromise for their beauty and they seem to be making it possible for us to do so!  This set is excellent.

This is a charming biography of a lady who set the record for the time of flying 590 miles nonstop in 1916.  She accomplished this while attempting a flight that had never been done before, nonstop, from Chicago to New York City.  It is most charmingly written and I even laughed out loud at certain parts of it.  It is absolutely perfect for young readers as it is based on actual history and it is inspiring, as Ruth Law prepared for her journey and kept at it, inspire of difficulties.  The illustrations are nice and colorful as well and fill the page.

I have to say, I actually like the accompaniment and notation for this classic piece from "The Student Prince."  I was disappointed, however, in that it is written in a much lower key than the key Mario Lanza sings it in in the movie.  Mario Lanza sings it in Bflat and has a glorious ending with it.  So, as a Soprano who can easily sing all the high notes, I was wanting it to be in the same key as in the movie.  However, if you find a pianist who can transpose on the spot (unlike me--I admit it), this sheet music will still work.  As it is better than the basic chord progressions one finds elsewhere.

These blocks are a favorite of my little nephew.  They are like lego blocks, except bigger and more easily put together and taken apart.  This set includes 150 different pieces and they come in a zippered, almost a mini-suitcase, type of rectangular bag.  We have lots of fun with these blocks, as my nephew loves to build towers, and of course, promptly knock them down!  Hee, hee!  They seem very well suited for the wee toddler set.  And we enjoy them muchly.

This is a very beautiful and lovely necklace.  I do have to say that I was a little surprised when I first opened the box that it came in because the filligree wasn't as detailed as I thought it would be from the picture.  However, it is still absolutely lovely.  And very elegant and dainty.  It isn't a heavy necklace (thank goodness!), so it can be worn for day or evening wear.  The rose gold plated sterling silver is a beauitful color and it really makes the necklace a very pretty one.

This is the first book that I have read in this mystery series and I found it to be quite charming.  Our young detective is a likable girl by the name of Maisie.  And in this mystery, she's asked to accompany her well-to-do friend, Alice, out to the Wisteria Lodge in the country in order to help her recover from her illness.  They are escorted by Alice's snobbish Governess and are soon left to their own devices when all of the hired help resigns due to ghosts and other strange sounds occurring in the lodge.  Determined to figure out the cause behind all of the unusual activities, Maisie and Alice soon uncover rational explanations for all of the events.  My only complaint about this story, s that I was so engrossed in the mystery, that I felt the book ended too soon!  However, it is a nice length for the younger set.  And it features activities in the back, such as a code breaking cipher.  And some explanations of some of the historical terms in the book, such as at the pince-nez spectacles.

I really like the fact that this supplement is gluten-free.  It is also one that I've seen highly recommended for those who have PCOS, as it is an adaptogenic herb and helps with the stress levels that affect PCOS.  This supplement is very calming and it works well.

I very much enjoyed reading this book.  It is both deep and simple at the same time.  The deep meaningful aspects of the story come from the struggles of the main characters to overcome their false beliefs about the past and embrace the "Love and Grace" of the future.  The light aspect comes from the fact, that the main mystery of the book is predictable.  However, it is still a very nice story.  We have the young Lady of Buckleigh Manor, Julia, feeling stifled by her dreary village.  Her Mother/Aunt is very severe and won't let the village celebrate May Day and strictly prohibits dancing of any sort.  Into this depressed village comes a family of dancing and fencing masters who unknowingly pose a threat to the "way things are." One of the main attractions of this novel was the emphasis placed on dancing and the civilities.  Each chapter opens with an historical quote regarding dancing and the art of dance.  And it is nice to be transported into a world of sophistication.

This is a combination of two of the world's best household cleansing agents, Bounty paper towels with Blue Dawn.  The Blue Dawn is in ridges on the paper towels and with water the Blue Dawn becomes activated.  The paper towels are nice and very thick and very sturdy, so they hold up well while cleaning with water.  And they also have a nice scent to them, I've found.  In sum, I'm very impressed by how well these paper towels work.

This is an excellent historical fiction novel set during the early American Revolutionary War.  It focuses on a young girl named Jasmine and her stormy relationship with her tutor, whom she mistakenly believes is a Tory.  We learn and experience the ups and downs of the British occupation of Trenton during this time.  And we learn, via her Mother, about the dangers of writing pro-Patriot articles.  Even when done under an assumed name.  Ann Rinaldi, the author, has an uncanny ability to bring history to life via her novels.  Personally, I didn't care for the way the romantic element of the story turned out.  As I preferred the nice Quaker boy, but I still enjoyed the novel fully.  I think it is a bit mature for young adult, but then, I am a bit old-fashioned in that regard.  However, it is a very good read.

I rally like the fact that this supplement is gluten-free.  I appreciate every item out there that is gluten-free, since I'm extremely sensitive to gluten.  Since I'm a person of low energy, I simply can't survive without some form of Vitamin B12.  I used to get the shots on a bi-weekly basis, but since the clinic ran out of the Vitamin B 12 shots, this is a viable alternative.  Personally, I didn't care for the natural flavoring of Tropical Fruits.  I think the natural flavoring may have MSG in it, as I got kind of headachy with it.  A side effect I experience whenever I have hidden MSG.  However, I do appreciate the Vitamin B12 and it seems to come in a good form.

Somehow, try as I may, I simply could not get in to this book.  When I read a novel set in an historical time period, I like to feel as though I'm being transported back into that era.  I did not get that feeling at all as I endeavored multiple times to become involved in the plot and characters of this novel.  Quite the opposite, I felt like the characters were overly stereotypical of the romance novel genre with the antagonism to cover attraction motif being overly done.  And I also felt like the mindset was decidedly modern, somehow.  It could be I simply was not in the frame of mind for this novel, but I just have to say, it failed to capture my interest.  On the plus side of things, it is a clean novel and one with a family appropriate message.

This is an example of where a little bit goes a long way.  Just a few of drops of this Citrus Oil Blend fills the room with the scent of oranges and tangerines.  At first I thought it gave me a slight headache, but then I felt wonderful with it.  And I slept very well with it, too.  It is a blend of Orange, Tangerine, Ylang Ylang, Patchouli Oil Light, and Chamomile Blue Oils.  It is gluten-free and paraben free, which is a plus, in my book.

I enjoyed reading this book.  It was a nice light and easy read, but not without substance to it.  It opens in Bath, England at a ball wherein the young Catherine is presented to a charming young gentleman from America.  Being quite used to the flirtations of wannabe suitors, she dismisses him rather quickly.  However, she is drawn to him as the evening progresses.  Due to a decline in her father's fortunes, she soon ends up in Pennsylvania working as a seamstress/dress designer in a sewing house.  This was an aspect of the book that I thought was well done, as it shows how the indentures and the placements of the girls worked in a sewing house of that era.  Coincidentally, the same gentleman whom Catherine met back in England, comes to the sewing house with his Mother and sister and thinks he recognizes her, but isn't sure.  Since Catherine has had to assume an alternate name, to protect herself and her father, this leads to some complications.  I especially enjoyed the page of the book where Mrs. Clarkson doesn't just yield to the demands for clemency on the part of the jealous sewing girl.  I thought that had a good balance of Christianity, but also, reality.  In the end, I felt excited about the outcome of the novel.

I love this kit!  I ordered it to make a book for my little nephew.  And while I just mailed it off and haven't received the finished book, yet (I'll update my review when I do); I just had so much fun designing this book that I have to say, this is a winner of a kit.  It comes with a complete eight count crayola marker set.  And it has two cover pages (in case you need to to design one twice) and lots of pages for the inside of the book.  One can also include a picture for the "about the author" section on the back of the book.  I even used the box for support for designing my pages, as it seemed designed for it.  Anyway, this is a winner of a "do it yourself" kit and I'm very excited about receiving my book.Here's my update:  I just received my book in the mail today and I have to say, it absolutely charming!  It is a plastic coated soft cover book that fits the hand very well, in terms of size.  And it is just plain delightful!  It also includes the number and code on the back of the book in case you wish to order more, which let me say, is definitely tempting!  (I'll probably order some more in the future, for certain.)  The picture on the back of the book in the about the author section is a nice and clear one.  And from start to finish, it is just a precious memento to make, create, and have!  I do recommend making sure you write out clearly what you wish to be included in the dedication and the title page, as I wrote mine in cursive (I'm a cursive writer) and they misspelled what I had written out.  However, I'm still very happy with it.  And my Mother was impressed by it, too.  Needless to say, my little nephew and I are going to have fun with this!

This is a very nice tablecloth.  It is very long and suited for a very rectangular table.  The color scheme is a nice one, I think for my taste, probably more for daytime entertaining, rather than evening.  However, it is very nicely done.  It is made from polyester, however, it has a linen look to it.  And a very sturdy feel to it, as well.

This is a very compelling historical fiction novel based on the actual historical event of General McCausland, C.S.A.demanding two hundred thousand dollars in ransom from the town of Hagerstown, Maryland.  By happenstance, a tenth of that amount was written on the actual order delivered to the town officials and the town was spared.  The story is told in the first person from the point of view of Amelia, a young girl whose father is the treasurer of the town.  She's also best friends with the son of the newspaper owner who happens to have Southern leanings.  The story opens with her telling him a story that ends up getting the press smashed, after all, tensions are high during this period of U.S. history.  This makes Amelia determined to stay uninvolved from the war, although, she admires her brother's sweetheart for having the gumption to dress up like a boy and go off and fight in the war as a soldier.  With great historical detail and fascinating writing, the author takes us through the entire history of the war and we become personally involved with Amelia's inner struggle of when to get involved in the activities taking place all around her.  I literally gasped at the ending.  And I'm sure all the reader's will, as well.  Having read other books by Ann Rinaldi, I do notice some of her trademarks in the novel.  Mainly, that the characters are all very strong and have resentments that seem rather severe, at times.  However, this didn't detract from the book.  And I found it to be a compelling read, all around.

These pull up senior diapers/briefs are very comforting and work well.  They really help provide support for the active senior lifestyle and they are easy to put on.  They cover well and work well.  It is best to purchase the right size, as the 2XL really are 2XL.  However, they are a very good item for the senior set.

The first section of this book is especially fascinating.  With the basic premise of this book being that beginning in the fourth grade, people go into a creative slump.  This is corroborated by NASA administered "creative genius" tests that show that 98% of five year-olds are creative geniuses, but the same kids by the time they are thirteen, only test at a 2% creative genius rate.  Apparently, our society and culture really emphasizes convergent thinking (i.e. the status quo) while creative geniuses manifest divergent thinking (more along the lines of "What if . . .?")  And this convergent thinking lifestyle contributes to a general malaise and dissatisfaction in the working world and in life in general.  The author writes from a very interesting Christian perspective and he emphasizes that since as human beings we are created in God's image, we have the need to create within us.  And when we create, we become closer to God.  (Provided that we don't fall into the trap of over-inflating our own egos in the process.)  The author even does a fascinating study showing how Jesus faced temptations along His path to creativity (after all, Jesus did create a whole new way of thinking and being that transformed the world).  And in sum, this book really provides encouragement and insight for all of us to get in touch with our inner creative selves.  I really delighted in the first section of this book, especially so.

This is an excellent frying pan.  It is nice and large!  So it makes it easy to fry lots of vegetables at the same time.  It heats up very well and actually our cooking is tasting better since we've started using it.  The ceramic coating makes it so easy to clean.  One just swipes the dishcloth on it and it cleans, we haven't had to use any "elbow grease" to get any tough spots off of it, or anything. Since receiving this frying pan, we've made it one of our principal pans to cook with, that's how well it works.

This soap is the definition of luxurious.  It lathers very nicely and it is very elegantly scented.  It is a large bar, but shaped in a curved fashion so that it fits the hand very nicely.  It has ingredients such as shea butter, mango, and argan oil in it.  And I just felt so stylish using it.  It is a very nice bar of soap with a touch of the exclusive to it.

These felt tip pens are a limited edition featuring tropical colors. And I find myself really liking the colors.  They actually aren't as "out there" as I first thought they'd be, the colors are actually quite pretty.  I was a little taken aback at first, as they don't write very smoothly.  That is to say, they don't have the nice and easy flow of a ball point pen.  They feel more like tough markers.  But, I'm still very pleased with the colors and I'm happy to have them.

Let me explain about these adult briefs.  They are designed more like children's diapers with the tabs to hold them together.  It works well if one is helping someone elderly change their diapers.  However, if the person is ambulatory and capable, then they are a little bit inconveninent in that pull ups with elastic are easier to use in those situations.  However, for someone who is bedridden or who has difficulty bending over, then these work well.  They do seem to make one sweat some in them.  However, the security of having them one is well worth the while.

We tested this detergent on some difficult stains that we've had difficulty removing with other cleansers and it removed them beautifully!  It really does seem to work.  It was gentle on the clothes, we didn't really notice any fading.  And the ingredients seemed pretty good for a detergent.  We are very pleased with it.

I really appreciate the fact that all of the ingredients in this juice are organic.  And I love the fact that it is gluten-free, as well.  For me, however, it was too sweet.  The number one ingredient is organic sugar, so that comes as no surprise.  If one likes really sweet juice drinks, then this one will do well.  Otherwise, I couldn't handle the sweetness of it.

This is the account of the accomplishments of his Presidency written by Felipe Calderon Hinojosa, President of Mexico from 2006 through 2012.  The first thirty pages, especially, are fascinating.  As he explains the fallacies of the term "drug war" and how during his Presidency the focus was on fighting the huge escalation of crime that surged in Mexico beginning in 2003.  As in 2004, the Federal Assault Weapons Ban expired in the U.S. with the result being that there was a mass influx of U.S. purchsed assault weapons into Mexico by the criminal element.  This, of course, led to the drug cartels being able to take over entire communities in Mexico and begin the regulatory capture stage of crime, wherein they start actually gaining control over the governing bodies of the city/state/country.  He also explains how the Drug-Trafficking in Mexico shifted from being transportation focused (i.e. getting the drugs to the U.S. for sale) to one of drug marketing as well (i.e. selling the drugs in Mexico for internal use).  This led to a lot of territorial fights among the different drug factions, which made for a huge threat to the national public safety.  He expresses a lot of pride in his country and it is fascinating to see the map of the world showing Mexico as being right in the middle, a position which he emphasizes can really be to Mexico's benefit.  His public works accomplishments are very impressive, including a tunnel under Mexico City for the water, which is bigger than the tunnel connecting England and France over in Europe.  He also established programs for the elderly (aged 70 and up), women, and youth.  And he expressed a strong interest in preserving the biodiversity of Mexico.  He is a very statistical, scientific, and factual minded person, which is reflected in his writing.  With the end result being that one develops a big respect for both his accomplishments and his intelectualism.

Organic granola... That's either a nick name for a stoner cartoon character or a good idea for breakfast cereal. My wife, the queen of green, said to order this since the box claims that it is organic and, therefore, better for you. Job done!She tried it first and made yummy noises. Crunchy, fresh tasting And loaded with fruit and nuts. All good. I tried it over plain yogurt and I had to agree with her assessment. Having said that, the fruit bits are a little too chewey for me and the sugar level is higher than my regular granola. I try to limit the grams of sugar in my diet so this probably won't be my go to granola. Also, the box claims that you can fold the top closed, but the inner bag doesn't reseal so freshness isn't really protected by folding the cardboard flaps.Final thoughts: Good taste. Organic. Nice crunch. A little sweet. You make the call...

I used to work on my car without gloves. Unfortunately, when I went to work at my Zfirtune 50 white collar management job, my hands looked like I was grease monkey - no matter how hard I scrubbed. Eventually, instarted using rubber gloves and things got better. I discovered quickly, all gloves are not the same. Some were so flimsy that they ripped open and others were do thick that, on a hot day, they filled up with sweat.These gloves work well - like Goldilocks - they are just right. The thickness prevents tears (none so far) and thin enough so my hands don't sweat. The grippy surface helps too.Used motor oil is a known health hazard so using gloves is important. These gloves work very well.Recommended

The unique shape and size of this speaker drew my attention. The small easily "carry-able" design said, this could be a very useful device when I work in the basement or the garage and want to listen to wi-fi radio or recorded music.When it arrived, I was surprised at the heft and overall quality feel. The color combination - red and black - is attractive without being gaudy. Controls are simple to use and syncing with my iPad and iPhone could not have been easier. I'm not 100% sure about need for the loop and carabiner - perhaps to hook to my belt? But that doesn't detract from the product in the least.The most important quality of any audio product is the sound and that's where this product blows me away. It's tiny in size but huge in sound - especially in the bass. How that do it is a surprise to me given the fact that it could fit in a car's cup holder and serve as a Bluetooth dece for your Smart Phone (yes, there is a speaker and a microphone built in)The bamboo trim is supposed to make it "green" but unless you really look, it's not why I like the product (although I always try to be "green").The instructions page is in a lot of languages and extremely difficult to read because of the tiny type (and I have excellent close up vision). However, the pictures across the top of the page (while also very small) are easy to follow so I deduct nothing for what seems to be an an area of this product that could be improved.Overall - this is an amazing little speaker. Its sound is excellent and the volume surprising, despite the tiny size of the unit. And there is that really good bass ...  Can you tell? I love it!Recommended...

We're thinking about buying a Subaru, so I thought I'd sweeten the deal by going in with a Subaru pen. The nine dollar price seemed affordable and worth using as an ingratiating prop when I went to the dealer. Upon ripping open the shipping pouch, I found a flimsy, plastic pen, only a little better than a hotel pen. The Subaru logo is painted on and I suspect will rub off or chip off.....what a disappointment. Being a pen geek, I unscrewed the pen to examine the refill. Unlike a quality, easily replaceable refill which you'd get from Cross, Sheaffer or Parker, the Subaru contained a cheap, low quality refill...sad. This is the worst pen I've bought through Amazon since I've been a customer. My bank gives away better pens than this. Not recommended.

This shower gel has a light, 'perfumey" fragrance. It lathers well and rinses clean. My wife said her skin felt soft and smooth afterwards. It did exactly what it was expected to do and did it well. But so do many other products on the market. I would say that this product's popularity would depend on the user's taste in fragrance.

The Kenwood kettle is an easy to use kitchen appliance. It has a large capacity and heats water quickly and at several different temperatures depending on the use. A check with a thermometer confirmed that the kettle heats to the chosen temperature. It sits on a compact base and the capacity levels are easy to read. Although hard water produces scale on the bottom, the appliance has a washable screen at the spout to keep scale out of your cup. The handle stays cool, but the lid gets hot and releases steam. This device has a tone to indicate that the water has reached the selected temperature. When it works, the tone is so quiet that it's easy to miss. On our model, the tone has been inconsistent. Sometimes it chimes and sometimes it doesn't.  You really have to be on top of it so it doesn't boil dry.  A negative observation is that the kettle is lined with plastic. Recent health information indicates the risks of eating or drinking food or a beverage that has been heated in plastic. Further investigation is needed to find out whether Kenwood has considered this. However there is no discernible taste to the water and the water isn't in the kettle very long.

I'm a Jack Black hair care fan but the shampoo plus conditioner products that I have tried really simplify shampooing when I'm in a hurry - which is most days.I'm probably outside the AXE product demographics based on the people I see in their ads. Young guys fighting off passionate women. Not me. OK, once, a women banged all night on my hotel room door but eventually I got up and let her out. (rimshot).Anyway, this product is a weird Kermit the Frog green and smells like the deodorant I used to use in high school. Not a complaint, just the facts. It lathers wonderfully - really well - fantastic, actually. The smell, while strong at first, subsides as you nose absorbs the cologne molecules (not a complaint, just the facts). Funny, but during the day, for some strange reason, a faint whiff of the smell returns - I really like that (magic?)The product does a fantastic job on my thin hair, rinses off and the conditioner leaves my hair soft and manageable.There is a lot of product in the bottle too but it squirts out heavily - you really only need a little dab because of the great lather. My wife tried it too and likes the way in leaves her thicker hair. And she likes the smell!Good product - good value - recommended, even if you're not in their age range or male.Five stars

I used to be a computer geek. I started business in the IBM mainframe days but quickly saw that the "small box" AKA PC / Mac technology was teh future (by the way, that was 1984!). I built my first PC from components bought at a computer show in the late 1980s and have not looked back. Currently, I have a wireless network in my house with two laptops and two desktops (Windows and Mac) all going along with smart phones and a tablet. My wife uses her Windows laptop in the kitchen to do our banking and e-mail and has complained a lot about slow or no response from the wireless router located on teh second floor in the furthest room in the house. When I saw this product on Vine and saw that it uses the house wiring to build a LAN (local area network) I ordered it. The description says that it is "plug and play" - an often misused term in the tech world - and for once, the units really were. I think I should have timed the installation process but using a SWAG (you can look it up), I say it took 15 minutes to unpack the two units, plug them in, run up and down the stairs a couple of times and reconfigure the network settings on my wife's laptop. Bingo!When I asked my wife - a demanding but honest and fair critic - to tell me if she saw a difference in response time she said, and I quote, "Wow!" I was surprised that she was that happy but there you have it. However the technology uses the house's wiring, it is faster and more reliable than my wireless network.I have to say that if you have a slow wireless network, give this product a try. It has made me a local hero around my house.
The refill drys out very quickly. I bought the pen and before I could use it, the refill that came with the pen died. This refill is in the pen now and already, it's a little dry.Not recommended.

I instruct in Car club high speed driving events. It's required to wear a helmet so having a communicator is a must. I have used the generation one for a while and found the original plugs frustrating. They only went in one way and if you had your helmet on, plugging in was always nearly impossible. Eventually, the unit gave up the ghost so I bought Generation 2. The plugs are simple pin types so inserting while wearing the helmet is easier - note, I didn't say easy because the power hole can be a target - oops!Mine has been semi reliable - it cut out yesterday for no reason and then started to work - again fir no reason. Sound quality gas never been good either - scratchy and strained.Finally, the poorly designed helmet clip broke after two wearing shorts and I had to duct tape the box to my helmet. Just about all of the instructors (not an exaggeration) have the same issue. Most use Velcro to attach the box but one made a clip out of metal to keep it secure.This is $100 tool that should have better sound quality and much better build quality ...

No, this wasn't a MAC product. My wife is a Windows user and we got this application for her laptop. We loaded it (easy) and started to edit some simple family clips from Easter. Her laptop is not a very powerful Windows 7 computer but it does have extra memory. I have to to say, it was slow to load and slow to pull in media files. Probably a combination of the laptop and the software. Getting the clips into a timeline was easy (I'm one of those users who judges software on how far into the use I can go without cracking the manual / looking for YOUTUBE videos) that was good. We then started to shorten the clips and add transitions. It was relatively easy too and that's a plus.I then did the same thing with my MAC with iMovie and it was easier and much faster - and I'm not much of a videographer. However, if you don't have a MAC, this relatively inexpensive product could work for you.I then asked my godson, a professional film maker, to repeat the exercise we just did and it was a revelation. His prior experience with Final Cut Pro X (a package that is much more expensive) allowed him to make the same small movie of holiday clips faster and with better transitions. This tells me that some of the clunky / slow / confusing things I experienced were due to my lack of skill with video editing. He gave the package a rating of OK which I translated to three stars.If I had a a faster Windows PC / Laptop, I think my experience would have been more positive. I guess, if you are a Windows are user and you shoot video, you would quickly get up to speed on how to make small movies. Considering the price of the package, it seems like a bargain. But don't expect pro level editing and production features at this price point.Recommended for Windows users with simple needs and a fast computer.

Back in the 1970s, I began to show my cars at Concours d'Elegance events. We didn't know much about the chemistry of the whole process back then, we used what we had. For example, there was a really popular car wash that came in the form of a powder. It was a strong detergent so that it could remove grime, road debris and things like pine tree sap. It worked well but after washing, you had little or no wax protection left. Naturally, we tried everything - dish detergent, baby shampoo, even Woolite - the results were the same - clean car, some residue and, alas, no wax.Today, we have products from the magicians in automotive chemistry labs all across the world. One of the best best magicians must work for Griot's because their car products are some of the finest made. I have used their waxes, cleaners and polishes for years and recommend them to others. Good stuff.When this came up on Vine, I was anxious to try this car wash to see if it was as effective as the German-made Sonax wash I have been using. Happy to report, it's just as effective - foamy enough to float off the dust my old Porsche accumulated after spending the winter in the garage. Left no residue. Didn't remove the wax either. And, because of the large size, it's less expensive. I call that a win/win/win.Have a car you care about? Wash it yourself? (Sorry California, maybe that's taboo these drought afflicted days) Give this product a try. A little goes a long way so it will probably last for a few years.Recommended.

There was a time in my computer life when my PC had a 30 meg not gig) hard drive. Actually, it started as a dual floppy computer but I upgraded it when I had a few bucks. That was then, this is now. Even entry PC and Mac computers come with storage in Terabytes and with video, music and photo files growing with each new device on the market, this additional space is needed.Also, carrying around data from work to the home PC or transferring files from a laptop to a desktop is a regular part of our technical life. Having a thumb drive that holds only a couple of gigabytes means that you run the risk of filling it up and having to get a second drive or working quickly to delete files to fit that new large file. Not fun.In my case, these days I do photo presentations for car clubs and carry my laptop with me for these events. Being a bit of a worrier, I always backup the presentations to an external hard drive and carry that along in case of a disk failure. That way, I can transfer the data to a loaner PC or Macbook should the unthinkable happen. Of course, mechanical external hard drives have moving parts and are subject to damage from magnetic fields. Having a "solid state" divide with enough storage was my dream. After seeing a 32 gig on the Vine shopping list, my dreams became reality.Now I have a large capacity "drive" that fits in my pocket and isn't subject to magnetic erasure. It worked immediately (no more than 3 seconds to get recognized) in my iMac (OS X 10.8.5) and I was able to save files to it without re-formatting.Not much more to say about a thumb drive - small, fast, large capacity and priced right.Recommended if you ned to carry large files around.One caveat - computer viruses and malware travel well on all read / write devices - a concern for every corporate IT support professional. I recommend every IT organization have a protocol that requires people bringing work files in from home on this type of divide run virus protection software against it using a stand-alone non-networked computer to ensure that nothing bad enters the LAN / WAN connected servers and PCs. That's supposedly how Iran's centrifuges got damaged!

In college, I didn't have money for speakers. I had a cheap amp. a very cheap turntable (it was, after all the 1960s) but no speakers. My friend's father owned a stereo store and he found a used pair of cheap head phones that he let me have for $2. The nicest thing I can say is that they worked and I could isolate myself and study organic chemistry without distractions. As bad as they were, they turned me into a headphone junkie and over the years, as my income increased, I bought better sets and enjoyed them all. However, when the Sony Walkman and other portable devices became popular, having true headphones on made you look a little dorkie (no comments) because the portable devices came with small foam-wrapped pads and, in the latest iterations, in the ear canal model. In a word, I hated them. Low fidelity. Slip-out-of-the-ear plastic buds. Just annoying.And then this pair arrived and all of that has changed. The sound quality is the very best of any headphones I have owned in (gulp) 40 years). They are also the most expensive but definitely worth it if you like great sound. Even playing from a iPhone or an iPod, the highs were crisp and, a real surprise, the bass was really good. Really, really good! One thing I can add, for songs recorded in the 1960s (like Peter Paul and Mary stuff), you can really hear the tape hiss!The verdict - Comfortable. High Tech look. Wonderful, realistic bass. Highly recommended for you headphone geeks out there.Wish I had these in 1968 when I had great hearing!

I have had the same capo since high school! How long ago was that, I hear you ask? Let's just say, mind your own business. My old capo requires two hands to install and has a very strong spring to hold the strings to the frets. When I saw this new design, I couldn't see how the gentle spring could keep the strings from buzzing. Yes, it was simple to install or slide with one hand, but I was worried that it would just be too weak. Boy was I wrong! The capo worked perfectly. It installed and re positioned simply - yes, one handed. Didn't produce string buzz and looked cool doing it. It also has a small, easily lose-able, tension adjusting tool if your guitar needs more pressure on the strings.Cool looking. Simple to use. Effective. Love it!Recommended... My old capo has been retired...

Reveal is a nice fragrance. It's musky with a hint of fruit, not heavy or overpowering. Sprayed on in the morning, it was still detectable hours later and was true to its original application, no degradation. Some perfumes have very distinctive notes and become signature scents. While Reveal is very pleasant, it didn't trigger immediate recognition each time I tried it during the review period. As a side note. I did a little research. Reveal is sold by a number of vendors but it's only available on line. I don't know about you, but I wouldn't invest in an expensive perfume if I didn't have a chance to try it first.
Perfect size, great price, does just what you need. Whatever you want to do with a lemon, this little thing will do it. It's just about perfect!Recommended

I have fat fingers. All too often I mis-type words, falling prey to the cruel clutches of automatic spell correction demons. Posting UN-proofed posts on Facebook, Yelp, or Amazon opens the gates to humility or humiliation - maybe both.I have tries rubber tipped stylus pens but they lack the sure footed feel you get with this fine point device. Another cool feature is the clear disk surrounding the fine point. It lets me see the letters, numbers or punctuation change color as I punch each "key". Very cool and really smart.As a pen geek, I like the high tech construction. It feels like a well made product; all metal, with a brushed aluminum finish. The 'clip' to hold it in your shirt pocket is a sexy looking notch in the barrel. But it's a little less effective in practice. Better designed is the cap. It screws on and off. But the smart feature is that when it screws off, there is a threaded end so you can store it there, saving it from the land of the lost.The tip has a shock absorbing point, preventing screen damage. Also smart!You can place the flat tip on the screen and glide it to scroll. That works really well and is my favorite feature.High tech design. Good quality. Fits in your pocket. Affordable.Recommended.

A nice jacket that's warm and comfortable. Even better, it fits over a sweater or fleece. I also like the fact that when it gets a little hairy from cuddling the dogs, I can wash it and have done so several times.Well made. The seams are finished beautifully and feel sturdy (a must in our world).No, not high fashion - but just what I wanted!Recommended

Here's another example of a great Bissell product. Just as the cleaner arrived for review, the dog graciously threw up on the carpet late at night and in the dark. That gave the stain time to dry and settle in. The SpotClean was easy to assemble and can be set up for a small or large cleaning task. Within minutes the job was done, the stain was gone and the carpet was only slightly damp. The machine was easy to clean and the hose, cord and cleaning ends wrap and nest compactly so it can be stored in a closet or cabinet. I was very satisfied with the result. So why four stars instead of five? Well the hose and cleaning tools are very lightweight; that might make the machine easy to carry and move around, but it also makes it feel flimsy. While I was cleaning the stain, I noticed a few other places on the rug that needed attention. This meant bending over or kneeling for each spot that needed to be cleaned. Easy enough if you're nimble and flexible, but I am neither. This machine would be perfect for someone who doesn't have a lot of carpet or messy kids and pets. We are looking forward to trying it in our cars which have accumulated many stains from this slushy winter.

Not sure how I messed up, but I got what I hoped was a real German product but it seems like I got a third party copy. I will compare these to a Mann unit and return if they look too cheap to use in a car I care about.Not recommended - yet

I stink at cooking rice. Or at least I did. I recall hearing an NPR commentator who was stationed in Japan complaining that he forgot to take his rice cooker home with him when he was re-located to the USA (I think it was called a Dinky Gamma). I looked for one but never found it. When this came up on Vine, I asked my wife if she thought we could use it. She thought about my cooking skills and then gave me the thumbs up.My wife took the time to read the instruction booklet and then gave me the Reader's Digest version so I could use it. For the first time, I didn't burn or undercook the rice - cool! Then, after cooking, it held the rice at serving temperature. This is so automatic that it makes me look like I know what I'm doing in the kitchen.Then, the next morning, my wife surprised me with a bowl of perfectly cooked oatmeal (not the instant kind...) with raisins and cinnamon. I looked around the kitchen for the pot that I had to clean and, to my surprise, she said she made it in the Rice Cooker! Her recipe - 3/4 cup oatmeal. 1 1/2 cups of water. A handful of raisins and a dash of spice... Stir gently with the enclosed plastic spoon to mix everything and then press a couple of buttons. Then sit down with the NY Times Crossword until you hear a beep. Simple, easy-peasy. I can't wait to try cooking artichokes (steaming actually) in it.The lift out no-stick inner pot cleans in seconds on a stream of hot water, soap and a few swipes. The lid has a cool water condensation catcher that keeps drips from spilling out onto the counter (you do have to eventually empty it). The only caution is that there is a steam escape port on the top. If you get close to it while its cooking, you will get a nasty burn (ask me how I know).Simple to use. Easy to clean. Cooks rice and oatmeal perfectly. A nice addition to our kitchen.Recommended.

We have a lot of small projects around the house. Recently, my wife had to build a fence to keep feuding pets apart (long story) and she started using our new electric drill to drive screws. The inexpensive bits that came with the drill chipped and stopped working well after about 15 minutes of use. Strangely enough, these Irwin bits appeared on vine and we pounced. When they arrived, we swapped out the junk we were using and finished the project with the Irwin bits. In the end, I examined the most-used bit and it looked like new. The real surprise was that these bits were very reasonably priced. Throw in the magnetic collar and convenient carrier and it goes from value to real bargain.Are you a do it yourself person? Have an electric drill? You need bits this good!Recommended

I was skeptical when I first saw the iPhone 6 because of its tablet-like size. The reason is because I keep my phone in my pocket and, of late, my blue jeans have gotten smaller! (Or the wearer is getting bigger?) Stuffing a $300 phone in such a tight spot made me worried that I might bend the thin thing first time I sat down. My goal, I wanted a robust case to increase torsional rigidity and, reading the specs, this looked like it could do the job.When I opened the package, I realized that I was right. This is a solidly built product. With an iPhone 6 enclosed inside, it's very unlikely that it will bend in normal use. Plus, the added benefit of double the battery life is really useful. However, this all comes at a cost. The already bulky phone is now even thicker, heavier and longer. Keeping it in my blue jeans front pocket makes a very visible lump in the fabric. Fortunately it's winter and I always have a jacket pocket to hold my phone. When the weather gets warmer, I may have to dump the case or only use it when I know I need the benefit of added battery life. My wife says I should use a "man bag " but that's not gonna happen!So, I found this product to be exactly what the manufacturer claims. Good phone protection. Excellent battery life. Quality construction. NOTE: you can't use your original iPhone charger to charge the case's battery. They provide a cable that has to be used instead. Yes, another cable in your life...

If you test your blood regularly, you have a simple and quick process that you follow. If it takes more than a minute for most folks, I would be surprised. Using this product adds a level of complexity and time that I found bothersome. First, before you start, you have to load an app - a one time process. Next, you have to scan the test strip cap to embed the code into the software - also supposed to be a one shot task, Then you have to plug the reader into your smart phone (no app for iPad - at least, none I could find). Then insert the test strip. Prick your skin and then, whew, you are ready to test.In my testing, I had to rescan the cap each time I tested. May have been pilot error, but it was the only way to go forward. It happened EVERY time ... Also, I had to remove my iPhone case to get the little pod thing to be recognized by my phone. That resulted in a broken piece of plastic on my case. Annoying, for sure. Finally, the readings never matched the traditional meters I have in the closet. And I tested with several traditional meters. Worse, this device always read higher from the same drop of blood. Hmmmm.Having said all of that, this device has potential. The supplies are very affordable - less than the brand I have been using. The ability to track your numbers in a cloud data base is also very 21st century. Finally, the small size is convenient for traveling. Lots of potential...Like I said, close, but, for me, no cigar.

I'm a Porsche guy and a pen geek. No apologies. I have had several Porsches over the years and, in fact, have only been without one for a few months since November 1975! Yes, I like these great cars. But, in New Jersey, you can't drive a Porsche you love every day. Snow, salt, slush, terrible traffic and potholes all make enjoying their special qualities, let's just say, difficult. However, I make up for this by having a cool Porsche design item in my pocket, on my wrist or in my briefcase. I wear a Porsche Design watch (on occasion) and carry a Porsche Design pen in my pocket or in my planner. The reminder of what waits in the garage helps me get through the day to day life in the real world.I have several Porsche Design pens since, as I said, I'm a pen geek and carry one on most work days. This pen is one of the first I bought. The cool, spare shape and high tech metal construction drew me in (pun intended). The grooves for finger comfort are both cool and comfortable. My wife thinks the pen is a little too heavy but not so to my mitts. The clip that holds it to my pocket is nicely polished, offsetting the matte finish of the rest of the pen. It extends the point with a quick twist but here is the reason for only 4 stars. If you are a little too twisty, you can rotate the top beyond the stopping point. Upon inspection, I saw that the "guts" inside are, ugh, cheap looking plastic, not high tech metal like the exterior. That was pretty disappointing for a pen in this price range.This pen uses Parker style refills offering easy and inexpensive replacement.Cool pen. Kind of expensive. Some plastic parts.You make the call.

This is lip balm, so it does what lib palm does. It is convenient, portable, applies smoothly and tastes like mint. Unlike some other lip balms, this one doesn't leave your lips with a heavy coating like you are wearing lip stick! It doesn't have that underlying funny taste that other products have either. I have been applying it just before bed for a couple of weeks and it is very protective against cracking and drying that can result from "night breathing" or snoring. In the AM my lips are smooth and kissable!Recommended.

I started gaming back in the Wolfenstein days. I spent an entire snowy Christmas Day once, unable to drive because of the dangerous road conditions, escaping from the Nazi stronghold. Even before that, I played Adventure on the company's mainframe. Xyzzy - remember? Anyway, these days, my gamer chops need a little help. Enter Turtle Beach Ear Force.First things first. Fantastic packaging! You open the box and the gear is laid out like a work of art. Next, the look and feel is top quality. Even the cables are covered in a woven fabric instead of slippery, squeaky plastic. I like that. They are a little heavy at first and the tight construction makes them stiff and hard to adjust for maximum comfort. However, after wearing them for a while, they got more comfortable and didn't feel as heavy.And then there Is the sound. Separation across the ear pieces was excellent. This improves the gaming experience, giving more of an impression of character movement tied to sounds. Cool!I also use my iPhone as a music player so, instead of those fall-out-of-my-ears buds, I plugged these in and discovered amazing bass. Seriously, if you listen to music on the iPad / iPhone / iPod ear buds, you are missing out on the strong bass that your MP3 device can deliver.These are good for gaming, built like they will last for years, comfortable enough after a while, and a step up in the overall gaming experience. The real value for me, however, is the improvement in sound on my MP3 players. The benefit is mostly in the strong bass sound but overall, the sound is so improved, these will be my go-to head phones.Recommended.

With the scary and sad Ebola stories in the news, there have been many reports of airport security agents and medical personnel using "no touch" electronic thermometers. When this item came up for review on Vine, I pounced, anxious to see how well it worked. The main reason is I use a remote reading infrared thermometer to diagnose heat related issues for my cars and tried using it to take my temperature. Alas, it wasn't designed for taking human skin temperatures. Plus, I hate sticking a conventional glass thermometer under my tongue - always nervous that it could break and put mercury in my mouth. We also have a digital under the tongue unit, but we never seem to have the plastic covers when we need them.After testing, we found that this product does exactly what it says it does. It reads quickly and easily without having to actually touch the skin. Pretty cool. (No pun intended.)However, I suggest that you test its temp readings against the readings of a traditional thermometer to set a baseline. My personal skin readings were consistently 1/2 degree lower than 98.6. Not sure why. My wife's temperature was consistently "normal" so it seems that my body temp is a little lower than normal.Great for kids. Fast reading. Small and easy to hold and aim (there is a little glowing beam). Gives a beep when the reading is done. Small cover to protect the sensor.Recommended.

This is not a vacuum designed for a regular home. First, it is worn on the back (think SCUBA gear or Ghostbusters proton colliders). This helps when vacuuming around a restaurant's tables and chairs or an office's desk and other furniture. Having a canister vacuum run into (and get stuck on) a table leg or office cabinet can affect productivity and efficiency. Carrying the vacuum on your back also prevents the inevitable damage to the furniture or the vacuum with each collision. Cool.Next, the electrical cord is about 45 feet long (~15 meters) and is made from heavy duty yellow wire. During my tests, it never kinked or got knotted. It extended the range of my cleaning job - minimizing the need to re-plug the cord as I moved around the rooms. I liked that.The hose and metal extension pipes feel like they are made from leftover pieces of the Keystone pipeline - sturdy, with a precision fit.The kit comes with several attachments - wide hardwood floor brush attachment, brushless wide rug attachment, narrow rug or runner attachment, narrow brush hard surface attachment and a thin crevice tool. Each goes on and off the pipe end easily.The vacuum is easy to heft onto your back and for me and the women who used it, the weight wasn't a problem. Not too heavy to lift up and carry around for (in our test) an hour. The on / off switch is conveniently placed at the user's elbow so there is no need to search for it when you need it.I thought that having the vacuum right behind my head would kill my ears, but the unit runs very quietly and I never thought noise was a problem.Like a lot of vacuums, the many attachments have no place to live. You need a bag or box to store them or they run the risk of getting lost or broken. Speaking of tools, the rug attachments (wide and narrow) do not have a way to "beat" the carpet (like the rotating brush of a canister vac or upright). I vacuumed a large expanse of medium pile carpet with the ProTeam and then re-vacuumed the same area with a bagless upright with a rotating brush. The upright pulled more "stuff" out of the carpet that this unit missed. Disappointing.Overall, the plusses - long cord, convenient backpack design and long reach tools - overcome the one issue - not the best tool for deep cleaning pile carpeting. Typically, offices and restaurants have hardwood / tile floors or very low pile carpet so this may not be an issue for any facility with those floor surfaces.I give one star for the unique backpack design. I add another star for the quiet motor. One more star for the ease of use with the long electrical cord. Finally, one star for the long reach of the hose and extension pipes. I could give 1/2 star (if we had them) for the way the vacuum cleans hard surfaces and low pile carpets. It loses out because it's not going to do a good job on any carpet with a medium or deep pile.

I'm kind of obsessive about my cars. I used to own a vintage Porsche that I showed in high level car shows called "Concours d'Elegance" and won more than a few first in class trophies. Getting the interior finishes "right" requires both the knowledge of what "right" looks like as well as knowing how to get that look. This required the right technique and the right materials.For years, the most common interior spray used by people showing their cars was ArmorAll. Their marketing program being the biggest reason why. This product - so popular that it was available just about everywhere - if improperly applied left the surfaces in the interior (dash, vinyl seats, door panels) a too shiny and very slippery. Heaven forbid you ever got it on the floor mats, brake pedal or steering wheel - that could be a recipe for an accident. Times changed and car show judges began to penalize us for showing our interior panels with too much of an ArmorAll, too shiny look. (Of course, you could really buff up the surface with a dry cloth and get the finish less shiny, but it took a lot of work.)Several products from Lexol, Griot's Grarge and Sonax (among others) became the cleaner / treatment of choice for for the truly serious. I had been using P21S interior cleaner for vinyl and rubber (but it's become hard to find) and old reliable Lexol for leather surfaces (great stuff). I am always looking for products that first, do no harm and second, leave a matte "original" looking finish. When this product from Chemical Guys came up on Vine, I decided to give its try since I had a lot of experience evaluating these products on my own vehicles. Here is what I found:First, the feeder tube for the sprayer that came with the liquid was about and inch and a half too long to fit in the bottle. I though that I was doing something wrong, but no matter how I tried, it would not go in until I got a scissor and trimmed it to size. Not the best way to start.Next, the smell. They boast (some might say warn) that their product has a pineapple scent. Call me crazy, but pineapple? Why not pine or apple? To be fair, my wife loved it. Me, not so much. You have to be the judge. I found it too strong and just a little odd.The product's ability to clean was actually quite good. It removed some scuff mark dirt in my aging BMW and Audi. Both have a light colored interior so the quick improvement was very noticeable. I did these tests in a relatively dimly lit garage but in the morning, in the daylight, the matte finish left by the spray was pleasant and the pineapple smell was almost completely gone.There is no way to tell if the claimed UV protection was there. That would take testing methods beyond the scope of an Amazon review. But the surface was smooth, non-greasy and looking like a Concours d'Elegance judge would like - again, all good things.Overall, this product seems to be a quality car care tool. Except for the smell that I find unnecessary, bordering on the annoying, and the too-long sprayer feeder tube, I think this is a good addition to my car care tool kit and I'll use it again.A note on the smell so you don't think I'm being too fussy. Concours d'Elegance judges are a strict lot. They have years of experience and knowledge in their chosen area of expertise. If he or she stuck his or her nose into the interior of a classic car and smelled an odd scent like pineapple, it might signal that the owner is trying to mask something - mold, mildew, animal urine or, the worst, mothballs. At the highest level of the hobby, something like a strong, unusual odor could be the difference between a win and a loss. Food for thoughtThree stars for the way it cleans and leaves the surfaces. Two stars missing for the scent issue and the mis-matched sprayer kit.

This pen had a simple, clean design. It looks and feels high tech without gaudy attachments. It sends the same vibe as the cars it shares its namesake with. Clean, simple and well made - it's all good.The solid metal barrel adds heft but because of the aluminum construction, it's not too heavy. The machined in finger grooves fit your fingers so that writing is more comfortable, despite the all metal construction. The point extends with a simple twist and has a precision feel. Speaking of points, the refill is a standard, easy to find Parker style so replacements will be easy to buy.The only gripe is that the top half can be twisted beyond the stopping point. Kind of surprising for a precision and expensive writing instrument. The inside "guts" are plastic - also a surprise considering the maker and price.Like Porsches and nice pens? Give this one a look.

Contrary to popular belief, a sharp knife is safer than a dull knife. That's because when the edge is keen, the user has to exert less pressure to make the cut. Pressing too hard can cause slips and injury. That's why you should always have a good knife sharpener in the kitchen. Also, if you never let your knives get really dull then simple "touching up" of the blade's edge will be quick and simple.I first saw this product at a knife show in NYC and watched as a salesman demonstrated how simple it was to restore the sharpness of a pretty dull knife. I know that the knife was dull because it came out of my pocket! When the sharpening job was done - about 2 minutes at the hands of an experienced hand - my trusty knife could slice through newsprint with ease, leaving a smooth, non-jagged cut. I was sold and have been using the tool for years with a lot of success.The design is simple. The sharpening "sticks" sit at the perfect angle so all you have to do is keep the knife straight as you run the edge down the point of the rods. For really dull edges, there is a medium (dark brown) grit rod. This puts a decent but rough edge on your knife. Next, you swap out the rods for the smooth (white) rods and repeat the process. This makes the edge more razor like and long lasting. Unless your knife is damaged or has been really abused, this process  should bring back the sharpness you need to do any kitchen chore.I carry my sharpening kit to our local soup kitchen where we volunteer to make and serve food to homeless and low income visitors. The kitchen is used by many different hands with varying skills with knives. I watch as experienced cooks hack away with the knives on surfaces that dull the edges quickly. I have recently taken a knife skills class at a local culinary school and see a lot more "don'ts" in the kitchen than "dos" - which (I think) explains the poor condition of the knives in the soup kitchen's drawers. I stayed late one session after lunch and sharpened all of the knives. I then wrote a note and placed it in the knife drawer warning that I had sharpened everything. The manager told me later that everyone remarked at how well the knives worked after I gave them the Spyderco sharpener treatment. Now, I bring my kit in every month and touchup the most commonly used knives. It makes me the local hero (blush).Recommended for its ease of use and effectiveness.

Porsche Design products have a certain look and feel that's very German, very high tech. Plus, they are made to a very high standard for build quality and look and feel. This little pen has a grippy rubber barrel that helps prevent it from slipping while I write. The tips have a brushed metal finish so they resist scratches while the pen rattles around in my pocket.The small size means it's best for jotting quick notes or signing for things in stores and restaurants. I like to place it in the small "watch" pocket in my jeans and use it instead of the pen handed along with credit card receipts - they have been through too many dirty hands to make me happy. Also, the small refill doesn't have a large ink capacity so using it to take long notes during interviews runs the risk of using up all of the ink.Finally, the best for last - the "shake" feature. With a flick of my wrist, the point goes in and out reliably. Another cool idea from the engineers at Porsche Design.Recommended.

I collect high quality writing instruments - AKA "pens". Also, I am a fan of the Porsche marque so having a Porsche Design pen in my pocket makes me smile. I have several of their pens and really enjoy using them to sign credit card receipts, jot quick notes, scribble in my notebook when conducting an interview for a magazine article. This is especially cool when I'm interviewing a Porsche owner.The pen has a high quality feel with a firm click. Especially interesting is the way the clip recedes into the barrel when the point is extended. Speaking of the point, it uses a standard Parker-style refill so getting replacements is a snap. Also, finding the color and size point that works best for you (i.e., fine, medium, gel, regular, blue ink, black ink) easy.The black finish gives the pen a nice high-tech look. However, it's a little too smooth and slips a bit in my hands. Also, the barrel is, as the name implies, really thin. That may or may not be to your taste. I think it's a little thin for my XL sized mitts which is why I gave only 4 stars. However, if you like thin writing instruments, you may give it a 5th star.Recommended - especially if you're a car guy or gal.

In the old days, a printer was just a printer (and a cigar was just a cigar) I go back to the LaserJet Series 1 days when a print spit out hundreds of pages in black and white from it's huge capacity paper trays. Today, everyone wants / needs color and ink jet printers are a more cost effective way to get that requirement met.To that end, as part of the Vine Program, I have reviewed several "all in one" printers with their Fax, Copy, Scan and Print text and photos ability. They have been quite acceptable for my small, home office. However, on occasion I have to print a large volume of copy and the smaller paper trays of these "all in one" machines make me run back and forth to refill them. With others in the office using the printers, having one machine with dual trays that give 500 sheet capacity is really helpful. Plus, I can use one for letter head and one with plain paper or high quality bond - whatever is needed. I like that. Throw in that the printer is fast and that the type is crisp, I am pretty sure that it will become my go-to for just about everything non-photographic.This printer does all of the cool printing tricks too - printing from smart phones, lap tops and tablets. It touches most of the bases. (Although, I am still trying to find out if it has the ability to print an e-mail and its attachments from a smart phone. An HP printer I recently tested had that available through an App - I'll have to keep reading and will update this review if it does.)This is the first Vine (meaning free) Canon printer I have tested but not the first Canon printer I own. I have a Pro-10 for quality, large format printing and an ancient Canon i960 photo printer that I've pretty much worn out over the many years it has been in service. So, I can honestly say, I know, like and respect Canon printer quality. This one does nothing to change that.Some things the potential buyer will find interesting (I hope). First - it's a big hunk of printer. It uses up a large chunk of my cramped office space geography. How big and heavy? When it prints, it shakes the table - nothing bad really but something to note.Loading ink cartridges is simple - there is a small ramp to assist with the loading and as you inset the tanks, it send a confirmation message on the small LCD screen that the job was done right and moves the holder over one slot. I think that's smart and well executed too. Speaking of ink cartridges - they only supply setup-sized tanks so if you order this printer for volume printing, order spare (at least black ones) or you may run out quicker than you expect. That, by the way, is not a Canon-only policy. All of the ink jet printers I have tested come with minimal ink tanks. It kind of explains how they can sell these complex, technical wonders for such a low price. (OK, off my soap box)Paper trays have to be extended to allow the owner to add letter sized paper - a little tricky if you, like me, don't like to read instructions but you'll figure it out.It is a WiFi capable printer but here is the only caveat I would offer. The LCD screen is tiny and there is no simple way to enter your wireless router's WEP key (assuming you use that security method). So to enter a WEP key, you must hard wire the printer using a USB cable to connect to you computer and, with the CD provided (or software downloaded from Canon's web site), enter the WEP key so that the printer talks to your network. Alas, this assumes you have a USB cable and can physically put the two devices close together. I had a little bit of a struggle doing that. Of course, if you use the higher level router security method, then connecting by pressing the WiFi button on the printer and the routers talk-to-me button will make the connection for you. That means if you use a WEP key for your network, then you have to have a cable handy or your printer will not work wirelessly - that can be frustrating.I used to be a computer geek so setting this up was a minor obstacle.
