This is a reference book that examines many issues in sports nutrition from technical standpoints. And it covers a lot of ground, including comments on young and older athletes, female athletes, team and endurance athletes, and so on. It isn't a how-to book that offers a few simple instructions, but unlike such books, it steers clear of fads and hocus pocus.But I wonder about how accurate it is. In some areas where I have expertise, it misses the mark. On hydration for endurance athletes it fails to challenge the marketing spewed out by the Gatorade Sports Science Institute. Admittedly, that's a challenge, but the real science needs to be disseminated to a popular audience. And Dr. Benardot is probably writing before the awareness became widespread that fructose is causing our epidemic of metabolic syndrome. If you take fructose out of sports drinks (remember: athletes in training drink A LOT), and recognize that sucrose (table sugar) is metabolically equivalent to high fructose corn syrup, you're not left with a lot of recipe options: just glucose and maltodextrin for carbohydrate. Ultra-endurance athletes have discovered the WHO oral rehydration salts (ORS) packets; they make pretty close to the optimum sports drink -- except that they taste too salty and not sweet enough for most folks or for commercial success. Benardot fails to mention ORS, that it is the closest thing to ideal hydration in terms of sodium, glucose, and osmolarity, or that the many commercial sports drinks fail to deliver what unbiased science has found to be optimal. (ORS is a fraction of the cost of Gatorade, too.)On another point, briefly, Benardot discusses the effects of altitude, but he fails to deliver the punch line: live high, train low. Live high so your body will produce more RBCs and other adaptations to hypoxia. Train low to give your body plenty of oxygen to permit maximal stress to your system before you return to altitude for recovery and rest. Muscle, including heart muscle, grows mainly during recovery, not during exercise.The book also fails to deliver the latest recommendations on vitamin D supplementation. And I found other points on which he could have done a better job.So if the book didn't nail these topics, I suspect there are others. But if you want to do better and dig deeper, you'll probably have to read research papers, and that will cut into your training time :-). Otherwise, this encyclopedic overview of nutrition for athletes is the best technical reference and broad collection of wisdom that I'm aware of.

This thing works well on flattened carpenters pencils. The blade is curved and sharp; the body has a rotating holder to position flat carpenters pencils. This all works well. It replaces the similar CH Hanson sharpener, which is no longer available. The new Hanson has a straight blade that isn't sharp, so it rips instead of carves, and no positioning provision for flattened pencils, just a round hole.One star off because mine arrived with some small pieces broken (still works), and because it doesn't work on ordinary, round, fat pencils -- the curved blade makes the point too long. Also, the tiny screws that hold the blade weren't tight and they seem prone to stripping. But I'm ordering another, 'cause it's the best available for the purpose.

It's well-made and all that, and the blade is sharp, but the problem is that it makes really stubby points -- like those on golf pencils. It works for colored pencils, but not for writing pencils. The stubby point is a real problem with fat pencils, like the Tri-conderoga. It's just a paper weight, I'm afraid.

I agree with the other positive reviews. This multimeter has a very nice feature set and seemingly good build quality -- certainly for the price. Just for fun, I compared its accuracy against my spendy Fluke ScopeMeter. On DCV they were essentially identical (+/- last digit), except on the Sinometer's handy battery test modes, which slightly load three common battery types to get a meaningful reading; there the Sinometer was about 4% high (?, but insignificant). On Ohms, the two meters were within 1% over various ranges. On ACV, the Sinometer was less than 1% high, compared to the Fluke's true-rms reading. However, I found that the 8221 measured a close-to-correct low voltage VAC reading but was about 5% high on its own mVAC range, for the same signal (? again). Only the included temp probe was a bit disappointing. I compared it to a lab standard mercury thermometer and found that at 37C the Sinometer was showing about 4 degrees low, just barely within its specs; this isn't surprising, as a type-K thermocouple puts out only a few millivolts at that temperature and Class II thermocouples vary several degrees anyhow. Although I bought it as a beater-meter, the Sinometer MS8221 has earned my respect. The only negatives are just-OK leads and no case (so I'm using a Fluke multimeter case, which costs as much as the Sinometer, because the old Fluke cost way too much to get repaired and the Sinometer has better features).

This product (Hedlin in the UK) is a 4% dimethicone (dimeticone) solution. There is considerable misinformation on such products because they work in a novel manner. Lice can hold their breath and hang tightly to hairs when immersed in water or shampoo (called their "immersion reaction"). As soon as the water is removed, the lice become active again. LiceMD and Hedlin coat the lice with silicone and kill them not by suffocation or dehydration but by causing continuing physiological stress. You can find a scientific article about this in BMC Pharmacology by searching for: "The mode of action of dimeticone 4% lotion against head lice, Pediculus capitis." [...]So, NO, LiceMD contains no pesticides. Anyway, lice have become resistant to the usual permethrin/pyrethrum neurotoxic agents in over-the-counter lice shampoos (Nix, Rid, or A-200), and strong malathion shampoo is an Rx.And YES, LiceMD does indeed kill head lice. It also makes it easier to comb out live or dead lice and nits. Nits can also be removed with vinegar and a nit comb. Some schools have a zero nit policy.But NO, LiceMD does not kill lice eggs, only hatched lice, so it must be repeated according to instructions.BTW, head lice can only live a couple of days without feeding, so the best way to rid your house might be to take a vacation. Lice eggs are laid only on hair shafts and can only develop in warmth close to the scalp; they will die in about a week otherwise. Human head lice can't live on pets or anywhere but your scalp.

This microscope is just the ticket. Either for a young scientist or for anyone who needs a basic, 20X stereo microscope. Coin or stamp collectors, for example.Most importantly, the glass optics deliver a clear, sharp image. The focusing is smooth and damped. The stage can be flipped to black or white, or left open for taller objects. The illumination is adequate; it's a battery powered white LED, so the microscope is portable. The inter-optical distance is adjustable. The focal distance and field of view are determined by the magnification, so they will be the same for any 20X 'scope.All the bases are covered -- for a great price. Don't let the "My first" turn you off. This microscope does what it needs to do; it's more than just a toy.

I use quinoa in a number of ways, so try to always have some cooked and ready to add to salads, soups, or breakfast cereal.  I trust Bob's Red Mill products, and always buy from them (through Amazon.,course, where, as a Prime member, I get 2-day shipping!).

These are just fine for my purposes.  I use a lot of mushrooms in my from-scratch cooking.  These, from Mushroom House thru Amazon.com are a wonderful bargain.  Remember that the dried ones are probably one tenth the weight of fresh ones (my guesstimate, based on my own experience with dehydrating foods), and you'll see why these are truly a great buy.  The types included in the package have never been a problem for me.  Very rarely do I find that one specific type makes a difference - and then I can either sort out those I want or buy fresh ones from the store.

I've used Puffs Plus since they became available.  I have some respiratory difficulties that used to cause a very sore nose.  Puffs Plus was a godsend for me.  I don't ever want to run out, so I order it by the case.

Adorable little creature, as close to the appearance of the real animal as I could find. All those children who saw him (? not gender specific) wanted to hold him, including preschool kids, teens and adults.  Hard to go wrong with this one.

Still a little loose, but everyone says it will shrink with laundering, which should neaten it up.  So I'm counting on  it!Good color, exactly as shown, and fits my two- cushion loveseat.  Just place both of your cushions inside and it looks like a single long cushion one. That was one of my concerns when ordering.
Convenient for cooking and baking, or even crafting where you don't want something ruided by a stray hair.  Disposable, and with 200 of them, there's no need to "share".

The title says it clearly: the book is nonfiction and very suitable for children; well illustrated.  I work with teens who. fearful of ridicule, won't ask questions, but are neary always delighted to learn about anything new to them.  Once begun, they  seem to lose that fear and are happy in the knowledge that they  know something many of their friends don't know.  Of course, they're very happy  to explain!

A poignant story about a young woman who cannot get over grieving her brother's death; a new friend helps her to work through the grieving process.  Good story for young women and teens, and perhaps for anyone of any age who is experiencing the same difficulties.

Sprouts develop in 2-3 days, may need  couple more days to mature to your taste.But...I think I am following instructions for dehulling, but it's not working.  Either everything floats, or nothing floats.
Bought this for kids who have a hard time focusing on anything.  It didn't work very well for them.  I'm going to give it to another group (adult) I know, so may have an update later.
I'm still using the Brother ink packs that came with the printer, so I know it lasts a long, long time!  I do a lot of printing!

I bought a West Bend timer many years ago(at least 20), and it would still be going strong if I hadn't shattered the glass by dropping it.  This is probably the thirtieth or fortieth time I've dropped it without any problems.  And, truthfully, it's still working just fine, except I can't read the hours, because that's where it shattered.  I think it's impossible to go wrong with West Bend timers.  That's why I bought this one, and I'm sure it will last  20 or so years as well.

For growing my own indoors...wheat grass and catnip for my cat, and sprouts for me.  I may create an indoor herb garden!  This is really great that I can buy such a small quantity of organic potting mix at this price with Prime shipping!  By the way, if you haven't used Espoma, I can vouch for its high quality.

Growing  my own sprouts (for me) and wheat grass (for my cat) is a time and money saver.  I'm getting high quality wheat seeds in bulk for slightly less than what it would cost me for a package of sprouts and a tiny pot of pet grass.  Given the high rate of germination, I expect this will last for quite awhile.  Another plus for me is that very often, the store will be out of the sprouts and/or the grass, forcing me to return another day and hope for the best...

I hate running out of paper towels, which is why I like to order in bulk.  Sparkle offers a decent price and a choice of using a whole sheet or half.  Very often you only need a half-sheet, as it's very absorbent.  I have some difficulty shopping.  81 years old and with an oxygen tank and walker, I can't carry much else, using cabs and buses as I do.  With Prime, I also save money.  For a one-time low annual payment, and the number of orders I place, I would otherwise pay several hundreds of $$ for shipping.  If I had to make all the shopping trips it would require I would often pay much more at the local grocery stores and also pay for transportation several times each week.  Some items would be impossible for me to carry home due to the size or weight, such as paperr towels in bulk and kitty litter.For whatever your reasons may be, you would find it more convenient to shop this way, Amazon.com makes it worth your while.

I've ordered and received this same scarf in several colors because I liked the  first one I received.  It's roughly 18" by 6', which makes it easy to loop around your neckline.  It's a very inexpensive way to accessorize and add drama to an otherwise plain outfit
Shows how it's done, mishaps and all.  Not just educational, but also entertaining.

When non-teachers try to tell them how to teach, it's a non-ending battle and the teachers don't always win, because there is too much prejudice against them.  People complain that teachers are overpaid, because they only work 9-10 months of the year and have short hours.  (Not really: ask a teacher.)  Religiosity denies science,  maintaining that it conflicts with the "true words" of the Bible.  This is a partial history of the difficulties of teachers, not only with parents, but with ambitious politicians and uneducated school boards.  Some detractors have actually burned books and fired tachers they didn't like, and still  today they are recommending tearing out any pages of books that contain vital information that students need to know.

Title doesn't give much of a clue as to the real gist of the book.  It's a true story of  survivors who were very young Jewish girls when the nazis were arresting Jews, so-called Gypsies, and anyone else they didn't like to send them to the labor and death camps. Their mothers, anxious to protect their children, claimed that they were Catholic and raised them as Catholics.  When the war ended and the scourge was over, their difficulties did not end when they were told that they were actually Jews.  A very poignant story and worth reading.

The kids I work with (ages10-17)  really like to laugh, so I do my best to give them reasons to do so.  Rob Elliott's jokes work.  The books are inexpensive, and the jokes easily forgotten, so it's ok if sometimes they hear the same ones again.  In fact, they laugh even harder when they remember and yell out the punch lines!  I hope he keeps writing them, because soon I will have all of his books so far.  (Most of the grown-ups find them funny, too)

The first few pages told me I don't want to do business with Ebay.  I hadn't realized that  Ebay owns PayPal.  After discovering that, I didn't read the rest.(I have used PayPal in the past, with poor results, like not getting the mdse and not getting a refund, either.)

The Princess Pia loves the turkey and the chicken - not so much the beef, so now I buy just those.  I'm sure they're all good for her, but some are just "not to her taste"  My friends who have cats tell me that their pets are just as persnickety as Pia, but have different tastes.(I used to make her food from scratch, which she liked for a long time, but now she doesn't.  Go figure)

Her Royal Highcatness Pia, really likes this. I, her lowly minion, like it a bit less.  The Princess is a very sloppy eater and pulls the whole thing up, out of its container and over onto the carpet.  Then she hollers at me to set it back up again.  I have an iron container that she has never succeeded in toppling, but this set doesn't fit into it. so I'm going to copy the idea  and plant the grass seeds into a different little pot that actually does fit.  If you can find a way to anchor it, you'll probably love it almost as much as your feline friend does.

About half the kids I work with really like these hidden pictures and do very well with them.  The others give up after trying just one and finding it  "too hard."  I usually help those kids with their first one after they've given up and again, about half of them want to try again on a new one.  These claim to be at an elementary level, but my kids are teens who have missed out on several years of school.  Some of them have been passed along without actually showing passing grades.I will continue to make brain games puzzles available to the students, because sometimes it helps.  Word searches help, too.

For me, buying this miniature cookie cutter set was a mistake - it has too much fine detail that gets lost when the dough sticks in the tiny spaces.  It would take a very tough (or maybe thicker) cookie dough to overcome this problem.  I'm not sure it can be overcome, even with dipping the cutter in water or flour before cutting each cookie.If I find a dough or a method that works, I'll update this and let you know.  If anyone else has found something that works, please let me know!

So far, I really like it!  It's quite a bit larger than I expected.  I just got it set up a few days ago. Chicken that I am, I asked a friend to help me before I even took it out of the box.  It holds more paper in one filling than any other printer I've owned,  Best part is that I can fast-print multiple 2-sided copies.  It would work very well for anyone with a small office.  It also functions as a fax, but I don't have a land line phone, so I don't use that feature.  My main reason for wanting this particular model is that I make up games and puzzles for kids that I work with, and this works fast and efficiently with color or black only.  I don't have to stand there and keep feeding and/or turning sheets over one at a time and wait for each one to print out before going to the next one. Patience has never been one of my few virtues!!!The price is really good at Amazon, too.  So if you're in the market, you may want to look into this model.  BTW, a friend of mine who owns a computer repair business recommended the Brother brand as having fewer problems than some others.

Bought it as a gift.  Seems diameter might be too large to be effective with relatively small bunches of  aparagus.  My friends thought so, too, and they didn't need it for anything else, so I returned it and took them out for dinner instead.

These are NOT brush curlers.  It's my own fault that I assumed that they were, just because I had never seen mesh curlers that were not also brush curlers... I can't make these stay in place - or even in my hair - with the pins that I would normally use, and with my arthritic fingers, I can't make them work with bobby pins, either, so for me, at least, they are useless.Be careful.

Ends needs better anchoring.  I've drilled the holes deeper (all the way through)and added some rubber washers and heavy-duty glue which I hope will hold them in place for awhile.  Pia stopped using it when it popped out and startled her a couple of times, but I'm trying to coax her into using it again.  She likes it when I'm holding it, but not the rest of the time.

These are perfect for my short hair, and you can dry them qjuickly with a hand-held dryer - I aim it through the "tunnels" so it's drying from the inside as well as the outside.  this takes just a few minutes while I'm watching the morning news.  Sometimes, I use them on dry hair  just using a finishing foam.  This perks the curls up again when I'm going out in the evening.  (My hair is baby fine and has very little body.) I use two sizes;  medium for most, and a few larger ones for the back where I don't want so much curl.

I love this pattern and bought the shams and spread to make a complete ensemble.  Only one drawback, as I see it.  My can also loves it, and does not only sleep on it, but also stretches and digs her claws into it.  If you don't have a cat - or possibly a dog - it's beautiful.  If you do, it will be beautiful until...so only 4 stars.
Could not use this as my shelves are not thick enough to keep it stable.  Would require inch-thick (or more?) to make it stable.  I returned it,

Have been using this as cereal, and in recipes for muffins, biscuits, pancakes, etc.  I've also used it in recipes that call for wheat bran, but when wheat is not desirable, I can use the oat bran instead.  So far it has all worked out very well.  This makes it a more flexible addition to baking.  I will undoubtedly order this again.

As an adjunct, and not a regular classroom teacher, I generally work with each student on a one-to-one basis.  This is helpful for many reasons., but the point here is that I need some of the same information as the regular teachers, which is why I wanted this teacher's version of the book mentioned.  If the classroom teacher's is unclear to the student, I can individualize and find other ways to explain the same material.  It often helps just to hear the same information in a different way.  By using the text, I can find variants for the descriptions, including, when appropriate, examples for illustration. The idea is to help the student stay on the same page as the rest of the class.  For these reasons, I like to have the classroom teacher's version as a base. Without it, my  own explanations might be over- or under-simplified, or even far outside where the student should be.  I  rarely have the opportunity to discuss ideas with the classroom teachers before working with the students.  This helps keep me and the students on track.

I bought this for  students who cannot seem to understand a topo map.  by showing them side-by-side, I'm hoping that they will begin to understand.  Also, by questioning, I also hope they can understand why both types of maps are desirable in some situations.  I. e., in a topographical map, extremely steep inclines and declines, the lines would be so close together that they would appear to be one wide line.  A relief map is easier for young students to comprehend.  I haven't shown them this one, yet, but I am surprised - and very pleased - at the accuracy of the contours.  Now they can SEE and FEEL that Kansas, for instance, is not completely flat!

I would give it a negative if that were possible!  This cheaply made "precision" gyroscope is worthless for demonstrating to kids how and why gyroscopes really work for so many different scientific engineering applications, mainly because this one really does NOT work! I  The anchors for the ends of the vertical points are soft plastic, which allows too much "give" causing vibrations, and the center, also plastic, causes resistance so that it turns much to slowly to do what it's supposed to do.  Next time I won't be in so much of a hurry to order.  I'll read the reviews!

I ordered 3 of these, and am using them all.  I really like them as they use some of the empty space at the upper front third of nearly all kitchen cupboards, but do wish they were a little larger.  (that's why only 4 stars: they are 8 inches outside measurement of over-the-door clips, but could be up to 11 inches, could also be 3-4 inches deeper top to bottom and still fit most standard sized doors.) However, they are still handy.  I keep my clean dishwashing cloths (I don't mean dish towels; 'way too small for those!) in two of them and rubber gloves in the third one.  They do not allow for anything that takes up much  vertical space, like detergent bottles or tall cleanser cans. They are only 4.75 inches from bottom of basket to top of cupboard door.I'm keeping these, but in future, I'll look for something a little larger.  I have lots more cupboard doors!

I use all kinds of nuts in many different ways in my vegetarian diet.  I use them raw to make nondairy milk or cream, and to make up nutty health bars.  I add them to soups, as well.  If I want them for snacks or  to add to salads, I will sometimes roast them.  (Usually, 170 degrees F for 25 minutes or so. Do not use higher temperatures if you want to maintain the antioxidant benefits.  Most commercially roasted nuts are processed at higher temperatures and have already lost much of their nutritional value.)  Hazelnuts (filberts) can be used with skins on or off after roasting.  To remove the skins, let them cool, then  lay them on a dishtowel and rub until the skins come off.  This will take less than a minute.  Try them both ways and pick the way you like them.I recommend purchasing all nuts (and seeds) raw if you can get them that way.  Then you can roast or not - your choice!  Only at Amazon.com have I been able to find them both ways.

Update: July 11, 2014I hade been giving the Princess Pia (my aging Siamese cat) other products to help ease her arthritic joints, asd could not see any improvement. Then I tried Nutramax Cosequin.  But when I tried mixing Nutramax into her food, she wouldn't eat her food.  I can't think WHY I keep thinking my (overweight) cat will starve, but I finally overcame my fear and kept putting it into her food - and she finally ATE it!Well, to keep this short, She now gets it twice daily and she eats it every time.  She also runs, jumps, climbs, and chases a little "critter" that hangs on a long string from a helium balloon (her current favorite toy).  She hadn't been doing any of those things, and had a bad limp.  Now she's very active and her limp is barely perceptible.  I'm ordering it again.

When I'm unsure about a book, I usually check it out first from the library, then decide whether to purchase it  After renewing the book twice, then fotocopying some of the recipes I tried and liked, I've just  ordered it.  (I was beginning to feel guilty about keeping it so long, and for copying so many recipes from it!, so I ordered while I still have the library's copy, so that I can have my own before I have to return this one!)  Can you tell that I really do like this cookbook!!?This is a wonderful book for anyone who's trying vegan for the first time, and I'm sure experienced vegans are going to benefit from it, too!  It has all the features I think every cookbook should offer!  Easy and quick-to-make-up recipes that don't (usually) call for items I don't have in my pantry or fridge.  If it does call for something you don't have on hand, it could pay you to add it to your shopping list.  After you've tried a few recipes, you'll want to try the rest!One feature that is especially good is that it gives you recipes for making up your own sauces and mixes  - cheese sauce, taco sauce, instant applesauce, no-beef broth, no-chicken broth powder, worcestershire sauce, even a gluten-free flour blend!It even includes a glossary of ingredients!You can't lose with this one!
This little book is full of humor, and still says what you want to say for someone you really like who is retiring.

Furthermore, she smells it on my finger and won't let me near her until I have washed and deodorized my finger.  My plan was to put in her nose and paws, which didn't even work once!  I should have known better, as she won't eat fish-flavored cat food , either!However, if your cat likes fish, there's a fair chance he/she will take to this better than my cat!

It was the price that first caught my attention.  The "Breathe Easy" claim was another important factor.  I have always used clumpable litter, and was curious about this feature (non-feature?).  I guess it's ok if you don't mind replacing the whole thing and cleaning the litter pan every other day, but that makes it not as inexpensive as I thought, and it doesn't control the odor nearly as well as the clumpable kind.  Also, I had a hard time with all that replacing and sanitizing.I now know that I still prefer the unscented, odor control, clumpable type.  With clumpable, you prevent most of the odor buildup by scooping out the "used" portion and replacing the cupful or so that you took out with fresh litter.  I usually try to sanitize the pan and replace the litter every 2-3 weeks.  Much easier for me!

I don't use a lot of this, but it comes in small cans, so I can store if for a fairly long time, until needed.  It does contain about about 28% saturated fat, so be aware of that when you use it.  It is certified organic and kosher and gluten-free..I chill it, then whip it and use it as topping for  raw, baked or canned fruit desserts.  It's also tasty on mashed sweet potatoes, along with a little cinnamon and ginger!  I don't usually add sweetener, but you can if you wish.This is worth trying, especially if you are on a vegan diet

I could not find these locally, but of course, I did find them on amazon.com!  Raw seeds are flexible.  Most of the time, I  just eat them raw, because I'm on a salt-restricted diet.  On the rare occasions I want them roasted, I can do that wihout adding any salt.  When making them up for guests, I can add sea salt before roasting.  That's what I mean by "flexible".  Raw seeds can be kept  refrigerated for 1-2 months in a tightly sealed container without loss of flavor, but frozen can be kept for a year.Not only are they flexible, but they are outstandingly good!  I use them a lot in vegetable salads, but sometimes I just eat a handful or two as a light snack. If you want to dry roast your own, here's how I do it: Heat oven to its lowest temperature(160-170 degrees F.  Spread seeds in a single layer on a cookie sheet and roast for 15-20 minutes.  Higher temperature will cause break down of fats, creating free radicals you don't want.  (Commercially roasted are generally heated to much higher temps)  Remember, too, that roasted seeds have a shorter shelf life than raw.  So there you have it.

I should have asked the question before ordering, so it's my own fault, but this is too much salt !.  It's the first ingredient listed on the nutrition label.  I can get the salt-free powdered broth locally, but it takes a special trip which is difficult for me.  This is probably ok if you're not on a salt-restricted diet, and others say it's very good.  I won't return it, but I'll check around my friends to see who's not on a no-salt regimen.  I'm sure they'll appreciate it.Update: 10/20/14  One friend urged me to try it, so I did.  I'm glad.Although apparently high in salt, flavor is good and if no other salt is added to cooking, it brings down the total salt level per serving (in homemade veg soup) down to an acceptable level.  I'm now giving it 5 stars!

I use a lot of molasses for baking - cookies, cakes, breads, etc.  (I bake a lot!) This  molasses is very good., and I can recommend it, but if the ad still says 44 fl. oz., that's a mistake.  It's actually one quart (32 fluid ounces), but the NET WEIGHT is 44 ounces.  The package shows it correctly, it's just the ad that's wrong.  The product is fine.

I've been using #2 pencils for awhile, and it seems I make a lot of trips to the pencil sharpener.  I don't have one on my desk, because it needs to be accessible to many others.  It finally occurred to me that a slightly harder lead would cut down on those trips. Duh!It was a good move.  It's still soft enough to use on all kinds of paper and my time spent sharpening pencils has been cut down considerably.  (A #3 would cut the number of trips still more, but would be too hard for some uses, like writing on newsprint type paper.)

I like to control (as far as possible) the ingredients I use in my vegetarian cooking.  I want to know for sure what's in the foods I eat and serve to others.  Most of the time, I also like it to be easy, with little cleanup required.  This cookbook is perfect for people like me. And it's also very good for beginners.The point is that her recipes are flexible, with  easy-to-understand directions.  The beginning cook and the "experimental" cook like me can both benefit from her book, and neither of us will have to do a massive cleanup!.  Any vegetarian cook will enjoy this book.

I requested these through the Vine program.I really thought it would be neat to have them for labeling the home-dehydrated foods in my pantry.  The template for them is available online from Avery.  Sounds good, doesn't it!  However, in order to download the template, you have to also replace your home page with theirs, along with a whole different group of sites you may not want. I like my home page.  I do not want to replace it with a different home page.  I could not find a way to simply download the template without all the stuff I didn't want to be loaded onto my computer.  I don't need any more complications just to print some labels.I can still use them, but will have to hand write them with a pen.  Not so cool.

Very sturdy, handsome and well crafted.  Honestly, I can't believe the price for a watch of this quality.  Personally though I just found it a little too big for my taste.  As others have noted, its heavy, but its also just really large if you can't tell from the pictures.  Some people will like that, so just be aware.  For me personally, I have fairly skinny wrists and the style just doesn't work for me.  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the watch based on quality, value and its overall appearance though.

Eight of these for fifteen bucks?  Sold.  Nice colors, feels like quality material.  Cleans up the counter very well and holds up well in the wash.  Did not shrink or fade after washing.  Nice option!
Beautiful!  This will be a nice addition to our Christmas entertaining table.  Very elegant and well crafted.

Sturdy, slim, very easy to install.  I like it!  I prefer this "mid" level of otterbox protection to the bulkier options.  If you're reasonably careful with your iphone, this will do the job.  Love the colors too!
Sturdy, slim, very easy to install.  I like it!  I prefer this "mid" level of otterbox protection to the bulkier options.  If you're reasonably careful with your iphone, this will do the job.

I have a couple of these Brother WorkSmart printers in our house. Got tired of the kids printing to MINE, this one was a great option for them.  Compact size, very easy to set up and connect wirelessly from their laptops and ipads.  Print quality and speed are good enough.I don't really have any use for this ability to print from evernote or dropbox or whatever.  That seems a little "meh" to me, not really sure why its necessary.  But the overall functionality of the printer is solid so OK.You should know when you buy a printer that the cartridges that come with it are usually on the light side and you'll be buying ink soon.  One thing I like about the Brother printers is that you can definitely find less expensive cartridge options when it is time replace.Brother has a good iphone app available if you want to print from your phone.Lastly, I'll add that I used to use HP printers but the amount of software, etc; that they would require to install on you computer really turned me off. Huge pain everytime I switched computers or had to allow a new computer to print.  I love Brother specifically for that reason.Highly recommended.
Quality set of sturdy pliers at a good price.  Easy to use and decent grips.  Good value!

Great dolls - my five year and eight year old squealed with delight when I took them out of the package.  They both loved the Descendants movie on Disney over the summer and were excited to have the dolls to play with.  I believe the dolls are made by the same company that makes the everafter high dolls too.  They're very similar in design, well made and durable.  If your little ones are fans of the movie, this is a very easy gift to choose.
So additive and fun with awesome story's and people you will never get board!!!!!!!!

Great scent.  I wish I had the words to accurately describe it!  Its manly and clean, but also reminds me of... candy?  Only word I can find to describe it.  Anyway, I've enjoyed a lot of different CK colognes for men, and this is another fine cologne from the company.  My wife and daughters all give it two thumbs up.  Definitely worth giving.

Can't go wrong with Scotts Turf Builder grass seed.  If you follow the instructions here, this seed WILL grow.  Period.  Just know that you can't just throw this stuff down on the hard dirt and expect to be successful.  I waited until early September.  Still pretty hot here in Virginia, but its a small window before the fall.  I aerated the lawn and put down lime a week before to break the dirt up and soften it.  Put down the seed and have kept it watered on a daily basis.  Two weeks later, I see some beautiful new green grass sprouting.  Especially from those aerated spots.The only thing I wish I had done is also de-thatched the lawn.  Probably would have been better.  Sounds like a lot of work, but do it right and this seed will grow!

Very nice. I've never tried a memory foam pillow before so I was happy with the opportunity to test one out.  Its definitely more comfortable than my regular feather/down pillows.My only complaint with the pillow is the chemical smell out of the bag.  I had a similar issue when we put one of the foam mattress pads on our bed.  The smell does fade, but fair warning that it does linger for a while.  Bothered my wife more than me.  If you have an especially sensitive nose, this might not be a great option for you.

Both my nine year old and my eleven year old enjoyed this book.  I was a little concerned that the subject matter might be depressing or hard for kids this age, but I liked that both kids were okay with it.  The lessons are valuable to know that not everyone is as fortunate as yourself.  Recommended!

Not bad.  I prefer these over the ear type buds for my personal use, in the gym or running.  They stay in place very well and the sound is good enough.  I mostly listen to audio books and music on the iphone.  Comfortable both around and in the ear.I'm still looking for earbuds that I like as much as the Phillips Flexible Earhook headphones which are a little less expensive and about as good in terms of quality.  Those don't have the microphone like this though if that is a concern for you.These aren't studio quality obviously but worth checking out if you want something that will hold up.

So awesome - I love these sets for our kids.  The kids love them too!  Crayons, markers, colored pencils and paints.  Every kid needs them either for school or just for entertainment.  My favorite part of this set is the wood case where all of the items fit securely instead of ending up scattered all over the house.  Worth the $20 just for the case.

I'm kind of surprised by all the five star reviews on here.  The presentation of this gift box is nice but that's about the end of it for me.  Five of these candy bars for $25?  Really???  I don't think you'd pay that much for a pack of five Lindt chocolate bars.Anyway, this part is just personal taste.  I actually really like the Hershey's Dark Chocolate almond bars a lot.  Just not a huge fan of the milk chocolate.A bigger issue is how they arrived.  I've attached a photo of my five melted chocolate bars and how they looked.  Appetizing right?  I opened the box and wondered why the bars didn't take up the entire box and why they seemed to be in a weird shape.  Apparently UPS delivery in August is just not a good option.  Luckily as you can see this is a Vine review of a free product so no harm no foul.Box would make a nice gift for someone who you KNOW is a fan of these bars I believe.  Just be careful that you've selected a good delivery option.  There is no way to tell if you're sending them melted chocolate that looks turd-ish or not until you've actually opened the wrapper.

Very cool.  Simple to set up to an AV receiver.  Easy to pair with your bluetooth device.  I have an older home stereo that still sounds great.  I connected the TP-LINK to it via RCA cable so I can play music from my iphone.  Works like a champ.  I often have the phone in my kitchen while the TP-LINK is a good 20 feet away and around a corner in the living room.  Still works great.  Good price and simple solution.

I read Stuart Neville's RATLINES book a few months ago and enjoyed it.  Was happy to have a chance to check this new series out, and I'm happy to report its even better.  This is a new police procedural, mystery series set in Ireland.  I liked the main character, and Neville's writing is fast and entertaining.  Definitely worth your time for a quick and enjoyable and entertaining read.
Love this bag.  Wool and canvas, beautiful stitching and well crafted.  Small enough that it works well as a small backpack or a large purse.  Stylish either way!

Really cute umbrella stroller for dolls, stuffed animals, etc;  My five year old daughter has enjoyed repeated playtime with this.  Fine for pushing the dolls around the house or outside on the sidewalk.  Seems very well made and easy for your little one to use.  My only star off is that folding the stroller back up wasn't especially intuitive. I gave up for fear that I would break it.
Got these boardshorts for a great price!  Love the fit and the material which is lightweight and dries quickly. The shorts tie up easily and were my go to boardshorts for the beach all summer long.

Very cool and fun bracelet making kit for girls.  My nine year old daughter had no problems getting started on making bracelets with the kit  The spinning loom was easy for her to use, but also not *so* easy that it would take away the fun.  I really enjoyed watching her solve certain problems of how much string to use, how best to line the strands up, etc; and to see her get better with each attempt.  She made bracelets for all of her sisters and a few friends as well.The loom is well constructed and not a huge piece of equipment that you'll have lying around the house forever.  The kit comes with a ton of string, so your little one will get plenty of repeat use from the kit.We had a small issue with the string sometimes slipping off the back hook when she started spinning.  Didn't happen all of the time, and possibly more of a user issue than the equipment itself.  Either way, fun toy and recommended.

Really well written, good story and quite touching.  I find memoirs largely hit or miss and mostly avoid them, but this one caught my attention and I'm glad I gave it a shot.  Gus Lee provides a really unique book and his writing is top notch.  Funny, thoughtful and just a lot of fun to read.  If you're like me and had experience with USMA, you will definitely appreciate Lee's thoughts on West Point.  Better yet, if you've never been to West Point and know nothing about life there, I think those readers will get a vivid picture of the place and life.Gen. Schwarzkopf was a larger than life figure for those of us who served in the 90s.  Its pretty amazing to get this part of his story from a third party.  I wasn't aware of his background as a professor.  Pretty amazing to read about the effect he had on this particular cadet and many others it is safe to assume.Well worth your time to read!

Very impressed with this Sony Handycam.  Its been a good ten years since I last bought a video camera shortly before our youngest child was born.  So seeing how small and light this unit is, not to mention to low price for the quality is pretty amazing.  The unit fits easily in one hand and stores compactly in the (recommended and sold separately) Sony carrying case.Setup and use are a piece of cake and very intuitive.  No issues at all.  The viewfinder is nice and big, flips around to various positions as you need.  I really like that a small USB is attached to the camera and tucks away so you're never left stranded for connectivity.  The zoom function and quality is pretty amazing.  I stood on a beach and zoomed in on a lighthouse across the harbor.  Picture quality from that shot was impressive.One of the features I was most excited about was the bluetooth connectivity with an app on my iphone.  I was hoping to use the camera to videotape kids' soccer games on an extended pole.  That's very difficult once the camera is elevated.  With the app, you can control the camera and actually see the video directly on your phone (or ipad or whatever).  Very very cool.I'm sure other more serious videographers may have more technical comments.  For me personally, I was interested in filming kids, vacations, soccer games and the usual family events.  For a while I thought my iphone was good enough for that use, but there's just no comparing the quality of the video here.  Fortunately the small size and light weight of this unit makes it nearly as convenient as your phone to carry around for those purposes.  If you have similar needs, I would definitely recommend taking a look at this handycam.I hope my review was helpful and please feel free to ask any more detailed questions, I would be happy to respond!

I have three curly haired daughters - Suave's detangling spray is a MUST HAVE.  Huge time saver in the morning, getting the kids ready for school to get the knots out of several bedheads.  Makes combing and brushing those little birds' nest much easier and less painful for the kids.  Nice scent and easy to use.  Our 9 and 11 year old use the spray themselves.  Recommended!

I'm not entirely surprised but DJ Molles finishes strong in wrapping up this series.  The whole thing was very entertaining and well written in my opinion.  I read a lot of different books and styles of books.  This series was the equivalent to me of watching a really good action flick.  Pass the popcorn!I was a little disappointed in the previous book, probably for leaving so many loose ends.  Fortunately we didn't have to wait long for EXTINCTION and the author wraps everything up in a satisfying way.  I have to say he did a great job of delivering the urgency and insanity of what is going on.  Captain Harden and his friends are racing against time and a horde of millions of infected and the wheels are flying off left and right.  It was really fun and action packed.  I also liked some of the internal struggles of these characters.  Molles puts in a good effort not just delivering on shoot em up action, but in thinking about some of the moral decisions these characters are forced to make, how they deal with them, and in some cases how they look for redemption.  I give the author a lot of credit for not going the paint by numbers route here.  Its not all happy endings and some of the Hollywood movie endings that one might expect never materialize.Book one of this series was a little raw, but like a lot of you I stuck with it and the series got better and better.  I will look forward to seeing what this author comes up with next.But... series ending???  Oh man!  There are still so many things that I want to know how they will turn out!Recommended!

I love these Adidas performance shorts for working out in the gym and own several pairs.  My waist size is in the 32-33 range and a medium fits me perfectly.  Very comfortable and cool.  Look great.My only small complaint with these shorts is that I wish the pockets were deeper.  I'm sure I'm not the only guy in the gym who carries his iphone around in there.  Your phone will definitely drop out of these shallow pockets.

I enjoyed Bradstreet Gate.  The description of the book advertises it for fans of Donna Tartt, and I found that recommendation appropriate.  If you enjoyed the Goldfinch or Secret History, I think this one is worth taking a look at.Without re-summarizing the plot, I did want to point out that this isn't really a murder mystery.  I started the book thinking it was, but its not your typical murder mystery thriller.  The murder just provides the setting for more of a character driven story.  I still enjoyed the story, but just wanted to give fair warning if you're a mystery reader and interested in the book for that reason.Give it a shot!

Sometimes the reviews on Amazon really nail the way I feel about a book.  Like others I loved READY PLAYER ONE, and personally I was worried I was being overly critical of ARMADA or just missing the genius or something.  I really didn't expect Cline to write something as wonderful as RPO, but ARMADA just feels not only like a really big miss but like Cline didn't even try.The story was basically the plot of Iron Eagle mashed up with the Last Starfighter and regurgitated.  I was waiting to find out that the paint by numbers SF plot was some clever twist, but it really wasn't.  The lowest point for me was Zack immediately meeting the prototypical SF hacker dream girl in his space briefing and becoming romantically attached within a few minutes.  I nearly quit reading at that point.I kind of think Cline would have been better off avoiding a story like this in his follow up to RPO.  ARMADA feels unfortunately like schtick.

I like all of these Dove soaps for men.  Great scent and I don't smell like my wife after I use them.  This one is also nice in that you can use it on your face - I'm not usually able to wash my face with regular bars of soap.  Moisturizing and refreshing scent.And Amazon currently has this priced at $9.29.  That's about $1.16 per bar.  Not bad!  Highly recommended.

I found Jonathan Weisman's debut novel imperfect, but well worth my time in reading.  For any of its faults, it was still a highly original story in my opinion.  I personally had no knowledge whatsoever of the history of Portugal or its involvement in Africa.  Setting the story and characters in that backdrop was very interesting and unique.I noticed before reading this book that it was being compared to Nick Hornby.  I understand the comparison, but I would say this is more of a "RIYL" comparison.  If you enjoyed any of Hornby's books, you might like this one.The back of the novel makes a big point of mentioning the Cocteau Twins and seems to play up the music to drum up interest.  I actually found the musical references weird.  I'm a fan of all the bands who get name dropped in here, but I didn't really understand why they were included or how it really fit into the story at all.  The fact that the narrator started listening to post-punk when he moved to the UK in the late 80s was kind of like.. ok?  I guess that fact alone would have been ok with setting the scene but there are these frequent digressions into mentioning the Cocteau Twins or J&MC or whoever that bugged me.  It felt more like trying to hit a target audience than actually adding to the story.Some of the relationships in the story seem to move too quickly.  Two characters suddenly break up.  Two other characters are suddenly soulmates.  The biggest one is how quickly David is suddenly a confessor to this family and a dear friend to Hans.  Its a good story, but that just seems to happen rather than being advanced through the narrative.Anyway, these were just some small criticisms.  Still one of the better books I've read this summer.  The build up to learn what happend to Hans and Joao is brilliantly executed and surprising.  Will keep you reading through the end.  Recommended!

Great quality.  I love the flat design which is tangle free as described.  I personally can never have enough of these cables around, frequently find myself needing one in a pinch.  This one is considerably more expensive than the Amazons Basics version, so you'll have to decide if that's worth the extra cost.  I like the high visibility color too.  Helps the cable stand out in my piles and piles of these things.  Recommended!

Smell is good and not overly strong.  Easy packaging for the kids to use.  You'll appreciate the 2in1 conditioner/shampoo if you're in a rush.  Its not the same as using those separately at all, but for a quick bath or shower night its a plus.  My children at 5,9, and 11 so didn't really have any issues with getting soap in the eyes or anything, probably more of an issue for younger kids.  Overall, not especially great or high quality shampoo, but affordable, everyday stuff for kids.The price on this six pack is currently $25.87.  That's $4.30 a bottle.  I just checked - you can buy this at Target today for $1.70 a bottle on sale from the usual $1.89 price.  Horrible pricing here on Amazon.

I love these Nike Rabid Sunglasses.  They're similar to the older TARJ model which I used to wear and lastest quite a while.  These are great sunglasses for active people.  The plastic is durable and flexible.  The arms have a good grip which will stay in place if you're running or on the move.  And for $70 or whatever you'll find them for, you won't be worrying about them as much as you might a pair of fancier glasses at twice the price.I'm a soccer coach and these are perfect for my needs.  Can throw them in the coaches' bag when I need them off my head.  They stay perched easily on my head when I need to lift them up to look players in the eyes.  I can leave them on while I'm demonstrating.  And of course, they keep the sun out of my eyes when I'm on the sidelines.I wish some of the sellers would be more clear with the Nike sunglasses and the sizing.  I've mistakenly bought the kids' sizes once or twice.  This version EVO603-001 is definitely the correct size for adults.

Absolutely loved this book.  Hard to write that sentence as this is such a dark and disturbing novel, but I devoured it.This was my first Don Winslow book.  Picked it up because THE CARTEL looked interesting to me, so I thought I would check this one out first.  I'm a huge James Ellroy fan and Winslow's writing really reminded me a lot of what I love about Ellroy.  Not derivative or aping Ellroy by an means, but if you like Ellroy's books I think you'll enjoy this one for sure.I'm a little hesitant to actually recommend this book broadly to friends though.  Its a very gritty, violent and disturbing novel.  There's nothing gratuitous about it.  Winslow writes about how the narcotraficantes behave, how they deal with people and take revenge upon people, and he doesn't pull any punches with any of it.  So, fair warning to any prospective readers.The characters in the book are just outstanding.  Loved the well developed back stories with each of them.  Winslow does such a good job introducing each of the main characters at their younger ages, its really awesome to follow them on their paths to see how they are affected by the events in the story.I'm really looking forward to reading THE CARTEL now.  If anybody would care to comment on my review, I would be very interested to know from other readers if any of Winslow's other books are as good as this one.  Thanks in advance1

Honestly my nine year old and my five year old would give this doll five stars no problem.  They love Equestria Girls and were thrilled to play with this doll.  My only complaint is that I feel like we have four or five Pinkie Pie dolls that are labelled slightly differently and I can't really tell what the difference is between any of them.  Just a dad problem?  I don't know.  There's apparently a way to get a game on your iphone and connect it with this doll somehow but the kids couldn't be bothered.  They had fun playing with the doll though!

My girls ages 9 and 5 were so excited about the Rock 'N Royals dolls.  They have both the Courtney and Erika dolls.  The dolls switch from princess to pop star with a twist.  Both dolls play a little tune that will probably bug the heck out of you after an hour, but oh well.  These aren't like other Barbies where the kids will be swapping outfits.  Mine built a little stage out of a shoebox and were playing pop stars with their dolls for hours.  I know they're looking forward to checking out the movie now for sure.These remind me of the dolls from Barbie and the Diamond Castle which my kids absolutely loved as well.  Easiest 5 star review ever.

My girls ages 9 and 5 were so excited about the Rock 'N Royals dolls.  They have both the Courtney and Erika dolls.  The dolls switch from princess to pop star with a twist.  Both dolls play a little tune that will probably bug the heck out of you after an hour, but oh well.  These aren't like other Barbies where the kids will be swapping outfits.  Mine built a little stage out of a shoebox and were playing pop stars with their dolls for hours.  I know they're looking forward to checking out the movie now for sure.These remind me of the dolls from Barbie and the Diamond Castle which my kids absolutely loved as well.  Easiest 5 star review ever.

Hmmm.  I didn't really notice the strong fragrance that other reviewers mentioned.  May be more of an issue for some than others.  I barely noticed the smell at all.  Works well as a daily face cleaner and does a nice job leaving the face feeling soft and clean, not dried out.  Price is a *little* bit hefty in my opinion to think about using this daily so I'll give it four stars.

Swiffer WetJet is awesome and so easy to use.  Plug the cleaner cartridge in, stick a "mop head" on the velcro part and go.  I've used it both on the hardwood in our kitchen and on the tiles in the bathroom floor.  Could not be easier to use for quick, everyday cleanings.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
Before I got this app I drew horrible ponies. But now I'm really good at drawing ponies thanks to this app! I hope everyone else will enjoy it too.

Very happy with this pre-workout mix.  I've been using a pre-workout drink regularly before hitting the gym the past year or two and appreciate the benefits.  I workout early in the morning too, so this is a big help getting an extra kick in the pants.  By the time I've driven over to the gym, I'm ready to go.  For the past year my go-to has been BPI Sports 1.M.R. Vortex Pre-Workout Powder (which I highly recommend as well), but I got a free tub of this and was eager to give it a shot.Fruit punch taste is great and mixes well.No jitters or stomach issues for me at all.  I'm a caffeine junkie though and as I said have been using pre-workout drinks for a while now.  If you're new to these products, I would warn you to expect that jittery feeling at first.  Definitely start with smaller mixes, see what you can handle and allow your body to adjust.  As good as the added energy feels going into your workout, its no fun to try to bench press while you have the shakes!Hard for me to comment on the nitrous/creatine claims.  I don't know.  hah.Bottom line for me personally, this mix delivered a good pre-workout energy shot that I was looking for.  If I'm looking more "pumped" as a result of the added ingredients, even better.  Recommended.

This is my fourth pair of Mizuno Wave Inspires, my first pair of the new version 11.  I like them both for running and for wearing to the gym.  This version is made with very light and breathable material, but still feels substantial and durable.  The 10 oz weight is perfect.  Slightly less than some of my other usual running shoes.  I loved the Wave Inspire 9.  This model feels like a definite upgrade from the previous.I wear a size 10 in most shoes, and the 10 in these shoes is a perfect fit.  My feet are also on the wider side - some of the more narrow Nike running shoes are uncomfortable for me.  The normal D width in these shoes is fine.Shoes look and feel great.  I would not hesitate to recommend Mizuno running shoes in general, and this model in particular.

High quality whey protein from a well known and reputable brand.  If you're training regularly, this is a 2 lb inexpensive way to to get the post workout protein you know you're supposed to get.  I won't go into the benefits of this.  Taste is good, mixes well and I like that this container isn't as huge as some other monstrous jars I've purchased in the past.  Price is a bargain too!

My five year old daughter enjoyed this Barbie.  She was able to apply the glitter to the hair with a little help from her older sister.  The hair design/glitter activity seems to be kind of a one off thing in my opinion.  After doing the hair once, she quickly discarded the accompanying glitter, stickers, etc; and just played with the doll.  On the plus side, she LOVES the doll especially the accessories this Barbie comes with.  Fun!

We were really excited about this new crockpot.  Love cooking with the crockpot especially in the winter time.  This model is the perfect size for our family of five which is especially nice, doesn't take up as much room as our old silver one.The digital timer is a great feature.  I have definitely been guilty of leaving the cooker on for too long and ruining the meal by the time we got to dinner.Our favorite thing about this though is the removeable casserole dish which can easily used in the oven.

Reliable brand obviously.  You get plenty of aluminum foil in this package.  I prefer the slightly thicker version of this aluminum foil (this pack is on the thin side), but its a small complaint.  Can't go wrong with Reynolds Wrap!

This is really cute.  My nine year old loves to keep a journal and this voice-locked password journal was really fun for her.  We had recently purchased a similar item, the Ever After High Secret Hearts Password journal, for her sister.  I much prefer this item.  The Ever After High journal felt badly made and was a real hassle to program the password and to get it to respond correctly.  The girls had no trouble at all putting the password in this journal and getting it to open.  Win!

This is a cute book.  My eight year old daughter read it with her five year old sister and said, "Five stars!"Its written almost like a comic book with illustrations on every page and text scattered throughout so it was easy to keep the kids' attention.  We'll be looking out for book #2.

I've been using Philips over the ear sports headphones for years.  I buy them two or three at a time in case I lose them or they break.  I read a couple of the other reviews and I just haven't had any kind of similar experience with them.  When they've broken for me, its usually been because I've been using them for a while or left them in my pocket or something.  I listen mostly to books but some music as well in the gym and the sound quality has been fine.I really like this Action Fit model because you can swap the ear buds out.  My one complaint with the other model I've used is that my ears would get sore after wearing them too long.  This provides a very snug, comfortable fit that you can choose.  I don't personally like earbuds without the over the ear clip.  These things aren't going anywhere while I'm in the middle of working out.I'm sure there are probably better sounding ear buds if you want to spend $100 for Beats or whatever.  For sports use, I think these sound fine and are a really good option.  I would definitely purchase them again.

WOW.  Wish I had used one of these when I first bought my iphone 5.  I've had the usual thin plastic stuff for the past two years.  Applied this new tech armor ballistic glass today while I was replacing a broken case.  Amazing!  Love the clear look and feel.  Installation was incredibly easy.  I will definitely buy these again in the future.

Very pleased with this purchase.  I've had the original black leather 5s case from Apple since I bought my phone, but it has recently cracked near the headphone jack which lead to some issues with the charger.  I wanted a thin, sturdy case to replace it.  Some protection but no bulky phone.  The Slim Armor case from Spigen seems to be exactly what I was looking for.The case was super easy to put on.  Fits the phone snugly.  Looks great.  If you're a butter fingers, be forewarned this isn't a "grippy" kind of case.  That wasn't really a big requirement for me.I applied a new Tech Armor ballistic glass screen protector to the phone before I put this case on.  The case works beautifully with that protector.  No issues at all.If you're looking for a case that retains some of the original beauty of the iPhone, has a slim profile and you don't need it to survive a four story fall, I would not hesitate to recommend this one.

We've gone through numerous ink jet, scanning printers in our house.  This is just an altogether different kind of printer.  If you need something just prints quickly, reliably, easily and isn't going to be complaining about being out of paper or ink anytime soon, this is the business.Set up on the wireless network was a piece of cake.  The biggest plus for me though is the printing speed.  LOVE how quickly this stuff comes out, I'm not standing around in front of my printer anymore waiting for my print job.Its not huge, but be aware that its a bit bigger and heavier than other printers.  Highly recommended for your small business or home office.
Sturdy, functional and fits easily under the bed.  This is a really simple option for storing our out of season clothes out of the way.  Nice!

Love the Magista Onda Turf.  I have the firm ground and indoor versions of these also and couldn't be happier with them.I normally wear a size 10, but bought 10.5 in this shoe.  Even half size up the fit was a little snug in the toe.  I found that they loosened up a bit after the first run in them so I don't think I would have wanted a bigger size than that.Highly recommended.

Wow, I could not be more impressed with the Electrolux 2-in-1 hand held. Its very simple set up right out of the box.  Charged it for 24 hours and it was ready to go.  Used as a stick vacuum it is very light and easy to use anywhere you need.  I've been mainly using mine for quick messes (my kids get field turf all over the house frequently changing out of their soccer cleats), but I'm 99% certain you could use this to vacuum an entire floor on one charge.  Its also a great option for stairs which are a hassle to vacuum.I'm really impressed by the power you get using this as a stick vacuum.  Wasn't really sure what to expect of that.  It has good suction and some sort of rollers in the head to easily clean up the carpets.The hand held piece detaches simply from the stick and is perfect for hard to reach messes and your car.  It comes with a small brush attachment to use for hard to reach areas and dusting.These battery powered devices have really come a long way.  I would not hesitate to recommend this particular vacuum at all.

Hard to find anything to complain about with the Diono Cambria booster car seat.  I've gone through several different similar Graco car seats and thought they were all fine.  I have no problems with those Graco models at all.  This car seat is at least as good as any of those, and honestly probably a step up.  It has a more weighty, substantial feel to it.  Feels a little more padded and comfortable overall and at least from appearance gives the impression that it is providing more protection around your child.Set-up out of the box could not be simpler.  I'll compare again with the Graco models I've used which were fairly simple as well but required a few more steps to assemble.  The Diono Cambria is basically one step to hook the booster to the back.  Easy.  The latch system is equally easy to use.I love the latch system with these car seats.  Having used both with and without, I would highly recommend the added protection is worth whatever the additional $10-$20 cost is.The fold out cup holder and trays are easy to access and my child likes them.  Highly recommended car seat.

Works great!  I honestly have no idea if this Monster splitter works any better than the $3 splitters or not.  I needed to split my Verizon FIOS outlet to accommodate the DVR and the wireless router.  It was really important to me that both continue to work perfectly when I moved them to the same outlet, so I picked this splitter.  Very solid and well constructed and I've had no problems with FIOS since I made the change.

I'm really impressed by this dehumidifier so far.  We've been using it for about three weeks now in our basement which has long been a problem area for us.  The difference in the basement in only a few days is frankly unbelievable.  That damp, musty smell and feel is just completely gone.  If I had known it was going to make such a difference I would have bought this years ago.  Kind of kicking myself now.As others have written, the setup is really simple.  I wish the manual was a little more clear on the buttons/usage.  It could use a little more detail on which settings to use and why.  But otherwise I got it up and running quickly.I haven't messed with the pump or hose options yet.  The bucket fills up for me after about a day and a half most of the time, and I've just emptied it myself hasn't really been a big issue.  Its pretty amazing though to empty the bucket and see the amount of moisture that has been pulled out of the air.  It is a bit noisy too, I guess.  I'll probably experiment some with placement of the unit for that reason.I expect I'll try to hook this up with the hose set up fairly soon.  If that goes well and I don't have any problems with the unit over the summer, I'm sure I'll update my review to five stars.

Nice!  I can't quite place the scent, almost like baby powder but not quite.  A small amount does the job.  Dries quickly and doesn't leave your hands feeling greasy.  I was impressed how immediately soft your hands feel after applying.  I kind of wish the cap was a flip top rather than screwing off like this, but that's a small bit of nitpicking.  I would definitely recommend this hand cream.

I got tired of those cheap made in China boots, that you get at the big box sporting goods stores, wearing out before the first set of laces broke. So I asked my Iron Worker buddy (one of those crazy guys who walks along exposed steel girders 80 floors off the ground), which boots go the distance in his work environment. Without hesitation he said "Danners', but be sure to get the Made in USA product", apparently Danner does sell some cheap made in China products, that are no better than the ones I was getting before. He said these boots last for 10 to 15 years, in one of the harshest work environments around.These are not cheap, so go to some trouble measuring your feet, and get the right size ... I typically wear an 11 D, I ordered 11 D, and they fit perfect. I've been wearing a black pair for almost a year now, this my second pair, they fit great, feel great, and are clearly well made.  I've put a lot of miles on my first pair, and if I clean them up, they look like I could have bought them last week, the Vibram soles will probably outlast me.

It's ok, not exactly like the original Tempurpedic cover, but it works.  Mine is what Tempurpedic calls a "queen" size, but their sizing is different from the industry standard, so measure your pillow and double check ... this cover is slightly too large, but it works ok after washing it a couple of times in hot water.

I own four of La Crosse's so called "Radio Controlled", or "Atomic", clocks ... all four originally worked perfect, then all four failed on the same day (still indicating that they received the NIST signal, but failing to re-set the clock).  I understand that the NIST transmission was upgraded on that day, but they say that no existing receivers should be effected, the original time data is still on the signal, and it was just an upgrade.  I did my research on the web, and found that thousands of other La Crosse clock users had the same problem.  In other words, the La Crosse engineers should have designed a system that would tolerate upgrades to the signal.I contacted La Crosse, carefully explaining the situation, and asking if they were going to do the right thing, and provide a solution, or new working clocks.  They responded with a standard form letter, suggesting that I "try changing the batteries", or "try moving the clocks to a different location".  I responded explaining that I had already tried all of that, and I again carefully explained that all four clocks functioned perfectly, and all four failed on the same day (still indicating that they received the NIST signal, but failing to re-set the clock) ... this is not a battery or location issue, it's an engineering failure.The final response from La Crosse was that my clocks are "out of warranty", so it's my problem, not theirs.So let me ask you this ... if a company refuses to do the right thing, and replace a product with an obvious design flaw, why would anyone ever buy a product from them again?

Soft and fuzzy inside, thin layer of neoprene outside, lightweight and not a whole lot bigger than the device it's protecting ... unless you're going into a war zone, this is just the right amount of protection. Because it's stretchy, it grips the device inside, holding it in firmly, not so firmly that it's difficult to get out, but firmly enough that you can toss it across the room into your luggage, and expect it to stay put. I had one for my 3rd generation Kindle, for two years, before I gave it to a relative and bought a new Kindle. It's tough, it lasts, and does it's job. I have one for my new Kindle, and one for my tablet which is the same size as the Kindle Fire.I bought this one for a Dell XPS 15z (supposedly the exact same size as a MacBook Pro), and found that the width and thickness are perfect, but the length is just a bit too short.  I can stretch it, and close the zippers, so I'm going to keep it, and hope it stretches a bit over time.

It's very difficult to find the original Panasonic batteries anymore, and when you do find them they cost a ridiculous amount of money, so I decided to try these.  Since I actually needed three, this package was a good deal.One battery indicated full charge, right out of the box.  This worried me at first, but it seems to be functioning quite well.  The other two were at different levels of charge, and both indicated full charge in a reasonable amount of time.I can't comment on longevity, of course, but these batteries seem to be performing as well as the original Panasonic batteries in daily use.
These filters seem to do a good enough job filtering, and flow smoothly for a long time.  This was just a good price on a six pack of the same filters I buy at the hardware store.

It took me a while to get around to writing this review, because I use Linux exclusively, and I wanted to make sure I had all the kinks worked out before I talked about it.The first thing I did when I got this XPS 15Z, was to remove the Windows disk that came in it (without ever turning it on) and install a 120GB, high speed, low power, SSD for my Linux installation.  This was not a simple task, since this laptop is so small and thin, doing something as simple as swapping the hard disk, or replacing the battery, requires a somewhat complicated disassembly.  Fortunately, I found a guide on YouTube that pointed out all the pitfalls as you're going in.On the "small and thin" note ... it's really quite cool.  Thin, light weight, covered with an aluminum/titanium alloy that looks nice but might scratch, and still large enough to hold a 15" full 1920x1080 native glass LED screen.  I like the look and feel of the back-lit keypad, but I'm not crazy about the glide-pad, but that's ok, since I use a Bluetooth mouse most of the time anyway.  I've seen many people knocking it because they say it looks like a Mac-book Pro., this may be true, and it does seem to have all the exact same I/O ports in the same locations, including the Mac "Mini Display Connector", but I don't care, I like it.This laptop (XPS 15Z), had one little quirk that threw me for a loop because I never had to deal with it before, but once I figured it out, I'm really quite happy with it.  That quirk is the "Optimus" system that manages the two different graphics adapters, the low power Intel GPU, and the high power nVidia GPU.  Many Linux users seek out systems with nVidia graphics, because nVidia likes Linux, and in previous systems, I simply set the BIOS to only use the nVidia GPU.  This laptop does not allow that option, forcing you to learn how to manage the Optimus hardware.  In a MS Windows system, virtually all of the applications have a profile file associated with it, and the OS passes part of the profile to Optimus, which determines if the high power nVidia GPU is needed.  In Linux, you have to use an application like "Bumblebee" to manage Optimus, and decide for yourself if the application you're using requires the nVidia GPU.  It's really quite simple to create a launcher that starts your favorite apps. with the nVidia GPU enabled, but you have to know that it needs to be done. Also, every high power 3D graphics app. that I've tried so far, will actually run with only the Intel GPU, just very slowly.Under minimal power conditions (display brightness at minimum, keyboard back-light off, WiFi and Bluetooth off, nothing plugged in to the USB ports, Ethernet cable plugged in, Intel GPU only), I get about 6 hrs. 20 mins. on the battery ... not bad.  An interesting side note, simply turning on the nVidia GPU cuts that down to about 40 mins., also the fan gets a little loud when nVidia is running full blast.Addendum:  We have a huge fire burning here in So. Cal., and power lines got knocked down this morning, so we had a lengthy power failure.  I kicked this laptop into low gear, connected it by tethering to my cell phone (which means WiFi), and I got over 7 hours of battery life with the WiFi turned on.  Apparently, WiFi uses less power than wired Ethernet on this machine.I've jumped through all the hoops to get this thing running perfectly under Linux (Fedora 18), so if you're considering this laptop as a Linux machine, and need some help, just ask.By the way, there are a few misprints, even contradictions, in Amazons' product description.  A couple of important notes that helped me decide to buy this machine are:  The nVidia GPU is a "GeForce GT 540M", and the native resolution of the glass is a full 1920 x 1080.For the geekier readers, here are a few numbers:glxgears with Intel GPU only:$ glxgearsRunning synchronized to the vertical refresh.  The framerate should be approximately the same as the monitor refresh rate.302 frames in 5.0 seconds = 60.353 FPS300 frames in 5.0 seconds = 59.879 FPS300 frames in 5.0 seconds = 59.874 FPSglxgears with nVidia GPU:$ optirun glxgears5935 frames in 5.0 seconds = 1186.968 FPS5879 frames in 5.0 seconds = 1175.759 FPS5989 frames in 5.0 seconds = 1197.705 FPS$ lspci00:00.0 Host bridge: Intel Let me start out by saying that I don't usually fall for the gimmicky TV commercial stuff, and I have perfectly normal healthy feet, but I saw these things at my local CVS pharmacy and decided to give them a try, and here's why.  I go barefoot, or in socks, around my house most of the time due to grass pollen allergies (it helps to kick my shoes off at the door and not track the pollen around the house).  To compound the situation, I use a stand up desk (I'm standing in front of my computer right now), and my bare feet sometimes get tired standing on the floor all the time.Again, I have perfectly normal healthy feet, and I won't be wearing these inside my shoes or anything like that, but I have to say, this feels pretty damned good walking around the house in my socks, so far.I'll update this review after a few weeks of testing ... hopefully they will be halfway durable.

Let me start out by saying that I don't usually fall for the gimmicky TV commercial stuff, and I have perfectly normal healthy feet, but I saw these things at my local CVS pharmacy and decided to give them a try, and here's why.  I go barefoot, or in socks, around my house most of the time due to grass pollen allergies (it helps to kick my shoes off at the door and not track the pollen around the house).  To compound the situation, I use a stand up desk (I'm standing in front of my computer right now), and my bare feet sometimes get tired standing on the floor all the time.Again, I have perfectly normal healthy feet, and I won't be wearing these inside my shoes or anything like that, but I have to say, this feels pretty damned good walking around the house in my socks, so far.I'll update this review after a few weeks of testing ... hopefully they will be halfway durable.
