One well-timed swing and I'm back to enjoying my coffee in peace. And I have two teenage sons who are now fighting over the rights to be Head Electricutioner (and who are under STRICT orders not to use it on each other).The one downside is that it's not effective for creepy crawly bugs  anything on a flat surface (like the spider that decided to skitter down the wall behind my desk as I was writing this review) is pretty much safe from the Electricutioner. I think it'd be possible to sort of rest the metal grid against a crawling bug if it were large enough (taller than the frame of the Electricutioner), but awkward to do. But, bonus: Since you have to hit your target in midair (as opposed to squishing it against a flat surface), it helps improve your hand-eye coordination!I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

I absolutely love this skirt  I ordered the Native Tribal Bush patterned skirt in a size medium and couldn't be happier with my purchase.The material is lightweight, super soft, and quite stretchy, with a smooth and silky sort of texture. I'm currently six months pregnant, but given the design of the skirt I felt that I could wear it as an "over the tummy" style skirt for now, until I have a waist again. And I'm pleased to report that it works just fine as a maternity skirt, with the fold over band going above the baby bump.The pattern is just gorgeous  very intricate with vibrant colors and contrasts. I also love the length of this skirt  I'm 5'10, so other maxi skirts that I have are more like above-the-ankle skirts on me. This one actually comes all the way down to the tops of my feet if I were to wear it "normally" - it still comes down below my knees even worn maternity-style.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

These are very comfortable pajamas and the sizing is pretty spot on. I'm 5'10 and usually wear a large (14 or 16), but I'm currently six months pregnant and have been going with an XL in maternity clothes  I ordered these in an XL and they fit great. The material is stretchy enough that the bottoms fit over my pregnant stomach, and they'll probably fit for at least another month. (After that they're going in my hospital bag, because these are definitely going to be great for post-partum and breastfeeding wear as well).The top is perfectly designed to allow for discreet yet convenient nursing. The material is both soft and super stretchy. The "main" layer of the shirt has a low scoop neck (it just covers the top of my bra), with a second ruched layer over that. The top layer has a "twist" design that allows you to lift one side without exposing the other side. The bottom layer pulls down for easy nursing access. For moms who've nursed before, it works along the same lines as the "tank top under the t-shirt" method, but all in just one lightweight shirt so you don't swelter in the summertime. As a bonus, the shirt is cute enough that I would (and plan to) wear it as a regular nursing top, not just as a pajama top. The bottoms are made of the same soft, stretchy material. On me they hit just above the knee  partly because I'm taller, and partly because I have them pulled up over six months worth of growing baby.These were definitely a great purchase (I'm actually wearing them as I write this review, and plan to get a LOT of use out of them), and I'd recommend them to any pregnant or nursing mom. Or even just as comfy pajamas to non-pregnant/nursing moms, for that matter.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

This is an "alternative use" review of these great little reusable pads. I'm currently six months pregnant with my fifth child, and without going too far into TMI territory, sometimes coughing or sneezing can be dangerous. (Or having a toddler climb in my lap, or standing up too quickly, or you get the idea). Before switching to these, I was using regular disposable pads, and I even tried using those disposable menstrual underwear, but honestly, they made me feel like I was wearing a diaper (which I basically was). Nothing like amping up the discomfort and "unsexy" feelings of being pregnant like wearing the equivalent of a diaper!These cloth pads are both discrete and comfortable, and work perfectly to handle occasional light bladder issues. (I should mention, however, that these probably wouldn't be effective for anything beyond "light" issues  they work great for a trickle when you cough, which is all I need, but I don't think they'd hold up to a full deluge). I especially love how comfortable they are against sensitive bits  the lining is super soft, MUCH more comfortable than disposables. (For that matter, they're more comfortable than underwear lining too). And the charcoal layer is effective at containing odors. They're discrete with their cute geometric pattern on the outer layer, and they stay in place just fine when I use the snaps to secure them. (And the snaps work both ways, so they also keep them folded nicely both before and after using them).Convenience-wise, they're a tiny bit less convenient than disposables, but with more than enough benefits to make up for it. You'll want a "wet bag" of some sort to keep them in after you rinse them until you get a chance to wash them, but they're more comfortable, they're better for the environment than disposables, and they'll be a money-saver over the long run as opposed to buying expensive disposables every month. After reading the positive reviews of more typical usage, I'll definitely be using these after my baby is born too.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

1:07 MinsWhen we were little, my mom always used to sing the "You Are My Sunshine" song to me and my sisters, and I've carried on that tradition with my own kids. This necklace is absolutely adorable and will make an ideal gift.The larger charm is hammered silvertone metal stamped with "You are my Sunshine my only Sunshine." The disc is a circle roughly the same circumference as a nickel but about half the thickness. If it flips around (and what necklace charm doesn't?), the back of the charm has grooved lines that catch the light radiating from the center. The smaller charm (which was the selling point for me, because it's absolutely adorable) is smaller, with a sunshine cutout stamped with the image of a smiling sun, which goes over the larger charm.The chain the charms come on is a delicate 18 inch chain with a lobster clasp. It's adjustable down to 16 inches, with two extra clasping rings built into the chain down its length. Both the length and the delicate style are perfect for a young girl, but it *is* long enough that an adult could wear it also.My only suggestion? (And this is just an idea for the sellers, not a criticism of the item I received) - I've seen this necklace available with both charms in goldtone; I'd love to see an option with the larger charm (the one with the words) in silver but the sunshine charm in gold. I think the contrasting tones, with a golden sunshine against the silver background, would be really cute.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

You don't really realize that there's a difference between "bad" tweezers and "good" tweezers until you've experienced both. (Spoiler alert: these are good tweezers!) The bad ones don't grip the hair properly and aren't tight enough to yank a hair out in one tug. Sometimes they're also quite awkward to get a good grip on in the first place, before you even start trying to get your eyebrows (or whatever) into decent shape.These tweezers from Malva Belle have none of those problems  they're well designed and do their job with finesse. You only need slight pressure to bring the tips together tightly, so you can use them even if you have minor mobility problems with your hands or fingers. (I have some minor nerve damage in my fingers and have no problems manipulating these tweezers, unlike others I've tried). The tips are slanted so you can get a good grip without pinching the skin around the hair (or splinter, or whatever it is you're trying to yank out). Also, they're a cute dusty rose color, which sets them apart from other plainly-colored tweezers I've used.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

I love my Keurig, but I don't love the expense or wastefulness of standard disposable K-Cups. These reusable K-Cups are the perfect solution, and have several other benefits as well. You can make a stronger or weaker cup of coffee by varying the amount of grounds you put in the cup. You can fill them with whatever brand of coffee you like - my favorite coffee, a local store's brand, isn't even available in K-Cups  problem solved! You can mix flavors for custom blends, or even adjust the caffeine level by combining regular coffee with some decaf. And the only thing you have to throw away is the grounds, which are compostable, so you're not filling up your trash can (and the landfills) with a bunch of K-Cups.Functionality-wise, these work perfectly. They're made of solid plastic with micro-mesh cutouts around the sides. The lid closes securely, and the mesh is tight enough that even espresso ground coffee won't spill out. And I love that they're purple (my favorite color) and the mesh cutouts are dolphin shaped. They're also easy to clean  just tap the grounds out and give 'em a rinse and they're ready to use again. (They're also dishwasher safe). And you get three in one package, so if you have two people brewing coffee in a row, the second person doesn't have to wait (or burn their fingers trying to clean the still-hot reusable K-cup). And the bonus charcoal filter is a great addition!I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

I have an absolutely tiny downstairs bathroom with no storage space  no medicine cabinet, no counter space next to the sink, nothing. I've been keeping my "girl stuff" (makeup and the like) in a box under the sink  inconvenient, but good enough temporarily. This organizer, however, is a much better solution!This organizer is the perfect size to store all the little odds and ends that tend to clutter up the countertop (assuming you have a countertop to clutter up, that is). The three drawers are each large enough to hold several items (multiple tubes of lipstick; assorted powder cosmetics; a variety of jewelry), but the organizer as a whole is small enough to fit into a small space (like the top of your toilet, which is pretty much the only flat surface I have in my bathroom).The drawers also come all the way out, which is convenient for retrieving and using those smaller items stored inside. They're lined with removable cushy black mesh padding that serves a dual purpose  it protects your possessions (and the drawer itself) from getting scratched up, and it also keeps those items from sliding around within the drawer. Also included is a little pink microfiber cloth (like the kind you use to clean eyeglasses or electronics) so you can keep the organizer free of smudges and fingerprints.I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

Carbon monoxide is kind of terrifying  odorless, invisible, and deadly. My husband and I and our four (soon to be five) children recently have a 100+ year old house (radiator heated by a gas-powered steam boiler).  We already had an older (but still functional) carbon monoxide detector that we installed right after buying the house, before we even moved in, but we knew our large two-story house needed more than one. And this carbon monoxide detector from X-Sense is great!This carbon monoxide detector comes with everything you need to get it set up right out of the box  not only does it come with the hardware you need to mount it on the wall (two screws and anchors), it also comes with the two required AA batteries. And the battery installation is as easy as it gets, no screwdriver required  the battery cover just slides over, and it's on the front so you don't even have to take the detector off the wall when it's time to change the batteries. So instead of setting it aside until you have a chance to find batteries for it, or while you're looking for a screwdriver to open the battery compartment, you can take it out of the box and put it to work in under a minute. Additionally, if you don't want to (or aren't allowed to) drill holes in your walls to wall-mount it, there's a built-in stand that flips out on the back, so you have the alternative of setting it on a flat surface (great if you're renting and can't put holes in the walls).There are three indicator lights top and center of the detector  power, alarm, and fault  with an LCD display underneath. When all is well, the green power light flashes about every 30 seconds to let you know it's working and the display screen is blank. One of my favorite features of this particular detector is that it measures both the specific levels of carbon monoxide as well as the length of time that level has been present. If there are dangerous carbon monoxide levels, in addition to an audible alarm, the red alarm light would blink every ten seconds and the screen would display the level of carbon monoxide detected (from 30 to 999 ppm). The response time of the alarm varies based on the amount of carbon monoxide detected. The minimum level is 30 ppm of carbon monoxide for 120 minutes, but it only takes 3 minutes if it detects 300 ppm of carbon monoxide. It also automatically resets when the danger has passed. Another great feature is the built-in memory. The test/hush button on the front of the detector also has a "peak level" indicator, which when pressed will tell you the highest carbon monoxide concentration since the last time you reset it (cleared the memory). It was a little scary for me to see that it's detected 20 ppm of carbon monoxide at some point since we set it up! That's a terrific feature to alert you to potential problems ahead of time, before they become critical.I definitely plan on purchasing at least a couple more of these detectors, both to replace our old detector and to add additional layers of safety to our home. At minimum you want one CO detector on each level of your house (including at the top of the basement stairs), but for extra safety you can add detectors in each bedroom and in the basement itself (but at least 20 feet away from any fuel burning heat source).I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

This is a great set of six of the most frequently used essential oils. The selection is perfect to restock your own supplies (or to keep a second set of oils in another room), or it would make a great gift set for someone who's just starting out using essential oils. The packaging also makes this gift-giving quality (although the box containing the bottles is so well sealed and tightly fitting that it was a little difficult to get it open the first time).The bottles that the oils come in are great  they're dark glass (ideal for essential oils) with plastic screw-top lids that are safety sealed. The built-in stopper inside the bottles lets you easily dispense the oils a drop at a time (and no having to fiddle with an eyedropper style cap). I'm not an expert on essential oils, but the oils themselves seem to be high quality and emit great scents when used in a diffuser. I personally use the Calily diffuser, the one with the color changing LED lights and multi-function remote, and these oils work wonderfully in it.I use oils semi-frequently (diffusing lavender oil is a WONDERFUL way to help to calm my autistic son), but since the set is described as a "starter set," the addition of a basic list of the benefits/primary uses of each oil would be a great addition to this set. I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

This is a convenient, easy-to-use essential oil diffuser. It comes with the diffuser itself, a multi-function remote that works from across the room (batteries included!), the power cord, a cleaning brush, and instructions.This diffuser is really easy to use, even if you've never used a diffuser before. The cover lifts straight up from the base, revealing the water/oil reservoir beneath. After connecting the power cord, you just pour 100ml of tap water into the reservoir, add in 2 or 3 drops of essential oil, replace the top cover, and plug it in.The remote offers you a lot of choices in how you prefer to use this diffuser; it's not just a straight on/off remote. You can set how long you'd like the diffuser to run for (dependent upon how much water you have in the reservoir)  the settings allow for 1, 2, or 3 hours continuously, or you can set it to diffuse intermittently (15 seconds on and 15 seconds off) for 2, 4, or 6 hours. (The instructions do state that you should avoid using it for more than 3 hours at a time, and to allow it time to cool down between sessions).You can also use the remote to set the diffuser to cycle through four colors (blue, green, purple, and red) or pick your favorite color and set it to stay on that one. The brightness is adjustable as well. Or, if you prefer, you can turn the light off entirely.As far as operation, this is an ultrasonic essential oil diffuser. There are different types of diffusers you can get, but the benefits to an ultrasonic diffuser like this one are that they're quieter than a nebulizing diffuser (I can barely hear this one running at all, just a low "white noise" sort of hum) and they don't run through your oils as quickly. Additionally, they can double as a humidifier.Safety features: This diffuser uses cool mist, and states that it's cool to the touch. That's been my experience  I haven't let it run for long periods of time yet (I have a houseful of kids and pets, so I turn it off when I'm not right near it), but after half an hour of continuous misting it was still cool, not even warm, when I touched it. It's also designed to automatically shut off if it does happen to overheat, and when the water level drops too low.The only difficulty I ran into with this diffuser was trying to figure out where the "max fill line" was located  if you put too much water in the reservoir, the diffuser won't mist properly, and I put too much water in the first time I tried using it. When I didn't see any mist, I dumped the water into a measuring cup and realized that I'd gone well over the listed 100ml. Once I lowered the water level, it started misting as soon as I turned it on. I'm not certain, but it appears that the little orange cap inside the reservoir is the maximum fill line  that's where the water level was at when I adjusted the amount to just shy of 100ml, at least. So I would recommend measuring the amount of water you add the first time, just so you're familiar with where that level is inside the diffuser.Overall, I found this diffuser to be simple to set up and use and very quiet in operation. The LED light features take this from being an effective diffuser to being an aesthetically pleasing one as well. I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

When I first heard about ultrasonic pest repellers, I was dubious, but I figured it couldn't hurt. My husband and I bought a big old drafty house that's like Grand Central Station for spiders and carpenter ants. (Mice also used to congregate here, but our two cats took care of that problem). We started using a Hoont pest repeller a couple of months ago and were incredibly pleased with the results (no more ants in the bathroom!), so when I got the opportunity to test this model out, it wasn't even a question.Twice in the week before receiving this pest repeller, I was accosted by very large, very scary looking spiders in our downstairs bathroom. (And watching a spider creep towards you while you're helplessly indisposed in a compromising position is one of the worst feelings ever). And while spiders freak me out, I also don't like killing them. I'd attempted to negotiate with them previously  they stay out of sight and eat any other bugs that got into the house and I'd leave them alone. Their visible presence in the bathroom obviously proves their violation of that agreement, though. Since I'm pregnant and our family consists of four kids (including a toddler who touches EVERYTHING), two cats, and a dog, we didn't really want to use poisons to combat the spider problem. We tried using peppermint oil (which can be dangerous for cats, but we kept them out of the room we sprayed it in) to repel the bathroom spiders, with minimal to no success.And then I plugged this pest repeller into the wall. And even though the instruction sheet says you might see an increase in pests for a couple of weeks as they're flushed out of the walls, I haven't seen a single spider (or anything else) since putting this product to use. We keep the bathroom door closed so our toddler doesn't play in the toilet/the dog doesn't drink out of the toilet, and the instructions also say that the sound waves can't penetrate solid walls, so this might just be a coincidence but I also haven't seen a single pest in the kitchen that's next to the bathroom since installing the pest repeller, and spiders liked to hang out there sometimes too. And the pest repeller doesn't bother our cats or our dog (or our kids, for that matter) at all.You can get this information in the product listing, so I'll just do a quick overview: there are three different pest control technologies built into this product. There's the ultrasonic pest control (high pressure sound that irritates insects and rodents); the ionic pest control (negative ions to clear the air of pollutants and odors); and electromagnetic pest control (digitally-processed magnetic vibrations that travel through the wiring in your walls to create a hostile environment for any unwanted residents). You can cycle between these three technologies to choose just one or to have all three of them active (which is what I went with). There's also a built-in blue LED night light that's bright enough to make your way around an otherwise dark room, but not so bright that it hurts your eyes if you get up in the middle of the night and use that for your sole source of illumination.The important part of all this is that its worked for us to keep all the creepy crawlies away! I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

Before you even read this review, you need to know that Stephen King is my favorite author  I've never met a Stephen King novel that I haven't liked (although I haven't LOVED them all, and I've been lukewarm on a short story or two). So while this book isn't flawless, I still very much enjoyed it and would recommend it. (But oh, how I wish I could be a beta reader for King and help catch those little errors before the books go to print!)This novel, like Mr. Mercedes, falls outside of King's "regular" genre of horror. There's only the slightest hint of the paranormal in this novel (although I expect that will be expanded upon in the final novel of the trilogy). I wouldn't exactly call it a mystery, because while there are mysteries for the characters, the reader already pretty much knows the answers. Suspense, crime fiction, detective fiction, or even thriller would be a more appropriate classification - definitely not horror, in my opinion, even though there are some horrific elements. That being said, there are "tones of King" in this novel  the very plot itself revisits past King themes (the lengths book addicts will go to in order to get their next fix in particular).I think you might have to be one of those people who's more than a casual reader to fully appreciate the motivations and actions of both Morris Bellamy and Pete Saubers. Avid readers might even find themselves having the slightest twinge of sympathy  just a teensy bit  for Bellamy and his motivations. Bellamy was obviously already unstable before his imprisonment, but I think waiting almost four DECADES for a particular book would drive any passionate reader insane. When you're emotionally invested in a character or book series, the wait for the next book can be agonizing, especially if the wait is particularly long (fans of The Dark Tower or Wheel of Time feel my pain here, I think). Six years between Dark Tower books was torture, and the books weren't even written yet (that I know of). To know that there's another novel (or two) in a beloved series, just sitting there and waiting for you to come dig it up, a story that no one other than the other has ever read before to wait thirty-six years to be able to actually read it? To know that there still might be hope for a character that  you believed the author had "destroyed," a chance for that character to redeem himself in your eyes? And then to finally be able to retrieve those writings, only to find them gone? If Morris hadn't already been crazy, that right there would've tipped him over the edge.When I read Mr. Mercedes, I was unaware that Bill Hodges was going to be the star of a trilogy. Mr. Mercedes concluded satisfactorily as far as I'm concerned; I didn't feel like there were unresolved plot points when I reached the end of the book. Finders Keepers, however, definitely has some loose ends to be tied up in the next (and final maybe) novel, The Suicide Prince. Don't keep me waiting, Mr. King! Because we all know what happens when you keep your fans waiting

A few years ago, I was introduced to the concept of adult coloring books as a stress reliever/meditation aid, and I've been hooked ever since. However, this is the first coloring book I've had where the colors are basically reversed  these are black pages with white designs to color in, as opposed to the usual white pages.The mandalas are very intricately designed and have varying levels of difficulty (with difficulty level determined by how many teeny tiny spaces there are to color in). Because the page is black instead of white, if you do happen to accidentally color outside of the lines, though, it's less noticeable. And the black background has the added benefit of making the colors you use really stand out  I particularly liked coloring the pages with bright jewel tones, and the results are pretty enough to frame.So whether you're looking for a relaxation activity for yourself or perhaps a gift for a loved one, these beautiful patterns will provide hours of coloring enjoyment.I received an e-copy of this book in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

These are incredibly handy little deodorizing bags, especially if you're a mom of boys. My husband and our two teenage sons keep their shoes in a wooden drawer under our stairs, and the "boy smell" was sometimes overwhelming whenever the drawer was opened. I put two of the bags in the drawer with their shoes, and the odor is gone. And additionally, that drawer has a naturally "musty" odor to it (we live in a 100+ year old house, so all the small places are musty smelling), and that odor has dissipated as well. As we also have younger children, including a curious toddler, I love that these bags are chemical-free and safe if our little guy gets his hands on them. Since this package has four regular bags plus two smaller bonus bags, I can put more bags in those other musty areas, like the kitchen cupboards or my own shoe storage area. And the bonus bags come in a pretty little green pouch with a ribbon tied around the top, so one of those is going in the diaper bag to keep that smelling fresh and clean.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

I'm used to using plain, wired earbuds without any extra features, so these wireless earbuds are a huge step up for me. (For comparison's sake I asked my husband, who uses wireless earbuds regularly, to test these out too, and he liked them so well that I think he's keeping them).Instead of one-size-fits-all (and hope they don't fall out), these earbuds come with everything you need for a custom fit: four sets of ear tips and 3 sets of ear stabilizers in varying sizes and cord management clips so you can custom-fit the amount of slack in the cord, plus a carrying pouch and a micro USB charging cable.Now, I've gotta say, I've never used earbuds with "ear stabilizers" before, and it took me a couple (okay, several) minutes to figure out how they worked. Normally I just stick the buds in my ears and hope that they stay put. Between the instruction booklet and a mirror, though, I sorted it out, and I'm happy to report that these earbuds stay securely in place even if I shake my head around a bit. (Apparently I have tiny little ears, though, or maybe just oddly shaped ears, because even the smallest stabilizer was a little tricky to fit on my right ear).The earbuds have a feature that I haven't seen before  a magnetic clasp within the earbuds themselves. When you're not wearing them in your ears, you can put the earbuds back-to-back and the magnets hold them together so they stay securely around your neck, like an earbud necklace. But even with the magnetic clasps built into the earpieces, these earbuds are very light and don't feel like they're so heavy they're going to fall out.Pairing was simple and fast  you just hold down the center button for 8 seconds, but by the time the earbuds said "pairing," my phone had already found them. The controls for power, volume, etc. are in a little remote built into the cord near the right earbud, so you don't have to touch the earbuds themselves (or your phone) to change the volume, skip to the next music track, or answer/end a phone call.The sound quality goes from "meh" to quite good once you get the buds properly adjusted in your ears. When I first tried out these earbuds, the music seemed tinny and the balance seemed off between the two sides. But after I fiddled around with the different sizes of tips and stabilizers and got the earbuds properly situated (which took me probably ten minutes of trying out different combinations), I was really pleased with the sound quality  it was comparable to the quality of my good set of wired earbuds. These aren't bass-boosting earbuds, but I personally don't want my earbuds to assault my ears with heavy bass anyway  I save that for when the speakers aren't millimeters from my eardrums.As far as Bluetooth connectivity goes, the listed effective distance is 33 feet, and while I was able to get that far away from my phone before the earbuds actually unpaired, the sound started cutting out after approximately 12 feet (with my phone sitting out in the open on my desk with no walls between me and it).  That's just as good or better than other wireless earbuds that my husband has, though. (He says ten feet is pretty typical).And obviously the water resistant/sweatproof feature is a huge bonus  I bought these primarily to use them for activities like yoga, bike rides, and kayaking, where they're going to get sweaty and possibly get a little water splashed on them. They hold up well to physical activity, both in terms of water and sweat resistance and in staying put and not slipping out of your ears.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

My son recently turned two and is just about to transition to a toddler bed, and with a big boy bed comes a big boy pillow. This one attracted my attention because of the high thread count and the fact that it's machine washable. The size is just right for a toddler-sized head, and this pillow achieves the perfect balance between softness and firmness  soft and squishy enough to be comfy, but firm enough that it's supportive. I do plan on putting a pillow case on it even though it's not necessary just so I don't have to wash the pillow itself as often (and also because it's white and therefore bound to get stained sooner rather than later if it's not covered with something). Although he's not yet using it to put his head on when he sleeps (he cuddles up to it instead), my son likes to carry his pillow around with him and "squish" it like it's a stuffed animal and has also been using it to sit on (another great reason to get a pillowcase for it).I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

I switched over from waxing to tweezing around the time my fourth child was born  the time and money saved makes it worth a little extra hassle. I've used the cheap silver tweezers that you can pick up at the grocery store, and they sort of work if you don't mind tugging on the same hair a few times to get it out, or leaving some shorter or finer hairs behind because you just can't get a good enough grip on them. This is one of those cases of "you get what you pay for." With these tweezers, the slanted tips make it easier to grip shorter hairs, and there's just the slightest bit of texture added to the inside of the tips so that they don't lose their grip on even fine hairs. I'm currently pregnant, so I have random little stray hairs showing up in a wide radius around my actual eyebrows, so I've been able to really thoroughly test these tweezers out, with great results. These tweezers make it really easy to grab a stray hair and yank it out with one little tug, making the whole process faster, easier, and less painful.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

This is a very well made bath brush. The long wooden handle is thick, sturdy, and comfortable to hold, and has a rope handle to hang it in your shower. I have limited mobility in my shoulders, and I'm also a taller girl, and I'm happy to say that the handle on this brush is long enough for me to get even those hard-to-reach spots on my back. The boar bristle side has just enough texture that my skin feels smooth and exfoliated after using it, yet isn't so rough that it hurts or scratches my skin. I haven't been using this brush long enough to say whether or not the nubby side really does anything about cellulite, but I can say that using that side on my legs is like getting a massage and really helps my tired, achy legs feel rejuvenated. I also use the nubby side on my back and shoulders to give them a nice massage.I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

0:31 MinsThese are a set of four super cute iridescent dinosaurs that are infused with catnip for your cat's amusement. We have two cats, both of whom are older but who still love a good dose of catnip (I think it reminds them of their reckless youths). This set comes with two each of the pink and the iridescent green dinosaurs, so there's enough fun for more than one if you're a multi-cat household. That's also handy for when one gets batted deep underneath the couch and you don't feel like retrieving it right away - you can just toss over one of the other three and save the heavy furniture moving for later.The toys are also nice and light, so they're easy to play with for both older cats who might have mobility issues, or for younger kittens who are too small to be able to move around larger toys. The catnip scent isn't overwhelming like it is with some cat toys (or with straight catnip), but it's present enough that the toys got the attention of both cats, who sniffed and pawed and nibbled at the dinosaurs when I presented them. My cats are not, however, cooperative about playing with toys and being cute in front of people (they're like my toddler that way), so they're acting fairly nonchalant in the video. Once they see I'm watching, they put on their typical uninterested air - but I've definitely caught them "attacking" these toys when they think I'm not looking, and I know they get a lot of enjoyment out of them when they're prowling around at night. A younger cat would likely go gung-ho for them straight out of the packaging.I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

This is a great DVD set for little ones. I have a son who's almost two, and the first time I put in the alphabet DVD, he stopped what he was doing to watch  and read the letters back as they were said. (And then looked over at me each time to make sure I was noticing how clever he was being  and trust me, I was!) He didn't, and doesn't, stare at the screen with these videos, which is good, but he'll go back and forth between playing and checking out what's happening, and frequently repeats the letter/number/shape/color the narrator recites.The music and animation are both slow-paced and repetitive  as an experienced mom (nearly 20 years of parenting and preschool entertainment), I'm mostly immune to the monotony. Repetition is a great way for little ones to learn, and having the animation set to music helps with retention. My little guy is definitely picking up on the content, and is getting practice at both learning the concepts and speech as he repeats the information on-screen.I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

I really like the design of these headbands and the various colors they're available in. I chose to try out the black headband first, since black goes with everything (right?) The braided style is really cute, and the backing doesn't stick to my hair to the point that it tugs when I put the headband on. It was a little small for me when I first got it (I think I have an average sized head, but maybe it's a little larger than average - I'm tall for a girl), but I stretched it out around the flap of a box (nearest thing I had handy) and left it there for a couple of days. Now it definitely still has plenty of stretch to it (meaning it's not likely to wear out anytime soon), but it's also a little bit looser so it's more comfortable for me to wear. It also stays put really well even though other circular-style headbands tend to slip up the back of my head.This product was provided at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review.

This is a really cute necklace, and my son (who's working on his last four teeth) loves chewing on it. It took me a while to decide which color to pick - I love the bright purple! - but I wound up going with black so it would match with everything. I can wear it whenever we leave the house and if my son gets fussy, I have the necklace available for him to play with and chew on no matter where we are. (Much more convenient than digging through my purse hoping that I remembered to toss a teething toy in there before we left!) And it's designed so that it isn't *obviously* a teething necklace - it looks similar in style to a lot of the statement necklaces that are so popular right now.The beads have a fun slightly "squishy" feel to them, so I can understand why they're so much fun (and comfort) for a baby to chew on. I just wish I'd had this necklace when he was still nursing, it might have saved me from some hair pulling! (I'm expecting another baby in October, so I'll be certain to try it out with him/her at nursing time!)I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

Habanero peppers are one of my favorite foods  it used to be jalapenos, but once I discovered the spicy-sweet flavor of habaneros, there was no going back. I live up north (aka the land of "we don't like flavor"), so it can be challenging to find habanero products in stores around here - so I'm very grateful that this habanero salsa is available (and I don't even have to get out of my pajamas to get it!)This salsa has a heat index listing of 9 out of 10  in other words, have the milk close at hand for this one! I think I'm pretty tough when it comes to spicy food, but this one had me reaching for the milk after the third or fourth bite. Not that I'm complaining, mind you! If you like heat in your food, you're going to LOVE this salsa! This is a thicker, chunky style of salsa (just the way I like it), and I love the inclusion of corn, which I haven't seen in the salsas I've purchased off the shelf at the grocery store. The corn adds a great touch of sweetness to the fiery flavor of the peppers, it's SO good!This salsa is great with tortilla chips, but you know what I liked even better? Using it as a cheeseburger topping! ). The heat is less extreme when you eat the salsa this way, so it's a great way to give a burger a kick without overheating more sensitive palates. I'm going to try it as a blackened chicken topping next!I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

This bowl is much prettier in real life than the pictures show (although smaller than it appears in the yoga image  it's about 4 inches across and 1  inches high). It has intricate etchings and bright, vibrant colors (and makes a lovely ringing sound when it's tapped, which might be a strange thing to like about it, but it's a beautiful sound). I have it on my bookcase with my collection of old books  since it looks like an antique, it complements the dcor perfectly. I use it to keep jewelry in, although it could be used for a variety of other purposes.I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

This is a beautiful notebook; I adore the texture of the paper. The front and endpapers are a heavier weight paper with a rougher texture, while the interior pages are a lighter weight with a smoother texture (but still very "natural" and not a smooth, processed paper). I do a lot of writing and journaling, and strongly prefer this style of paper, with more texture and "character" to it. This is a hardcover journal, but it really is surprisingly lightweight.I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

I'd never tried coconut flour before I had the chance to try this at a great price, and I've gotta say that I love it! I've used it in both blueberry muffins and chocolate chip cookies with terrific results. I have a child with special needs so we try to avoid gluten in his diet; I love that I can use this flour to achieve that goal! (And it's also great that it's healthier for the rest of the family too!)

I love products that put an ingenious spin on an existing product, and this is one of those! We have tons of gadgets in our house - smartphones, tablets, an iPad, portable chargers, earpieces, etc. - that all need a USB cord to charge. (And of course the iPad needs a completely different charger than everything else).This cable is great because it has both the micro USB and the lightning ends, so it can be used to charge everything we own. It's also designed so that it's very convenient to use the included key ring to keep it with you at all times - it plugs into itself to make a little rectanglular shaped package that hardly takes up any space at all.It works with any USB portable power bank in addition to USB car chargers, wall chargers, and computer USB ports - so basically, as long as I have this cable with me, I can charge any device I have with me as well. I can plug this into the USB car charger to juice up the power bank, and then connect it to the power bank to keep my phone alive while I'm out and about. And NO error messages on the iPad like I've gotten with other charging cords!I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

These flameless candles are a terrific alternative to regular candles. I have four sons, including a toddler, so for safety's sake I can't always light a candle when and where I want to. (Mostly my candles have just been sitting around gathering dust since my youngest got mobile). There are all sorts of things I love about these candles. I can put them pretty much anywhere without risking one of the kids trying to burn the house down - I can even put them on my bookcase or on a windowsill without having to pull the curtains way back. They have a light vanilla scent and they're actually made of wax, so they feel like real candles too. And there's a remote that I can use for all sorts of things - changing the mode, changing the color, setting a timer - really quite ingenious, I've never had remote-controlled candles before! I can set them on the fireplace mantle and then make changes from the couch!You will need quite a few batteries (not included) to get them set up (again, with four kids, I already keep a stash of batteries on hand at all times so I was good to go). Each candle takes three AAA batteries, and the remote needs a CR2025 battery (the larger round button cell battery). I'm using rechargeable batteries in the candles (like I do for everything possible), and they work fine.I received these candles at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

There's still a LOT of snow on the ground here, so my bike is still waiting out winter in my mother-in-law's garage, but I paid it a visit to try out these lights. (I confess, I may also have challenged my husband to a mini light saber war  complete with sound effects - with these lights when they first arrived. Yes, we're geeks, but you've gotta admit there's a resemblance). The lights by themselves didn't fit on my bike, but they fit perfectly once I added on the (included) adapter. Once the weather warms up enough for bike rides, my kids are going to be THRILLED to have these lights on their bikes. And since they come six in a pack, that's enough for three bikes in once package (although I feel like there may be some bickering over which kid gets the awesome color-changing LED lights!)I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

I love this dress! It's incredibly comfortable and very versatile - it's casual enough that I can wear it with a pair of strappy sandals for a casual dinner date with my husband, but I can also dress it up with a fancier hairstyle and heels. I'm also very impressed with the way it fits - I'm a taller girl (5'10) with a larger bust, so I wasn't sure that a size large would fit me, but I'm happy to say that the fit is great! The back of the dress is a shirred elastic that allows for some "give" if you're a little larger up top. The dress is shorter on me than in the product images (obviously), but the style is such that it looks great even with a shorter hem. (The dress comes to about mid-calf on me, with the bottom ribbon above the ruffle hitting just below my knees). And the pattern is terrific - I got the "orange black" (which to me looks more like red and black), and the intricate pattern and the contrast with the red dress really appeals to me.I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

If for some reason I ever had to give up all of my beauty products except one, argan oil would be the one I'd keep. I started using it on my dry, damaged hair at a friend's recommendation, and since then I've found a variety of other uses for it. I use it as a leave-in treatment every time I wash my hair (I have long hair, but just a drop or two is plenty), and to tame down the ends if they get frizzy between shampoos. I also add a drop to my moisturizer to keep my skin soft and smooth. AND it's great for really rough patches of skin, like elbows and feet.

I have a one-year-old son who's been working on cutting his last few teeth for what seems like FOREVER, so we have an assortment of teething products for him to chew on. The necklace is great because it's made of food grade silicone and is BPA free, and I love the available color choices! I had to stop wearing regular necklaces when my son was still tiny, because he would grab anything within reach and put it in his mouth. It's nice to have a cute piece of jewelry that I can wear that he's allowed to chew on. (It also means that don't forget the teething toy at home when we're out and about, so we always have a distraction available when he gets fussy - as long as I remember to wear the necklace!)He loves playing with it as well as chewing on it, and it's also fun for him to try to make ME chew on (as in the attached picture!) This would have been great while he was still nursing, as he was a very fidgety little guy, and I'm looking forward to using it for that purpose when my next kiddo is born this October!I received this necklace at a discounted price in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

I've tried Garcinia Cambogia before with positive results, but just switched to this brand, which I received to try out in exchange for my honest review - I really like that this brand has no fillers, binders, or artificial ingredients. I started gaining weight after my youngest son stopped nursing, and taking Garcinia Cambogia before meals seems to have helped me in reversing that process. I'm not sure if it's because of the Garcinia Cambogia or if taking the pills before meals makes me more aware of what I'm eating  I think a combination of both. Either way, it works for me with no negative side effects. Even better, I don't crave sweets like I did before, which obviously also helps with weight loss!

I have four sons (ages 1 through teens), and we received a BOX4BLOX in exchange for our honest review. The consensus? We love it! My teenage son has a lot of teeny tiny Legos, and this container sorts all of his Legos by size using the grids on each level. It makes it much easier for him to find those small-but-critical pieces - instead of having to dump out the entire bin of Legos, he only needs to look in the bottom tray, where all the smallest pieces get filtered to. And my 9-year-old son likes picking up the Legos and shaking the container to make them fall through... and with all the Legos picked up, mom doesn't have to get on anyone's case about leaving them around where the toddler might get his hands (or mouth) on them. Now if only they'd come out with a container for the medium-sized blocks that are also scattered all over my house!

I really like this showerhead  the lights are pretty, the 10" rainfall design is luxurious, and the included extension arm is wonderful. (Both my husband and I are tall  my husband is 6'8 - so that extension arm is a must-have!) The person who designed my bathroom was an idiot, so even though the bathroom has a window and a ceiling light, the inside of the shower stall is dimly lit even on a bright day with the bathroom light on. The upside is that the LED lights on the showerhead are more effective than they'd be in a brightly lit bathroom (gotta find that silver lining somewhere!) The picture attached was taken at night, but with the bathroom light on. If you have a nice brightly lit bathroom, the LED lights aren't going to be as obvious. (I also took out the water flow regulator before installing the showerhead, since I live in an old house with questionable water pressure, and maybe the faster water flow makes the lights brighter? That I'm not sure about).I found the showerhead to be very quick and easy to install, less than a 10 minute job from start to finish. Other reviewers mentioned the showerhead being noisy, but I don't notice any noise at all when this shower is running, other than the typical "water is running" noise. Maybe those people got a bad showerhead; maybe I'm just immune to noises that are quieter than a dull roar (I DO have four sons, so "quiet" is rare for my house). I also didn't experience any leaking issues as others have mentioned, not even when it was first installed. But I do have a fair bit of experience with plumbing-related activities (I've swapped out showerheads before plus have done plenty of plumbing-type repairs, between the four kids and an old house). So again, could be others received a defective product; could be just that the more practice you have with things like this, the easier it is and fewer problems you'll have.I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

Two Kids covers a year in the lives of Rob and D.C., two twelve-year-olds who meet at a summertime birthday party. As a former extra-tall 12-year-old girl myself, I related to the main female character, D.C. (although I was all gawky, with none of D.C.'s athleticism or confidence). D.C. also experiences a tragedy in her life midway through the story that my family also experienced, and it's the details like these that drew me into the story.This book reminds me a fair bit of one of my favorite children's books, Bridge to Terabithia  Rob and D.C. have vivid imaginations and create their own fantastic stories and make-believe games, yet there's also real-world personal tragedies that the kids must deal with. But the friendship between the two kids is strong, and this story shows how those friendships formed during that awkward heading-into-puberty time can turn into strong lifelong bonds.The story was a lot longer than I expected it to be  I don't really look at page numbers with ebooks, I read enough that I usually know about how long a book will take me (depending on the target audience  adult, YA, middle grade, etc.). I expected this one to be about half the actual length given the target audience. That's neither a negative nor a positive, though. However, I do feel that a more imaginative title would have improved the book as a whole  I think the simplistic title also led me to believe that this would be a shorter, simpler book (with less tragedy and more of the fun parts of a coming-of-age story). Likewise, the cover art  I know, I know, don't judge a book by its cover. But we all do, and my expectations based on the title and the cover didn't match up with the actual contents of the book.I received an ecopy of this book for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

I work from home and spend a LOT of time sitting in front of the computer. I developed some really bad sciatica pain (the kind that radiates all the way down to your foot) a few months ago, and had been using various pillows and cushions from around the house to try to ease the pain when I was at the computer. Then I was given the opportunity to review this cushion in exchange for my honest opinion - it's a MUCH better choice than random household pillows! The cut-out design relieves the pressure on my tailbone, and the way the cushion is curved positions my hips and legs to relieve the pressure on the nerve that's causing the majority of my pain. The memory foam makes it nice and cushy to sit on, and I especially like that the cover is machine washable (I have a toddler, and one of his greatest joys in life is to take the cushion off my chair and throw it on the floor). I've been using this cushion for a month now, and while it's not a "miracle cure" for back pain, I'm able to sit at the computer for as long as I need to without the sciatica pain flaring up.

This drawing set was a birthday gift for my teenage son (I can barely draw stick figures, myself), and he loves it. This set has all of the artists's tools he needs to keep working to perfect his craft - both graphite and charcoal pencils and sticks, sharpeners for both kinds of pencils, both a plastic and a kneaded eraser, and the plastic case it arrives in can be used as a storage case if desired. The 12 graphite pencils come in varying degrees of hardness (from 5H up to 8B), plus there's a soft graphite sketching pencil and 3 graphite sticks (one each hard, medium, and soft). Then there are 3 charcoal pencils and 3 charcoal sticks.This is a great set for any artist, as it has such a wonderful variety of pencils and sticks (plus the sharpeners and erasers). With so many tools to work with, and at a great price (I've bought him drawing kits with not even half the quantity, variety, and quality of supplies that cost just as much or more than this set), this is a must-have set for any artist.I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.

This is a very handy little gadget! I ordered this for my son for his 19th birthday, and he absolutely loves it. It has so many little gadgets built into it, pretty much any tool you might need for small jobs around the house. It opens up into a set of needlenose pliers with various other tools built into both sides of the handle (a small saw, a Phillips screwdriver, a file, etc.). The multitool as a whole is quite compact despite the quantity of tools it contains, and comes with an attached key ring so my son won't lose it (hopefully!) It's the perfect size for my son to carry around in his pocket so he always has a set of tools close at hand.I received this product in exchange for my honest review; all opinions are my own.
They do what they're supposed to do- keep food off of my shirt, and give me something to wipe my hands on... nothing spectacular, but gets the job done.

This is the 'go to' for a lot of diabetics.  It doesn't have protein or fiber amounts, but it's nice for on the run, or figuring insulin for insulin:carb doses.  I keep the regular size print in my purse, and the large size near my insulin and medication area.

I can't take NSAIDs (ibuprofen, naproxen, aspirin, etc), so it's nice to have a topical analgesic for neck and back pain (degenerative disc disease).  It does have a medicinal smell, but it's not really strong - and not like wintergreen.  Nice to carry in my purse.
Nice to have another variety of flavors !  I can't find these in stores around where I live, so was glad to get them on Amazon .  I especially like the peach and red apple. :)

These work well for dog pee pads.  The edges of one side have tended to stay folded over, which is fine, as it acts as an additional barrier if my dog 'hits' too close to the side.  They absorb well, and are good for 2-3 good puddles.
Seems to be working OK.  No expiration dates on the box or individual application 'sections'.... I don't like that.  But my dog doesn't have fleas.

My doctor's office recently changed to narrow pee cups.  I mean seriously, those are great for men who can see what they're aiming at, but for women, it's a disaster.  So, I got my own.  It's still not all that easy, but at least I have a fighting chance of getting the specimen IN the cup, instead of dripping down the sides.Here's the thing.  These are good for a LOT more than pee !  Small batch salad dressing, jello servings, fruit cups, safety pins, paper clips, nails, craft items, etc.  They're sterile- so no problem there.If you work in a hospital or drug/alcohol treatment center, and like to prank your nurse/tech buddies, fill one of these part way with apple juice, and casually pick it up off of the counter and drink it.  Had a patient do that one time, and we're still talking about it :D  Just be sure yours is the only one on the counter ;)

This reminds me of stuff I ate as a kid.  Sometimes, that's just nice to have again.  I add a can of mushrooms, and sometimes a little more light sour cream.  Instead of whole milk, I add %2, with about 3 Tbs of nonfat dry milk powder, to make it creamier.  An extra dash of  worcestershire sometimes makes it in the pan as well :)

Sometimes, good old fashioned tuna casserole just sounds good (especially with the weather getting cooler).  I am disabled, so making things from scratch is rough most days.  It's nice to have an old standby that has been around long enough to be dependable and consistent.  This is good to have around when it's a 'long month' between disability checks.  Still get something tasty.  I usually add two cans of tuna, and a can of mushrooms.
I got what was expected.  I haven't used it yet- but don't anticipate it will be a problem.
Plastic is fairly flexible.  Measurements are easy to read.  Very much like the ones used in hospitals I worked at from 1985-2002.
Returned, as lab tests turned out better.  Book looked pretty comprehensive just eyeballing it.

My dog like this stuff.  She's had some ups and downs lately, and with bilious vomiting syndrome (she pukes if she does NOT eat often enough), it's important that she eats a few times a day.  This at least gets her attention.

My dog likes it.  I use it to coax her to eat.  She's an odd-ball, and will vomit if she doesn't eat often enough, even though she has food around and available at all times.  A little of this mixed in with the kibble makes all the difference.

Great to have around for first aid for myself and my dog.  They are individually wrapped, and have enough 'cling' in them to make wrapping easy.  I like the 2 inch size for general first aid around home... If I need something wider, I probably need to get it seen at an urgent care facility.  I've been an RN for 30 years- and this type 'fabric' is the stuff I always preferred when I was working.
Works well, and safer than commercial laundry detergent.  One 'nugget' works on a medium to medium-large load.
Seemed to make my stomach feel bad.  Had some GI issues already, but they were worse on this.  Back to the nasty statin meds.

Super fresh.  Shipped safely in a  box.  Good assortment of flavors.  Perfect for that sweet tooth fix.  Double Bubble is the only brand of bubble gum I buy.  This will be my preferred vendor from now on.  Also got a free pound of popcorn kernels.
It's a chain.  The paint has sealed the clip thingie shut, and I'm still working on that- but once I get that opened up and usable, it will be good.

Nice !  The plastic windows do need to be fit into the inside slots, or the seed falls all over the place, but once they are aligned, it's a great little feeder.  The birds love it, and the chipmunk has trouble getting into it.

My dog is a miniature schnauzer, who is sort of between a medium (she had that when she was spayed at 6 months old), and the large (which she is wearing now after a toe amputation).  The medium fits her neck, but is too short to keep her away from the toe (bandages).  The larger one is a bit big, but keeps her away from the toe.  Both have loops on the inside to put a regular collar in to adjust the fit- which is what made the large one fit.  Without the inner collar (which needs to be purchased separately, or use the normal collar on the dog), she could get the large one over her ears, and off.Easy to blow up once you figure out how to squeeze the inside portion of the "blow up thingie".Both times I've purchased these, I've been pleased- and my fur baby has had something more comfortable to wear while recovering.
Great for mini-muffin and mini-donut pans/batter.  I got the large caps for the batter. The smaller ones would be better for thinner condiments and salad dressings.
Great for mini-muffin and mini-donut pans.  Batter came out evenly (didn't have any nuts or chunky stuff in it).
Very good- no added sugar- just juice and carbonated water with some vitamins.I can't have alcohol because of medications, so this is kind of like my version of a wine spritzer.

Reason for purchase:  GERD, chronic gastritis, (also esophageal spasms, but not purchased for that)Prescription meds used:  Protonix (pantoprazole- most effective, yet still have symptoms), Prilosec (omeprazole- effectiveness 'wore off'), and Dexliant (brand only- got samples; not much help at all), Zantac (ranitidine- made things worse).Other OTC meds used -  Gas-X (simethicone)- helps, but doesn't address the gastritis; Tums- helps, but again, more of a 'bandaid' than solution, papaya enzyme (to help with protein digestion)Effectiveness of Gaviscon Extra Strength tablets- very good.  I could feel the relief within minutes.Taste:  A sort of creamy vanilla- it's not unpleasant.  The gentle 'fizz' is more noticeable than the flavor- but it wasn't hard to get down (on the other hand, I found the Gaviscon Cherry liquid to be very hard to swallow- though would use it if nothing else was around).  I might try the cherry tablets, but if I could only get this flavor, I could reorder and know I'd be able to use them.  The flavor doesn't 'linger' like the cherry liquid did.Overall impression:  Effective, flavor is palatable and doesn't linger.

These are not really  "wide"  (I ordered a 9 W- and that's what I received). I have diabetes, so footwear is really important.  These will NOT  work. I had hoped for something a  wider, as I wear slippers pretty much all day long.  If you wear socks for warmth with your slippers, get at least a  size larger than you normally wear (including width).  These are more like a 8 1/2 M than a 9W, but I can't wear them comfortably (also no socks).  They are flat bottom slippers, with plastic soles, and a knit type material.  They are MADE IN CHINA (might explain why there is a difference in what is considered 'wide').  Not worth returning (shipping would take up too much of the return).  Maybe someone at a thrift store I donate to can use them.
Nice material.  Good assortment of colors (as pictured).  Good to have some socks that aren't my usual dorky white ankle socks.

Got what I wanted- they're sturdy enough for separating items in gift boxes for Operation Christmas Child, to prevent any fragrances or candy from getting into other items.  The part that holds stuff is 4 x 6- the entire bag is longer.
MUCH less expensive than the brand name bags.  They can be cut in half for smaller needs- just seal one end before filling.  Good deal.
Yum !  These are somewhat firmer, and have better flavor, imho, than the regular Fizzers.  I love the sodium bicarb in them, to help settle my stomach.  Much tastier than Alka Seltzer- LOL.

They were very inexpensive, and I got what I paid for.  The 30 out of the 40 that work are fine-  but know ahead of time that the color of the light is definitely what the color of the 'case' is.  Ten didn't work at all (%25 of the order).  They're not worth sending back from a financial standpoint, and I have enough working lights to include in the Operation Christmas Child gift boxes.  Just not thrilled that 10 didn't work.  If you want something that is just for the sake of something fun for a kid to play with in the dark, these are fine.  Just know that you might need to order two 'sets', depending on how many you actually need.

I wasn't sure to think at first, but after a few minutes, they became rather addictive.  The black currant flavor is subtle, and the texture is like an American jujube.  The freshness is great (with an use-by date  2 1/2 years from when I got them).  There is a 'cool' sensation from the sugar alcohols (sorbitol and maltilol).  I usually don't get products with any artificial sweeteners, but the AceK in this is very low on the ingredient list, so there can't be much in there.  I'll probably reorder.
Nice socks- very soft and good stretch.  Colors are vibrant.  They are perfect for having a sock, but not a thick beast of a sock.

Very sturdy and slightly flexible.  I'm hoping that this will alert the lawn guys who take care of the apartment complex grounds from whacking themselves with my bird feeder (killing the last one) with their HEADS ....  Seriously- they're at eye level on a 8 x 8 foot lawn.  It's not like there's much else to see, besides the tree.... Oy.  Anyway, this is exactly what I was looking for :)

I got this set through a different seller, but absolutely LOVE it.  It's a lightweight, so much easier to maneuver with klutzy arthritic hands, and less than stellar arm muscles.  They clean up very easily with some warm water, dish soap, and a paper towel.  Scrambled eggs slide out, grilled cheese get a nice even browning, and anything else I've cooked washes out nicely.  The handles stay cool with the silicone between the end of the handle and the pan itself.  I've gone through some medical issues (most notably chemo, that left me with neuropathy), and haven't cooked much because my old set of hard anodized aluminum pans were just too heavy.  I'm now cooking more, so getting more 'whole' and simple foods.  This was a great buy- not a cheap purchase (I got mine on a payment plan elsewhere), but worth it if I can actually use it and make healthier meals.

I LOVE these pans (I got a set of 2 through a different seller ).  They are lightweight enough for me to lift (a  huge issue), but get the job done with searing meat, scrambling eggs, burgers, homestyle potatoes, etc.  They work like cast iron at a MUCH lighter weight.  The handle stays cool, and it's very easy to clean up- just  a bit of dish soap after the pan cools off, and a gentle sponge or dishrag.  No sticking.  One of the best kitchen items I've ever purchased.

I love these, and can't find them near me in the U.S.  They are sweet, with a tiny bit of tang, but a great level of fizziness- not so much to tickle the nose, but enough to settle my acid reflux.  I used to be able to find these in international stores, but not in the smaller city I live in now.  Nice to have a place to get them !  Shipping also was a month faster than estimate.

Great value on non-GMO canola oil.  Even the shipping was acceptable (flat rate box- I ordered 2 1/2 gallons and they fit in one box).  Organic (the reason I get it is for GMO free canola) is much more expensive per ounce in smaller bottles, without shipping.  This is cold expeller pressed, and contains only canola oil.  I will gladly get Italian oil for the non-GMO aspect of it.  It might seem like the shipping is expensive, but it's a lot cheaper than a plane ticket, and the actual half-gallon (64 oz) is pretty cheap per ounce.  I'll reorder when this gallon runs out (might be a while).

Great to get 24 in a pack to use in Operation Christmas Child gift boxes.  This is basic lip balm, which will be good for kids in all climates.  I've used this brand before- and while it's not fancy, it gets the job done.  I'm sending 2 per box- so the kid can either lube up for a while, or have the chance to give one to a friend.

I have used these lancets for years, and while I can get individual lancets free from my Medicare diabetes supply provider, I pay for these out of pocket because they are that much better.  I use each lancet 2-3 times (they stay sharp enough to not 'grab' or hurt), so each 'drum' is like 10-15 lancets.  They make testing much easier.... it helps to have the drum for clumsy fingers as well.  I have arthritis, and using those individual lancets isn't all that easy.  The drum protects the lancets between uses, and disposing is easier, as the points never see outside of the drum.  They have a 'thing' that pulls up when the drum is removed from the lancing device, preventing reuse.  I still use a sharps container- but I know their secure should they accidentally hit the trash.

Upbeat, zany movie about a male actor who can't get work as a man, who dresses up as a woman and becomes very successful.... but, being a straight guy, it gets complicated when he falls for the lead female costar on the 'soap' he's in.  Then, the female costar's (Jessica Lange- in her glory days) father falls for the female version of the actor, and things get a bit dicey.  Classic retro film.
Lots of nice protein/plant combinations.  Makes it easy to come up with additional ideas with this as a starting point.

PERFECT for Operation Christmas Child boxes- sturdy and well made (edges look sturdy, and like a product I'd buy for myself- not just boxes going to kids who have nothing- I look for nice things for them; not just the most cost effective... they deserve something well made).  I will buy these again, either for myself, or next year's boxes.  There are a few stray strings- but once they are trimmed, they look really nice.

There is definitely a difference between this and Nutella- this has a much more pronounced hazelnut flavor.  The texture is much more like an artisinally ground smooth nut butter (not ultra smooth, but not gritty).  The chocolate flavor is there, but not overpowering.
Really nice pepper flavor- I can see why this are considered the world's best black pepper.  I have a ceramic 'blade' pepper grinder, and keep the rest in a bottle in a dark, cool cabinet.

Nice big tube of toothpaste for Operation Christmas Child boxes, at a great "add- on" price.  These are 8 oz tubes- so 1/2 pound, or 1/2 pint of toothpaste !! Perfect for kids who don't have access to much, and who actually get excited over general and oral hygiene products :)

Great gentle scent, individually boxed for Operation Christmas Child boxes. I will still double bag (to prevent fragrance transfer to toothbrushes and other items), but the scent is much more mild than some floral soaps.  I can detect some of the coconut through the box, but it's not strong.  I think the 10-14 year old girls will like it.
Only product I use for a laundry booster... if I need something whiter, I use bleach, but this is great for colors, and soaking stains out of clothing.

Great flavor- not really a 'swirl' - the nut butters are blended.  Tastes mostly of cashews, not able to detect the macadamia flavor at all.  It does stay soft enough to use straight out of  the fridge.

Interesting.  They're flimsy- but if needed for simple clean-up, they'd be fine.  NOT for heavy-duty scrubbing.  Would work well for straining yogurt or other cooking needs (bouquet garni, spice bundles, etc).  I don't see the benefit for traveling, camping, or a loaded baby's butt- other than they're soft enough for the latter.

This is a short, hot holiday novella. Tess and her twin Hallie has come to their sister and her mates home for the holidays. When she gets there she gets a gift that she wasn't expected... a mate. Patrick, a bear shifter, has come home to see his brother and his mate and when he sees Tess he knows that she is his mate. This is a short complete story with no real conflict and no cliffhanger but it does have a HEA. I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

OMG!!! What a wonderful next part of this exciting saga and the cliffhanger was awesome!!! I love how Tori has taken to being a werebear and how she is coming out of her she'll and willing to do what it takes to be who she is meant to be. Izzy is amazing and what she is willing to do for her family makes me want her to make it as long as she changes the plans that she has set forth. This part was exciting from start to finish and I was so upset that it ended! I want more now.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

This is the second book in this series and features the Rick, the father of the H in book one and Heather, a human that Rick has known since he and his deceased wife knew. This is a great story about an older couple and a second chance at love. Rick has a lot on his mind with his granddaughter having cancer that he hasn't realized how lonely he has been since his wife has died until he sees Heather. Heather is getting over a painful divorce and starting a new job when she sees Rick and remembers the crush she use to have on him when she was younger. What I loved about this story was that they started out as friends and that the slowly feel for each other. This was a hot story especially the scene at the waterfall. I can't wait to read the next book in this series.I received a copy of this book for a honest review.

This is the first book in a new hot shifter series. Kris is a Ranger whose bear is telling him it is time to find a mate and settle down, but he has family problems since his young niece has been diagnosed with cancer. Winnie comes to town looking for photography jobs and overhears Kris and his brother discussing different ideas for a fundraiser. When the idea for a calendar the brothers see that Winnie is a photographer. Kris and his bear realize that Winnie is their mate and must now convince her to take a chance on them.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

Tina is the sister of Ty and Cody and works the ranch with her brothers when you go to their neighbors home to meet the new manager. When she arrives she sees Rick, her ex whom she hasn't seen in years but she still loves him. Rick still loves Tina but he doesn't know her secret so she feels that she needs to stay far away from him, but he has other plans. Rick being back is not her only problem there is a hellhound wandering around and the Twin Moon Ranch and their allies must find and destroy it. This is a standalone with no cliffhanger and has a HEA.I received a copy of this book for a honest review....

I love Anya's writing so I was happy when I saw that she had a new book and not only was it a bear shifter book but also a historical one at that. This is a awesome story but it started off to slow for me and that is why I rated this a 3.5 instead of a 4 or 5. I loved that it took place during Roman times since I love that time period and Gladiators. Erden was an awesome hero and fought hard for his owners and loved his mate Kiya, from afar until she comes to him to let him know the plans that were meant for him. I loved that he fought for her against anyone who stood in his way.I received a copy of this book for a honest review

This is the sixth book for in this series and so far my favorite. Javier is a ghost wolf, or a wolf who has never shifted and Corrine ( love that name) the wolf from book five that has had her heart broken. ( You must read book five to understand my prior statement.) Corrine is struggling to overcome the worse heartbreak that a wolf can have but she is willing to help in bringing down those who have hurt her. Javier is still coming to terms that he has never shifted and never will. These two come together to try to forget their hurt but instead bond over their troubles. Ike that this wasn't a instant love but one born of strength in helping each other. This is a standalone in a continuing storyline with no cliffhanger and a HEA.I received a copy of this book for a honest review.

This is the next book in the series and Zane the lost wolf from the prior books gets his mate. Hallie has come to Angel Rest to work on her thesis but she is meet with a stone wall where no one wants to help her. Zane is still feral but his wolf recognizes Hallie as his and wants to help her. This is a great story that has an HEA , but it also sad when the twist is revealed. I can't wait for the next book in the series.I received a copy of this book for a honest review....

We return to Bearfield to celebrate Halloween. These are two short stories that feature Marcus's son Sebastian and Raven Queen and also Alison's sister Chloe and Donovan, one of the werewolves that Alison saved. Both stories are Hot with a little magic and ghost thrown in. It is beat to read the other stories in this series first to get a better understanding of the characters.I received a copy of this book for a honest review.

Mia has accepted a full ride scholarship to Winter Valley University so she can study werewolves. Ekton is a Chemistry pre- med student who is also one of the Winter Valley Wolves. He know that Mia is his true mate but refuses to tell her since she wants to research the one thing he has to protect. Mia soon learns that she must also protect Ekton and his secret. This is a short story that is a standalone with no cliffhanger and a HEA. I can't wait for Esher's story next.I received a copy of this book for a honest review.

OMG!!! This story is getting better and better. I knew Tori had something to do with the Victor and his clan but he wasn't as bad as most thought he was his mother is/was the evil mastermind. I'm so glad Keith has finally gave in to his attraction to Tori.
