Lucy is starting to become my favorite character, she is so loving and giving especially with how she loves Tori and how she is starting to love her sister and also Annie. I just hope she doesn't get hurt when the secrets of her mates clan comes to light. Tristan loves Annie but I don't think he realizes that she is not going to let him just try and take over her brothers clan even though she is his true mate and he is her alpha. While I do feel sorry for Isabella on how her mate is treating her I don't like how she is using not only Annie but the rest of the clan when all they have done is try to help and include her.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

This is the next book in the Shiftr series and the first about single parents. Lori is the sister Andrea and is returning home with her infant daughter after a bad divorce. Bruno is a single father of a young son who lost his mate in a bad fire. While on route Lori and her daughter are involved in a serious accident that could have ended badly for them if not for Bruno. Lori soon joins Shiftr and learns that Bruno is a 100% match but he doesn't want a mate and tries to let her down easily but in the process he actually hurts her. This is a standalone with no cliffhanger and a HEA.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

Lola has been offered a once in a lifetime opportunity and she is willing to do what it takes. That is until she meets Drax the lead singer of the rock band Roadkill. Drax comes off as an a$$ but Lola still has the hots for him. When Drax fails to show up the band is fired and blackballed by their old manager and Lola steps in to help them. Drax really likes Lola but she doesn't believe he is especially when she sees his ex. Lola is the perfect person for the band since she is able to make them do what she wants and helps them at every turn. Lola's dads are a riot and the love that girl to pieces. Lola at times comes off as immature but Pepper is the perfect BFF and doesn't allow her any slack. Hopefully she will get her own story. This is a standalone with no cliffhanger and HEA.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

Kayla comes home five years after she left because she needed to get away from an abusive ex boyfriend. She is her high school's soccer coach and is glad that her high school crush, Ergan is the boys coach. Ergan has known since high school that Kayla was his true mate but let her go hoping she would return one day. Since she has come back she has done everything to get Ergan to notice her but he seems to back away at every turn so she believes he isn't interested. When Kayla is hurt Ergan comes to her rescue and they slowly become a couple, but when her ex shows up Ergan's secret is revealed. My favorite character is the cranky Warren. This is a standalone with no cliffhanger and a HEA.I received a copy of this book for a honest review

I love Nicole's MC books and this one was is new series so I just had to read it. Meg was a spoiled rich girl until she made a few dumb mistakes and she ended up as a sex slave. When Skin goes to a rundown brothel that is being ran on his MCs territory but being protected by their enemies he runs into Meg who tells him who she is. He leaves her but tells her he will return for her but before that happens she is sold. Skin comes to her rescue but at a price. The pair soon for each other but they must make sure Meg pays for her rescue but the enemy that Meg escaped from wants her back and don't care who stands in their way. While I understand why Meg did some of the things she did I think she should have told her father the truth because he was willing to do anything for her. After the things she was forced to do she still acted like a spoiled naive princess, sneaking out, lying, I was also shocked that her father didn't hire a bodyguard for her. I was kind of shocked at how fast she was able to sleep with Skin after all she had been through plus she didn't really know if he was her savior or not. Skin had his own set of problems and he knows his MC should come first but his attraction to Meg makes that harder for him to remember his priorities. This is a standalone with a HEA.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

Claire is tired of her life in Georgia so she decides to sell her family home and move across the country to be with Argo and Cooper, two Alpha werewolves whom she has been writing to. This Alpha pair know that she is their third in their triad but they haven't quite explained that to her plus the fact that they came back so they can reclaim Argo's pack. This is a fast paced story that is kind of a continuation from the last book where you first meet Argo and get his backstory but don't fear if you haven't read it this book also lets you know what happened from Argo's POV. This is a standalone but you do get to see a lot of the characters from prior books.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

Daryl is the dummer to famous country band, Tennessee Honey. He is a polar bear that needs to be near water since he can't be in the cold but while swimming one night he runs into Matt a bear cub who is runny no away from home. When Matt's mother, Allie, comes looking for him Daryl realizes that he has found his mate. Allie is in the middle of a nasty divorce and custody battle so she doesn't have time to date but she is attracted to Daryl. When she asked him to help her son with his up coming shift this pair is thrown together. This is a short story with no cliffhanger and a HEA.I received a copy of this book for a honest review..

If you have read any of Jessie's Dragon series books or even if you haven't you will fall in love with this full length novel. This time we are back the Lochguard Highland Dragons and we get the story of one of the hot twins of the clan alpha. All Holly wished to do is save her father's life so she volunteered to be a dragon sacrifice and then go home after giving birth. Fraser just wanted to get a peek at the woman who was to be his brother's sacrifice but instead he got a jolt to his system. When he learns that she is his true mate he refuses to hurt his brother and is willing to let her go so not to cause trouble. His dragon has other ideas and sets out to win her over. This is a fast paced story that flies by and you don't want it to end. Of course we get to see our favorite members of both clans and of course the dreaded hunters. This is a full length novel with no cliffhanger and a HEA.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

Josh AKA Long Shot is a MMA fighter who has been fighting illegally for the local crime lord, Frank. Natalie is Josh's stepsister who is not only a doctor but his best friend. This story starts three years before Natalie became a doctor and before Josh got caught up with Frank. When Natalie returns have me to do her residency Josh shows up after being hurt in a fight while she doesn't want to help him she does and soon learns about Frank and gets caught in the middle. Josh has tried to protect Nat from the realities of his life but she is a strong woman and is willing to help the man she loves. This is a step sibling romance but doesn't read as one since their parents were divorced before the story ever started. This is a standalone with no cliffhanger and a HEA. I received a copy of this book for a honest review..

While I purchased this box set I have only read one story so far so I will review the first ne and come back to review the others as I finish them.Prince of Flight ( Birds of Prey) by Mandy Roth... Keonae is a bird prince who left his realm when his mate betrayed him and his people and he was left scared. Lark is a waitress and Keonea's favorite dive bar and becomes friends with him. They are attracted to each other but are both keeping secrets. When his friends and brothers come to visit him he soon learns that Lark is his mate and that she is being chased by his enemies. This is a short story that is standalone but part of a continuing storyline. This is a great series so after reading this book I recommend you go back and read the others in this series

This is the second book in the series and takes place right after the first book. You will get some flashbacks from the first story so beware. Elizabeth Montrose has a PhD and is working with the Army trying to figure out how and why shifters don't get sick and heal faster. She also has a secret she is fighting a rare form of cancer. Martin is a high ranking member of the Sippe and learns that Liz is his mate and he is torn because not only is she sick but he thinks that she is evil. When he finds out that she was trying to help them he is relived but they are still keeping secrets from each other. Those secrets do come to light and they are able to get past them and start to become a family when someone wants them all dead. This story is a standalone with no cliffhanger and a HEA.I received a copy of this book for a honest review..

Aurora Aka Rori wants to get her PhD and to ge it she must go to the Serengeti with Professor Beck. Heath, has been cursed to be a lion shifter after a  poaching incident and he has been hired to be a guide to them. Heath doesn't believe that Rori has what it takes to survive and doesn't want her there she believes it is because of her weight. When they come across a deadly group of poachers they must do what they can to survive. This story was a little slow for me and didn't have a lot of romance it was more story driven and times my mind started to wander and I have to go back and reread some paragraphs. The climax was good but I was left with questions.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

This is the next book in the Hitman Series and features Rafael " Rafe" Mendoza , a mercenary, and Ava, a hand model, who is being used a mule to save her best friends life. Rafe was a tough Alpha when it came to his job but he was a huge wimp when it came to his personal life. Ava seemed as she was the stronger of the two who was willing to do what it took to save her friend's life. The whole thing with Rafe's issue dominated too much of the story and while I can kind of see that what happens in the past can warp your future I think it was a little unrealistic.Rafe is 35 years old and with his job you would think he would have gotten over his problem if he would have just went to counseling. Ava who is no counselor and is younger had more common sense than Rafe does. The main storyline seemed to take a backseat to this and this is why I gave this story a three instead of a four or five.I received a copy of this book for a honest review..

This is the first book in a new series that features wannabe journalist who is actually a baker. Felicity wants a more exciting life and so her wishes come true but her comes a real journalist who wants answers about the billionaire who lives in this small sleepy town. This is a romantic comedy that will leave you in stitches.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

This is not your typical shifter love story and is not for the faint of heart. This is a serial with cliffhangers so beware!!! I didn't really know what to thwear no when I first started reading this book because I'm use to this authors others stories when at least one H is a little softer and more romantic. The Alpha, Erik, in this story will have you loving and hating him all at the same time. The h, Astrid, will have to continue to be strong if she is to survive not only Erik, but also the pack and her circumstances. I can't wait to read the next part.I received a copy of this book for a honest review....

What would you do after you tell your condescending " f you I quit"? Well go visit Shifter Grove, Idaho of course! Keesha does just that. Battle is a bear who is running from his past but after meeting Keesha, his mate, on Sassy Dates he wants to put down roots. He is so excited when he learns she is coming he knows he must find somewhere to live. Keesha doesn't know what she has gotten herself into but she is attracted to Battle and is willing to give him a chance. Battle's past soon catches up to him and he knows he must protect her and she is willing to fight right by his side. This is stand alone with no cliffhanger and has a HEA.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

Mia is sailing with her sister around the world but for now they are in Bonaire working for awhile before continuing their voyage. Mia is working on a boat that takes groups out to go snorkeling what she doesn't expect is to see the man who broke her heart in New York. Ryan is one of NYs finest but he takes leave so that he can find Mia and apologize for hurting her. Mia doesn't want his apology she just wants to be left alone. When she sees something she shouldn't she has to fight for her life since there are bad guys that want her dead. Ryan promises to keep her safe and protect her no matter what. Mia knows that she needs him and is willing to let the past stay in the past and try to start over. This is a fast paced story that may not be long but it has everything you want and need in a romantic suspense story. This is a standalone in a series with no cliffhangers and has a HEA.I received a copy of this book for a honest review.

Ava has her hands full with trying to raise her nephew and trying to go back to school she doesn't have time to date or have a relationship. When formula one driver, Dyson, comes into the Dr.'s office where she works her life starts to change. Dyson loves his life that is filled with racing and women he doesn't want to get involved with a woman that has kids but something about Ava makes him give up his rules. When Ava is hired on as part of their medical staff they are thrown together and sparks keep flying. Dyson is having a hard time on the circuit and he throwing away his chance of being number one. When a tragedy occurs Ava tries to help him and he rejects her attempts to help him. Ava has her own problems in the form of her nephews father. This is the first in a new series but is a standalone with now cliffhangers and has a HEA!I received a copy of this book for a honest review..

Reid AKA Climber and his stepsister, Rebecca have been friends since he moved to town when they were kids and was going to take their relationship further until they learned that their parents had eloped. Years later Becca returns home for the summer before going to grad school. Reid is hiding something from the family and if he is caught he will either be dead or in jail but that isn't his only problem he must try to keep away from Becca. The both thought their time was over when their parents married but you can't stop fate and the love these two have for each other. When a dangerous element comes into their lives Climber must do what he can to save not only himself but Becca and their family.I received a copy of this book for a honest review.

What do you do when you find out that your hot one night stand will soon be your step sibling? Declan and Claire must answer this question and more when they learn that not only will they soon be family but they must also work together. This will cause problems because even though it is taboo they still want each other and are having a hard time staying away from each other. This is not the only problem this couple have they both have to contend with Claire's ex who is obsessed with her and with the client they are suppose to depend who holds bad memories for Claire. Can these two deal with the issues in they life and also be a couple without destroying themselves and those around them?I received a copy of this book for a honest review..

This is a novella that is taking place during the time of the original Riverford Shifters and is a standalone with no cliffhanger and with a HEA! Tori is a rogue lioness that is on the run from those who want to push her for leaving the pride. She is also a trained assassin who refuses to kill. When she is finally found she runs into Nolan Bray who helps her get away but he won't help her past getting her out of town. Tori is grateful for the little help he has given her and in return she gives him some info that will help his Elders in the fight against the lions. When Nolan is attacked by those who are hunting Tori she comes to his rescue. These two star crossed lovers know that many will look down on their relationship but are willing to still be together. The only thing that is missing is we don't get to see how Nolan's friends and family treat the new lovers so it seems more of a HFN.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

Now that all of her secrets are out Kylie must find a way to survive on her own since Hunter has turned his back on her. Hunter realizes his mistake at once but he doesn't know if he should can trust her since most of her kind are lead by the lions. Maxim helps him come to terms with who and what Kylie is and that they will need her help to help them free their families. This is an ongoing series that has a continuous storyline but will feature a different main couple but we have not seen the last of Kylie and Hunter.I received a copy of this book for a honest review....

This is story was a wild roller coaster ride from the very first paragraph to the cliffhanger at the end! Kylie has been keeping a secret from the world and part of that secret is revealed after she is attacked and has to protect herself. Hunter comes upon her and now that her secret is out she has to go into a world where she knows very little and must protect her other secret to make sure no one around her including herself stay safe. Hunter has a few secrets himself and when still don't know what they are. As I said this book was once twist and turn after another and the cliffhanger at the end had me on the edge of my seat. I can't wait to get my hands on the next one.I received a copy of this book for a honest review..

This is the final book in this and Monica is determined to break her link to Jackson and help Henry overcome all his problems with Jackson also. This was a beautiful ending for this couple who had the weight of the world on their shoulders and came together to make sure each of them are healed.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

The Tennessee Honey Band is back and this time twin brothers, Emmett and Everett and after their mate. Trina is a waitress at a BBQ restaurant the band stops at so the can eat and both brother's bears scream mate when they meet her. When the boys save her she agrees to go out on a date with each brother she is smitten with them both. The twins are use to sharing everything including women but it takes a special one to make them want to share her forever. Will Trina be able to handle both bears are will she leave one broken hearted?I received a copy of this book for a honest review..

This is next book in the Werebears of New Hampshire series and is about the couple who started it all Connor and Rebecca. At the end of the last story we found out that Rebecca went back to her ex what we didn't know is why. This story gives us her reasoning and as I kind of understand her reasoning I believed that she should have confronted him. Connor I also thought should have went to her and found out. I did like how he confronted Mark at the end and how Rebecca handled Mark. The ending was perfect especially since we got to see the couple in the future. Hopefully we will get to see Connor's sister get her own HEA.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

Kat is trying for a better life for herself and her little siste after the death of her parents, when a job she applies for falls through she bumps into Billioniare, Blake who gives her an offer she can't refuse. Blake doesn't believe in love and wants Kat at his beck and call for at least six months. This part ends on a cliffhanger and I off to read part two.I received a copy of this book for a honest review.Kat is caught off guard by Blake as this second part starts off as part one ended. Kat agrees to Blake's proposal but she has more stipulations and she will not back down. Blake uses sex to get Kat to agree with what he wants and to take her mind off of things. At times Kat is a big pushover but she is learning to stand up for herself. Will Kat be able to give Blake what he wants without losing herself? This book also ends in a cliffhanger.I received a copy of this book for a honest review.Fiona gives Kat another out if she wants and Kat must decide if she wants to take her up on her offer or will she stay with Blake. In this episode Blake opens up about his past abuse by his father and how it has affected him. Kat knows she is falling for him and her sister is now in on the secret and she is not happy. Meryl, Blake's mother is great and I'm sorry about her illness but she is tough and lovable.kat is confused with what she is feeling and is torn in her quest to have it all without falling in love. This part also ends in a cliffhanger with one more part left.I received a copy of this book for a honest reviewThis was the final episode and it was bittersweet. Kat is days away from her wedding to Blake and she is falling apart. Blake's mother steps in and gives some advice and makes her promise to give Blake a chance. There's some sad moments in this final part, but it was a wonderful ending but I wanted more since I didn't want it to end. Hopefully we will get to hear about Fiona and Lizzy in the future since they paid a major part in their siblings lives.I received a copy of this book for a honest review

This was the final episode and it was bittersweet. Kat is days away from her wedding to Blake and she is falling apart. Blake's mother steps in and gives some advice and makes her promise to give Blake a chance. There's some sad moments in this final part, but it was a wonderful ending but I wanted more since I didn't want it to end. Hopefully we will get to hear about Fiona and Lizzy in the future since they paid a major part in their siblings lives.I received a copy of this book for a honest review.

In this episode Blake opens up about his past abuse by his father and how it has affected him. Kat knows she is falling for him and her sister is now in on the secret and she is not happy. Meryl, Blake's mother is great and I'm sorry about her illness but she is tough and lovable.kat is confused with what she is feeling and is torn in her quest to have it all without falling in love. Kat is caught off guard by Blake as this second part starts off as part one ended. Kat agrees to Blake's proposal but she has more stipulations and she will not back down. Blake uses sex to get Kat to agree with what he wants and to take her mind off of things. At times Kat is a big pushover but she is learning to stand up for herself. Will Kat be able to give Blake what he wants without losing herself? This book also ends in a cliffhanger.I received a copy of this book for a honest review...

This case looks like a matte ruby red. It looks different in person. My camera made it look brighter than it really is. The side view of my picures shows more of a true color. My phone fits tightly, and I like that the two parts (rubber inside/hard outside) do not come apart like many cases.  The S pen comes out smoothly, and the volume and power buttons work just as easily as the phone's. Overall, this is a quality case that doesn't add too much bulk.

These pretzel chips are delicious.  Regular pretzels are a little dry, but these are a perfect for snacking. You can mindlessly eat them more like chips. They are also great with Nutella, but what isn't?

Sinus rinse is a life saver! My whole family has terrible allergies. I hate giving tons of allergy meds to my elementary aged children.  This product helps all of us breathe freely. We have noticed a decline of illnesses too. When we do get sick, with this product,  we are able to shorten our illness time. While it was tricky getting my younger kids acclimated to using this, they have no problems using this every day.

This is a hilarious series ! My older boys are in elementary school,  and they enjoy reading and watching the "Diary of a Wimpy Kid" series. My husband and I laughed out loud. It is nice to be able to watch something without worrying about cuss words or sexual hints. Three movies for $20, you can't beat it!

We have had several models from different brands. We had only fair luck with other models, and we ended up having to glue together a different brand's Millennium Falcon. This model had well constructed parts with easy directions. My 7 year old put this together with no help from me. He is an wiz at Legos but still! The really cool thing about this model is that it has sounds and moving parts while still standing up to play time. I can not say the same about other models. This model is a great addition for any Star Wars fan!

When I first opened this package, I was blown away by the skunk smell. I figured it would help to wash it with soap...it did not.  I ended up having to let it air out in my garage for a day because it made my whole bathroom smell like a skunk. Afterwards, it was fine.As far as it helping with slipping, it does its job. I got it to bathe my 8 month old who was slipping all over prior to this. It did do its job, but it didn't completely drain without moving it. I don't know if any of these bath mats would.Overall,  it does its job, but the strong smell is disconcerting.Update:After three days of airing out and washing it, my whole bathroom/bedroom smells like a skunk. I threw it away.

I wish we could give half stars because this is more of a 3 1/2 star product.  I am not a super technical user. I am your average, everyday consumer, so this review will reflect that.Pros:This has a solid feel. It reminds me of our Samsung laptop but without the back lighted keyboard.It is small enough to throw in a purse or small bag without taking up much room, but it is still big enough to use as a computer, not just a tablet.The fact that it has Word, PowerPoint,  etc. is awesome. You can use the Windows cloud service to save documents or a flash drive.As a mini laptop,  this isn't bad. If you are thinking about getting a Chromebook,  this may be an attractive alternative since it has a scaled down version of Microsoft Office.Cons:As a tablet, this stinks. It is not intuitive.  When typing, you have to click the button to pull up the keyboard and put it away. No clicking on a search engine and the keyboard automatically popping up. This may not seem like a big deal, but try going without this feature for awhile...The apps available are slim. Microsoft only allows you to use their app store, so a lot of your favorite apps will not be available.The touch response on the tablet is not as good as others. I often had to click multiple times to get it to respond.The processing time was a little longer than my son's 7 inch Samsung tablet.Overall, if you want a small laptop for work or school that has the Windows suite, this is pretty good.  If you want a tablet for games and apps with the occasional need for a keyboard,  keep looking.The photo compares it to my son's 7 inch Samsung tab

My 8 year old was over the moon when I opened this package. The sheer size of this toy makes it exciting. When we finally got it out and played with it,  he couldn't stop thanking me.The Transformer's arms move in robot mode.  The eyes light up blue when you press the Transformer button, and it says several phrases.  It easily goes in car mode, and it does roll. It has a little scraping noise because of how the legs are made, but I didn't see any scratches on my floor. It seems well made. There are not a lot of parts, so it should hold up well.The Transformer app is pretty fun on its own, and scanning your toy just makes it feel cooler. You get more tokens by scanning it, but I could not tell any other difference by scanning it.Overall,  the sheer size of this toy adds to the joy your Transformer fan will feel by playing with this. My son played with it for three hours straight after receiving it. That is a successful toy!

When I first tried this product, I was concerned.  It felt oily to the touch. I was happily suprised that it did not look oily on my face. I have very oily skin that is prone to break out, so I am very cautious about what makeup I wear. This glides on easily and covers just as well as heavier foundation. Overall,  I am very impressed. It is hard to find a good oil free base makeup, but this is a good one. My cheap side shudders at the cost, but if you are accustomed to buying non drug store makeup, you will like this one. It is a good matte makeup that doesn't look chalky on your face.UPDATEDAfter a week or so of wearing this, I have to delete a star and make this 4 stars. The makeup still looks good, but it stays oily feeling on your face.  It still doesn't look shiny, but I don't like to brush a hand against my face and feel like an oil slick.

I thought these earrings would be a lovely deep purple. Instead, they are almost black in natural light. They are a pretty design, and the size is good. The color was just a little off. They are opaque,  not a sparkly gem.  If this doesn't bother you, they are well designed earrings.

These underwear are very comfortable.  The material reminds me of a thin pair of basketball shorts. The idea of air holes all over is neat, but I don't think it actually does anything.  They are thin and light, so they aren't hot. The fit is pretty conservative and does not ride up into places it is not supposed to go. My only complaint is that they run a smidge big. Even though they are too big, they still work, and they are my new favorite underwear.

I have a confession to make.  I rarely floss.  I know I should, but it rarely happens. I also have never used an electric toothbrush.  In today's world, I know that seems crazy. When this toothbrush came up on Vine, I jumped on the idea of trying it.I love it!  The power is a little overwhelming,  but after I used the brush with longer bristles,  I felt like I had a dentist cleaning! It is fantastic. I had an initial naive moment where I turned on the toothbrush before I had it in my mouth : toothpaste everywhere.  My bad...Now that I know how to use it, it would be hard to go back. It is obviously superior to a standard toothbrush.  Why only 4 stars? I am very budget minded. This is a big chunck of change for a toothbrush.  If you can swing it, it is well worth the investment.  I am thinking of getting one for my boys because I know they will have clean teeth with little effort; like a lot if little kids, they are not known for their brushing prowess.Overall,  if you are on the fence about getting this, hop off and buy it now!

Let me preface this by saying that I have been exclusively breastfeeding for the past 6 months. Unfortunately,  my baby still gets up to nurse about 3 times a night. I nurse him while lying down, and then I put him back in his crib.I had been using Pampers Swaddlers for months with occasional night time leakage while nursing in bed. That was annoying, but it didn't happen but about once a week. After awhile, Swaddlers were not fitting well, so I bought the same size in Cruisers. ( Yes, I followed the size suggestion)The first 5 nights wearing them, he leaked out of them every night! Furious,  I decided to try Luvs at night. Imagine my amazement when they did not leak! After I use all of these Pampers,  I will be switching to Luvs.

My husband has used a traditional tower charcoal smoker and a different electric smoker in the past. They got the job done, but they had their flaws. This smoker is fantastic!With just a little handful of wood chips and water, my husband was able to perfectly smoke six Cornish hens in about two hours and forty minutes. The built in thermometer didn't give us any trouble. The meat was done and extremely juicy.  The only down side is that it takes about 40 minutes to preheat. If you think about your prep time with charcoal,  it probably evens out. The glass front is great. I loved seeing the progress. Overall, this smoker is easy to use and produces the most moist meat I have eaten. I can't wait to try smoking other things.

My five month old baby can obviously not stand yet, but he loves to sit up and play with this toy.  He is just now starting to prefer toys that make noises.  This table has six different activities, all but one making noise.  It is well made with bright colors and lights that capture his attention.  Right now, I hold his waist for support while he leans over and plays with everything. It is almost too big to hold upright while he plays with it in my lap, but I make it work. I can see this becoming a favorite toy once he crawls and walks.  As far a s lasting power, this toy is a good investment.  The fact that it also talks in Spanish as well as English will appeal to some people and adds an extra "neat" factor.  Overall, I am very pleased with this interactive toy.

I have three different bath mats in my house, and  this one is smaller than them all. It is soft, but the small size negates that pisitive. It also is slippery. Overall,  I was underwhelmed by this bath mat.

This starter set has everything you need to set up your crib. If you are starting from scratch, this is a good deal. The fitted sheets are thin but soft. If you don't mind about seeing through it a little, this won't bother you. I love the little thermal blankets. They feel like long underwear,  and we use them as swaddling blankets. The crib protector is not the best fitting, but it will do the job. It also has a loose protector sheet you can use on a changing table or bed when you change diapers. Overall, this is a good set for first time parents. It is not high quality, but it is fairly inexpensive for everything you get.

These blocks are bright and colorful. They are easy to stack, but you really don't get much for your money. There are similar blocks from other companies with more blocks for the same price. The stickers aren't very practical either since babies are sure to chew on them. They are easy to stack though.  I don't dislike these blocks, but I would not seek them out either. ( When reviewed,  this set was $16.99)

This Barbie house has everything you can imagine. It took about an hour to put together,  and it is amazingly sturdy. You can actually pick it up to move it without damaging the house. I wouldn't  do it often, but it can be done.The sound feature that is used for a vanity, aquarium,  grill, fan, etc. is really cool , but you have to move it around and decide which sound you want right then. This isn't a problem,  but it would be nice to have more sound features at once. The size is large. If you have a small space, I doubtyou will be looking for a Dreamhouse anyways. Barbie houses have been huge since I was a kidThe price may seem high, but with all the accessories, it is worth it. I can see this toy being something that you eventually put in the attic to save for the grand kids.

You are paying for the Ford branding on these pliers. These are not precision tools that open smoothly. They feel clumsy when you are trying to do more intricate work.  If you are buying these for the branding, fine. If you want high quality tools, these are not it.

My family loves this game.  We played it twice in one night.  My children are on the younger side, but they were still able to play and understand the rules.  My husband was in charge of the electronic banking system, and that seemed to work well for us.  The first time we played, it did take us a while to learn how to use the banking system and learn all the rules, but  the instructions were very plain and direct.  Any questions that we had, the instructions answered.  Overall, this game was great!  My only complaint is that the box is made of very thin cardboard.  I am not sure about the longevity of it, but this is a very small complaint.

It is always refreshing to read something completely different from everything else on the market, and this novel fits the bill.  The idea of jinni in this novel is so unique.  In my mind, I want to conquer up the genie from Aladdin, but the complex world of these jinni are completely different.  At the beginning of the novel, the author lists the different types of jinni and their powers.  This was helpful in setting up the world building.  It was a little complex at first, but you are so quickly sucked in that it fleshes out rather quickly.Our heroine is a strong woman who is still caring and sensitive after all the things she has been through.  She never got on my nerves or seemed whiny with her circumstance.  Our hero is strong both physically and mentally.  He is young to be the leader of a rebellious movement, but with his life experiences, it seems logical that he could do it.  There are several "bad" guys in this novel, and one of the aspects that I love the most about this novel is the complex way the author presents Malek, the heroine's master.  We are supposed to hate him and have a small soft spot for him at the same time.  I did.... I am a sucker for anti-heroes, and Malek fits the bill.  He clearly has feelings for our heroine, but he just doesn't know how to be a "normal", good man.This was a very addicting read.  I started it early one night, and I finished it a few hours later.  I devoured it.  If you are a fan of darker romances, you will enjoy this novel.  This is marketed as a Young Adult novel, but I believe it is just as satisfying of a read for adults.  As far as teens go, there are some dark, violent, scenes.  There is also bad language.  I do not think young teens should read this book, but that is up to the parent.Overall, I loved this book, and I can't wait for the next installation.

We actually have all the Kindergarten and 1st grade books at our house.  My eldest son is going into the second grade, but I wanted to keep him fresh during the summer months.  This was a great review for him.  The start of the book was pretty basic for him, but it was still good for him to remember all those terms that he will be using in class soon.  My youngest is going into Kindergarten, and he was able to do a lot of the Kindergarten aged books.  When they started getting into writing whole sentences, he did struggle a little.My boys love Star Wars, so this was a great series that motivated my boys to want to work.  My youngest wanted to do his "work" off and on all day.  If you are not a Star Wars fan, you may have a few issues with name pronunciations and fill in the blanks.  Other than that, this is a great series of workbooks.

I like to prepare for multiple scenarios.  Tornadoes are a huge worry where I live, and I also like the idea of being prepared in the event of a disaster of any kind.  This small, handy radio gives me a small sense of security.  This can fit in any backpack along with other emergency gear, and the long list of features for the price is second to none.  The crank is a little cumbersome, but because of its size, that is understandable.  The light is bright and long lasting.  I haven't tried the cell phone charger, but the specifications state that 10 minutes or so of cranking can allow for a short emergency call.  From my experience, cranking is definitely the faster, more efficient way of charging this device.  If you have left it run dead and need this device, you will want more immediate results anyways.Overall, if you are looking for an emergency radio/light/charger, this is a great one to just throw in a bag or have ready when bad weather strikes.

This Transformer will appeal mainly to the younger kids with its sounds and easy transformation.  If your child is older than seven, I think you should look into some of the more complex Transformer toys.  The transformation is not that awe inspiring, but it is easy enough for little hands to do it.  This toy didn't keep my kids hugely occupied, but they occasionally pick it up to play with it.  Overall, this is a fairly solid toy for the Transformer fan.

I LOVE Contigo cups.  We have several in our house all the way from kids, travel mugs, and straw cups.  These stainless steel cups keep things hot or cold for hours.  They never leak, and they are a breeze to clean.  These cups will keep coffee hot three hours or more, in my experience.  My husband travels for his work, and he sips on his coffee for hours in these cups. The SnapSeal kind of travel mugs are not quite as easy to one hand operate as the Autoseal kind., in my opinion.  The Autoseal you simply press down a button while drinking.  The SnapSeal has you snap part of the top open to drink and snap closed to keep from spilling.  It is really a matter of preference, but you can't go wrong either way.  While they are a little expensive, you get what you pay for.  You won't be disappointed.

This is a good historical novel. Many people do not like a SUPER clean romance. There is only kissing here, so be aware. The characters were well developed, and the setting was believable. I loved our hero, and our heroine was never annoying.Only one thing bugged me. I really wanted our hero and heroine to have some time together after they decide to be together. By the time they do, the story is almost over. This is still a good read.

If you are an avid hunter, or even not, this Realtree driver will make you happy.  The style of the driver is not overly ostentatious and bright, yet it definitely has a hunter feel.  The lightweight construction makes for great handling and long drives.  The price is a great selling point.  It may not be the Callaway brand name, but at over half the price, you can't go wrong.My husband didn't notice any huge changes to his golf game, but he did say that it performed well.  His drives were spot on what they always are.If you are in the market for a reasonably priced driver, this one is a great choice.

This nursing pillow has many cool features.  The duel sides offers a soft side for nursing and a firm side for when your baby gets older for spoon feedings.  It also has a new feature since I first started having kids, vibration.  This vibration disk emits a gentle vibration that is not over powering.  The disk goes in the middle of the pillow.  The only problem that I have with this is the fact that you have to unzip and put your hand in the pillow to turn the feature on and off.  This isn't a huge deal, but it is a little annoying.  It also takes a lesson than common battery, C.  Again, this isn't a huge deal, but a lot of people do not have this type of battery in their battery/junk drawer.  It also is a little snug, but that aspect can be considered good or bad depending on how you look at it.Overall, this is a good, quality nursing pillow.  The unisex pattern and colors is also a plus in my book.  If vibration is important to you, this is worth the extra money.  If you don't care one way or the other, I would stick with their basic nursing pillows.

I hate having to iron place mates, so I was excited about these bamboo ones.  They are very appealing to look at, and I LOVE that they instantly lay flat with no dreaded curling corners.  What I was not happy with was the durability.  I have two small boys, and they spilled on these the first day.  They tried to "help" Mommy clean them and almost broke one of the bamboo pieces in the process.  These are a lovely set to use, but be mindful if you have kids who still tend to make messes daily.

Decent for the price, but overall I didn't like these too much. Even the smallest size earpiece hurt my ears a little, I found the buttons hard to press/annoying, and the size of these makes it annoying to even open up the dust cover to recharge them. If you're not picky, these will get the job done, though.Good:+ Good price for the features you get+ Decent unobtrusive looks; although a bit big and the 2 loops on top stick up too far for my tastes+ Built-in rechargeable battery+ Calling feature seemed to work well and I was heard fine on the other side+ Decent sound quality+ Nicely designed packaging and helpful instructionsBad: Hurts my ears a bit after a while (but may vary person to person), saw no use for that loop thing Glossy parts show lots of smudgy fingerprints Flat cord gets caught on clothes and is stiff/annoying. Had to hang it under my chin instead of behind head because my shirt kept pulling on the unit Sound quality is not amazing, but decent for headphones of this price Mic quality not great but passable Awkward to press buttons (especially while wearing them... you'll end up basically pushing these into your ear just to push a button on the earpiece) Not so good battery life; I used them for about 1-2 hours and on the 3rd use had to recharge. Probably because these can only house a small battery Semi annoying voice prompts (that I never hear because I had to take them off to power on/off, etc)Note: this product was provided to me in exchange for a review, but I review honestly. I'm not a fan of cheap crap, so if a product sucks, I'll definitely say so!

Decent LED headlamp for the budget-conscious, but definitely not a design statement. I guess it doesn't matter if you're in the dark, though, right?Good:+ Lights up things in front of you+ Good price for a standard headlamp+ Useful to keep your hands free either on a camping trip, power outage, or just general home work+ 4 modes: Off, Bright, Low, Flash+ Adjustable to fit small heads or large domesBad: Not very cool looking, basic/boring design that doesn't look modern I wish it didn't say Wolverine all over the straps (but at least it's in muted colors) Annoying that it takes 3 AAA batteries which I usually don't have many of; 2 AAs (always seem to have them!) or a built-in rechargeable would be nicerNote: this product was provided to me in exchange for a review, but I review honestly. Great LEDs, cheap, and fit into our chandelier perfectly. Keep in mind, they are smaller than typical incandescent candelabra bulbs. Turn on instantly and work well with the dimmer switch. The only negative is they look kind of lame, so if you have a chandelier where these are visible, don't expect to impress any visitors! Other than that, they are what you'd expect and good value for the money.Note: this product was provided to me in exchange for a review, but I review honestly. I'm not a fan of cheap crap, so if a product sucks, I'll definitely say so!

1:19 Mins Impressive for the price, overall nice set of headphones, but don't expect to be blown away by sound quality. Nice for a budget gaming headphone, but not comparable to higher quality headphones at all. If you're not picky about sound/mic, you'll likely be pretty happy with these. Worked easily on my Mac after going into system prefs, sound, then selecting USB device as the output.Good:+ Good price for the features you get+ Decent looks; although a bit big and the 2 loops on top stick up too far for my tastes+ Cool features, many of which can be turned on/off+ Mic can be folded up and hidden+ Covers my entire ear and overall decently comfortable+ Nicely designed packaging and helpful instructionsBad: Hurts my head a bit after a while, but may vary person to person (I have a small head plus usually wear glasses) Glossy parts show lots of smudgy fingerprints Sound quality is not amazing, but tolerable/expected in cans this price (almost nonexistent bass, overall sound lifeless) Mic quality not great but passable Not a fan of the vibration feature (made my ear drums tickle, pretty annoying!)Note: this product was provided to me in exchange for a review, but I review honestly. Great value here, and super easy to swap out (at least in my vehicle). This fit perfectly in my '13 Mazda CX-5; just open the glove box, push the box hinges inward and pull down to reveal the filter. Pull out old, put in the new... close the box. This was also much cheaper than genuine OEM parts, so I couldn't be happier all around.

0:34 Mins Decent pencils, but definitely not professional grade. These are not quite as smooth/buttery going onto paper nor as vibrant as a nice set of Prismacolors. Still, these are clearly more cost efficient and will probably get most jobs done. I will update my review once I have had more time to use them on my actual artwork instead of just random test doodling.Good:+ Good value+ Somewhat strong lead that don't break too easily+ Good assortment of colors+ Great starter set for beginners who want to experiment with pencil art+ Seem to sharpen easily; haven't had many broken tips+ May be good or bad, but each pencil has a colored back end to tell them apart easily (but no color name on the pencil)Bad: Harder lead is good for less breakage, but you have to press a little harder and color doesn't go down as smooth Colors not as vibrant as nicer, higher quality pencils (ie, the silver looks gray like other reviewers have mentioned)Note: this product was provided to me in exchange for a review, but I review honestly. Overall, these do what they need to if you don't have a lot of heavy cables. Too much weight, and they're likely to unstick themselves and become useless (the foam adhesive underneath rips and becomes useless). I had one fall off on its own with not too many cords, but then others haven't. Cords are fairly easy to pop in and out and each slot easily accommodates cords about 1/4" thick (which goes back to the too much weight issue, though). My other issue is the colors are mostly kind of goofy, but at least these cable clips are usually hidden (which makes me wonder, why make them different colors at all?). It might make sense if they were kids toys, or if you stick two together and let your cat swat it around. I wish they came in plain colored black/white packs, but just for hidden utility these colors work. Anyway, so far mostly good for hidden light duty jobs.Note: this product was provided to me as a promotion in exchange for an honest review, but I review honestly. I'm not a fan of cheap crap, so I'm picky and if a product sucks, I'll definitely say so!

This is a pretty delicious coconut water and it has no added sugar. I have found some coconut waters taste a little bit better because of added sugar but it's more healthy to have none. Not quite as bad as getting used to drinking coffee without sugar, but if you have a crazy sweet tooth give this some time. The coconut flavor is light and subtle but flavorful enough and refreshing. Solid healthy drink choice if you hate water, but keep in mind it still has 80 calories per pint. So far I haven't run into the sour/bad batches that 1star reviews mentioned, but I've only drank 2 cartons so far.Although not as cheap, I definitely recommend buying this organic coconut water instead of from some dude on a Cancun beach who hacks open a warm coconut with a rusty machete then puts a straw in it.Note: this product was provided to me in exchange for a review, but I review honestly. I'm not a fan of cheap crap, so if a product sucks, I'll definitely say so!

Not much that makes it stand apart from other Google Cardboard products, which isn't a big deal. It is what it is. Overall happy with this, although the on-box directions could be a bit more clear. Also, recommend using a larger phone like iPhone 6, since my 5S was a bit too small and was short by an inch so it bounced around inside. Besides that, my only negative was opening the box... manufacturing defect in the tear off strip made opening it a little annoying.Worth the price, though, for an intro to basic Virtual Reality using miscellaneous apps that are out there. This is a vehicle to those apps, which vary from simplicity like interactive Google Street View so more creative uses of the technology. Don't expect anything crazy, though, this isn't a high end VR goggle like Oculus. :) Great starter though if you are curious, and won't break the bank! Recommended.Note: this product was provided to me at a discount in exchange for a review, but I review honestly. If a product sucks, I'll say so. :)

A good, safe trainer. Overall seems like a nice product, but as with many pet products your results may vary. Different dogs/cats/personalities may react differently to this thing so you won't know until you try.Good:+ No option to shock, which is more humane.+ Has two options: loud beeps and multiple vibrate intensities so it essentially gets the same training results.+ Remote is a good size, and simple to use+ Collar startles your pet to tell them they just did something wrong, instead of hurting them+ Waterproof feature is wonderful for pool training and at the beach+ Collars have shorter prongs, you don't need to make skin contact.+ The beep is loud and clear and the vibration is enough to startle your pet straight/scream "stop chewing that shoe!"+ Rechargeable batteries for both collars and remotes make charging them easy via USB+ Batteries seem to last a whileBad: Range seemed good, but may be spotty if you have a really large yard (cannot test)Note: this product was provided to me at a discount in exchange for a review, but I review honestly. If a product sucks, I'll say so. :)

Oprah agrees; nothing beats a Menorah artistically handcrafted using the subtle shapes of intertwining bread penii. Great buttery flavor, texture, and purposefully stale, this bread is great for celebrating Chanukah or even your son's Bris. Tis a pricy loaf, but once you wrap your hands around it you'll see why. With shafts of varying girths, it's sure to please everyone in your family from your frisky uncle to even the hard-to-satisfy Grandma. Be warned, though... this bread is circumcised but not Kosher. Still, three thumbs way up!

Very nice sunglasses, much better than the usual $5-10 sunglasses I usually end up buying randomly on vacation or at the mall. Quality-wise, I love these... but still deciding if I love how they look on my face. It will depend on your personal preference; I would remove a star because I don't love the look (the look a little too much like lady's glasses to me), but it's just my opinion. I'll adjust my review if these break or something, but so far these are recommended if you like the style.The Good:+ Nice quality; feels nice/premium+ Nicely packaged; comes with a handy case, soft slip case, and cloth wipe+ Blocks out all the necessary sun rays while still being able to see clearly+ Classy look, although not for everyone, and thankfully has no goofy design accents like many sunglasses doThe Bad: Design is standard, but styled different enough where some people may not like them (I'm personally a simple RayBan style kind of guy). Nice item. Well packaged (for cheaper Chinese-made stuff), included remote, 5 ports, and a low profile look that is easy to fit into your setup. Then I started using it. The first few minutes I was sold; remote worked well and switching inputs was surprisingly fast. Even the automatic input switch was quite nice, since all you had to do was turn on another device and it switched to that by itself. For the price, this unit seems  great. Just before if you happen to get the older defective run/model that had a white remote, be ready to return it on the chance it's a bad one. I wasn't so lucky with mine, but the seller was very communicative about fixing the problem and getting me a replacement quickly.Received a free replacement with the latest model, and works well so far. I'll update if anything changes.Note: this product was provided to me free in exchange for a review, but I review honestly. If a product sucks, I'll say so. :)

Nice item. If you like the look of this from the pics, and are good with the price, I recommend. The watch portion is removable as well (attaches/detaches with a magnet), so you could always fit another iPad here or use the indentation from the watch stand to put rings, jewelry, stack of condoms, other watches, whatever. Overall nice pair of pruning shears. Quality is not 100%, though, as a nicer product like Fiskars. I noticed small defects in molding such as rough edges in the rubber handle, the brand name sticker was put in the wrong place, and the hole at the base of the handle was imperfect and partially filled in. Thankfully, these blemishes don't get in the way (yet) of the utility aspect of these. So far, they cut nicely because of the sharp blades. Keep in mind, the ratchet function is good but doesn't work miracles. For larger branches, you will still need good hand strength.So far, they seem to have plenty of leverage to cut through what you'd expect for shears of this size. Recommended as of now, since they seem to be decent quality. I'd check a Home Depot or something, first, though as personally I'm not sure these are worth $20. The price combined with the little nitpicky imperfections knock it down a star. Utility-wise, though, 5 stars.UPDATE 11/2/15: Used these outside trimming trees for a solid half hour, and they held up well. Ratchet function works well and I was able to cut some pine branches that were 3/4" to 1" thick. Keep in mind, it's possible but it takes still quite a bit of hand strength!Note: this product was provided to me free in exchange for a review, but I review honestly. If a product sucks, I'll say so. :)

Overall: I question whether this product is really even necessary. If you have a speakerphone feature on your phone, it's basically the same thing (except this clips to your visor, and you can feel for the button instead of looking for your phone and taking eyes off the road. It works well enough, and fairly simple to use. If you are picky with your electronics like I am, I'd spend a little more to get something nicer. On a strictly 'get the job done' basis, this'll do ya just fine. I removed one star for overall quality, but I can't really knock because it does what it is supposed to. If you want something louder, more versatile, there are plenty of options out there. I'll update my review if it proves not to stand the test of time or if other issues come up.The Good:+ Decent packaging+ Small form factor and unobtrusive+ Fits and mounts easily to your visor with provided clip and magnet+ Pairs very easily with your phone over bluetooth; connected to my iPhone without issue in less than a minute+ Good price if you're looking for a lower end product with decent capabilities+ So far battery life seems to last as advertisedThe Bad: Feels cheap, buttons feel cheap and clicky (but expected for this price point) Volume on the unit is not very loud Can pause/play music on your phone, which I found to be strange and pointless (and sometimes annoying)Note: this product was provided to me free in exchange for a review, but I review honestly. If a product sucks, I'll say so. :)

I have ADD/ADHD/whatever you want to call it... and this book helped, sort of. The problem was, it had good ideas, but most of what I read in here I had learned on my own while dealing with my ADHD. One example; a tip they give you is to leave items out to help you remember in the morning. Like put your keys on the kitchen table so you remember it in the morning, etc. It's just common sense when you have these types of scattered thoughts and issues. My main problem with this book is the writing is so simple that after a while, I found it borderline offensive. They probably thought, "these simpletons need small words, big font sizes, and the information repeated multiple times or they'll go running off towards something shiny."  It seems like the authors are so out of touch that they felt the need to address the reader like a child. Even the book itself is large, with large fonts as if designed for a senior citizen. Thanks for the extra legibility, but my eyes are fine.Bottom line: The book DOES indeed have many helpful tips on how to organize your life, but it's described in a simple, overly drawn out way. If you're really having trouble, and looking for kind of a beginners guide, the book may help you with the basics. Personally, as a moderately ADD-affected guy, I found it irritating and mostly speaking to common sense. Who knows, though, maybe I don't quite fit the audience they were going for.

Pretty much just vitamins, if maybe more specifically developed. I have tried these a few times after a night or two of wine drinking. They seem to work well enough. Don't expect a miracle though... the directions specifically say to take with a large glass of water, which in itself helps avoid a hangover. I'm pretty sensitive to getting hangovers as I've gotten older, and I did notice a difference after taking these (although nothing drastic). The directions say to take 2 at a time, and each gel cap is light and medium sized, so if you have trouble taking pills these may be slightly hard to get down. I had no problems, though.I'd recommend giving them a shot, but clearly not a necessity. Try a multivitamin and a glass of water before you drunkenly go to sleep and it will likely do the same thing. Sidenote: expect your morning pee to look like you swallowed a yellow highlighter.*I was sent this product at a discount in exchange for a review (but I always keep my reviews honest... if a product sucks, it sucks! :)

Very nice quality sleeves... I can't test them myself, but judging by the thickness of the sleeves and the foil/metal lining that each has, they are legit. Each sleeve fits about 2 credit cards, big sleeve will fit a passport (make sure to put your passport in chip first to be safe... with US passports, you can see the chip on the bottom of the front cover). The credit card size fits fine in a wallet, and has a smooth, soft touch outside that's quite nice. My only thought is that if you carry a bunch of credit cards, you may want to invest in an RFID secure wallet instead of individual sleeves. I can see these being annoying to take different cards in and out on a trip if you need one sleeve for each card. Overall though, great quality, unfortunately useful in this day and age, and a good deal for the budget conscious.*I was sent this product at a discount in exchange for a review (but I always keep my reviews honest... if a product sucks, it sucks! :)
