My first thought when I came across this product was, 'psh, why in the hell would you want to sleep in a coffin... you're not a vampire.' Then one night after the bar, I made a drunken purchase and blew all my gift cards on this bed. This is where my story begins.The coffin was waiting on my front porch when I woke up the next afternoon, as if my purchase was predetermined. I decided I should return it, so I left it on the porch until I could follow the usual Amazon return process with UPS pick up. There it stayed for the remainder of the day, until something unexpected happened late that night. I was having trouble sleeping, so I wandered downstairs for a little midnight snack. While stumbling through the dark, I slammed my shin hard into what I thought was our coffee table, and fell to the floor with a groan. I flicked on the lights to find the Nicodemus Coffin Bed leaning seductively against the living room wall, spread wide open to reveal it's enticing velvety red interior. I could have sworn the wrinkles in the fabric winked at me, but I blinked once and never saw it again. The smell of pine, freshly glued velvet, and black lacquer was strangely inviting. After re-reading all the 5 star reviews, I reconsidered my purchase and was confident this would be the best night of sleep I'd ever experience. How wrong I was.I laid in the coffin, closed the lid, and instinctively crossed my arms over my chest. The cozy padding enveloped my body like a sea of the finest Amish quilts, and I comfortably drifted off to sleep in seconds. I awoke in a panic not too long after, struggling to breathe. I realized that I was running out of air and partially hallucinating from choking on an hour's worth of sleep farts. I clawed frantically at the coffin's interior, and surprisingly a secret panel slid open in the siding. I felt a large button (which said 'kablamo', according to the braille beneath it), and pressed it. A whoosh of fresh air burst into the coffin as an LED operational display lit up in front of me on the backside of the lid. I felt great relief, both for the fresh air and also because the screen was HD with luscious pixel density running the latest iOS 8. After I turned on the 'reduce motion' setting to prevent vomiting, I explored my in-coffin options. There was the usual unnecessary apps like iBooks and Apple Maps, but one in particular caught my attention. The icon was a stylized image of Spock's face with the name "BeaMeUp". Of course I tapped it.It forced me to sign up through Facebook, which was annoying, but at least it was one less password for me to remember. After logging in, I came to a screen that said Beam Locations. I was still a little confused, so I clicked the only one available named Warehouse. Within seconds, the coffin went black and I felt like I was in Disney World riding Space Mountain. Thirty seconds later, the movement stopped. I hesitantly peaked out of the lid to see owls flying everywhere, holding boxes of varying sizes. I looked around cautiously, and judging by all the logos, I was in Amazon's warehouse. I was about 2 stories up on a shelf, with security robots searching everywhere with flashlights. I knew I shouldn't be here, so I quickly navigated the app's simple yet boring interface to take me home. After a few finger taps and a quick ride, I was back in my living room. What a rush. I was blown away by the possibilities, that I immediately ordered another Nicodemus Coffin Bed before finally going to sleep.Since that day months ago, I have saved an inexplicable amount of money on my daily commute as well as a vacation to Australia. By simply placing the second coffin in another location (or shipping it to another country to save on airfare), I not only save money but also a lot of time. I have yet to fully research it, but I think it is also much more environmentally friendly than a Prius and the rechargeable battery on The Nicodemus lasts about 2 weeks before recharging. My commute is now approximately 1 minute each day, which frees up lots of time for me to sleep or write Amazon reviews. My only negative is that the interior is not removable or machine washable. This is a big deal for me, since I routinely sleep nude and it's a real hassle to lug this thing to the dry cleaner.After the initial buyer's remorse, I highly recommend blowing a full paycheck on this product. Well worth it, you will not be disappointed!

I'm not really qualified to start critiquing musical aspects of this album, so my review will be short and non-technical. As a long-time Bodyjar fan who owns all their albums, I was pretty excited when I heard this was coming out. They've always been catchy, fun, and consistently delivered enjoyable music. This album is no exception, however, it did take me a few listens to latch onto it. It's still same-ish formula, but seems more mature and less poppy than How It Works. Anyway, if you're a fan, you'll love it (even if you are unimpressed at first, it will grab you the second time around).Favorite tracks: Role Model, Stranglehold, If This is It

It's sturdy, grippable, and seems to do a good job with 'panning for gold'. I use Feline Pine, which starts out as larger pellets then becomes more like sawdust as it gets used (recommend this litter too). This scoop works well with either state of that particular litter, and depending on what angle you hold it can either sift or remove the unwanted litter. The holes in it are on the larger side, but I think it would work well for clumping litters as well. Overall, for such a simple item, it does a good job and seems like it will last a couple years without breaking. Also, it seems to resist turds and such from clinging to it, keeping it looking less gross looking than my previous dollar store scoop. So far, it has put up with a lot of s*** and remained decent. I have not regretted this purchase, and I doubt anyone would. My only worry is that it's so beautifully designed, someone may break in to burgle it.

In these times of extreme busyness, you can't help but get frustrated sometimes and think "there's just not enough time in the day!" With this item, your capacity to "get s*** done" is increased exponentially.PROs:* Get s*** done* Colors are not only pleasing to the eye, but scientifically proven to encourage productivity and movements* No need to flush, built-in incinerator removes waste after motion sensors detect your absence* Small enough that you can leave your iPad installed and just carry the whole thing with you* Can download a free bidet app (although after the trial period, you have to pay for it with an in-app purchase)* Installing your iPad doesn't cover up the camera lens, for easier multi-tasking (Skyping and wiping?)* Seat sensor technology detects up to 4 individuals, adjusting seat height and warmth automatically according to programmable presets* Magnetic smart lid keep animals out, and scents inCONs:* No Bluetooth support, will not sync with a smart watch or wireless headphones* I'd love to see this in a champagne color or maybe customizable lidsThis is the best money I've spent in years... I will be buying more of these. 2 thumbs up!UPDATE: I have dropped my review down to 4 stars. Currently, my left buttock is securely lodged in the seat. While I wait for the fire department to arrive, I wanted to share my further experience with this product. Since I was unable to Facetime for help (less than ideal Wifi access) and had fallen over during my struggle, it wasn't until the mailman found me on the front porch that I was able to call for help. It clearly needs some sort of safety mechanism to prevent cheek lock.

Overall nice item. I love it, aside from the fact that it sounds like there's a bunch of crap rattling around inside it. I almost want to shake it over some ice cream to see if sprinkles come out. There is no hole in the bottom to get whatever it is out (probably leftover imperfections from molding?). Luckily, I don't really pick it up too often so it's a minor gripe.

I've always had a soft spot for Reggie since my college years, so I was legitimately excited to hear about this 'comeback' album. I do find most of the joke tracks funny (on first listen, at least). There are some great songs on here, and I admittedly really wish the joke tracks were a bit more of a minority (I feel that way about most Reggie albums). Album would kill it if there were a few more serious[ish] songs like Revenge is a Dish... that song rules and is catchy as hell. The dude obviously knows how to make great music, but sometimes it seems like it's a battle over making cool music vs. joke skits. Some songs you have no urge to go back to after that initial chuckle, but there's definitely enough content on here to keep listening (even a couple jokier tracks are fun enough to enjoy more than once). Loving this album so far, and I think it's catchy enough that even non-fans will enjoy the majority of it. Revenge is a Dish is still my favorite... if you're unsure, at least buy that track. Welcome back, Reggie! I can't wait see one of your shows next year.

And I'm not sure mine will last much longer, even though it's spent half its life folded in the box. I have barely used this thing over the past 2-3 years, inflated it to the specified size. Now it's developed a bulge at the top, transforming it into a 'fitness egg'. I'm strangely looking forward to the painful hilarity that will accompany the moment it randomly explodes as I'm doing some awkward situp. End result, besides the future falling-to-the-ground-in-a-climactic-fitness explosion, is that I will probably not buy this product again.

Overall, I dig it. This is definitely one of the stronger pilots being voted on. Characters are likable, with enough chuckles to keep me into it. I generally have ADD tendencies, so it's a rarity that I don't get bored easily. Story was so-so, if anything I'd say it's average. Futurama comes to mind... futuristic fun without taking itself too seriously. I'd watch it.

Fairly funny, great especially for a pilot. This one has my vote, I'm sure it'll get better as it matures (if Amazon decides to move forward with the series). Some of the jokes try a little too hard, in my opinion, though. There are only so many times I can hear them say the word 'hater' before it gets old. Maybe it's because I'm not ghetto? Most of it was funny, creative humor, though. I think it would be way better if they dropped the annoying ghetto slang terms, their mannerisms, voices, and attitude clashes with their situation just fine without them. This show would feel right at home on Adult Swim, I'd DVR this. Nice job, Amazon... looking forward to more in the future.

Keeping it short, wish I could rate these pilots without writing a review! Overall I enjoyed this, and really liked the characters. I felt they were likable, sometimes funny, and relatable. I think it would get even better with time as you get to know them. I thought the show was mostly well acted too. It reminds me of It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia a little.

Unfortunately, I was hit with the inconvenience of one. I just received my Nexus 7 yesterday, and enjoyed it for the hour that it was working. The apps seemed cool, I started loading some ebooks on there, the free Transformers movie looked fantastic even though the movie itself sucks sack. I was happy... until I downloaded Google Sky and started playing. Not sure if it was coincidence, but after that the unit's stopped accepting any of my touches on the screen. It was just done. I tried a soft restart, hard reset, and nothing seemed to fix it even when done multiple times. I couldn't even get past the lock screen, except for 2 random times when I was pawing at the screen like a frustrated 5 yr old. Somehow, my frantic swipes got through the lock screen and I was able to get to settings to do a wipe to factory defaults. Still, the screen was F'd up. So... RMA time for me.I'm not a diehard Apple fan, or Android fan. All I want is something that works well, looks cool, and lets me customize it out the arse. It sucks when you get so excited for something, and it completely disappoints you. I don't want an iPad, I have an iPhone (and honestly it bores the hell out of me). The most customization you can do with iPhone is change your background. iPhones are nice, but designed so simply that it's borderline outdated at this point. They haven't redesigned the iOS look in how long? Or even changed a ringtone in 5 yrs? Oh well... I digress, as my hopes for the Nexus 7 are over for now. It's sad too, because I can tell it's a fantastic device if it actually worked. I've rarely ever, no matter what brand, had a product be this obviously defective. I refuse to even try to exchange for a new Nexus, I am going to wait on the next generation to see if they are manufactured better.If you really want to give it a shot, be aware of the possibility of a dud. If you get a good one, then luck you... from what I have seen in my hour of use, it's a fantastic device.EDIT: I decided to try ordering another from B&H a week later. Now that I've had a few days, I've raised my rating a little. I do really like the N7, BUT guess what... a few days into using it and I am having a different (also seemingly common) defect. I have screen flicker when reducing the brightness down. It's not terrible, but annoying. If I buy something, it should be perfect out of the box. I also noticed that at the lowest setting, the screen is still pretty bright. To compare, iPhone and iPad backlight goes down super low when wanted, saving lots of battery life and making it easier on the eyes in the dark. I'm not sure why Android refuses to make their backlight control go comparably low (aside from having to get an app to do it). My original Droid phone was the same way with it's overly high lowest brightness setting. Anyway, now I am again stuck in the 'return or exchange' dilemma. I'm not sure I'm willing to take the 'third time's a charm' route.EDIT 12/10/12:I've had my second Nexus 7 (unfortunately bought before Google changed prices/GB versions) and I'm loving it. There are some minor quirks and imperfections (screen flicker, etc as noted earlier) but overall I don't notice it much since I've installed Lux. I use it fairly often, and at this point I'm pretty happy I gave it a second chance. My one new issue is the camera, which is AWFUL quality pics. It's basically unusable except for video chats since it's front facing. I tried it with Instagram out of curiosity, and the picture quality was so bad that I realized it's not even worth messing with it. Slight annoyance, guess I'll stick to my iPhone for that. Other than these things, I now highly recommend the Nexus 7, especially the newer versions where they've probably worked out all the little quirks. Screw the iPad Mini.

The case looks as pictured here, although it doesn't fit my iPhone 4 all that well. It's very rubbery, as is expected with a silicone case, but it really should be tighter. Spend a little extra and get a better case... I wish I spent the $1 on an app instead.

As expected silicone case. Looks awesome, as pictured, and fits pretty well. Left and right edges are slightly loose, but what do you expect when it's a rubbery silicone case? Overall I like it, and for $1.60, what's to complain about? My only complaint is that it does not play old Gameboy cartridges.

This is easily the cheapest and most energy-efficient air conditioner I have ever experienced and it works with incredible speed and ease of use. I figured I'd take my product research straight to the streets for a real-world test in August at the Jersey Shore. In my search for a helpful volunteer, I came across a self-defined 'studly gent' named Giovanni, who was sporting an FBI (Female Body Inspector) t-shirt, expertly pruned eyebrows, and a healthy orange glow. The dude looked like he could benefit from some high-quality air conditioning. I asked him, "Hello, sir, how would you like to test out a portable air conditioner that makes the outdoors feel like a walk-in freezer?" He replies, "Yo, bro, as you can see, I'm always hot, hit me up with that!" So I instructed him, "Put this against your neck, hold down the button, and you'll be shaking with the chills in seconds!" Eager to beat the heat, he snatched it from me with his finely manicured hands, and wasted no time pressing it against his 12" diameter neck. Giovanni's eyes rolled back in his head, and he dropped to the ground with pleasurable, heat-lifting chills. He was swinging his arms at me (probably because he wanted a pinch more cooling down), so I gave him 5-10 more seconds of that sweet, sweet air conditioning. Strangely enough, he was so relaxed from the cooling down process, that he emptied his bowels and bladder before falling sound asleep on the hot boardwalk. The gathering crowd was applauding wildly, proof that everyone there was equally as stunned and impressed by the air conditioner as I was. Two thumbs (way) up, and highly recommended!

I wanted to like this book, but I just couldn't get into it. The whole time I was reading, I was waiting for that moment in a book where you start to get sucked in, and it never happened. Many of the chapters I found flat out boring because they revolved around politics/details within the armed forces and the government. These parts felt pretty bloated and made my eyes glaze over, some of it was intriguing but mostly a borefest. I quickly found myself skimming these parts. I got about 1/3 through the book when I realized that if I'm skimming pages already, why should I bother forcing myself to keep reading just for the sake of finishing? I feel the book was well written, but I agree with some other reviewers... I also found the format to work against the book as a whole. Besides hearing about the emotional parts, how it was effecting actual people and characters, I wasn't often emotionally invested in many of the stories. I didn't really care to read pages about the inner workings of the government/politics from the point of view of an army general. Maybe I didn't give it much of a chance, but I wish it were more stories like in the beginning where it felt more human/relatable. I'd rather read a book that I have trouble putting down, and this was not not one of them for me. This zombie fad is getting tired, I'd much rather close this book and watch The Walking Dead.

The statue has a nice feel to it and seems to be of good quality. It's light enough to fit on a small shelf without ripping it off the wall, but hefty enough to beat a burglar unconscious with ease. The colors are subtle and pretty accurate to the picture. I am happy with my purchase... adds a little spirit to a room, without being all up in your face about it. I am not the type of person to have a 3' Jesus deco, creepy gold-framed picture of the Pope staring into your soul, or a 300 lb life size Buddha statue in the corner of the room... so this was perfect. Overall, classy and recommended.

My cats seem to love it. Maybe they are just little fat arses that eat anything, though. All I know is that my one cat used to have constipation issues before Wellness and Wilderness. He'd get a little random butthole bleeding (yuck) and discomfort of which he relieved by leaving lovely skidmarks across my carpet. So far this has been gone since the food switch off of garbage ProPlan. They also seem to have more energy, coats seem shinier as well. I would definitely recommend spending the extra money on either Wilderness or Core Wellness (grain free foods) for your little guys. I'm confident the money saved on crap junk foods like Purina, etc, will not make up for expensive vet visits further down the road. I'm not sure if they have indeed changed the formula, or exactly how it changed, but I switched to Wilderness anyway. My cats went right to it, I don't usually need to transition them.One issue I have had with this food is my cats still occasionally drop a vom-bomb on my floor. I don't think this is due to the food, though. I think they are just little pigs, and sometimes I take too long to feed them. It seems they eat too fast and then -- BLEH, out it goes. Also, I wish they'd package it in more environmentally friendly bags though, there has got to be a way to not make the bags out of thick plastic (or whatever it is). It just has that feeling... like it's an unnecessary amount of material for what it's needed for. It was most likely some art director (I am one) that created the packaging and decided customers would think it feels fancy so it's worth the price.Overall, I've done much reading about various foods, and this food seems great for them, aside from a raw diet. I'd also recommend Wilderness (it's got a sweet looking Lynx on the front).

Overall, I like my Apple TV and would recommend it. Do I think it's one of Apple's best products? Nope. Maybe I've just become increasingly critical in my olding stages of life. Anyway here are my goods/bads:SWEETNESS*Streams pretty flawlessly in various formats, have not had any stuttering*HD movies on my iTunes look pretty great (even if they are only technically 720p)*Netflix, radio (new), many options for video/audio*Easy to use interface and navigation*Anything you put on your computer (music, photos, videos) is available through ATV, which is niceCRAPNESS*You have to turn your computer on, then open iTunes to use anything*Apple TV remote is very clicky (hard clicks, doesn't feel all that comfy to use), inputting passwords, etc is a real chore*Sometimes ATV refuses to shut off after turning the TV off. You need to go to top menu, then hold center button on remote to shut it off... it will randomly not turn the unit off, and you must repeat this a few times then all the sudden it works*Light randomly comes on for network activity (supposedly) even though the unit isn't on... but it looks like it's on? Sure, ok, Apple.*iTunes store is built in, but seems to be a ripoff. $4 to rent, $15 to buy (avg, non-HD) a movie? Two rentals and you might as well have gotten a month of Netflix.For $100, it's a pretty good deal in my opinion. I have enjoyed it, except for the minor annoyances with the hardware and having to go turn my computer on before using it. The computer thing is my biggest grievance, but most of the time I have mine on already anyway. If that's a dealbreaker for you, you'll have to shell out some more bucks for a product with built-in storage. I'd wait on this ATV, though, since it looks as if a newer model is in the works. Hope this helps!

The good: It's easy to take down and put up, has been surprisingly sturdy, and overall decently built product. If my feet and ankles weren't so pathetic from wearing shoes all my life, I'd hang from it like Batman. I weigh about 180 but if I were 200+ I would probably be more hesitant to trust this thing. So far I don't see any chance of the door frame breaking/bar popping off/you falling to the floor and shattering that sweet arse you've been working on. It does what it's supposed to do. If you feel so inclined, you can also dazzle your guests by leaving it in the doorway and hang potted plants from it.The bad: As another reviewer said, the crappy foam ends leave black marks on white molding (it did for me). I don't care, though, since I rent an apartment and they'll just put paint layer #217 on it after I leave anyway. Also, this same foam that rests against the door frame will eventually split and tear half off from the pressure. Both sides of mine are flat and splitting off, which means that the bare metal is pressing against the door frame. The last thing I don't like about it the foam grips are cheap and thin, so your hands will be a little uncomfortable. Weight lifting gloves help.This experience comes from owning it for a few years.

Works Great for all Tubing!!I use the 1/4" ones all over the place from under the sink with water filters and ice makers, to on the roof with evaporative cooler connections.You can make a line repair in seconds.All you have to do is cut the line and slide it on.

Evaporative Cooler Motor Generally Come in 3 Sizes (Bigger is generally better in all but the smallest coolers);~ 1/3HP~ 1/2HP (This is the 1/2HP Motor)~ 3/4HPI have used this brand motor many times and they work good. Cooler motor life expectancy should be 6-10 years.An Evaporative "Swamp" Cooler is a very simple device. Your cooling power will be determined by the amount of water you can evaporate. The more air you move across the water saturated pads, the cooler your air will be. Therefore a bigger motor is a good upgrade in most situations. Unless you have a VERY, VERY small cooler that has a 1/3HP motor installed going with a stronger motor will be an upgrade (although it will consume more energy). If in doubt, just replace with the same size you took out.I Always Upgrade to a Higher CFM Pump As Well Like This One:http://www.amazon.com/dp/B0002YTQJK/?tag=areview-20

Cooler motor life expectancy should be 6-10 years.An Evaporative "Swamp" Cooler is a very simple device. Your cooling power will be determined by the amount of water you can evaporate. The more air you move across the water saturated pads, the cooler your air will be. Therefore a bigger motor is a good upgrade in most situations. Unless you have a very small cooler that has a 1/3HP motor installed going with a stronger motor will be an upgrade (although it will consume more energy). If in doubt, just replace with the same size you took out.I recommend this larger motor and a larger capacity pump like this one:http://www.amazon.com/dp/B0002YTQJK/?tag=areview-20

This is Actually A 11,000 CFM Pump. There is No Such Thing As A 1,000 CFM Pump From Dial.I have used this pump many times as a replacement.A pump on an Evaporative "Swamp" Cooler has a limited life expectancy.The harder your water the lower the life expectancy will be.In hard water areas, expect your pump to last 3-5 years.You can buy the more expensive pumps, but in the end you are not going to get much more life out of a different pump.I always recommend going for the largest pump you can for the lowest price.The more water you have running over your pads, the more you will evaporate and thus cool.

You Have 2 Options When it Comes to The Float Valve:1~ Buy a Cheap Float (Generally Plastic) and Plan on Replacing it About Once a Year2~ Buy A Quality Brass Valve That you Can Disassemble and Clean When it Starts LeakingThis is the First option. This will be good for 1 year Maybe 2 if you're luckyThey work fine and are good if your maintenance schedule calls for replacement anywaysLife expectancy will be higher if you don't have hard water.Watch the video on Valve Maintenance:http://youtu.be/u4wFgl-VEoQ

These are the Better Float Valves for Evaporative or "Swamp" Coolers.Those that are complaining about the 1/4" compression fitting and inability to use in a toilet, need to understand that the primary application is for swamp coolers.As Far as swamp coolers go, you have 2 options;1- Get the cheapo $5 valve and plan on replacing it about every year  -or-2- Buy the Heavy Duty Brass Valve (which is this one) and know that you can disassemble it for cleaning when it starts to leak.Pros:~ Rubber Seal on the piston valve can be "Flipped" over to extend the life of the valve.~ Valve can be disassembled for cleaning and maintenance (cap comes off, cotter pin removes & Piston Valve Comes out)~ Brass means it won't corrodeCons:~ Just like any swamp cooler part, it will eventually get covered in calcium/mineral deposits which makes disassembly a little more difficultVideo showing Disassembly and Cleaning:http://youtu.be/u4wFgl-VEoQ

9:23 MinsAs an entry level digital micrometer, I couldn't find anything that came close.I have both this iGaging EZ Mic and the Full Vernier IP65 iGaging digital micrometers and they both pretty much nail their price points. The display is HUGE and covers most of the measuring body. Very smooth over-all.While it's bigger brother,the iGaging OriginCal, took first place due to it's absolute origin feature, I would not have any hesitation trusting the EZCal for critical measurements down to .0005" which is not something I would say for the Neiko or Carrera.Pros:~ Good Accuracy over-all.~ Solid build design!~ Well polished/finished which makes it look better than the others~ Takes a Commonly available CR2032 (comes with an extra battery)\~ Battery Compartment is Not Going to Break On You~ IP54 rating for moisture and dust resistance~ Large, Clear, Easy to Read Display. Largest Display of all of the calipers~ Auto-Off After Inactivity Feature~ Fractional measurement to the 128th~ Over-All, the best $25 you can spend on an entry level caliperCons:~ No Auto-On when you start moving the body. (this might help with battery life?)Watch the full video series to make an informed buying decision.WHICH CALIPERS DID I REVIEW IN THIS VIDEO?Mitutoyo ABSOLUTE 500-196-20 Digital Caliper, Stainless Steel, Battery Powered, Inch/Metric, 0-6" Range, +/-0.001" Accuracy, 0.0005" ResolutioniGaging IP54 Electronic Digital Caliper 0-6" Display Inch/Metric/Fractions Stainless Steel BodyCarrera Precision CP9806-TF Titanium 0-Inch to 6-Inch Electronic Fractional & Decimal Digital CaliperCarbon Fiber Digital Caliper Central StormNeiko 01407A Stanless Steel 6-Inch Digital Caliper with Extra-Large LCD Screen and Instant SAE-Metric ConversionCapri Tools 6-Inch Digital Caliper with Fractional Display/MM/SAE & Extra Large LED Screen[...]

10:00 MinsI compared the Carrera Precision to 6 other digital calipers in this Video RoundUp.(Video Size and Quality was reduced to meet Amazons limits, Watch the full video on my YouTube GadgetClass channel)The Carrera Precision comes in a few different varieties, all of which are just slight styling changes. There is a Titanium a Platinum, TF etc. They all use the same heavy cast metal body(not made of titanium or platinum) and stainless steel caliper parts. The metal case actually throws the balance off quite a bit. The build quality and accuracy is not all that great compared to the iGaging EZCAL. There is a gap between the internal measuring jaws which renders all internal measurements inaccurate.Summary:I would stay away from the Carrera and get the iGaging EZCal for the same exact price. The iGaging EXCal was the clear winner in this price categoryiGaging IP54 Electronic Digital Caliper 0-6" Display Inch/Metric/Fractions Stainless Steel BodyCons:~ There is a gap between the internal measuring jaws which makes all internal measurements inaccurate. Watch my Youtube video showing this gap visually.~ It just barely meets it's rated accuracy spec across the entire data set.~ There is a lot of "Slop" between the ruling body and measuring body of the caliper which leads to a wide variation in measurement accuracy as you get closer to the ends of the jaws~ Finish and build quality are lacking when compared side be side to the iGaging EZCalPros:~ Fractional measurement (also present on the iGaging EZCAL)~ Auto Off (Also present on the iGaging EXCAL)Watch the full video series to make an informed buying decision.WHICH CALIPERS DID I REVIEW IN THIS VIDEO?Mitutoyo ABSOLUTE 500-196-20 Digital Caliper, Stainless Steel, Battery Powered, Inch/Metric, 0-6" Range, +/-0.001" Accuracy, 0.0005" ResolutioniGaging IP54 Electronic Digital Caliper 0-6" Display Inch/Metric/Fractions Stainless Steel BodyCarrera Precision CP9806-TF Titanium 0-Inch to 6-Inch Electronic Fractional & Decimal Digital CaliperCarbon Fiber Digital Caliper Central StormNeiko 01407A Stanless Steel 6-Inch Digital Caliper with Extra-Large LCD Screen and Instant SAE-Metric ConversionCapri Tools 6-Inch Digital Caliper with Fractional Display/MM/SAE & Extra Large LED Screen[...]

This tool easily disconnects all of the transmission cooler lines on your truck.Do Not Buy that cheap plastic set of 2!!!If you have been going crazy trying to disconnect the 2 oil cooler lines going into and out of the bottom of your radiator, this tool does the job effortlessly! A quick snap and a solid metal engagement.Pros:~ Solid metal, you don't feel like it's going to break or deform on you~ Perfect fit for the Ford 6.0L Transmission Cooler line Quick Connects~ Disconnects the lines with a nice, smooth click and pullCons:~Orange colored finish wears off after many uses as one would expect.

9:00 MinsI decided to try out the data cable while I was doing my 7 digital caliper roundup and was very impressed with it.A data cable is not something I would have normally thought would be very useful, but once I started using it, I was sold. I do a lot of prototyping and CAD work and I never realized just how tortured I was inputting all of those 8 digit numbers manually until I was able to just hit a button and have the numbers inputted automatically with one click.Pros:~ Works with the Mitutoyo digimatic calipers~ One Button data input. How did I live without this before?~ No special drivers (Windows auto detects and installs its own drivers)~ Very Simple & Easy to UseCons:~ Could be smaller?

10:00 MinsThis Digital Caliper is by far THE BEST Caliper You Can Buy Under $100!!I put 7 digital calipers through a series of tests to determine their over-all accuracy, precision & repeat-ability.This Caliper Performed On-Par with the Mitutoyo Digimatic Digital Caliper Which Costs OVER 2 Times More.Watch the Complete Round-Up Series of Videos on my YouTube Channel: GadgetClassSummary:  If you're in the market for a digital caliper you need to decide if you are in the under $50 price category or over $50 price category. For a long time there was a huge gap in the market in the over $50 category. Most people either bought a cheapo caliper or went for the Mitutoyo absolute origin caliper which costs $120. iGaging has filled that gap with their OriginCal absolute origin digital caliper. It functions and performs nearly identically to the Mitutoyo. So much so, that if you removed the labels, you would hard to tell them apart. If you need a quality, absolute origin digital caliper, this one is the best value for the dollar hands down.If you want something cheaper, the iGaging EZCal is the second place winner, and blew the low end of the market out of the water:iGaging IP54 Electronic Digital Caliper 0-6" Display Inch/Metric/Fractions Stainless Steel BodyPros:~ Absolute Origin~ Very Accurate and Precise~ Great Repeatability~ CR-2032 Battery~ Battery Door is Strong and Will NOT Break~ SPC Data Output Port (works with the Mitutoyo cable)~ Very Smooth and Buttery, like the Mitutoyo~ Very Well Machined. No sharp edges like the cheapo brands~ Buttons function exactly the same as the MitutoyoCons:~ No Auto-Off Feature (just like the Mitutoyo)

I can drain my pasta, noodles, veggies and even fruit. My noodles don't try and slip though these holes like with my plastic one. This even has two nice handles so you can hold on to it and not drop it. Then the bottom is made so you can sit it on a cabinet and it will stay in place because of how it's made with the design. It's really nice to have and would make a great gift. I'm loving mine and making my family all want one too.I received this product for free in exchange of an honest and unbiased review.

A) These work perfectly -- exactly as stated to remove adhesive (we used these to get mic-tape off of faces!)b) They are disgustingly oily and smell. You will need another soap to use directly afterwards to wipe this grease off of you.

Standard Tower of Hanoi puzzle -- but the pieces are very small -- it looks pretty big from the photos and descriptions, but this is very small and the tinier pieces are hard to handle for larger hands and or older folks or people with fine motor coordination issues. Nice wood though.
Terrific CD version of a forgotten musical...well recorded and a lively score. You'll feel like you are discovering a treasure.

One of the best books I've read -- it quickly sucks you in and keeps you there -- it does help if you know your French history a bit since many of the characters are historically accurate but minor in the scope of world history, but very major in the scope of French/Parisian history. The only thing I would imagine would make this book better would be sitting in a French cafe while reading it -- Highly Recommended.

Far more difficult to use than indicated. If I wasn't setting this up for my elderly parent, they would NOT be able to use it independently. Also, if there are days that you do not take a med (example, you take a pill every other day) then there is no way to set that.I also found that it is very "beatable" -- that is, if you open the lid and close it without taking the pill, it resets for the next pill in the evening. As such, if your loved one gets annoyed by the alarm, they just need to open and close the lid and go about their daily business -- and get no further reminders and will forget to take their dosage.There are better things out there, although at this price point it is okay IF you continue to set it up and monitor it. Otherwise I would not leave this alone with a loved one to handle on their own, especially if they tend to forget things or are good at beating the system...

Look great, sound really good -- but quality is poor -- within a couple weeks they had cracked on the left side -- I can still use them but I am afraid the sound is going to go bad quickly. I am someone who uses these very casually and I am not rough with the at all -- I keep them in my messenger bag and use them on plane rides and that is about it ---I am going to go back to my older pair of noise cancelling earbuds once I get home from my current trip. Its too bad -- I liked these, and the noise cancellation was actually better than my Bose earbuds which cost four times as much. But at least those aren't falling apart on me.

I have been using Spigen Glas for years now -- but THIS DOES NOT FIT properly on the iPhone 6S Plus...they market it for both the 6Plus and the 6S plus...it doesn't fit right AND it scratches easily -- I've never had a Spigen Glas scratch on me before -- this one scratched in only three days.

First, I do not believe there is any difference at all between Regular Topricin and Foot Topricin-- just packaged differently for people to find it under "foot pain" meds...That being said, during severe gout this does nothing...it soothes a bit with its coolness but that is all...BUT afterwards as the swelling goes down and the foot pain lingers for month after month this works better than anything else out there...cools, soothes, without smell. It does remain somewhat "wet" for awhile, so you have to wear socks after application. But the foot pain is definitely gone while using it, especially overnight.

Just finished this new novel by David Blixt and loved it -- though parts made me mad and parts made me want to instantly get even more of the story!! -- a great sense of history told with humor and well-paced...with great characters.

Fun writing -- fun story -- and characters you can recognize, if not necessarily like...like your own friends, you want to know a few better, you wish you could change a few, and some you wouldn't want to spend an hour with, let alone a wedding party....

I've referred many to this volume already -- these short essays feel conversational in tone and open up a world of ideas for theater actors and students alike -- the essay on the "tomorrow" speech is superb...highly recommended.

What a great new album from one of my all-time favorites, Melissa Manchester --- the music here is all hummable, and ranges from lovely ballads to many upbeat jazzy tunes with great riffs...and a gorgeous and surprising interpretation of the R&H "Something Wonderful" that took my breath away...Just get it -- on CD or download...you'll love it. Congrats Melissa!
A well-written and enlightening read -- saw Brian talk about his book on several talk shows and had to buy it -- and I very much enjoyed reading it.
Looks great, feels good in the hand, Incipio quality as usual. Bought several in different colors, very low profile, sleek. Note that this is more for scratch protection than it is drop protection.
Does exactly what you would expect, and reliably.

The best Gene Kelly biography out there, even though it ends before his death -- non-sensationalized and down to earth writing, with lots of information about Gene, his style, and his life in movies and afterward. This really needs an update with a final chapter on his late-life recognitions and death, since it still stands as the definitive biography on his life.
A gorgeous sign, big enough to use on stage as a set dressing -- well made, bright coloring.
Very realistic looking -- we used these on a stage set for Bonnie & Clyde the musical and they looked very real -- easy to apply, various sizes.
Lots of photos, and clear non-sensationalized writing make this a coffee-table book worth cherishing of a favorite actor/singer/dancer.

Does what it says -- harder to wash out than expected -- stains flooring and body -- took three washes to get shirt clean enough to use again -- had to contact the company (they were SUPER helpful and responded right away) to see how to wash this off of your body, because regular soap does not work -- you need Glycerin soap which worked immediately -- that should probably be written on the label somewhere since we walked around with glowing red bodies after our first dress rehearsal...Otherwise, the consistency is great -- the color looks very natural, and it sparkled under stage light, making it look real and quite effective.

Superb family game -- fun and easy to learn rules and educational as well. Also teaches divergent reasoning skills to some degree as one makes decisions, decides on priorities, and still has to take into account speed and length of track in order to win.

Beautiful rubber with material top flip flops -- these are so comfortable I got several pairs. Note that I normally wear about a 7.5 shoe, and the size 9 Reef Stuyak fits perfectly -- so consider ordering at least one size larger than what you normally wear. They also leave minimal coloring on the bottom of your feet when wearing them for a long time -- though there is some -- especially on very hot days when worn for long periods of time -- but the dye easily washes off your feet with soap and water, not like that other competing company that starts with a T and ends with an A and has an EV in the middle. You'll be very happy with these. Note also, the sand color with black rubber sole also looks great. I have two pairs of each color.

Hilarious and fast reading -- BJ Novak is already a fan favorite from tv (The Office) movies (Inglorious Bastards) and stand-up comedy. His (sometimes very) short stories are hilarious and great slices of life/thoughts. Some feels a bit like its pulled from his comedy routines (also okay by me). You'll really enjoy this collection.

Perfect OEM lens cap for lenses that are 77mm size -- like the Nikon 17-55 or the Nikon 18-300...it fits beautifully over any filters you might attach as well. Note that mine did not come with any black thread attached like shown in the photo (and I wouldn't want one) so I am not sure why that is in the photo, except to let you know that you could theoretically attach a black string.

This is a beautiful hard-cover snap-on case for the Galaxy S5. It is thin, as expected, and fits perfectly. It looks great. The coloring is a good solid white without yellowish shades, and the orange is a bit duller than shown, making it a very nice looking case indeed. Several people around SE Michigan have asked me where I got mine. This is a terrific case, and I recommend it for Tigers fans, or Detroit fans in general! Nothing like the old English D....

Exactly what I wanted -- I administer a lot of iPhones for clients and patients -- and I know they'll all be looking to me for advise once the iPhone 6 4.7" is released --- I have to admit the only reason I purchased this was to be able to show them an approximation of what the phone will be like in size. These covers are based on pre-release stats and rumors, so that it might not exactly be the perfect fit once the actual phone comes out, but with all the leaks, its probably pretty much spot-on.

Love it! Originally got this to use on a stage set where it was too difficult to hard wire a lamp, it looks great. Light emitted is not as bright as that of other plug-in lamps, but for battery operated portability it can't be beaten. I liked it enough after the show that I brought it to my office and use it as an emergency light in case of power outages.
Very good -- we use these to move heavy furniture around a theater shop. Sturdy, reusable, and large. Note that these are for hard surfaces like cement or wood floors, not for carpeted areas.

Solid and comfortable bench, ideal for electric piano -- and while it really doesn't fit two, I've found it usable for quick 4-handed play when someone else needs to join me for a moment or two...Easy to assemble.
This is a great lifesize dummy -- we used this as a body in a play I was directing, and with a wig and costuming, it was exactly the right size for what we needed...

This is a very good wireless printer at this price point.  I have purchased more expensive that did not the quality that this printer has.  This is a wireless all in one printer.  I have already scanned, copied and printed pictures.  The pictures that I printed came out very nicely.  This printer has a small footprint on my desk which I like.  The printer is also White and looks nice.  Not your standard black office looking printer.  I would recommend this printer especially at this price point.

Another very good Epson Printer.  I have owned several epson printers over the years.  This printer makes Professional photo quality prints up to 11 x 17 when using quality photo paper.  The printer makes 6 color pro-quality photos.  It has a speciality paper tray, plus a dedicated DVD tray.  The thing that I like most is the wireless printing.  It was very easy to set up and start making pictures.  The box states Wireless, Print, Copy, Scan, Ultra HD photon Ethernet.  I have only tested the photo printing, wireless, copy and scan features.  I definitely recommend this printer.  It is another quality Epson product.

The TALKABOUT T480 is a small radio union  weighing in at 8 ounces, that receives the weather channels, FM radio and permits you to talk to other that have the same radio or compatibility. I only received one for review purposes thus I cannot evaluate the talk feature.In the box is the radio, a battery, charging cord, instructions and a wall holder. The unit weighs 8 ounces thus is a little heavy to constantly carry around although there is a belt clip. The instructions are printed in such small print that I needed a magnifying glass to be able to read parts of them. Once the battery was installed the unit went to work immediately broadcasting the weather reports locally. The sound is good and you can control he volume with the off-on switch.The radio is weather and water proof and that is a good feature. The wall hanger will permit you to hang on the wall for future use. There were no screws for attaching. There is a built in flashlight in the front with a switch on the side. Works well. There is an emergency call button on the side. You can use either the battery that came with the unit or you can use 3 AA batteries. The AA batteries would be good in the event the rechargeable battery went dead.Switching from one mode to another is easy and quick, just punch of a button. There are many additional features that you can use such as 20 different call tones and quiet talk. The unit is compatible with all FRS, GMRS Two Way Radios.The radio seems to be well built for rugged use. I did  find it a little annoying to carry on my belt for a long period of time due to its weight. I do not know hold long the rechargeable battery will hold a charge.

I obtained an advance copy of this book thru the Vine program. When I receive a book for review I always take a loo at the quality of the book , binding and print as I really dont like those 10 cent novel printed on newsprint. This book is a quality book with a great binding and pages lay flat each time you turn a page. The print, like many of todays books, is light and hard to read unless you have perfect eyesight and great lighting. I mention this but many  will probably obtain this book as they will have an interest in Civil War history and that vertically eliminates the younger generation who apparently seldom even pick up a  book let alone read one.Wen I got the book there is a section referred to as introduction and on page 11 there is an accusation that William Hickok was a murderous lawman---not my words but those of the author. William Hickok according to the info I have read was not the most law abiding person before he turned lawman and while there are at last half a dozen deaths attributed to Hickok, I think one should closely look at the circumstances, the number of deaths and the end results before labeling Hitch a murderous lawman. I managed to get myself beyond that printing and headed for the books chapters.The book is about 70 people after the Civil War and what each may have contributed  or not contributed after that aftermath. Many of the writings are about the good and even a touch of bad about each of these people; however there are individuals the writer does not find a lot of good to write about. Dont expect a full expos of each of these people, who are actually real, but rather just a few pages about them and some of their exploits.I once developed a college paper about Andrew Carnegie and Andrew was a chapter in the book, with a title Man O Steel. While Carnegie was shrewd business man he was also a ruthless employer that had little use for some, since as those such as those employees that once struck one of his steel mills. I found the sketch interesting but not even close to a full recording on Carnegie. Just brush up on history and add to what you read in this book.I found the book interesting and kept asking myself after each chapter, What is the rest of the story? You will no doubt find the book interesting, as I did, and want to do some more research yourself on each of the characters.

Right out of the box I felt I had a professional level hair trimmer just like the ones in the barbershops. The ergonomics are great making it easy to hold. There are three attachments that are for hair, beard and body hair. Each is easy to remove and insert. The first place I tried it was my side burns, with the pop up trimmer and I got a great even cut across the bottom of the sideburns. It takes about an hour to fully charge the trimmer which will them run about an hour on the full charge.You probably wont get the full benefits right out of the box as I found that it would take a learning curve to get the proper adjustments. The quick adjust dial will help you get that the desired length. It is waterproof, thus safe in the shower and thank goodness no cord hanging down while trimming before the morrow. You can use the cord is you had rather.There is a two year warranty and the unit runs on 100-240 volt power. This looks to be one of the best built trimmers I have ever owned. The unit is quit and comes with a storage/travel case to keep all the attachments in one place. Great trimmer which I really like.

These are the perfect cups for either watching TV at home or tailgating. They are strong and hold 10 oz, which is just right for ice and a 12 oz can of drink. They are colorful and very noticeable. The ones I received through the Vine program were for the Tennessee Vols where I once lived so they are perfect.
I used this chip in a security camera located on the front porch. It has preformed exactly as it should. Great product

I have already sewed new seeds twice this summer without any good results. Part of the people I have is the amount of shade. I always prepare the soil as suggested, plant  the seeds and water and still not much in the way of success. I trust this bag of seeds with be different as they are quality Scotts seeds and the mixture is for the shade. I am once again spreading new garden oil (Scotts) and will plant these seeds today in hopes I get a stand before winter. The mixture is for the deep south including Texas where I live.The seeds are guaranteed to grow and provide thicker and greener grass. I am trusting the WATERSMART Plus coating to absorb water and protect the seeds from disease. According to the bag the mixture is 99% weed free. I know that Scotts make quality products and I am optimistic this bag will produce good results.

If you are a beef jerky lover, then you will love Jack Links Peppered Beef Jerky. The jerky is seasoned with  pepper. The package was fresh and the jerky moist. Love it!. Can't beat it for the weekend football games as I take it to the couch for an all afternoon treat.

This small electric chain saw is the perfect addition to your saw cutting collection. It is easy to use and does a great job. There is very little assembly right out of the box. Just attached the saw blade, make some quick adjustments and add the chain oil (which does not come with the package). When cutting be sure and use a heavy duty electric cord as a light weight cord may over heat.The saw has a 16 inch blade and come with a  low kickback design. The motor is plenty strong for small jobs. The tool free tensioning for the chair works great and is very easy to use. The automatic oilier works great and there is an oil level that will show you how much chain oil is remaining in the reservoir.This is am impressive small electric chain saw that should provide years of service is really great form the small clean ups around the yard. Thus far I have used it to cut small limbs from several trees. A job that would have cost me more than the price of the chain saw.

You cannot afford to purchase these asparagus spears at the local grocery due to the price. Then I noticed these on Amazon and that is really good rice in the 12 pack. The asparagus does not compare to freshly grilled or cooked asparagus in taste or in price. Lots of sales been running recently locally, however this canned asparagus is very good. It is crisp and tasty. We went to a  reception and this asparagus had been cut into short links and covered was a cheese sauce. Very delicious.

This is not your usual can of fruit cocktail but rather an interesting can of tropical fruits that may of may not be in that normal can of fruit cocktail. The fruit taste great and are delicious. Great for a change from the regular fruit cocktail.

Costco has many great Kirkland labeled products and this white chicken breast meat is one of our favorites. The chicken salad made from this meat is delicious. We first got a sample in one of the stores and have been using the chicken breast every since. We also cut a tomato into four sections and top it off with the chicken breast and a little dressing ----delicious.
Great for addition to many recipes and especially as a main ingredient for dips. We love the product and it is our favorite.

Progresso soups are full bodied and with lots of veggies and meats. No other soup has the thickness and consistency of the soup and on top of that they are all tasty and delicious. Not a lot of liquid and water thus you get all soup in a  can. Great products.

You have to like the taste of potted meat or you will no doubt think it not at all good. I would not eat this on any regular basis however once in a while I like a sandwich spread with this particular potted meat made with chicken and pork. This product hasn't changed much if any over many years and still last about the same to day as it did in the past. The price of the can though keeps increasing significantly Look for  multiple pack so you can save some money. The package I just purchased has an expiration date on 2018 thus it had good shelf life.

This piece of equipment looks and feels really heavy duty. The brochure states that it is engineered for a broad range of grinding, cutting and deburring applications, the 4.5" 900 Watt WP9-115 Quick compact angle grinder features a smaller, ergonomically designed body with integrated non-locking paddle switch for increased safety and more comfort, the quickest wheel change system available, and a tool-free quick-positioning guard that allows for fast change-over from grinding to cutting. The powerful Long Life 8.5 Amp, AC/DC, 10,500 rpm motor includes advanced designs to optimize air flow for cooler operation and extend longevity in harsh environments. The S-Automatic Safety Slip Clutch helps to prevent kick back if a disc or wheel should jam.I find the handling of this grinder to be excellent although it is quite heavy. I was all excited when I got a chance to test and review this item and could not wait to open the box. To my disappointment the unit comes with no accessories, not even a  single cutting wheel. At first I though that was a mistake however after reading the box label I found that no additional items , including cutting wheels, were in the box. Thus I can only write about what the company states and cannot provide the readers an actual test report since I have no cutting wheels. I just checked at one of the large hardware stores and they do not have cutting wheels either. I did locate then on the internet however it will takes several days for the wheels to be shipped and arrive. I am giving the unit five stars because the construction looks great, the feel of the grinder is very good and when I turn the motor on it is one powerful "dude". I like it just will have to wait for some cutting experience.

I have no idea why a manufacture would advertise a stapler that takes only half a strip of standard staples. I now have to go back and refill the stapler twice as much as I normally would if it took a full strip. There was no paper work with the stapler thus I cannot find out from the mfg. The stapler looks nice in its pretty colors but works like a very cheap stapler. The handle is hard to push an forget about a couple of sheets to be stapled as it does not do that good a job. Staple many sheets and it works fine. Id you want a stapler that primarily sits around on your desk and looks pretty then the colors this one comes is means you can change out the stapler every time you need to refill the one being used. I think there are better staplers on the market.

The mouthwash has a mint flavor with a very good taste. The mouthwash will strengthen enamel even when brushes are missed. This helps reverse enamel softening to help. Contains fluoride and freshen one's breath. Great product although I have no way of knowing about the factors involving the enamels. We are using it strictly as a mouthwash and trust benefits on the hardening will follow.

My wife uses these drops since her implants on both eyes. They were recommended by the doctor and she has been using them every since. I occasionally us them however my eyes do not dry as often as hers. These are the best eye drops on the market and one that we fully trust. They are long lasting when used as directed. The lubrication formula helps penetrate the surface thus keeping the eyes moist for hours. I found that I get a better price at the local big box store than on the internet. Highly recommended.

We have been looking for these for a long time, after we noticed several hamburger restaurants were using this size to serve their hamburgers on. Just wasn't available in the local stores, then we saw them listed on Amazon and at a price that was most reasonable. The aluminum is very heavy and these pans are well constructed and should last a long time. We have learned the hard way on some of our pans and know now that a hot pan will warp if you put the hot pan in cold water. That won't happen to these. We can cook a small can of biscuits (5) in one of the small pans and it works out great. There are also those five cinnamon rolls to a can and they too work great. The pans have given us good looking biscuits that cook evenly in the pan and all five look identical with no hot spots. Also since there are just tow of us we can cook a small amount of french fries in these pans. Great purchase.

My spouse says this is a fantastic hair dryer. It has 1875 watts, is translucent and looks great. It works really well with a true cold shot button along with three heat levels and two speeds. Easy to work and all the controls are clearly marker and visible. There is a concentrator attachment which with my spouses short hair she does not use. This is one powerful hair drier.The carton says it has been designed with salon performance and that I believe that is true. You will get 50% faster drying, and according to CONAIR up to 3X longer life. The hairdryer has a limited four year warranty.Ceramic technology helps to protect hair from heat damage while ionic technology gives you smooth, shiny hair with up to 75% less frizz. Excellent hair dryer that preforms great.
Bags worked as they were advertized. A little messy when compared with just using aluminum.

This is a perfect replacement for the cable I have been carrying in the car for my iPhone. The tips of the section that go into the iPhone slot are showing a lot of wear and don't always connect good. I especially like this cable since it is flat and fits easily the space on my SUV. The flat cable is also very nice, very flexible and easy to store. I now have to get a matching (red) charger for travel.

This is a super nice electric grill that I can use indoors or outdoors. Dont look for assembly instructions, as there were none in my box, however it is easy to construct and all you need is a Phillips screwdriver to fasten the handle on the top. It takes about fifth teen minute to assemble the grill and the stand. This is the perfect size outdoor grill for those that have a small amount of space and want to grill outside like on a patio plus you dont have to worry with that heavy can of propane or charcoal.I do find that the top part of the grill is heavy and causes the grill not to be all that steady. That should not be a problem unless you have very small kids around and I would then be a little concerned about them tipping the grill over. The grill it self is ceramic coated and that is great for cooking hamburgers. You can place more than a dozen burger patties on the grill. The burger patties will come out will grill marks just like the big grills and the non-stick surface will not end up having tid bits of meat that stuck to the grill.  The grill does not heat from the top and bottom, only the bottom, thus you will more than likely have to turn your patties at least once. Hot dogs are a breeze to cook.  By the way there are no cooking instructions such as time, etc. in the small booklet that comes with the grill.The grill gets its power from a single wire hook up that goes directly into the grill. The cord is well made and easy to remove for storage. By the way, outside storage is not recommend in the booklet that came with the grill. I like the fact I can remove the grill from the stand and use it indoors. Finding a place for permanent storage though may be an issue and it will probably not go into the post and pans section of your cabinets. I have a special four shelf shelving that I have just outside the kitchen door so that all appliances as large as this one can be stored and easily accessed.I would never use any utensil that could scrape the surface of the grill thus when washing you should be careful. The grill top is made into the overall unit and thus is not removable for washing. I used a wet sponge for cleaning and it worked really well. I think it would have been better to have manufactured a removable cook top. I have  a small George Foreman grill for making sandwiches and waffles and those cooking surfaces are removable. Due to the ceramic surface clean up I found to be rather easy. There is a drip tray to catch excess juices and it is removable.

These pants are 100% cotton and they fit perfectly now. I am afraid they will shrink after washing and I will not be able to wear. I actually wear a waist 39/40 and length 30. I love these trousers and hope they maintain their size after washing. The material feels good. They have a flat front and are the classic fit. The  crease is permanent and the waist is a comfort fit.I would have been more comfortable in a loose fit.There is absolutely nothing bad about these pants I just need a different size.

I will not get the full use out of this heater until colder weather is here. Its over 100 degrees here today in Dallas thus I cannot give a complete heating report. The unit looks very nice and will not standout in a room, as it will blend in with the room. We are going to be using this in an upstairs bath that has an outer wall and gets a little chilly at times.Love the features such as the child locking switch, the finger friendly design, the auto shut off, topple protection, cool touch case and the covered power cord storage. All of these are great safety features and they work really well, are easy to read and easy to turn on and turn off.We have only sued the unit for early testing and we live it. The unit is quite and the design first class. If you get any dirt in the unit just use a brush to wipe it out. Could not be easier. According to the paperwork and user manual thus unit comes with a five-year guarantee.

This was a VINE product which stated 8 packages. I received one package which was delivered by the US Post Office and left in my mail box on a Sunday according to the Sunday delivery label. . We had no reason to check the mail box on a Sunday thus the mail was not checked until Monday morning. The temperate here in Dallas was at 100 plus degrees and the box was beginning to swell from the heat.I opened the box and heated the contents however after one bite I could not eat anymore. I noted on the box there were no preservatives and this was an organic product. The box is paper with an aluminum lining. The soup did not taste good and I was afraid to try to eat any more. The liquid has noodles, small pieces of chicken and other vegetables.I now have a lingering after taste in my mouth. I think the box had sat in the heat too long. I destroyed the rest. I would definitely not purchase this product. This product falls short of Campbells quality products. If you will check my reviews I dont recall every recall giving a product one star, however that  is all I can give this soup. I think the problem may lie with the United States Post Office and their poor delivery process.

The Avery 3 1/3 X 4 inch shipping labels is excellent for making one printing and getting six labels to a sheet. The quality of the printing is excellent and the sheets are jam and smudge free and can be used with a laser printer or ink jet printer.Avery make quality printing product and this is another great example.  Avery has a template that can be used to print the labels if your do not already have software for that printing. This is a large box of labels20 sheets or 12500 labels. Should last me a long time.When peeling the labels from the sheets I found that stick really well on the envelopes where they are used. You can print these labels on a PC or Mac. By going to the Avery site you can find a great many pre-designed labels to use.

I have been using a store brand label for my printed Post Office shipping labels and as soon as I received these labels I printed a Post Office mailing label. The paper is very high quality and the ink printing look bold and sharp on my label. These are quality labels and easy to use. They sheets fed through my printer without one hang up. I don't use the Avery template as Word has a template that works perfectly well. While these labels are  8 1/2 by 11, the sheets come in an assortment of sizes. This by the way was a large box with 250 pages. Enough to last for a while. The box indicates these labels are jam and smudge free and that has certainly been the case for me. These by the way work on both laser and ink jet. Great product!

This is a new  from Heinz and I think it is better than the original. Love the bottle because you can stand it on end and let the mustard flow to the top for easy use. The taste is very good and I think much better than cheaper store brands. For that reason alone we always stick to the Heinz brand. Mustard is one of the best buys you can get for a condiment and it lasts a long time. This mustard has no carbs and no fats and only  65 mg sodium.

Just like the dressing at Olive Garden Fresh and delicious. The only think I see negative is the prices for some of the listings. There is one really great price and that is less than $4. I have purchased two different size bottle, one was 20 oz and the other is 16 oz. This is really great dressing. Suggest you cut your salad or use a pre-cut package and then mix the salad dressing in a large bowl juts like they do at Olive Garden. I think it spreads better than adding to a single salad dish. This is an update on July 26, 2015. We just had lunch at Olive Garden and they sold us a nice bottle of Olive Garden Dressing. It is in a very nice glass flask and sells for $5.29. I checked everything on the newly purchased bottle against those I have previously purchased. Same manufacturer, same ingredients ,just different kind of bottle and different size. The Olive Garden bottle was 17 oz.

I am a casual table tennis player and was a tennis player on a tennis team when in college. Therefore I am far from being a great player but nevertheless love to play an occasional game of table tennis or ping-pong. All the paddles in my past have been those which I have purchased at a discount sporting goods tore and never once did I pay anywhere close to the price of this excellent tennis paddle.The first think I noticed was the weight which was great and the paddle seemed to ant to balance itself regardless of how poorly I held the paddle. The paddle coating lets one pout a tremendous amount of spin on the ball and the speed, while not being at the top range of Stigmas paddle, its nevertheless excellent.I am amazed at all the various layer used to construct this paddle. My first paddle as I recall had a plywood middle board and covered with sandpaper and alter rubber or sponge. This one is many years advanced and I intend to take care of it by never leaving out on the porch on top of the table.I love this tennis paddle. The handle grip is outstanding. My hands sweat and I have lost grip of the handles on other paddle, but dont think this will occur with this one. Great addition for my game.

We have been making pizza for decades and never had a pizza baking pan. Just always used a metal tray however that is going to change with this new pizza bake pan. We now get an even baking of the entire pizza. Really works great.I do have a couple of issues though. The paperwork that came from the manufacture is printed in light red ink and almost impossible to read. That is one of the poorest printing job I have seen on any product. That are a lot of do not do listed on the paper however not one set of instructions on actually baking a pizza.  Guess the buyer  should know what to do. Many of these instructions deal with the issue related to heat. For example do not but under a broiler and instructions about outdoor use.The pan looks good and works well. We are happy to add it to our cooking equipment.

These are not your normal paper towels. They are water activated which means you get some soap in the towels when you wet them This is great fro cleaning surfaces. These clean as well as any dishcloths we have and the good part about this is they are disposable. I always hesitated to throw the dishcloths away when they got really stained. The Dawn actually does blast through the grime and dirt with water activated bubbles. These are great for use in the bathroom, the wash room and around the kitchen sink. I do believe they leave less residual then the soap and dishcloths.Now for a slight dilemma. We have a kitchen towel holder for the towels. We use those towels for clan up, for the microwave and even as last minute napkins. That will continue however we will spate these Bounty towels fro the otter towels and use them strictly for wet clean ups in the bath and kitchen.Great product which we will continue to use.

Wasn't sure if these would fit my time as they were shown as being different color from the original trippers. They did work quite well and they were a very good price when compared with the local pool store.
These were for a gift and she really loved them. First thing she said was "I need to get some additional colors". She was a Happy Birthday girl.
Exact replacement for the timer. They fit the clock dial just as the original ones did.

I already have two Fellows shredders however I needed one additional for the second floor so we could stop running back and forth. This shredder will easily shred 12 sheets at one time. I have never tried to use more than the recommended number of sheets maximum. The motor is about average for quietness. The blades seem to be extremely sharp and that should be expected with a new shredder. I have always used a shredder blade oil in my shredders and will do so with this one.The micro cut is perfect for a complete destruction of the papers I am shredding. Much better than some of my previously owned shredders. There is an auto/stop on the machines and a manual reverse function plus if it should get too hot from shredding there is a light indicator. Casters on the bottom make it easy to move around ones desk and the five-gallon wastebasket will hold a lot of shredded paper before it needs emptying. According to the paperwork with the shredder that wastebasket will hold about 450 shredded sheets. I am no where near that capacity right now.There is a  one year manufacture warranty which seems to be about standard for the industry. Paper shredders are really a consumable product around my office and house as we go through one very few years and have to replace it. Never have used a warranty for replacement and dont expect to do so on this one.A note about the price. You an buy really cheap one at an office supply store, however we think you  get what you pay for and they sometimes dont last very long. This one is in the mid-price range and as long as we get a few years out of it, we will be satisfied.

This cover for stackable chairs is in my opinion an excellent product. It is well constructed, made of heavy polyester materials and fits more than just four stackable chairs. I have just used it to product a lounge chair and ottoman from the rain and sun and it was a perfect fit. It also covers four stackable chairs the same way. The materials is very heavy so dont worry about it leaving the chairs during heavy winds and the thickness of the materials will protect your chairs against even the heaviest rain downpours which we have recently encountered.The cover measures 36 X 25 X 47 inches and for my chairs was perfect fit. There are toes that can also be used to hold the cover in  place. The materials are woven polyester fabric laminated with polyvinyl chloride backing.The base has a protective splashguard to help with heavy rains and the interlocking seams add strength and durability to the cover. This is a quality product that greatly exceeds the attributes of the cover I am replacing. I may have to purchase another for the other lounge chair plus a second one or the love seat. I checked at the outdoor furniture shop today and found this product cost to be far better than the ones they tried to sell me and the thickness of the materials were no where close to the thickness of this material.

I will start, since this is a new release as I write, by saying that I did not order or expect a HC edition, so I don't have the complaint the others here (so far) have with this. I will say that I miss the inspired artwork of the first few volumes of this series: the lush, art-nouveau look that made the reintroduction of the character so vivid and memorable. That out of the way, I highly recommend this to anyone following the series and do so otherwise unreservedly.The stories here are genuinely involving and Kate Kane may well have the most interesting and complex private life of any current SH character. I would welcome an episode or two that just focus on that, frankly. Even so, the action here is terrific, and if the artwork is now more conventional, so it goes. The writing and plotting are first-rate and I am impressed with the way the stories develop and expand, both tying up previous strand and introducing new ones.If you are new to the character, or have not followed the series to this point, this is not the place to start. Go back to the beginning. It won't take you long to catch up - Batwoman is pretty compelling these days.

I cannot really express how much I enjoyed this. It is an absolute hoot. You can get the product details above, but in short, this is simply, flat-out fun. For kicks:All of the villains have wonderful names like Lord Death Man and Professor Gorilla.All of the villains look like Clark Gable at various stages of his life. All the scientists (and there are plenty) have large foreheads and fluffy white hair. And mustaches, of course. And lab coats. You can't be a scientist without a lab coat.Bruce Wayne and Dick Grayson are always, always immaculately dressed. Dick has what appears to be a pompadour.The stories are all "science"-based, with some great ray guns, rather like Doofenschmirtz' -Inators. The pulp content is off the charts.Batman has a number of cool vehicles, including something that looks like a Plan-9-style space ship (with retractable grasping arms, naturally).Clearly, Japanese kids in the mid-60s understood, and accepted, evolution.The artwork is astonishingly clean and tight. Not to insult, but it is like the guy who drew Nancy (name not recalled off the top of my head) did the ink here.There is evident glee on every page, and not the Dark Night is not even a glimmer in anyone's eyes. This is pure corn and pure delight. Safe for young 'uns except for, as noted in an earlier review, a couple of "dammits" from hard-boiled cops and henchmen. B & R wouldn't dream of uttering such things. However, it is likely that the best audience for this is among those old enough to appreciate how rare and welcome such inspired silliness is.

I liked Vol 1 of Bedlam quite a lot and am pleasantly surprised and happy to say that I like Vol 2 even more. The story is genuinely gripping and the continued unfolding of the over-arching themes and story lines is intriguing. The series seems to be coming into its own. I honestly don't know what's coming next, or how things will play out. The characters continue to grow and become increasingly 3D and, a great step forward as far as I'm concerned, the art work tones down the gore. The jittery lines and jagged edges are still there, but the blood and meaty bits are dialed down. This lends the art a feel more sinister, atmospheric and less grind-house exploitation, which was one of the few blemishes on Vol 1. I am sincerely looking forward to Vol. 3

I wrote my original review in haste and sold this terrific book rather short (though not the 5-star rating). So I'm amending below the original, short one.Thankfully, I live in one of those cities that still has a handful of good, and a couple of great, delis left.
